Went by tour as we were unsure on how to get here by public transport as I googled it and it looked pretty complicated. 

Even though it...더 보기It’s far away from town, we joined a local tour that included the transportation. The  scenery is spectacular all the way, even in tunnels , there’re decorations!Booked the last slot at 530pm which was great because we could catch the beautiful sunset as we cycled past the route. Passed through various music themed tunnels from classic to romantic to dance pop which livened up the 40 mins route before we took...더 보기Was part of nami island tour package. 
We took 2 seater and went in oct. 
Remember to wear thick jacket and go to the toilet before the ride as the weather is quite cold during late noon time. Will recommand this for couple and family...더 보기This place is part of the itinerary for our day tour after Nami Island. The ride was pretty easy as...더 보기The ride was easy and the view was wonderful. Whole experience was awesome and really enjoyed the whole tour with my familyGood weather in september 18th... we took 4 seater bike... pretty view .. you must try this...  in finish line...더 보기It was a fun activity and a new experience to bike along an abandoned railway, such a good use. The bikes were comfortable and the views were stunning, and the tunnels were very nice to see as well. It was a bit of a workout...더 보기This place always gets crowded with visitors so it recommended to book ahead or be early in this attraction. We got this ride as a part of our tour package (on sale via airasia activities and Ktourstory).
The Rail bike runs on an old rail...더 보기

Name: 대관령 삼양목장
Review: When we reached the entrance, we were told there were only 8 sheep but we still went ahead. Maybe it was not a good month to visit because when we got in. There was absolutely no sheep at all. What made the trip nice was it snowed heavily when we got there on 15th March 2019.There isn't that much to see though I have a feeling a lot of people come just for the store which sells instant noodles at a super discounted rate. The scenery was pretty though and we took some fun family pics.Make sure you know when the bus leaves each location. The driver doesn't count the number of people and if you miss it, he'll leave you.This is sheep ranch and very big area and for family with children, will take about 1 hour plus to complete to whole area. But it is good for education and very nice view during winter since you can see a lot of snow covered the mountain and etc. Even you can feeding the sheep and etc. Beware that the entrance is about 800m walking from parking area. The charges for the ticket still okay and i could not remember but if not mistaken about KRW5000 for adult. Nevertheless you can always check the price online.Excellent place to see where your dairy comes from. Scenic pastures, mountain views. My boys enjoed meeting the cows and sheepThis is a pretty site where you can feed sheep. There are also some snacks available just outside the entrance. The fee is small so worth a short visit.Visited this ranch last winter and it was very very beautiful. We took a cab from Hoenggye and the cab driver agreed to take us on a private tour for KRW50K/USD50 inclusive of entry fee. There was no timeline so we took our time. He drove us around the ranch and we could freely ask him to stop at all the scenic spots for photography. Most the the spots were well marked so those wanting to have their photographs taken at drama locations will be very happy.Winter is not the best time to go for taking photographs as the cold winds were very harsh! However the winter landscape was undeniably beautiful...a stark kind of beauty. Definitely worth a visit!With such good reviews, we were excited to take our kiddos to see this Ranch. We went early this month and were not impressed. We paid about 30,000 won for entrance and only saw the ostrich's and a couple of sheep. The dairy farm was closed to visitors and none of the animals were out in their fields, but stuck in their little pens. Our kids were pretty disappointed. Be sure to bring food if you plan to go around lunch. The restaurant and shop has a lot of ramen and frozen beef and that is about it.Took the hotel shuttle bus to the sheep farm. Cost 2200 won per pax. Was around 20-30min journey. Entry was 4000 won per pax including sheep feeding. Was quite fun. Kids will definitely enjoy it.This place is very amazing not only as a ranch but as an entertainment. This ranch made by Samyang, which is one of representative food companies in Korea so that in this place, you can taste some food which made by that company Samyang. You can try Samyang's ramyeon and some dairy food before touring that ranch. In Summer, it gives you a free tour bus so you can take on whatever you want and the scenery was really great on the top of this ranch, personally. I recommend this place!The place is a great place to visit, especially if you're traveling with kids. There are a lot of sheep and Holstein cows. At the same time, there is also an ostrich enclosure. There are also wind turbines and the view is breathtaking. I like that there is a Samyang noodle store within the property that also sells milk and cheese made from cows in the area (or for the cheese, Korean cows at least). What is amusing is that they even sell blankets made from the fleece from their own sheep.

Name: 대관령 양떼목장
Review: This is a hiking trail which is fairly steep & sometimes slippery as as the walkway is covered with gravel > the walking course is circular & it is more slippery on the way down then up. this is a sheep farm but during our visit we saw about 50 sheeps feeding on grass in one sectioned off field & remaining field did not have any sheep except for about 20 sheeps in the feeding area. We were travelling with an elderly person & course was not suitable to walk together & the hills & trails are not suitable for wheel chair therefore had to wait in coffee shop. the admission price was Krw6,000/person including the grass to feed to sheep. Its good if you have children & want to let them see sheep close up & feed them but if you want to see large flock of sheeps then you will be disappointed. There is a good view of Pyeongchang area at the top of the hill. Its good for 1~2 hour visit.Worth a quick stop, come in the morning to beat the crowds. There is not much on display in terms of sheep, but a very nice walk trail is made within the park.It's on a beautiful grounds with plenty of sheep to feed. There is a nice walking course. Not the best for strollers.Feeding the sheep and seeing the views is the main attraction of the place. It is not expensive and it is a nice hike around the grounds. Kids love it.The views are fantastic. Sheep were wonderful. They are scattered on the hill. The sheep are the superstar but one can also come here for an easy hike up the hills where there are set trails. It's not as overwhelming as other bigger hills/ mountains are. With the 4,000 won ticket for adults and free for children under 5 or 3 (not so sure, but my child is 3 and free), it includes sheep feeding. Sheep are very kind creatures. This may just be not exciting for people who have been to countries that have abundance of sheep, but this is a great experience for anyone if you're in Korea. We visited during the summer. I wish I could be here in winter. Also, this is a good side trip for those who visit Pyeongchang for the ski resorts.Natural Beauty and scenic view of Hills is just amazing. Very good for natural lovers. Very good experience.Wonderful scenery. Abit of a walk up but so worth it. Beautiful way to spend a day. Bring a good camera the view is awesome!This farm is attached with another attraction : " Making Cheese D.I.Y", we were instructed how to make a cheese by milk, then we walk to the farm, there were a lot of sheep waiting for us to feed them, I personally think is ok only but my children love it. It was raining after visiting the farm, and was very cold.The landscape at the ranch looks quite foreign. All the sheep were out on the hills, dozing. It was nice to walk around the ranch going up and down. You can also feed some of them. I and my friends enjoyed the visit.I went there last August.Although it rained, still had a lot of fun.If you are planning to go there, I advise you to check the bus time table

Name: 오션 700
Review: My kids loved this place especially after spending several other days outside doing winter stuff. The water park is warm , clean and there is a lot to do. The wave pool and water park were fun. We really enjoyed the outside sauna and pool. The river, tube pool was a bit too strong though and I would say almost dangerous for kids under 8. It’s just rough and as an adult, I felt a bit seasick afterwards. Other than that, great fun. Try to get there either before lunch or just after since they will close in the early evening. They also close on Monday’s, so schedule your trip around that. When we went the cafeteria was a bit backlogged and took a while to get the food so possibly order 30 minutes before you think your kids will get hungry. The water park was a highlight of our trip for our kids so I would recommend it.It's a great water park. I thought it was going to be very cold during winter. I was wrong. The park was warm and the water was just nice. There's a lot of things to play inside. Slides, tubes and a fake wave pool too. Very clean. There's personnels around the area to assist you after you slide down into the pool.It's just beside the Alpensia Pyeongchang Ski resort. Walking distance to the ski area and Holiday Inn Hotel.There's place for lockers, showers and a shop selling swimwear & gears if you've forgotten to bring yours.My kids enjoyed it so much. Mind you it's during winter some more. Just awesome!Facility is fine but over charged . After the main entrance fee , you have to rent a life vest and cap (this is mandatory, regardless your swimming ability ) , and rent a lounge chair if you want to sit on the side to watch your kids.Stayed at the Intercontinental for 4 nights during the winter months mainly for skiing. This water fun park is a great break from skiing when the kids were a bit tired of skiing. It's not the greatest I've been but quite good with about 5-6 areas with different rides with floats and tires. My favorite was being able to swim outdoors in warm water when it's like -5C outside, almost like the onsens in Japan. We went after day skiing about 5pm and stayed till 8pm which was really plenty of action for kids to exert whatever energy they had after skiing. Slept well that night!!Spent an hour with my year old daughter. Facilty is modern and clean. Difficult to navigate if you do not speak Korean however staff are exceptionally friendly and really try to help. Park is advertised as one of the largest in Korea however actually quite small. Fortunately not that crowded so you can easily have multiple goes on the water slides. Tornado four person rubber ring slide is a must try..my daughter loved it.We spent a fun hour there, however could not imagine spending much longer.Though it is in winter, the waterpark can still give you fun. The water is warm with spa, made you relax and relief. It was also suitable for kids with a few slides. Feeling good when you go outside of the waterpark especially in winter time, so enjoying.Since it is not crowded, no need to queue up for most of the water rides. Water can be warmer, but overall very good. Changing room is super clean.Small indoor park with few slides but provided good fun away from the slopes for the children. Its heated, so its nice and warm although its snowing outside.Theres also a korean sauna at the top level where one need to be fully undressed to enter.Theres stalls serving udon, burgers, fried chicken, rice, etc. Enough to keep rumbling tummies happy.Recommend for family with kids if you are visiting Alpensia.Great indoor waterpark and small part of it is open to air and especially good during winter, discount for hotel guest and please show your room keyIt is good for adult but not good for kid who height lower 120cm. Because all faculty is not for kids. The price of ticket is quite high but guest of hotel have 30% discount.

Name: 피크아일랜드
Review:
I liked the outdoor hot tubs and the jjimjilbang, but its quite overpriced. I would only go here when I can get a discount.Super overpriced  (even with a gift card discount). The outdoor hot baths were too cool at only 36 degrees. The...더 보기A place for young and old. There are theme park, hot spring, Korean sauna for everyone. There are 2 different...더 보기The children could play in the water park while the parents could enjoy the hot spring, both outdoor and indoor...더 보기It's average, there's an indoor side and like 4 slides. The indoor side is basically just for kids and the slides don't impress. It's definitely not the highlight of the resort, guess it counts more like just its pool side.60.000 KRW (+-52 USD) & 45.000 KRW (39 USD) (adult & child) which is not cheap and then realizing, once...더 보기A heads up about the very liberal nakedness in the change rooms- had to help the kids deal with that-...더 보기This place has a two great water, a lazy river, massage jets in pools, outdoor coloured spas, a wave pool...더 보기This is a must for after ski relaxation for a few hours. Food is also sold.

Tips: bring your own...더 보기My advice is, no need to waste your time to go to this water park AT ALL.

If you have been to many water park before, especially the water park in Singapore at Santosa, this water park is consider very small, items are limited. Worst...더 보기

Name: 용평 리조트 곤돌라
Location: 강원도 평창 대관령면 올림픽로 715 드래곤 프라자 2층 (우) 25352
Review:
Закрытый гондольный подъёмник на местную вершину ( около 1500 метров),
Отличный вид , интересные трассы для подготовленых горнолыжников.

Name: 휘닉스 스노우 파크
Review: We stayed here for 5 nites this time for our annual ski trip. 2.5hours drive from Incheon airport. We picked the Green Condo as we wanted the whole family of 4 to stay together. We would have to book two rooms if we chose the hotel. The ski resort is huge. With hotel, condo, villa and youth hostel. We picked the room of 99m2 which had one room with two beds and another room with tatami. With a small kitchen we were able to cook some simple breakfast. No room service, not much toiletries for condo. 5 mins walk to the ski rentals/lift ticket office. Good mix of slopes of different levels. Snow honestly not very good this year cos not cold and no new snow. Quite icy. Nite ski was good as no queue for lifts. English speaking ski / snowboard coaches available and friendly. Waterpark, bowling, spa n sauna, arcade avail. The waterpark is only good for very small kids. Don’t waste money if your kids are older. Can go to the sauna to enjoy hot-spring which is much cheaper. Bowling is good value of money. Restaurants ok. More choices if you walk out of the resort. 5-10 mins walk. Facilities overall i would say excellent in terms of convenience and variety but cleanliness and service level average. Would be good if staff can speak a bit more english.Top of the class ski resort where the Winter Olympic was held here recently. Ski track is very spacious, offering breathtaking view. Should spend the whole day here, at least.We (European family with 6 and 4 yo) spent 1 week in PyeongChang over Christmas 2018 and had a fabulous holiday. Phoenix was for us logistically easier than Japan (Flew into Seoul Incheon and pre-booked a shuttle service to PyeongChang which took 2,5 hours). The kids took skilessons at the Foreigner Skischool and the resort provides ample beginner slopes, great fun!! My husband and I enjoyed the advanced slopes and were OK with the fact that the resort has only few slopes for us. Each kid went with their own instructor as level was uncomparable and there were not enough non-Korean kids to form a class. Compared to a week skiclass in Europe for kids, it is pricy as many Koreans take lessons by the hour and the price is calculated by just summing up hourly rates. Their development in 1 week was tremendous however and most importantly they had a lot of fun. We took lunch at the food court: choice of 6 dishes, affordable and more than enough, it is quick but has little atmosphere. We enjoyed the americano coffee at the NY coffee and hotdog truck at the foot of the slopes. There is no such thing as a village bus service. You have to walk or take a taxi if your accomodation is not right at the foot of the mountain where the few restaurants and bars are. Not ideal when you have little kids as a bit isolated to our appartment in the morning and evenings, however the price difference between our appartment in Story residence and the hotels at the foot of the mountain was a factor 1:4. All in all, great week of ski <U+2600><U+FE0F>Phoenix Park is very well kept. The snow is mostly artificial but the grounds crew does a great job maintaining it. It can get icy. To me, the best thing is night boarding. 2200-0400. It helps saves time in your busy weekend schedule, but of course, it gets really cold at night. If you're looking for stuff to do or restaurants to go eat out at, good luck, because you're not going to find anything. The ski resort is basically located in the middle of nowhere. During my first years living in Korea I had a season pass but now would rather go to High1 Resort because it snows there often and has a bit more to offer outside the resort. Phoenix Park is small, but that means you get a lot of runs in. It can be crowded but the lift lines move quickly. Panorama Slope is my favorite.It was my first time at a ski resort in Korea. Apparently there were many choices available but we were brought to this one by our tour guide. The hotel was just located below the ski resort and it was easy for us. The rental of the ski shoes was also done within the compound. Overall a nice experience and great views at the top!The Phoenix Snow Park is surrounded by good places to ski and it now joins the Pantheon of Ski Resort venues that have hosted an Olympics.1) Fly to Seoul.2) Head to Seoul Station. Take KTX to Pyeongchang or rent a car. The road can be slippery after snowfall. Take 4wd if you plan to drive around Pyeongchang.3) Best to stay in the ski resort to maximise time on the slope. We stay at the nearby AirBnB.4) There are 3 ski resorts around Pyeongchang. We recommend Phoenix due to trainer availability. *Don’t pay for the ski park entry yet, It’s for the lift. You probably not ready for Beginner slope on the 1st day. * Take 2 hours class. It’s worth it even if this is just 1 off - bucket list thing. The class make the next 2-4 hours on the slope more enjoyable.5) Schedule a class before arrival or in our case we just walk in and book 2 hours afternoon class for 5 people. If you don’t speak Korean, you have to book private class with 1 trainer.6) Come early, take gondola to the mountain top. Have some hot chocolate, throw some snowballs before the class.7) Allow 1 hour for prep to pick up ski set - ski, shoes and poles. Helmet & goggles are optional but they keeps your head warm. * The shoes are uncomfortable. The ski set are heavy.8) Today class is about how to slow down (without falling down too much ).There you go. That’s pyeongchang 1 day. Scheduled it to happenI'm a skier, but did not ski this trip. I went for the Olympics and saw two events at Phoenix Park (also known as Bokwang Snow Park) a ski resort in South Korea. It is located in the township of Bongpyeong-myeon, in the county of Pyeongchang. Note: Pyeongchang is a county, not a city. The area was all decked out for the Olympics, but the mountain still looked inviting with a variety of ski slopes to entice beginners to upper intermediates. New hotel construction in the area will offer "front door" service to chairlifts. Other accommodations in the area are readily available and numerous ski rental places. Note: Koreans seem to all rent skis, not own. By KTX train, the nearest station is Pyeongchang with easy taxi service to hotels and the resort. The resort also has a bowling alley, "food court", spa, billard parlor and although closed in the winter, there is a big water park. The winter visit was great, but I'd also enjoy seeing the area in a different season.We visited this place in early March 2018 Most of the events for the ski had ended. We had great enjoyment as we were the only visitors there at this time.We went to watch the Ski half pipe and of all the events we watched this was definitely one of our favourites. I am not sure whether the Olympic facilities will remain after the Olympics,, but I sincerely hope they do to provide young Koreans with the inspiration to follow in the footsteps of their successful athletes.

Name: 평창올림픽시장
Review: Great to have experienced a Korean tradition and culture by visiting the Pyeongchang Olympic Market during the very commercial sporting event.  After the game are gone this will remain a great place to visit.Tickets were expensive ($200 each) USA were in the minority.  Parking was free, but it was about a two hour...더 보기With the approaching 2018 winter Olympics active and interesting location to experience Korean foods and culture.It was lot of pleasure to meeting Korean tradition and culture by visiting Pyeongchang Olympic Market. Also it was best experience to learn Korean culture especially in foods. The people are warmhearted and so so kind. I really love that place.The Pyeongchang Olympic Market was the most authentic traditional market that I have ever been to. With that are amazing finds for seekers of herbal finds and traditional food. To top the experience, you might catch some flurries as the place is always covered in...더 보기Although the market itself is relatively small compared to other markets in Gangwon province, this market serves its purpose of...더 보기I had a great time at Pyeonchang Olympic market. The place was really beautiful. There are so many different kinds...더 보기I love to travel in different place and now i am in Korea. My favorite place to visit in Korea...더 보기The market is great and lots of foods to try especially buckwheat foods! The people are also good and very welcoming!It was such nice experience to enjoy a meal and travelling around the market. Warm welcome from the shopkeepers and their business style is unique to satisfy customers.

Name: 홍천 은행나무 숲
Review: A small and private place. They say that this is a private place own by a rich man who created this for the enjoyment of his ill wife. The ginkgo trees are planted bh him and only open in October. We were not lucky when we went there because the leaves of the ginkgo trees alhave already fallen due to rains the previous days. It was compensated by the colors of the trees/leaves at the entrance though.Hongcheon ginkgo forest is a hidden gem because it is not open to the public except in the first 3 weeks of Oct. (approx. period) when the ginkgo trees turn into a beautiful yellow colour. The map coordinates are: 37°41'49.0"N 127°53'19.3"E and one has to join a local tour (in Seoul) to go there, as it is quite remote (3-4 hours drive from Seoul city). I went there in early Oct. and only the rear part of the forest has turned yellow. Nevertheless it was a great place to visit. The ginkgo forest which had been strictly closed to the public for 25 years starting in 1985, has been allowing free admission during a designated 20-day period in October. Located at the far eastern end of Hongcheon County, the ginkgo forest is lined with around 2,000 ginkgo trees planted at intervals of 5 metres. In Oct., the ginkgo leaves turn yellow and create an unforgettable scene. Near the ginkgo tree forest, visitors can try local specialties sold by local residents.The best time to visit the ginkgo forest is mid Oct. This forest is probably the best place to see ginkgo trees in S. Korea.

Name: 공작산 수타사
Review: C1 ( 2013.11.09 ) The Sutasa temple was so-so than another many temple, but scenery with temple and mountain was very beautiful. There was a tracking way, small lake, beautiful mountain with auntumn colors. and fresh air make me cool. Some of building was remodeling, but good place to walk with aumtumn atmosphere.

Name: 비발디파크 오션월드
Review:
It was a great experience and personally think it is slightly better than the Caribbean Bay. More food varieties and facilities are more organised. But the slides and waves are not as exciting than the Caribbean onesWhat a fun day at Vivaldi Park Ocean World! Ski, cable car, snow, snow boarding... very very cold! White Christmas and everything!We bought discounted tickets from Funtastic Korea.  Didn’t notice the fine print that the vouchers had to be PRINTED (no...더 보기Big and nice place to have excellent time.
ticket prices is same regardless which time you go so it had better to visit as early as possible.
For foreigners there is a 30% discount. that is very nice )))
Closing time is 7pm. be sure...더 보기Really enjoyed Ocean World. Booked on klook and klook gave the wrong info on the voucher re the timing and...더 보기Got the tourist package for 25t won, The sleigh ride is ok, for a few mins than you get bored of it fast. but the water park is great for kids, Adult go to the spa where you HAVE to be NUDE/ NAKED. They have...더 보기

Name: 홍천생명건강과학관
Review: 홍천 가족 여행을 하면서, 어린이들을 데리고 가기에 좋은 곳입니다. 사람의 몸, 건강 등에 대해 알아보고, 체험하면서 배울수 있으며, 홍천군에서 운영하는 곳이다보니 입장료가 매우 저렴합니다. 1시간에서 2시간 정도면 즐겁게 구경할수 있어요~^^

Name: 알파카월드
Review: There's no public transport to Alpaca World, so you'll have to grab a taxi from Namchuncheon Station (it'll cost around 40,000 won for one way). Do install Kakao Taxi as we called for a normal taxi via the hotline and it took around 1 hr of waiting time before it arrived. All the visitors there were the locals who drove there. I'd say the travelling time wasn't worth it.We took a day tour covering nami island and alpaca world. After Nami island we had to travel further up for another 1 hour plus before we reached the place. Maybe it wasn't peak season, there were only a couple other visitors so the park was very quiet. The alpacas looked very skinny and dirty - maybe their fur was trimmed during summer? The animals in the park were confined in a small space with insufficient space to roam about and they don't seem active and happy. In fact we feel a bit sad for them. All in all, I don't think it's worth the time to travel so far (we took about 2.5 hrs to return to myeongdong) and atmosphere was not a fun and happy place to enjoy as the animals don't seem very well taken care of. I would recommend to spend the time elsewhere instead.Visited this place by a day trip booked with Klook.We went on the mini-train ride with the help of a kind korean lady to buy the tickets, have our lunch (fried corndog, tuk-sausage stick), feed the deers, alpaca watching and also walking around all done in 2.5 hours. The place was much smaller than we thought. Definitely a place where the kids could run around freely and enjoying feeding the alpaca, rabbits, and deers.We were there in first week of April. It's about 3 hours coach ride from Seoul. Alas much of the attractions in the theme park appeared to be closed or under maintenance. There are still the walking trails which is nice to do in that cool weather, but still, we were there for the animals not the trails. Seems like we were there too early in the year and that May or June would be a better time to visit.Alpaca world was a great park to go too as there are a lot of animals and the alpacas r really cute and friendly. A good recommendation.It was a good zoo to come too especially seeing those adorable alpaca which are really friendly and cuteAlpaca World is a relatively new attraction in South Korea. A 2-3 hours drive away from Seoul, you might want to include this attraction into your itinerary if you’re into alpacas and other furry animals like rabbits and sheeps. There are ample opportunities to take really nice scenic photos and we highly recommend that you visit during spring time. When we were there in Winter, it was really cold. Having said that, children and adults will definitely enjoy their time here as there are opportunities available to walk the alpaca and feed them. Feeds and other adhoc activities like the monorail and walking the alpaca are charged separately though.It’s a valuable chance to meet so many alpaca here! We can feed it or even have a walk with it! Don’t miss the chance to come here!I had been there in July 2018 with my family. Although it is a bit far from the city, it is worth to visit and there are lots of different kinds of animals except Alpaca. You can touch and take pics with the alpaca over there. Besides, there is a train in the slope you must experience as the staff will give you a cup of food to feed the alpaca while you are on the train.Free n easy to Alpaca World is like go at your own risk if you decided to take the last public bus! 535pm (bus will arrived and take off early, stand on the roadsite and wait! Else bus will just drive off!) I notice bus number 3 drove by same driver, so if he is sick, good luck to you! Unless you can call a taxi, else there is no transport back to town! Nov is a cold weather, temperature drop to 2° and sunset is around 510pm. Something that not very tourist friendly is that the stuff will lock the makeshift waiting room (with heater) at around 5pm. So we have to wait outside in the cold for about half n hr! Aside from this, the park is fun and kids friendly (not suitable for handicap or elderly with problem walking), prepare to climb lots of hill! Highly recommended. My family have a great fun around the park for one whole day.

Name: 용암불한증막
Review:
친구 수료식 때문에 화천에 오게 되었는데 잘곳이 없어 여기를 택했습니다 되게 한적...더 보기안녕하세요.
화천 용화산 불 한증막을  찾아 주셔서  감사드립니다.
사정상 개점휴...더 보기화천에 참 좋은 찜질방 하나를 소개합니다 
1. 장소 : 화천에서 용화산방향 약...더 보기화천에 참 좋은 찜질방 하나를 소개합니다 
1. 장소 : 화천에서 용화산방향 약...더 보기

Name: 얼음나라화천 산천어축제
Review: So, at first I would like to mention, than I am not a tourist and I live in South Korea for almost 4 years already. I am a foreigner married to a Korean national, so it is not my first time in Korea. This weekend we decided to visit Hwacheon Ice festival for the first time and totally regretted it. I speak higher intermediate Korean, so I thought that visiting the festival is not going to be a problem at all, but I was yet to know that staff here is judgemental and rude to foreigners. They just look at my face and scream rude english words, even though I tell them in Korean that I don’t understand that they were saying. Left with ruined mood and worse memories ever. I would reccomend choosing something else for your vacation, as my experience was not good at all. It is overpriced as well! If you don’t speak english, you should not scream random english words you remember at my face. I as you a question in Korean and you can’t even answer? Then, you should not even work there. I how Hwacheon Ice Festival will reconsider their staff choices. Until the staff is changed, I am not coming back. Ever, and not reccomending it to anyone else.Our group enjoyed snow sledding, ice fishing, korean snacks and grilled trout. The overall experience was wonderful.If you want to try a winter experience, I would recommend this ice fishing festival. Fishing on a frozen river is an exciting experience.The organiser have allocated an area for foreigners and staff are able to speak English so communication is not an issue. You are able to move around the area to try the different holes to get your fish. Each person is allowed a maximum of 3 fishes. Staff are at hand to help you removed the hooks from the fish once you caught it. After which you can bring your fish to the kitchen and they will grill it for you. It is a good activity for an individual traveller or a group.Went with my wife and 4 year old on our recent trip to Korea on a weekday and we all have a really fun day out. We booked the trip on the Funko website with Korea Tours and were picked up within 100 metres from our hotel in Myeongdong. Comfortable bus took about 2 hours to get up to the festival nestled in the mountains, where the activities were all explained by a friendly guide. It wasn't crowded and we tried the ice fishing, ice sledding, assorted sleds and the price of the tour also included a food voucher for lunch. Our favorite part of the festival was the indoor ice sculptures. It was advertised as 5000 won per person but the lady just waved us in for some reason and it was fabulous. A bit like a kiddies play gym made from ice. This one was a bit away from the main festival (500-750m perhaps) and a little tricky to find but we managed (It's right next door to the cinema). People there were very friendly and many stopped to try and talk to us. Highly recommended day trip if visiting South Korea.About 1-1.5 hours from Seoul. It's absolutely unique experience only can do in winter in Korea. Entrance fee is around 10,000 Won. For tourists and locals, our fishing area are separated. Will be given a fishing rod and you find your own ice-hole to catch fish. Maximum 3 fish per person. If you failed to get any, they will give you one during the exit. There are facilities whereby you can ask them to cook your fish. Price range around 3,000 - 5,000 Won. Other than fishing activity, there are more fun rides on ice, concert and few stalls that serve local food.Really well organised and interesting event for the family. Got our fishing rods and tickets then off we went ice fishing. My young kids 2 and 3 year old had loads of fun. After catching the fish we had them grilled at a tent for 3000krw each. Even if you dont catch any you still can get grilled trout at that same price so technically it makes no difference whether you catch any. Just really for the experience and fun. Great service, friendly staff and many activities available for everyone. An experience that shouldnt be missed.This ice fishing festival has been running for a number of years now and they have been able to keep up the momentum from year to year. The main activity is the titular ice fishing, and it is a great activity. There are also restaurants on the grounds that will cook up your fish. In addition there are plenty of other ice related activities to be had on the ice.We came with a tourists group of 65 people and we really enjoy this day in ice festival ! So many activites proposed there (ice fishing, quad on ice, hand fishing...). We appreciated the general atmosphere on this event even if you were so cold (-15 degrees). Super nice moment ! Thanks a lot to make us discover winter in South Korea !

Name: 오두산 통일전망대
Review: ツア<U+30FC>の際に訪れた場所。イムジン河の向こうは北朝鮮。訪れたときは天<U+6C17>もよく<U+7A4F>やかな日で<U+89B3>光客も多く、フィルム鑑賞では韓<U+56FD>語<U+30FB>英語<U+30FB>中<U+56FD>語<U+30FB>日本語に<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>していました。互いに監視していると伺うと、不思議な感<U+899A>にもなり、怖くも感じました。韓<U+56FD>人の友人が車で連れてきてくれたので交通の便は分かりませんが、<U+685C>がほぼ<U+6E80>開の季節だったこともあり素敵な公園でした。建物<U+5185>では日本語の解<U+8AAC>付きでフィルム<U+89B3>賞が出<U+6765>、ここが南北にとってどういうところなのか<U+5B66>べるようです。現に先生引率の小<U+5B66>生グル<U+30FC>プと一<U+7DD2>になって賑やかでした。無料の望遠鏡で見る北側は、人の往<U+6765>が確認できましたが、生活感の全くない「舞台」のように私には感じられました。北のロケット<U+767A>射ニュ<U+30FC>スの後は、必ず見て<U+6765>てと知人からメ<U+30FC>ルが<U+6765>るので日曜に絡めて出掛けるのですが今回も近隣は緊張感無しです。ここがそんなに緊張感を感じないしと<U+30FB><U+30FB>他の投稿にありますが<U+5B9F>は展望台の尾根の下にあるのが韓<U+56FD>軍の兵<U+820E>、宣<U+4F1D>スピ<U+30FC>カ<U+30FC>です。また、展望台への道路途中に脇道がありますが、ここが兵<U+820E>に<U+7D9A>く道で補給物資を運ぶカ<U+30FC>ゴも時折、見かけます。2000年頃は金村<U+99C5>から展望台下の駐車場間の道路途中の路側<U+5E2F>にはカモフラ<U+30FC>ジュの土<U+56A2>を積上げ、兵士が行き交う車<U+4E21>に常に警戒していたのが思い出されます。10月の<U+767A>射ニュ<U+30FC>スの後も近隣は至って平<U+9759>でした。ソウル市<U+5185>から電車で金村<U+99C5>(Geumchon)まで1時間少しでした。そこからタクシ<U+30FC>で約15分、料金は片道約9000ウォンでした。しかし、11/27まで<U+5185><U+88C5>工事で<U+55B6>業していないみたいです。<U+6B8B>念です。皆さまお<U+6C17>をつけください。2015年ごろには北朝鮮の物産が買える<U+58F2>店があったらしいですが、2017年11月の段階では<U+58F2>店自<U+4F53>が存在しません。日本語上手な模範タクシ<U+30FC>の方に連れていってもらいました。ずっと行ってみたくて行った結果天<U+6C17>も良かったし<U+6E80>足でした。絶<U+5BFE>天<U+6C17>の良い日に行くことをお<U+52E7>めします。<U+89B3>光地なので誰でも<U+6C17><U+8EFD>に行けるし２㎞先の北朝鮮が見えます。無料の<U+53CC>眼鏡で見ると人が<U+6B69>いてるのも見えます。日本語のテレビ案<U+5185>やパンフレットもあります。北朝鮮のお土産は今はないそうです。一度行ってみていい場所です。８月１１日（金）、烏頭山統一展望台へ行ってきました。玉水から京義線に<U+4E57>り、金村まで直通で行けると思っていましたが、途中の一山行きに<U+4E57>っていたらしく、電車を<U+4E57>り換えることになりました。金村<U+99C5>①出口でて左へ進み、信<U+53F7>を渡ったところにバス停があります。No.900バス終点まで<U+4E57>ります。４５分位<U+4E57>っていましたが道路の<U+8217><U+88C5>が良い<U+72B6>態ではないことと運<U+8EE2>が荒いため、座席から何度も落ちそうになりました。終点のバス停でシャトルバスを待っていれば<U+6765>るのかと思っていたのでその場にいましたが、<U+6765>ない<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>。どうしようかと途方にくれていると、どうも終点バス停の斜め前、駐車場入口<U+6A2A>にシャトルバス<U+4E57>り場らしいものがあるのを<U+767A>見。そこからシャトルバスに<U+4E57>ることができました。平日は３０分から１時間間隔です。シャトルバスで展望台までは５分かからずつきますが、かなりの坂道を登って行くため<U+6B69>いて登るのはきついです。望遠鏡は展望台の建物の中の３階と建物外にありました。望遠鏡は無料で使えます。北朝鮮の動向が<U+6BCE>日ニュ<U+30FC>スで流れ緊張感漂っていますが、それは外の<U+56FD>の話のように感じるほど普段通りの<U+56FD>境周<U+8FBA>でした。この展望台の前で漢江（ハンガン；韓<U+56FD>側に上流）と臨津江（イムジンガン：北朝鮮側に上流）が合流して西海へと流れる<U+69D8>が一望できます。川<U+7E01>には<U+9244>城門が設置され、地雷も設置されているようです。添<U+4E57>員付きのツア<U+30FC>で訪問したので、展望台近い駐車場まで上がれましたが、韓<U+56FD>のかたは、展望台下の駐車場からシャトルバスであがる必要があるとの事です。日本語で解<U+8AAC>ビデオも流され、<U+6226><U+4E89>で分<U+65AD>された<U+56FD>家の悲劇について<U+8AAC>明を受けました。<U+5C06><U+6765>統一された際には北（板門店）へとつながる<U+56FD>道が整備され、現地の人にはドライブコ<U+30FC>スになっているそうです。　日本での北朝鮮の報道を見聞きした上での<U+6765>訪でしたので緊張してましたが、全く普段通りの生活されている韓<U+56FD>でした。<U+6EDE>在の合間に出掛けました。多くの人はソウル近郊に宿泊するのでソウルからの交通手段から<U+30FB><U+30FB>ソウルからメトロ4<U+53F7>線でDMC<U+99C5>へ、ここで<U+56FD><U+9244>京義線で金村(グムチョン)<U+99C5>下車、<U+99C5>前の通りを渡ったバス停ですが、聞いても余り知られていない<U+70BA>、No900のバス停と聞いた方が早いです。終点の「統一展望台入口」(オドゥサントンイルチョンマンデ)下車約30分程度、そこから無料シャトルバスで15分間隔であります。わざわざカタカナを表記したのは特に一人で出掛ける方はその場でトラブルが無いように<U+899A>えてもらった方が良いかと一言確認すれば安心です。さて、展望台は以前(2002年）に訪れた頃より石碑、建物が改<U+88C5>されて新しく<U+30FB><U+30FB>北朝鮮との緊張感は全く無し、以前は韓<U+56FD>軍の<U+6B69>哨も見られたが、それも無くフェンスも無く隊<U+820E>がある程度。北朝鮮の領土を<U+53CC>眼鏡から<U+8997>くと川沿いを散策する姿や<U+8131>穀所で作業する<U+69D8>子が見られ、のどかな日曜日の<U+663C>下がり。因みに<U+53CC>眼鏡は無料になっていました。訪れている人は韓<U+56FD>人が殆どで日本人はツア<U+30FC>10名程度。中には韓<U+56FD>軍の兵士も何名か見られた。何故か、周<U+8FBA>はリゾ<U+30FC>ト化されていてびっくり、日本では北朝鮮近隣諸<U+56FD>を含めて<U+9A12><U+3005>しいが韓<U+56FD>至って平<U+9759>です。料金300ｗ添<U+4E57>員付きのツア<U+30FC>旅行で行きました。川の向こうは北朝鮮だなんて不思議な<U+6C17>持ちでした。展望台に据え付けてあるコイン式の<U+53CC>眼鏡を<U+8997>けば市民が暮らしている<U+69D8>子も見ることができます（韓<U+56FD>側に見せている演出的な印象もありましたが）。その他暮らしぶりがわかる部屋や<U+5B66>校の<U+6559>室なども再現されていて、じっくり見入ってしまいました。ソウルでのお買い物だけでなく、リピ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>さんなどには少し足を延ばして朝鮮半島というものを<U+4F53>感できる場所だと思います。機<U+4F1A>があればまた行ってみたいです。

Name: 칼봉산자연휴양림
Review: 겨울에 방문했는데 남자친구랑 산책하기 좋았어요!!!! 물소리 새소리 바람소리 완전 좋았고 데이트 코스로 강추입니다 ㅎㅎㅎ비가 오는 날 방문하여 아쉽게도 산책로나 계곡이 통제되어 제대로 즐기지 못하였습니다.저희가 묵은 산림휴양관은 계곡에서 가깝고 다리 하나만 건너면 매점으로 갈 수 있어서 위치상으로는 아주 좋았습니다.휴양관 안에 이것저것 체험할 거리도 있었는데, 유료 체험입니다.방은 아주 깨끗하게 잘 유지되었다고 보기는 어렵지만, 가격대비 만족했습니다.가평군에서 직접 운영을 하는 곳으로 가격이 저렴합니다.바베큐를 할수도 있습니다.휴양림에 매점도 있어 편리하네요.계곡, 산책로가 잘 정돈되어 있습니다.힐링이 되는 느낌입니다.서울에서 별로 멀지 않은 곳으로 편하게 공기좋은 곳에서 쉬기 좋은 곳입니다. 예약만 좀더 수월하게 할 수 있었으면 좋겠어요~~4인기준 성수기 가격 65,000원으로 바베큐 장소가 숙소 앞에 호실별로 있고 산책로와 계곡을 잘길수 있습니다. 터미널에 여러 마트가 있어 장을 보고 이동하시면 됩니다 휴양림의 매점이 상대적으로 가격이 비쌉니다가평군에서 직접 운영하는 곳이라 그런지 숙박비용이 저렴했어요 ㅎㅎ주변에 물도 넘넘 맑고... 여름에 가니 정말 최고였네요 ㅎㅎ

Name: 아침 고요 수목원
Review: I have been here over 10 times throughout the years and it still remains as one of my top places in Korea. This 30,000 sq m mountain garden is quite majestic in its natural beauty. It can be accessed by hop on hop off your bus from Gapyeong station or Cheongpyeong station. You can also take a taxi right from Gapyeong station which is what we did and it costed around 30,000 won. The garden is truly beautiful during all seasons but my favorite is during the fall when vibrant colors mark the park like dotted spaces. There is a cafe and restaurant at the park and lots of resting spaces. Right in front of the entrance to the Garden they also sell snacks and local food you can take with you. Go check out this place, it will take you on a relaxing adventure for the soul!I'm glad to have visited this awesome garden during autmn season last November 16, 2019. I would like to think that this is The Garden of Eden. A must visit place if you are a nature lover.I visited this garden each time I went to Seoul. In spring there were lots of flowers. In autumn there were not only autumn colours but also lots of flowers. They really kept the garden in good order.The Garden was a pleasure to visit and walk. Landscaping and foliage are excellent. Soft soothing music in the background enhanced the pleasure of strolling and relaxing in the beautiful grounds. At Petite France, soothing music was also played in the background - seems like a common feature in parks... Petite France has lots of French-inspired (as its name implies) architecture especially images / statues of the Petit Prince which are a big plus for a fan like me!Re-visiting Nami Island was great (last visit 10 years ago was in winter) as the gingko trees were changing shade to yellow.Check with your hotel concierge for a day tour to Nami Island, Garden of the Morning Calm and Petite France - it's really worth the 130,000 wons (organised by Cosmojin travel agency, includes chicken bbq lunch)If you are planning to go here, you need at least half a day to finish walking the whole garden. Not recommended to follow tour group.I would prefer The Garden of Morning Calm compared to Nami Island. Not too commercialize and can feel the freshness in the air. I love this place!Love this beautiful garden! We came in the morning and enjoyed the cool crisp morning air with lesser crowd. The garden is perfectly manicured with lots of beautiful pathwaysGardens are beautifully manicured and well kept. It was autumn so the leaves had already started turning and falling. This place is definitely worth a few hours if you enjoy the peace and serenity of nature, even more if you want to get great photos and are a fan of horticulture.This is one place you shouldnt miss when going on a trip to Seoul. Autumn, for me, is the best time with bursts of yellow,red and orange complementing the spectacular garden foliage. Photos taken here are definitely keepers!After the congestion of Seoul, this is a welcome respite. Lots of nice walking paths, but there are hills. Definitely felt the calmness and peace. We arrived fairly early and noticed more people arriving later in the day. If you feel the need to slow down, this is the place to go.

Name: 청평호
Review: Came here during early March, weather was good . Got to wear winter wear to keep warm . It was windy . It's so serene and peaceful lake . Admire the view .Good view quiet location you can get here by the subway from Seoul to Gapyeong station used about one and a half hours and then get the one day bus ticket 6000KRW you can buy the tickets direct from bus driver and use its to...더 보기This is beautiful lake. You can just watch the nature, or you can do some water sports too. A popular destination for young adults.Perfect for couple in love with solitude, adventure, scenic beauty without going bankrupt <U+263A>.....We made online reservation for every thing. We were picked up on time from the railway station . it is equally safe too. The bungee jumping is the highest in Korea. ..around...더 보기Cheongpyeong Lake was the result of constructing a dam. While the area is pleasant enough, visitors to the lake are...더 보기

Name: 청평 자연휴양림
Review: everything is natural. clean air & clear water is impressive. also you can use a barbecue equipment for free.

Name: 쁘띠프랑스
Review:
Pretty French style houses standing on the hills. A village of children stories and beautiful landscape! Excellent destination for families!I really do not understand this as an attraction at all. It was cost around $6 USD to walk around for 20 minutes to see what looks like a little town for children in a theme park. It was boring, tacky, and uninteresting. I would...더 보기Not really worth the visit here as there are nothing much to see except for colorful building. Save the $$$...더 보기petite france is a very nice place already beautiful. there is also a Korean drama shooting location. and very suitable for coming during winterEverything seems romantic and happy here but I prefer the real things instead of fake ones. Luckily it was a stop on the way to Nami Island.You feel being transported back in time with small village in France
Well preserved collection and you remember why the little prince book was one of your favouritesPetite France and Nami Island are owned by the same owner. Therefore, those two places are always bundled together in the tour package. A very very small one road village. The icon picture basically have it all. Do not go there. Nothing to see or...더 보기Purchased a 1 day tour ticket from Travideals and went there for leisure and experience. Petite France has a nice scenery in terms of cute and colourful buildings. But I think going here as a 1 destination is not worth, lucky my 1 day tour...더 보기I wasn't that impressed with Petite France, regardless of how pretty it was. It didn't remind me of France, more of a cross between Germany (architecture) and Italy (colours). My wife and teenage children surprisingly did enjoy themselves so I can't award a "terrible" review....더 보기This is the french styled village and a forest way inside good for kids.There is a puppet show worth seeing.Its like a amusement park not worth specially going.However,photography is enjoyable

Name: 고양 국제꽃박람회
Review: 預<U+552E>票8000元，現場要12000元，一定要提早購買。博覽會有多達30國、300多間的花卉機關、團體、業者一同參與，展示各國的珍貴花種。還可以欣賞平常不易看到的珍稀植物展、運用花卉造型藝術打造成的室內庭園、或參加花卉文化體驗、<U+63D2>花。夜間活動還有燈光庭園、K-POP表演等，等著大家一起同樂。說到花卉，大家多半走訪日本賞櫻行!花卉喜好者千萬不要錯過韓國的高陽花卉博覽會，這裡的百花齊放更具蓬勃朝氣，室外夜備有以花卉<U+70BA>主題的體驗DIY活動，<U+5F88>適合帶小孩一同來玩。每年四月底至五月初於高陽<U+8209>辦的花卉博覽會，以各種不同的花樣展示花卉之美。不過相較於其他文化慶典或<U+771F>正大自然的景色而言，就沒這<U+9EBC>吸引人了。該活動被認<U+70BA>是韓國代表性的國際花卉展覽。節日於4月至5月在高陽一山湖公園<U+8209>行，來自25個國家的近300家相關機構，團體和公司展示鮮花和各種鮮花製品。此外，還計劃<U+8209>辦獨具特色的稀有植物展，以花卉藝術品裝飾的室內花園，戶外主題公園，花卉體驗製作，花藝比賽等文化活動和表演，<U+70BA>花卉節增添更多樂趣。<U+665A>上，燈光花園，LED性能，K-POP表演等精彩活動也將<U+70BA>遊客帶來歡樂，營造歡樂花卉文化節的<U+6C1B>圍。韓國於每年4月在一山湖水公園內的高陽花卉展覽館內<U+8209>行。本次活動是一次花卉貿易專門博覽會，將展示花卉栽培的新技術和新品種，<U+5D84>新的展示方法和全新的空間表現，使春天更加絢麗奪目。非常迷人的花卉博覽會，讓人流連忘返，而且心曠神怡，目前正在展覽花卉的藝術，2017.4.28～217.5.14非常建議可到此一遊，會讓<U+60A8><U+503C>回票價，very good!耶！

Lots of citizens of SEOUL go there by subway, and step up along handrails. Stand on the top, you can see amazing scenery of mountain rocks of KOREA. Highly strong recommend you walk up.This fortress is located inside Bukhansan Mountain National Park. - It was initially built in 2nd century by The Kingdom of Baekje.
- One way or another, hikers meet gates of the fortress...더 보기We spontaniously decided to hike to Bukhansanseong fortress on the sunny saturday last weekend.
It turned out to be the...더 보기Going by subway to Gupabal Station and then taking bus No. 704 or 34 to Bukhansanseong, we got there easily...더 보기

Name: CGV일산
Rank: 2위(5곳의 고양 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review:
I wanted to see Ant Man and the Wasp on IMAX and boy was I impressed! This IMAX facility has probably one of the biggest screens in the country! I swear it's awesome! HD clear pictures and sound! It has very clean and very beautiful lobby! I also saw BATMAN keeping watch in the rafters lol!! I only paid about 18,000 won for the 1125 am showing and I received a FREE poster as well!! So cool!! The customer service was really nice and ready to help you if you have questions! I believe you can also purchase your tickets on their many electronic kiosks as well. There's plenty of parking in the basement area. Only costs me 17,000 won from 0930 to about 1430 hours. If you have time to explore Ilsan, check CGV Ilsan out! You will find many attractions on this location! You won't be dissapointed!You have to visit this theater for the 4Dx experience and IMAX if you have plan to visit Ilsan which is located on northwestern area of Seoul.Experience korean movie theater was so fun
Staffs were super kind and nice would love to go back next timeEverything is nice expect that CGV charges more for the seats that are higher up.. The gourmet popcorns are very delicious!Bestest cinema ever visited. Imax and 4Dx experience is amazing.
Also the staff is very helpful, for foreigners too.We watched Kung Fu Panda in 4D at the CGV IIsan Theater in Lafesta Shopping Mall in Goyang. This was my first full length movie in 4D. The theater was a bit complicated to understand for us at first. My Chinese wife and mother in law couldn’t help me nor could my Korean father in law because he never frequents the movies. I got in line and spoke to the cashier but she wouldn’t help me and kept speaking to me in Korean. Finally, a lady helped us and told me that I had to get a ticket. I wondered if I was at the DMV lol! So first step is to get a number and wait your turn. Then ask which movie, if any, is in English. There was only one movie in English but it was also in 4D and that was Kung Fu Panda. It wasn’t my first choice but I’d rather watch a cartoon in English than watch a movie dubbed in Korean. Were so glad we were able to watch that movie in 4D because of all the action which made the very comfortable chairs vibrate and rotate. It was an incredible experience for all of us except for my Chinese mother in law that doesn’t speak English nor read Korean nor likes jerking chairs haha. This is my review and I loved the experience. Watching a movie in 4D at the CGV Theater in Lafesta Shopping Mall in Goyandg is a must!

Name: 한화 아쿠아플라넷 일산
Review:
One of the largest convergence aquarium in South Korea. There are 3 levels in Aqua Planet which consists of sea creatures such as jellyfish, and zoo animals such as sand tiger sharks, beavers, otters and penguins. Visitors can enjoy marine ecosystem and learn the importance...더 보기Well decorated aquarium. I love the jellyfish section!

I'm surprised because it has walrus. I watched the walrus show entirely and it amazed me. 

Fun fact : In Korean, it is called Sea Elephant considering the similarity between two and the size.Because i was staying a full week in Seoul i decided to spent a few hours in a aquarium and/or zoo. 

The place has some very nice exhibits. Especially the jellyfish section is beautiful. Though the place has also animals with too small exhibits. The...더 보기Hanwha Aqua Planet Ilsan is a very large aquarium in Korea that is nor far from Seoul. You can visit by subway easily. There are 3 zone, eg. aquarium, forest, and sky zoo. If you walk for 3 mins, you can reach Onemount Snow Park...더 보기Nice tourist attraction.  The aquarium has the most beautiful creatures from jelly fish, to penguins, to even the walrus waving!From Myeongdong area going to ilsan took sometime in the train but the journey was worth it. I've always been a huge aquarium person and we had some time to spare before leaving Seoul and this aquarium really wrapped up a fantastic Seoul journey! It's...더 보기Aqua Planet Ilsan is a relatively new aquarium. Initially, we thought that since this is just another aquarium, we would not be spending too much time in it. How wrong were we! Even while walking "fast", we took two hours just to cover the whole...더 보기
