Name: 국립 과천 과학관
Review:
Could barely cover half of the main exposition with our toddler. Most of the exhibits are targeted at school-age kids, but we still had lots to play with. All the information is in Korean, which was a bit of a problem, but half the time we could figure it out one way or another. Most of the exhibits are interactive and fun! Would surely come back for more if had more time... Could spend the whole day here, especially if also visiting the separate space exhibit, and planetarium, plus there's a park around all that.We absolutely love this science centre as it's filled with interesting exhibitions and hands-on activities for kids. Though 95% of the information was in Korean, we still had a great time and learned new things. Our children (5 and 10) especially liked the Natural History Centre and Advanced Technology exhibition hall. Too bad we were there on a rainy day so we didn't get to enjoy the outdoor area where there are spaceship, trains, playgrounds, etc. Anyhow, it's a great place to visit if you're travelling with kids and looking for something educational to do in Seoul.We travelled all the way here for my 4 year old dino-obsessed son. We thought it was totally worth it! Word of warning - taxis are hard to come by so you are probably better off prebooking your ride. The main exhibit hall was great - lots of informative stuff in English. They also have separate buildings for an Insectarium (which we didn’t go to) and a Space Centre (which we did but left quickly as it was all in korean and we understood nothing). There’s a Dino park outside as well with Dino statues which my son loved taking photos of.The place was big and there were lots of exhibits, but almost all in Korean and very little English, which was a waste because the whole place looked very interesting but we couldn't really understand. My six year old boy enjoyed himself though, since he doesn't read much yet. Koreans really put alot of effort into educating their young as evident in the huge Science Museum. We also sat in for the entire Planetarium show in korean (which again, we understood nothing) but the show was nice. We didn't know there was a large foodcourt on level 2, and went to the cafe in the train outside the building for some sandwiches. We went on a public holiday (Korean Election Day) but the place wasn't really crowded. It's a nice place to visit if the weather was hot or raining, but you'll have some trouble understanding since almost everything is in korean.This is my first time in my adult life to go to a national science museum, the place is large with many different sections. However it is best to go with a Korean Translator or someone who understand Korean, because most of the information is in Korean. It was fun to look around, but it will be even more wonderful to understand what is going onIf you have young kids they will love this place. Lots to do and look at. And great value! Even though most of the displays did not have English translation we still enjoyed our day out ( was a rainy yucky day) and was very easy to get to.Seoul, Koreans understand a lot about Kids education. this is an amazing place to experience with your people. How is life in Mars? Wanna be an astronaut? 3 to 5 hours would do.I almost skipped this place but Im so glad I didn't. It is amazing, most of the exhibits are in Korea but it doesn't matter - there is a massive Sci-Fi and Space section. You should allow atleast half a day out hereWe went there already twice and for children is a nice place. Many things to learn and to do and especially during spring and autumn good place to be (if fine dust in Seoul is not higher then yellow). Just recently went during the winter days and it is not recommendable because nothing you can do outside. Outside area you have huge trains, rockets, dinosaurs and many other things. Inside quite a lot about human history, space and universe and all the planets around us. Many things are also kept interactive and kids running from one to the other to try and see. Unfortunately most of explanations are in Korean only (Will check that out next time being home how is that done in our country). However newly installed electronic ticket booth does not offer English. That's poor. So try and error. At least the lady at the food court was speaking English quite well. Parking place available. Car entrance 5000 Won per car and entry fee for adult 4000/child above 7 for 2000 Won. From our point of view price performance ratio is excellent.Good place to spend time with kids.
Many things to learn and play.
But dont expect specialize and expertized things. Good for kids.

Name: 서울랜드
Review: This amusement park is older and dated but it was still fun as there was not really any lines for any of the attractions. You will notice that many younger children or families go to this amusement park however it is still good for all ages as there are rides for children and those who are older.download Klook and buy entry ticket which is a lot cheaper than buying at the entrance, you can do this even if you are already at the entrance and its great to redeem the tickets immediately. We went on Easter Friday but the park was not as full n crowded as Everland so way way more fun in Seoul Land.Very large park with lots of rides and things for the whole family to enjoy, its enough for a full day outing, many many restaurants inside to choose from for eating.This park is in the Seoul Grand Park area not far from the Zoo and has some really cool rides including 3 roller coasters. The nice thing about this park is that since most people go to Lotte World and Everland, it doesn't get as crowded. There's a good mix of rides with something for everyone.The place is suitable for both young children and adult. Many attraction can be played by all family members. The place is big enough for us to spend full time and play same attraction several times. The crowd was less than I expected and we were lucky for that. Overall, we were happy to get the chance to play all the attractions with beautiful view of autumn scenery along the way to Seoul Land by walk, or by sky lift from nearby station.Although this is one of the most convenient theme parks to go to in Seoul/Gyeonggi-do, it lacks a real crowd drawing ride. Kinda like Lotte World's lesser cousin.A good place to go when you have nothing else to do or are unable to go to Lotte World of Everland.the trip is nice to go down of the hill and the view is lovely .. you can see the park and lack and trees and mountingThis is an outdoor amusement park. Highly recommended for kids and you have many rides that you can enjoy without queuing for long.Many local food stalls within the park and you will not go hungry.This is a outdoor theme park consist of different kind of themes for children.  If you would like to have fun with your children, this is one of a good choose for you.  But it is a bit cold in winter.Maybe this theme is old already or maybe I came during winter, or maybe combination of both. There is really very little people in this theme park. There is so little people that I believe because of it many of the rides is closed or seems closed. But if you approach the rides some of them is actually open and the staff will return and operate it. (they seems to be talking to other staff which also their rides have no guest riding it lol)A little anti climax since the mood is so different from lotte world or everland, but a very good point here is that you can practically ride everything that is operating even if we came at noon time because there is no queues mostly. Only thing to note is many street food stall is closed so you have to eat at their restaurant, which is also empty, so don't come here on empty stomach.Everything is old and such don't expect pretty stuff, but during winter, they have ice sledge which in my opinion is the most fun ride and worth coming. No waiting time, can play as much as you want, I will not grade this theme park higher or lower than everland, both are as good, just different expectations.Very near Gangnam District in Seoul.Just show the Korean address of Seoul Land to the taxi driver and you'll be there in 20 to 30 minutes. The staff at the main Information Office at Seoul Land just before the entrance are very accommodating and helpful, and they speak good English too. We asked for a taxi from Seoul Land back to the hotel and we waited not more than 10 minutes. Great!

Name: 국립 현대 미술관
Review:
Large extensive grounds, interesting stores including one selling clothes repurposed from other clothes. The exhibitions were, well contemporary and I'll leave it at that.Why the title? According to their website, the museum is supposed to open at 10:00 on Sunday, when I got there the sign said opens at noon, which is a bit frustrating on a hot sunny day.Highly recommend visiting this wonderful museum. I had the chance to see a wonderful exhibition on Park Seobo and honestly I was amazed by it. I wish there would be a lot more discussion about modern contemporary Korean art.The MMCA is a beautiful building is worth to visit only because of its Architecture the exhibitions i saw The Korean Artist price 2018 was pretty remarkable.I used to be a frequent visitor to Seoul but recently have not had the opportunity to visit so I was excited to return to the city. Several friends suggested that I visit MMCA and raved about it. It was much less than my expectations. Building is interesting but exhibits were boring. Too much empty space to wander around. Perhaps it was the time I visited. It is quite a distance from even Insadong, although it looks much closer on the map.and is definitely a destination visit. I love modern art but unfortunately this is not one of the best museums I have found.MMCA is quite easy to get to, it's right next to the ancient palace Kyung Bok Gung. The area itself is artsy and even if the exhibitions are not to your taste, it wouldn't be half bad to just stroll the surrounding area after your visit to the MMCA.Anyway, I really enjoyed my visit to the museum, free entry for under 24s and seniors (also have happy hour offer for entry after 6pm) which is a plus. A lot of interesting things to see at the museum, suitable for those who want to take a day or half a day off from their shopping spree in SeoulA long metro ride and then 10 minutes bus ride on the free shuttle bus to get to this museum, so you need to have plenty of time in hand for a visit. External sculptures as well as 6 main galleries. Check what's on before you go to make sure it's worth the effort." so awesome because the admission is FREE! Perfect place to visit especially those who love paintings, collections , and some unique arts. Great to know that some of the paintings and arts here have history to tell people. Best place as well for students and for the whole family "This was a really nice museum and I was quite surprised to discover admission was free. There was a great variety of exhibits, which I really enjoyed.The grounds of the museum were beautiful, with a reflection pool where you could sit under an umbrella and enjoy a coffee and a sculpture garden.If you're up for a bit of a hike, I highly recommend getting off at Seoul Grand Park station and walking up the hill to enjoy the view of the city and get a peek at Seoul Land and the zoo. There's also a shuttle that runs several times an hour if you prefer to ride. Parking at the top of the hill is limited and looked cramped, so if you're driving I highly recommend parking in the large lots at the bottom and riding the shuttle!To see outside of the window
After I saw the paintings.
I soon realise there is.
Hold my breath
And feel.
NATURE.
Nothing's special
But tells me something.I'm not really an art person but i enjoyed my afternoon here. Getting there was EASY. After coming off the Grand Seoul station (line 4) exit 4, a few meters away is a shuttle bus going to the museum. It runs every 20 mins and the service is FREE.There is a large garden with an open museum with various installations. There's also a small snack bar for those who wish to have a cup of coffee or sandwich while enjoying the beautiful grounds.Entrance is also FREE for the permanent exhibitions. There's a ticket for the special exhibitions but i opted not to. I must say there was a lot to see and even if Im not really an art person, every form of contemporary art imaginable was there. From photogrpahs, to paintings, to 3D art, multimedia and interactive pieces.I spend around 1 1/2 hours walking around which was quite relaxed pace. Overall for a free trip, it was worth it.Also there a nice pond with tables and chairs at the front of the museum where once can just simply enjoy and chill and relax.

Name: 서울대공원
Review: The Seoul Grand Park has a good zoo and rose garden. I did not see roses in past visits but this time (late Oct.) the rose garden was filled with roses. In autumn the autumn colours are fascinating. However this year was dry and the summer was unusually long so the ginkgo and maple trees were much less attractive than last year. I like the park because it has a bird house where one could see various birds face to face ie not caged. The zoo is very large and has a wide range of animals.The zoo is big and nice, better you buy the package ticket wich incl elephant tram and sky lift. The only minus thing is there is not much option for food. Mostly sell sausage, teokkebi, and other korean food. So, if you want to eat other cuisine, bring it from home/ buy it before get in to the zoo. Oh, there is also 1 kfc outlet wich always full and dunkin doughnut before the ticket counter.We went there to visit the Zoo, we ended up visiting the whole place and spend the whole day there. The zoo is big and there is a lot to see. There is a sky lift that goes over a huge distance with amazing views. We did not expect something so nice - we were also lucky to go there in autumn when all the leaves were changing and the views were incredible. Definitely go even just for the sky lift ride - it was amazing!To access this area I would recommend using the lift as it provides an aerial view of the zoo. Within the zoo there are many animals on display from giraffes, elephant, lion, etc. The zoo is well- kept and the grounds are so pleasant to walk through. There are even some activity areas such as a rock wall and elephant trunk slide.We drove. Traffic was pretty backed up getting to and from the parking lot and Waze was directing us away from the parking we needed, beyond the "Seoul Zoo" parking sign, so we ignored Waze. We were able to pay for parking using our debit card, didn't need a Korean bank card or won. 5,000 won for a smaller vehicle and 10,000 won for a larger. From the parking lot, follow the crowds to get tickets for the Elephant Tram or walk 1km to the main entrance of the zoo. At the zoo entrance, buy tickets to enter the zoo. There are stroller rentals available, we were also able to use our debit card for this. 3,000 won, but had to leave ID there until we returned. Strollers were nice. The zoo grounds are beautiful. It was hot out, but I bet a trip in the fall would have been perfect. I was expecting to see a lot of sad exhibits based on other comments, but they seemed pretty typical compared to any other zoo I've been to. I thought the spacing was good and yes, there's a lot of walking, but it didn't feel like too much. My kids had a lot of fun. I thought the food/drink choices were good, too. You can also bring your own food and drink in if you wanted. When leaving, you have to buy a return trip for the Elephant Tram or make the 1 km trek back to the parking area (which is also the same as the entrance to the subway)... I recommend going, especially if you have kids! It was fun!Easter weekend travel to Seoul Korea and we knew we would have to visit the Seoul Zoo during April, my daughter loves animals and zoo's, we came here in Dec 2018 and it was too cold and the animals were all housed inside so it wasnt fun last time but this time it was amazing. The weather was very nice, sunny and cool, no icy floor, the cherry blossoms were still in effect so lots of people were still taking pictures, all the animals were out and about instead of locked in large rooms. Kids get in free so when we went there was many school children which was very nice to see them enjoy the park.The park has been one of my favorites in Seoul. It had been under renovation for many months but fortunately the renovation was completed when I went there in early Nov., 2018. The aviary was extensively altered. Now the visitors are isolated from the birds by glass panels. However some new species have been added. I like to go there in late Oct. or early Nov. as the maples and ginkgo trees create a beautiful mix of red, orange and yellow colors. The park is very large and I like the zoo most. To save walking, it is better to take the chair lift to the top and then walk down the hill. Once back to the zoo entrance I usually take the chair lift back to the main entrance, around sunset time. The view (from the chair lift) of the lake at sunset is fascinating.I love visiting zoo’s and seeing different animals. However, I recommend not visiting this zoo. I travelled 1.5 hours to get here, and I feel like my time travelling and visiting was wasted. There were many different animals, which was probably the best point. Each enclosure was small, dirty, and there was no sign of a zookeeper anywhere. Usually on my visits to the zoo I see many zookeepers tending and feeding the animals, but during my visit here I didn’t see any. Many animals looked sad and hungry, often eating dry leaves. The monkeys were also acting out at each other, probably because the cages were so small. As I mentioned, I love to visit the zoo, just not this one.I visit this park today and not much animals plus all the information in the park in korean languageAbout an hour bus ride from Seoul is the Seoul Grand Park with Zoo. It is a fun place for friends and families. The place is huge and so many animals to see. You will see bears, elephants, birds and a lot more. The entrance fee is not that expensive which comes with a free ride to the zoo bus and skylift. It goes uphill so you will get tired going up so be sure to bring some water and snacks to replenish.

Name: 서울 경마 공원
Review: 韓<U+56FD>にある３つの競馬場の中でも<U+56FD>際競走などが行われる大きな競馬場です。ソウル中心部からのアクセスも便利ですし、外<U+56FD>人<U+5C02>用の<U+89B3><U+6226>席もあるので、競馬を知らない<U+89B3>光客でも<U+697D>しむことが出<U+6765>ます。日本からも期間限定で騎手が行っていたり、<U+56FD>際競走では日本馬が活躍したりと、日本との交流も盛んです。日曜日に行きましたが、地下<U+9244>から混んでいました。入場門前で入場券購入に<U+4E26>んでいる人<U+3005>を尻目に、T-MONEYカ<U+30FC>ドでさくっと入場です。Lucky Ville1階の外<U+56FD>人案<U+5185>所でチャンピオンズスイ<U+30FC>トを希望しました。日本語<U+62C5><U+5F53>の方が居りスム<U+30FC>ズに購入できます。通常のマ<U+30FC>クシ<U+30FC>トは、ハングル文字だけで、どこにマ<U+30FC>クすれば良いか？何やらさっぱり分かりません。1万ウォンは掛かりますが、5千ウォンの購買券をもらえますし、チャンピオンズスイ<U+30FC>トは必須に思えます。シンガポ<U+30FC>ルの外<U+56FD>人用席は、バドワイザ<U+30FC>ガ<U+30FC>ルがひっきりなしにきますが、こちらは自由で日本語<U+62C5><U+5F53>も居て、コ<U+30FC>ヒ<U+30FC>などの<U+98F2>み物もフリ<U+30FC>でとても快適です。只、食事だけは、鍵を開けてもらい隣のフロアのフ<U+30FC>ドコ<U+30FC>トへ行くのですが、先<U+6255>いでメニュ<U+30FC>がなく何を<U+983C>んだらよいか分からず、メニュ<U+30FC><U+5199><U+771F>の<U+63B2>示されている1階の方へ回りました。日本語のレ<U+30FC>ス情報も<U+5449>れますし、席の<U+753B>面でもオッズが確認できます。釜山競馬も購入できますが、そちらはオッズ通りのレ<U+30FC>スが多く、とりがみにならない程度には<U+5F53>たりました。最終的に席は、中<U+56FD>の方や、<U+6B27>米の方、日本の方などのグル<U+30FC>プやカップルでほぼ埋まっていました。競馬公園<U+99C5>より徒<U+6B69>3分。日本でも競馬が好きなので、行ってみました<U+30FC>！思ったより人も多く、にぎわっているイメ<U+30FC>ジ。入場料はt-moneyでタッチして<U+6255>うことができて2,000Wでした。全<U+4F53>的におしゃれなオブジェや撮影スポットがあったり、かなり綺麗で<U+6E05>潔でした。日本の地方競馬場よりよほど綺麗です。パスポ<U+30FC>ト持<U+53C2>で、外<U+56FD>人<U+5C02>用のＶＩＰル<U+30FC>ムに入れます。（1人10,000W）1人5,000Wのバウチャ<U+30FC>をもらえます。マ<U+30FC>クカ<U+30FC>ドの記入して、入り口のお姉さんに渡すと馬券が買えます。チェジュの馬券も買えます。地下<U+9244>４<U+53F7>線で、ソウル<U+99C5>から約２５分です。競馬公園<U+99C5>下車、徒<U+6B69>５分です。開催日の入場料は、２０００ウォン（約200円）でした。競馬新聞は、ハングル語ですが、１０００ウォンから販<U+58F2>されています。各競馬新聞の詳細の値段は、良くわかりませんでした。馬券は、マ<U+30FC>クカ<U+30FC>ド方式ですが、有人の窓口で買うことが出<U+6765>ます。但し、１階の窓口は、５０００ウォン以上でなければ購入できませんので、それ以下の場合は、２階、３階で購入することになります。<U+6255>い<U+623B>しも、購入と同じ窓口に的中馬券を出すと、<U+6255>い<U+623B>しが出<U+6765>ますが、全ての窓口なのかどうかははっきりしませんでした。私は、<U+6255>い<U+623B>しで<U+4E26>んでいるところで行いました。私が、訪れた日は２０１６年５月７日土曜日です。馬券は１００ウォン（約１０円）から購入できますので、低額で遊ぶことも出<U+6765>ますので、<U+6C17><U+697D>に行くことが出<U+6765>ます。一時期なくなっていた外<U+56FD>人フロアが復活しました。新館5階、外<U+56FD>人案<U+5185>所そばの<U+5C02>用エレベ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>で上がります。パスポ<U+30FC>ト要、スマ<U+30FC>トカジュアル。マ<U+30FC>クシ<U+30FC>トに英<U+30FB>中<U+30FB>日を塗る場所もあり、馬券やバウチャ<U+30FC>もその言語で出てきます。特に<U+4F1A>員<U+8A3C>やスタンプ押されませんでしたが、入退室管理はどうしてるのか聞きそびれていまいました(^_^;)一昨年からようやく<U+56FD>際競走が始まった韓<U+56FD>競馬。この日はアジアチャレンジカップが行われ大井競馬所<U+5C5E>馬、シンガポ<U+30FC>ルからの遠征馬が出走しました。韓<U+56FD>競馬自<U+4F53>ダ<U+30FC>トコ<U+30FC>スがなくレベルはまだ地方競馬ほどのレベルですが、<U+6765>月はついに初のJRA所<U+5C5E>馬の出走があるとのことで<U+697D>しみが<U+5E83>がります。ソウル競馬は<U+6BCE>週土日開催で土曜日は<U+6E08>州競馬、日曜日は釜山競馬の場外<U+767A><U+58F2>もあります。馬券は<U+5358>勝、複勝、馬連、ワイド、三連複で固い配<U+5F53>が多く穴<U+515A>には<U+53B3>しいかもしれません。<U+5185>馬場には家族公園があり、ポニ<U+30FC>の<U+4E57>馬<U+4F53><U+9A13>、ロ<U+30FC>ズガ<U+30FC>デンなどがあり、家族でも<U+697D>しめます。ソウル市街から地下<U+9244>でアクセスできる競馬場。ダ<U+30FC>ト<U+5C02>業かつ日本のjraのように大衆レジャ<U+30FC>化していないので、地方競馬的な感<U+899A>で<U+697D>しめる。競馬公園という名になっていますが、競馬場です。入場料は２０００Ｗでしたが、Ｔマネ<U+30FC>カ<U+30FC>ド（<U+6B8B>高なし）が入場券だったので、それ以降Ｔマネ<U+30FC>カ<U+30FC>ドにチャ<U+30FC>ジをして地下<U+9244>で移動しました。設備は非常にきれいで、雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>も昔の日本の地方競馬場より殺<U+6C17>だってなくて、安心して行けると思います。若い女性同士や若いカップルが<U+6765>ていたのがその<U+8A3C><U+62E0>かと思います。日本人向けに、日本語が話せる<U+62C5><U+5F53>者がいますので、不明な点はインフォメ<U+30FC>ションで尋ねることもできます。ソウル<U+99C5>から地下<U+9244>４<U+53F7>線で３０分ぐらいで競馬公園<U+99C5>に到着しました。ソウル競馬場は、<U+99C5>から徒<U+6B69>５分です。競馬場までの間には、競馬新聞を<U+58F2>る店があり、日本での風景とあまり<U+5909>わりません。競馬場は、ダ<U+30FC>トの左回りのこじんまりとした競馬場で、日本の地方競馬場と雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が近いです。馬券は，<U+5358>勝式、複勝式、連勝複式、連勝<U+5358>式、ワイド、３連複の６種類で、１００W（約１０円）から購入可能です。馬は、マ<U+30FC>クシ<U+30FC>トで買いますが、塗りつぶしには、サインペンを使用しなければならないようです。ボ<U+30FC>ルペンだと窓口でエラ<U+30FC>になってしまいます。サインペンを持っていない場合は、外<U+56FD>人<U+5C02>用のインフォメ<U+30FC>ションに行くと貸してくれます。日本語がわかるスタッフがいますので、安心して聞いて見てください。競馬場の入場料は、一人１０００w（約１００円）でした。

Name: 광명동굴
Review: Sure it's a bit far (40 mins train, 40 mins bus) from most main tourist zones in Seoul, but this quirky little park is worth your time. Part cave, part weird underground amusement park, this place can keep you busy for an hour or two for sure. I see people talking about the walking/steps, but if you are even minorly in shape, it's not an issue (maybe a few hundred stairs total). We did a cold wednesday morning and it was almost completely empty. For only 6000won, plus another 3000 to go through a "horror cave", you really can't go wrong. In addition to the cave and it's few offshoots, you can also do some virtual reality (5000-14000won), climb a platform for pretty good views, and there is upcycle art gallery worth a quick wander. It's not that the cave or attractions were so good, it's just the undeniable uniqueness of the entire experience that isn't available anywhere else on planet earth.This is a cave park with some fun attractions, shops and foods. Very nice for a family with young children. A day trip from Seoul is available.- How to get there: Subway line #1 (heading to Suwon, Byeongjeom, Shinchang) from Yongsan to Geumcheon-gu Office. And there's a connecting 4-coach shuttle train from the very platform you got off. This shuttle train stops at the next stop, 'KTX Gwangmyeong'. Be aware of this train's schedule. In the worst case, you may wait for almost an hour. After leaving Gwangmyeong Station through exit #7 or #8, take bus #17 at platform #8-1. 10~15 min until Gwangmyeong Cave. Follow others after that. It's about 15~20 min until the ticket office.- Entrance is 6,000 won for adults and there are other discount rules.- It takes about an hour to see the cave. You will go until wine cellar & cafe and come back.- Gwangmyeong Cave isn't that tough to walk around. Seniors can finish even if there are some up & down. They provide helmets. But, these aren't necessary. The observatory is next to the cave entrance and this is the only thing turning down for seniors.- There are other attractions in and out. Additional programs for additional costs. These are mostly good for children.- You can learn the cave's history. But, this cave is mostly for entertainment having fishes, laser show, illuminations, photo spots, wine cellar, etc.- The food truck zone outside looked cool for foreign visitors.We had a really good visit! The cave itself was a very enjoyable showing, but I also enjoyed learning the history of the cave. We visited the second exhibit (better for kids, additional fee) “Rainbow Factory”, a hands on traveling exhibit and light and technology. We didn’t experience the VR (additional fee) but heard great things. We hiked up past the sign on the mountain and explored the upcycled Zoo exhibit as well. Food trucks and cafes on site. Water for kids to splash in.It’s my first time visiting this attraction. Visit was worth it. The light and sound show. The gallery. The Lord of the Rings concept . The dark history of its past. But just a gentle reminder, this is said to be more of a man made instead of a natural creation. Another reminder , going to the main entrance itself will be a steep uphill climb. And inside will require 150 steps each going up and down both ways. A small consolation is a drinking fountain midway. And of course some wine tasting at the end of the tour . Our tour organiser arranged a fine dining set up for us.You can tour inside the cave for 1hr...lots of stairs and cool inside, you won't get lost, there's a lot of guide too. Outside the theme park are food and gift shops, and down further you'll see a mini recycling park and museum.I traveled all the way from Yongin to see this beauty. Took the subway all the way to Cheolsan Station from Stadium-Songdam College Station (took me 1 hr and 40 mins). From Cheolsan station Exit 2, I walked a little to the left and crossed the street towards the bus stop and rode Bus 17 which goes all the way to the entrance of the cave (travel time is around 1 hour). Upon arriving at the main entrance, I had to walk upwards for around 8 minutes just to get to the cave entrance itself. Tickets cost 6000 KRW for adults. Upon going in, you'll be amazed how Koreans were able to transform a former mining cave to the attraction that it is now. Inside they have aquariums, light tunnels, a lake, dioramas, and even a wine laboratory!Be ready to go up the Stairs of Longevity. It's quite steep and I was out of my breath upon reaching the top!Kids and elderly people might have difficulty roaming here as there are a lot of stairs, but they have designated rest areas where people can sit.A must-see! When I was there, all the people inside were Koreans.Booked the EG shuttle to visit the Cave which is an hour from Hongdae. Must be physically fit to visit because it took us about 1.5 hours to complete the circuit, excluding the horror zone. It is cool in the Cave with impressive light displays. Initially, the route we took was mostly down the steps but there was a stair of longevity which was going upstairs and it was challenging. There were no worries about getting lost because staff at stationed at strategic points to direct visitors. The last point is the wine cellar and there was even sampling of wine. After this section, we u turned and. the exit was not far away. Didn't want to wait for the EG shuttle so went across the road to take Bus 17 to go to. Cheolsan Station to return to Seoul.There's so much to see in the Gwangmyeong Cave alone. They have a light and sounds show in the media cave, big & moving dragon sculpture, hall of lights, aquariums, wine cave and cellar, horror section, historical and information area, golden cave, etc. Just be prepared to walk up and down lots of steps and stairs.Modernized cave with entertainment , various activities, sightseeing with aquaruim (small), light and sound displaying on the rock facade, winding steps but not too physical demanding, ex underground lake with light illuminstions, temperature is cool as compred with freezy cold outside. Pink tall chimney is the landmark when reaching this cave themed park.I booked transit tour ahead from incheon sirport website, important thing is that you need early morning arrival and then quick go thruogh immigration, further your way out through the custom declaration and go to identify yourself-booking reply e mail at the tour desk between exit gate 8_9. It's amazingly organized , and much important thst it's all free including transportation, english speaking tourguide, admission fee and transfer back to your terminal.We definitely recommend a visit to this site: a testament to the will of the Korean people to overcome a dark past. This cave was actually a mine exploited by the Japanese during their occupation where Koreans were the forced labour to mine gold, silver, zinc and other minerals. It was later used to store dried shrimp and other foodstuffs, then left abandoned for forty years. The old mine has been converted to a tourist site as a cave with an interesting light and media displays, local plants nurseries, and aquariums of exotic fish - all in addition to relating the story of the cave's past. For me a hightlight was a New Age music and video presentation using the contours of the rock as a screen for the video - just spectacular!

Name: 평화의 소녀상
Review: 광명동굴 입구에 있는 소녀상은 주변이 산이고 밑에는 어린이 놀이터도 있어요.동굴입구에 있어 수문장 처럼 앉아 있는데 왠지 쓸쓸해 보여요. 동굴 주변에는 사람이 많이 모여있지만 조금 비켜있는 소녀상은 별 관심이 없는듯 해요.C ( 17.08.15 ) 광명의 관광명소인 광명동굴 입구에 만들어진 평화의 소녀상. 2015년 8월 15일에 만들어짐. 늘 이 소녀상들을 볼 때마다 가슴이 먹먹해짐을 느껴지게 됨. 소녀상의 제작은 전국적으로 늘어나는 추세이니, 설명이 되어 있는 보드를 꼼꼼히 읽어보는 것도 좋을 듯함. 보편적으로 알려진 소녀상의 형태를 띠고 있음. 한국의 슬픈 역사 중 하나인 위안부를 기리는 동상이니 광명동굴을 갔을 때 꼭 한번 보고 느끼고 읽어보는 것이 좋을 듯함.

Name: 남한산성 도립공원
Review:
ソウルの南東、<U+5E83>州の山中にある山城。漢陽（現在のソウル）に置かれた王城を外敵の侵入から守るために防御用の城として整備されました。さらに万が一の場合には臨時の首都として使われました。ソウル近郊の世界遺産です。東大門のホテルから地下<U+9244>で<U+4E57>り換えて山城<U+99C5>まで行き、そこからバスで行きました。個人でいくのは難しいのかなと思っていましたが割とスム<U+30FC>スに着きました。現地には日本語のガイドブックもあり、<U+6B74>史的建造物の世界遺産を<U+697D>しめました。スニ<U+30FC>カ<U+30FC>でないと無理です。
<U+8210>めてかかるとかなりしんどいです。
おじいちゃん、おばあちゃんでも登れます。ソウル郊外にある大きな山城です。古代からの朝鮮式山城で、山を取り<U+56F2>んで延<U+3005>と城壁が築かれ、その中に砦<U+30FB>見張り台だけでなく、王宮や集落、田畑もあります。この城をめぐる<U+6226>いとしては17世紀の<U+6E05>との<U+6226>いが映<U+753B>「天命の城」に描かれています。日本語ガイド付きのツア<U+30FC>で<U+53C2>加、近くの<U+99C5>でワゴンにピックアップしてもらい、かなり上まで行ってもらって、西門から城壁を<U+6B69>きました。世界遺産となって修復、復元もすすみ見ごたえがあります。2014年に世界文化遺産に登<U+9332>されたソウル郊外の山です。地下<U+9244>８<U+53F7>線の「サンソン（山城）」<U+99C5>からバスによるアクセスとなります。「山城ロ<U+30FC>タリ<U+30FC>」バス停が目的地となりますが、そこまでのバスには二系統あり、直行便の他、街の中を巡る系統があります。地下<U+9244>「サンソン（山城）」<U+99C5>にはコインロッカ<U+30FC>もあるので、旅の最終日に訪れるのも良いでしょう。紅葉の時期に、はじめて行きました。ちょっと行き方が難しかったけど、地下<U+9244>とバスで行ってみました。行きは終点だったのでまあスム<U+30FC>ズにたどりつけました。<U+89B3>光案<U+5185>所のおば<U+69D8>も親切で、分かりやすい地<U+56F3>もくれました。全てをまわることはできませんでしたが、主要箇所はまわれたと思います。紅葉が素晴らしく、ほどよい運動になり、とても<U+6C17>に入りました。また行きたいです。<U+5E30>りのバスは終点ではないので、降りたい停留所（地下<U+9244>の<U+99C5>）で降りられるか心配で、隣の席の女性に聞いたら、とても親切に<U+6559>えてくれ、運<U+8EE2>手さんに大きな<U+58F0>で<U+4F1D>えてくれ、本<U+5F53>に助かりました。ソウルの人の<U+6E29>かさに<U+89E6>れ、とても幸せなデイトリップでした長城の上を<U+6B69>くことができ、門や宮殿の跡が<U+6B8B>っていて見所あります。ソウル市<U+5185>から<U+9244>道で1時間、バスで30分～1時間とアクセスするのに時間がかかります。時間の都合上2時間程度しか<U+6EDE>在できず、隅<U+3005>まで回ることを考えると移動時間も含めて、1日くらい時間をとった方がよいと思います。地元の方<U+3005>がお弁<U+5F53>もって散策しに<U+6765>ていますが、基本的に山なので、なかなかの坂道です。城壁に沿った道は<U+8217><U+88C5>されていますので、そういう道を選んで<U+6B69>けば通常の運動の<U+88C5>いで大丈夫だと思いますが、それなりの服<U+88C5>をし、スキ<U+30FC>のストックをもって、<U+7363>道へとはずれて行く地元の方<U+3005>もたくさんいました。山城からバスで簡<U+5358>に行けますが、シ<U+30FC>ズンの休日は10時過ぎくらいからバスは激<U+8FBC>みしますので注意!!地元の方の散<U+6B69>道にもなっておりすべて基本タダですので、おススメします!地下<U+9244>８<U+53F7>線の山城<U+99C5>2番出口を出たら、そのまま道沿いにまっすぐ50mほど行ったところにバス停があります。バス停からは52番か週末なら9-1番で終点まで20分程度です。最初どこから登ればよいかわかりませんでしたが、とりあえず行宮の<U+6A2A>を登るとなんとなく行き先がわかります。初めて訪れる場合は、道がわかりづらいので、最短ル<U+30FC>トでも1時間で周るのは難しいでしょう。あと、地<U+56F3>上で近道に見えても、細い道だと場合によって途中で道が途切れて迷子になるので注意です。

Name: 남한산성
Location: 경기도 광주 남한산성면 남한산성로 784-16 784-16, Namhansanseong-ro, Namhansanseong-myeon
Review: The World Heritage listed Namhansanseong fortress can be reached from Seoul in about an hour. Catch the metro to Sanseong, then the bus to the fortres. Set in the hills the fortress is a great place for hiking. The walls are about 12km long. The fort has several gates, crennulations and watch towers. A good half day out.It’s a little out of the way from Seoul, but totally worth the visit. Easy to get to as directions are quite clear, and in doubt you can follow the many elderly folk going there too. It gives you a different feel from the bustle of the city, and the air is cool and crisp. Lovely trip. At the base of the fortress there are also many restaurants and cafes which offer good food at affordable prices. Well worth a visit to do something different if you’re going to stay in Seoul.One of my favorite hiking sites to date...I'm loving hiking here in Korea, even summer time can make you feel happy...Nice view feom the top and you'll get to see the city view, if air quality is favorable, you'll see lotte tower too...It only took less than two hours to take the old walk way course. Hike for free.I combined my trip to Namhansanseong with a visit to Hwaesong, starting out in Seoul. All is easily doable using public transport. Since it was quite a hot summer day, I enjoyed that most of the ways to get from place to place is in the shade, the walls and gates are really pretty. If you have seen the royal palaces in Seoul beforehand the (reconstructed) Palace inside the fortress might be a bit of a let down. Inside the fortress is a normal village, you also find plenty of food or drink options throughout the paths you can follow. Besides the fortress walls and gates you can also step into a couple of temples.Very well maintained and marked attraction. Enjoyed seeing the various buildings and reading about them.I finally went out to visit this UNESCO World Heritage site, and I'm so glad we went. It has easy and more challenging trails. We took a bus from Sanseong station to near the top of the mountain to have an easier time. We walked to the North Gate and then up the mountain just a little bit to the West Door. We walked around just a little bit more before heading down. There were enough signs along the trail indicating where to go for what. Looking at the map was a little bit confusing, but the signs that pointed down each trail saying what was which way made it easy to figure out where we wanted to go. Be sure to eat lunch somewhere near the North Gate! There are a bunch of restaurants and cafes. We had a nice coffee right near the fortress palace and then a really delicious lunch of smoked duck, bibimbap, potato pancakes, and bean paste stew.Locals and tourists flock to this fortress and the city inside of it. Take the #52 bus from Namhansanseong station, or the #9 bus from Sanseong station.The city inside the fortress is filled with restaurants. The palace was recently reconstructed. This palace includes beautiful views from the mountain of the town below. There are many different walks or hikes you can take from the town to tour the fortress, ranging from simple to challenging.For a challenging hike, walk from the Namhansanseong subway station about 1.5 km to the park. Then, take another 1.5 km hike up the mountain in a beautiful valley. Locals come to this area to picnic, relax, and exercise. The route gets steeper as you go. Toward the top are natural springs you can refill water bottles from. At the top you reach the South Gate of Namhansanseong Fortress. This is the most photogenic of the fortress entrances. My 9 year old son and I did the above hike. From the South gate, we walked the perimeter of the fortress to the North gate, then down into the town. By the end, we were exhausted. It was a rewarding experience.This is made in Bakjae dinasty(7, 8 Century). Used also in Silla and Joseon dinasty. It is not tough at all, very easy walk course. There is also small palace where King stayed(need to buy ticket for the palace). We were lucky to have chance to watch the Korean traditional performance at the yard of South Gate. They said, every last Sunday of the month, there are some traditional performance for visitors. It is free.First of all, if you have time to see only Namhansanseong or Hwaseong(the other unesco listed fortress in the area - in Suwon), most definitely go to this one. The time it takes to get to either of them by public transport from downtown Seoul is roughly equal, but this one has more hiking, more views, more information, and generally more of everything. Do see both of them if you have the time though.Plan for a full day if you can, half a day if you must. The shortest suggested hiking route from the bus stop area is marked as taking about an hour.The fortress is in the provincial park, or the provincial park is in the fortress, can't really tell. Anyway, it's a large forested and hilly area surrounded by a wall with a village (mostly restaurants and cafes) at the centre and some pretty temples and military buildings all over the area.Tourist information isn't marked super well: from the last bus stop head towards the roundabout the bus just crossed and look for two small houses with thatched roofs some 200 m further out and slightly to the left. Once there you can get all the info about the area as well as buy tickets to see the fortress's "emergency palace" (guided tour in English at 14.00). There's also an info booth just at the roundabout, but here they only ask you how much time you have, hand you a map and say go this way and that way and bye bye.We came there for half a day, completed half of trail no 1, half of no 2, did some sightseeing at the palace and loved it all very very much. And we plan on coming back to see the rest.A bit hard to reach by public transport but totally worth it. The fortress covers a huge mountainous area, so be sure to wear hiking shoes. If the weather is nice, you can see a large part of Seoul from the walls. You can choose from among several walking trails. In the valley in the middle of the fortress there are plenty of cafes and restaurants. To get there, take subway no.8 to Sanseong station (not Namhansanseong!) exit 2, and then bus no.9-1. You can also reach it by bus 9 it takes longer and has more stops.Definitely worth visiting!

Name: 금남로공원
Review: 위치적으로 랜드마크지만 사실상 별거 없어요. 근데 가끔 공연하거나 행사를 하더라구요. 바로 옆이 충장로에요~리뷰를 하고 있는 금남로 공원은 광주광역시, 전라남도에 있는 금남로 공원이다. 이 공원은 광주의 구도심 충장로,금남로에 있는 작은 공원이다. 공원의 크기는 작지만 이곳을 처음 알게된 것은 음악축제를 이곳에서 하면서 이곳을 알게 되었다. 이 공원 근처에는 음식점도 있어서 사람들이 많이 찾는 장소이다. 공원에서 걸어서 조금 올라가면 쇼핑 구역이 시작된다.

Name: 남한산성 역사관
Review: 華城、南門ももちろん見どころですが、山を登って城壁とソウルの街<U+4E26>みの眺めは<U+58EE><U+89B3>でした。高野山のハイキングくらいの山<U+6B69>きで、人も少なく心地よいです。山城（サンソン）<U+99C5>前もしくは少し<U+6B69>いてポリテク大<U+5B66>前のバス停から何路線かバスが出ていて、たどりつきました。野搭（ヤタプ）<U+99C5>からバスとガイドブックには載っていましたが、バス<U+4E57>り場が見つからず別ル<U+30FC>トに<U+5909>更してようやく、でした。

Name: 동구릉
Review: Korean respect for their ancestors is impressive, well documented in the remarkable state of preservation of these Joseon dynasty tombs. There are apparently 119 burial sites for the 500 years of this dynasty, of which this site, "East Nine Royal Tombs," is the largest cluster. Very impressive, wonderfully landscaped with stone paths connecting the nine sites.Donggureung means Royal Tombs of Joseon Dynasty specifically located together in Guri City, Gyeonggido Province maintained by Korean Cultural Heritage Administration.- This is a really good place to learn history and take a walk in a forest area.- This is in Guri City. Not easy to arrive for foreign tourists. From Dongdaemungu or Jungranggu, Bus #88, #202 and #202-1 get there. It takes 30~60 min depending on traffic. Cheongryangri seems to have a good connection from the other districts of Seoul.- Locating outside Seoul, this is not that crowded with few people.- The entrance fee is 1,000 won. And there are discount and free rules depending on conditions.- Staffs were really kind and friendly.- The guided route is counter-clockwise from the ticket office.- Built in a massive area, visitors have to walk a lot. There are benches and folk playgrounds in many points.- The stream passing in this area is really pure and clean. It's so refreshing to see fishes and frogs in the water.- There are 9 tomb zones and some of them have more than one tomb in a single zone.- The oldest tomb is for the first king of Joseon Dynasty and built in early 15th century.- They have wonderful ceremonies on memorial days. Those rituals will be interesting as well.- There is the only one tomb that visitors can access so close. Others are quarantined by fences.A little hard to reach but is worth it to be in the company of such a historic UNESCO world heritage site - the tombs of many of the great kings and queens of the past Joseon dynasty ... Honestly it amazes me how quiet this place is, I had it almost to myself was a little creepy. The scale and sense of history here is just amazing and to share a quiet moment at the tomb of the founder of the dynasty with no one around is a unheard of experience in Asia. Please if you have any interest in history make the effort to come out here for a few hours -You will not be disappointed as even if you are bored of the history, the natural landscape is gorgeous!Went to this place with a Meetup group and was stunned by the sheer magnificence and beauty!!!It so stunningly green and just...wow. The history and preservation of this place is by far one of the best I have seen so far.The people are so attentive to keeping and preserving these tombs.There is complete and open space of just fields of green surrounded by huge oak trees which from my understanding are the kings of trees.Our guide was very knowledgeable and you could tell he loves the history of the tombs.I was very glad to have made the trip although the humidity was a killer.This place is huge and worth to visit. We luckily went inside without paying but I felt bad for doing so; this place worth more than \1000. The design of the tombs was similar to one another therefore you may skip it after seeing 2 or 3 tombs. To reach this place was a bit difficult; we got lost on the way thereCC(2013. 3)Donggureung means east nine tombs. The size of Donggureung was bigger than I thought. In Donggureung, six kings and ten queens are slept(Joseon's 1st king Taejo, 5th king Munjong, 14th king Seonjo, 18th king Hyeonjong, 21st king yeongjo, 24th king Heonjong). Maybe this royal tombs area will be the biggest Joseon royal tombs in Korea. If you want to know about Joseon's tomb form, we recommend to go there because there are nine tombs!!This historic complex of tombs is wonderful to explore. King Taejo's tomb which dates back to 1408 is the oldest Joseon tomb, as he began the Joseon dynasty in 1392. Seventeen kings and queens of the Joseon dynasty are located here. The tombs reflect the ideals of the Joseon dynasty, and are infused with Confucian design and principles. Each tomb site was carefully chosen using feng shui, to locate the most auspicious place to build.Donggureung is perhaps the best place to see various examples of Joseon tomb design. There are tombs found here from the 15th - 19th centuries. The beauty of the location, as well as numerous hillsides make it an ideal location. The elegant, yet simple design of the tombs found here are pleasing in their intricate details and stone guardian statues. If you have only one opportunity to visit a cluster of Joseon tombs visit Donggureung.

Name: 구리 타워
Review: С башни открывается очень хороший вид на город. Идеальное место и для любителя фотографировать, и для романтических парочек, да и ребетишки от зрелища в восторге. Также есть ресторан.

Name: 현대프리미엄아울렛 김포점
Review: Even with the tax refund the outlet is way too expensive for a shopper from Dubai!!! It way out of the reach of the city! It is closer to the Incheon airport and if you have a transit, you may consider visiting but I would not agree with shopping there! Will have to cab it there and get a return cab to the closest metro if you live in Seoul!This small mall based around the Lotte department store is a good place to kill a few hours before or after a flight at Gimpo airport. It’s attached to the underground walkway between the domestic and international terminals that connects to the subway. Nice selection of restaurants including decent Mexican, Indian and Chinese.Its the second time we were here. I find tgat that its a very big Premium Outlet complex, lots of walking to do. There's East, West and Tower blocks. Able to find many branded goods here. However, there's too little choice when it comes to dining. This complex and all their food outlets znd restaurants close very early, at 8.30pm. Tough time looking for place to have dinner after all the shopping. Hardly see any taxis around, too.In this unforgettable trip, we have been to Hyundai premium outlet and lotte department store of Gimpo airport. Unexpectedly, I love HPOG so much. There are many famous brands and traditional Korean foods that you can choose. By the way, one of famous Taiwanese beverage shop as well. For instance, I bought Nike shoes around $ 60, which is really cheap compare to Taiwan’s outlet. Spend too much money- please be careful. Enjoy and have fun 比起金浦機場的樂天百貨，我覺得我會選擇在現代暢貨中心花上整天的時間，不管是男生女生都會<U+901B>的非常開心。 大推The outlet is huge composed OF about 4 to 5 connecting buildings. All known usual brands are present. The prices are varied according to present sale/promo for The day. Food stalls and restaurants are open. However, in my opinion, American outlet are still a little bit cheaper. All in all a good place to shop if you are in The area.Terribly disappointed with GUCCI service ,the lady with her title MANAGER is a disgrace , poor English and poor service , she got irritated and angry when we asked her some information about the bag , she obviously didn't understand what we are asking and just keep dismissing us with YOU CAN REPAIR THE BAG AT GUCCI SINGAPORE . well I can do without a bag in my life but let's see if she can do without a job with this kinda of service attitude if she remain to be like that forever <U+200D>♀<U+FE0F>Outlet with premium international and Korean brand inside, with 3 levels and few gates. Few cafes and free wifi also....across the street there are H & M store, Uniqlo and some other stores. Tax refund applies for \ 30.000 minimal expenses. Nice place for shopping.Marvelous shopping outlet for famous international brands outlet I've ever visited.Name it....you can find almost all famous international brands there, say Ferragamo, Tory Burch, Jimmy Choo, Burberry, Prada, Miu Miu, Tod's, Channel, Balenciaga....and many more. If you can do camping.....just kidding, do so, as 1 day not enough for you to check in each and every shopIt's a new shopping area, so everything you see there are brand new. However, you walk outside to get inside individual retail chain stores. On weekdays there a few people, so it doesn't feel like a place for shopping. Also, I remember there wasn't a place to eat nearby (no restaurant). Overall, Hyundai Premium Outlet Gimpo is just an average shopping outlet center, for now.Don't see much review for this. Anyway, explored it. Pretty big and nice to walk around. The usual international Stores are there - tods, Ferragamo, Tory burch, Burberry, ck, etc.Quite easy to get there from Seoul. A quick subway to Gaehwa station before changing to a taxi or bus (number 16). I took the bus as there wasn't any taxi in sight. About 25 mins to reach there (last stop).There is even a kids club there where you can leave by themselves to play with supervision. Cost only 10000 won for 2 hours. Very clean and safe environment. Best of both worlds.

Name: 라베니체
Review: Superb view at night!Plenty of restaurants to choose from.The area kind of mimics the architecture and atmosphere of Italy, thus its name Laveniche.There's also an arcade to play with friends.

Name: 김포 장릉
Review: 산책하기좋습니다. 지금 가을이라 단풍이 예쁠것 같아요. 초입에 감계탕집잇는데 여기도 유명합니다. 가신김에 먹어도 좋을듯요^^김포까지 일부러 찾아올필요는 없지만 김포에 오실 일 있거나 지나가다가 방문해보실만합니다한적하고 주차도 편리하고 깨끗하게 관리가 잘되어있습니다공기도 좋고 산책로도 아름답습니다어릴적 부터 소풍갔던 장소, 아이들 데리고 산책하기 좋은 장소, 김밥 사서 돗자리 펴고 자연을 벗삼아 있기 좋은 장소김포시청 뒷편에 위치한 명소입니다여름에는 아이들을 위한 야외풀장도 개방하고있고 산책하기 딱좋은 높이와 거리입니다김포시청 뒷편으로 자리잡은 곳입니다.원종의 묘와 인헌왕후의 묘가 있는 곳으로가족과 함께 역사도 배우고 맑은 공기를 만날수 있는 곳입니다.맛나고 풍경속에 묻힌 하루는 여유로운 하루를만끽하고 멋진 스케치도 했어요 봄날이었는데 4계절모두 좋은풍경 입니다조선왕 인조의 부모를 모신 능입니다. 인조의 아버지는 왕족이었는데, 그 아들이 왕에 올라 능에 모셔지게 된 겁니다. 그런 만큼 화려하진 않지만 아기자기 잘 꾸며진 능입니다. 능과 넓은 잔디밭, 오래된 숲, 저수지 등이 있어서 김포시민들의 소풍, 산책 장소로 이용되고 있습니다. 입장료는 1천원이고 김포시민은 500원입니다. 안에 매점이 없고, 음식 갖고 들어가는 것도 금지입니다. 유모차는 2대 정도 비치되어있고 무료대여 가능합니다.집 가까운곳에 있는 장릉은 산책로도 이용하고 있고 가끔 답답할때 힐링의 장소가 되어줍니다. 사계절마다 경치가 다양하고 공기도 맑아서 자주 이용하고 있는데 가족들끼리 소풍가기에도 괜찮답니다. 추천이요예전 부터 학생들 소품 장소로 많이 왔던 곳이라 좋읍니다. 자연 그대로의 향도 느낄 수 있고 역사도 체험하구 좋아요유네스코 세계문화유산인 조선왕릉 중 하나인 장릉. 매우 보존이 잘 되있고, 주변이 산이라 공원이 조성되어 있어 바람쐬러 오거나, 산책하기에는 김포에서는 가장 적절한 곳이다.

Name: 다산유적지
Review: CYC(2013. 2)Dasan Yakyong Jeong was the representative Silhak scholar in Joseon. There is no entrance fee. In this site, there is a neat birthplace house and tomb burying Jeong and his wife. And there is a memorial hall of Jeong's with monument about him. This site is not big and not special. 10 minutes should be enough time to look around.

Though the road to temple was rugged, it was worth to climb to temple for scenery. There was very good temple because of fresh air and good view. The inside was not bigger than I think.

There was two tombs. One was tomb of Gojong(25st king of Joeseon) and his wife Empress...더 보기The Hongneung Tomb complex stands in stark difference from tombs of the Joseon dynasty. The design imitates that of Chinese...더 보기

It was refeshing journey. It's worth to visit. But greatest thing is the way to go there. Riding bocyle alongside the Bookhan river was simply amazing.We stopped by hoping to see a beautiful ice fall, and maybe even some ice climbers. No luck during the winter months the man made fall is turned off.C1 ( 2015.11.06 )
This fall was mady by ventilated water, so located in sewage treatment plant. This place had...더 보기My friends and i went to gapyeong for a weekend visit and stopped at a few places on the way. The piano falls was the best out of the three places we stopped. Here is a quick run down for you...

Name: Korea Spa World
Review: 동두천에서 그나마 장수하는 목욕탕이며 시설이 그나마 낫습니다 내부가 밝아서 좋아요 일반 목욕탕은 약간 어두침침해서 위생상태를 가늠하기 힘든데 여긴 밝아요 유아탕이 있어서 가운데 아이두고 삥 둘러앉아 목욕할 수 있어 가족들이 오기에 좋습니다 가격은 평범해요

Name: 평화의소녀상
Review: 좋은취지의 동상이 접근성 좋은 중심부 중앙 공원에 있어 지나가면서 항상 지나치게된다. 더 자주 위안부에대해 생각해보고 동상의 의미를 돼세기기 좋다.C ( 19.03.23 )동두천의 시민공원에 앉아있는 보편적 형태의 소녀상. 많은 사람들이 지나다니는 곳에 만들어 진것으로도 의미가 있으며, 지나가는 길에 잠시 만나보는 것도 좋을 듯 함. 우리의 아픈역사, 잊어서는 안될 역사를 보여주는 조형물. 2018 년 3월 1일에 만들어진 조형물이며, 현재 100개가 넘는 소녀상이 전국에 만들어졌음. 언제나 볼때마다 먹먹해지게 하는 소녀상.

Name: 자재암
Location: 경기도 동두천 상봉암동 산1번지 소요산 자재암 (우) 483-100
Review: CY+c ( 19.03.23 ) Though there was small temple and normal structure, but the road to there was very good. To there, about 30~40 minutes from parking area, it was good walk to us with fresh air and beautiful view. There had the cave Buddhist sanctuary that was beautiful. Good to enjoy nature smell, view and feelings on the way to temple.The temple complex itself is a relatively modest compound nestled into the base of a cliff and ridges leading to the six peaks that constitute the Soyo San (Mountain) Park. While it gets lots of visitors especially on Spring and Autumn weekends from Buddhist pilgrims given the attendant lore which stretches back well over a thousand years, it does not suffer from the level of traffic that afflicts many larger temples. The circular geography of the park allows you to either start at the temple or hike across the six peaks and finish at the temple. The peaks are modest by Korean standards measuring between 500 and 550 meters above sea level and can be traversed in between 2 and 4 hours depending on one's stride and stamina. Getting there from Seoul by car will average about two hours on Highway 3 passing through Uijeongbu and Dongducheon. I'm no geomancer, but there is an aura of serenity about the place that has kept me coming back since my first visit in 1998I dont know anything about this temple architecture but I love the stream and the cave in this. It's so beautiful and it makes the people feel the value of each moment clearly.I hiked to the four major points, some spots more scenic then others.The first point was the hardest to hike up, many stairs and hard to maneuver areas.Please be careful, I would not recommend children go with you. Some areas up top the maintain are straight dropping points.Stay vigilant and enjoy the views.This is a great place to just get away. I hiked the entire mountain in about 4 hours going pretty quick. Bring plenty of water and some snacks. Wear layers since u will warm up quickly hiking nearly straight up.This most serene spirited site is one that I will always keep coming back to that will last a life-time for me. My favorite time to visit is early fall when you get to see and view the beautiful different colorful scenery of Soyo Mountain and the surrounding area plus the weather is so serene pleasant during this time of the year.Koreans love to hike/walk. So this place is popular with locals. There were monks there when I went and the people along the trail are surprised to see tourists. The trail is well maintained and steep in many places. ADA is not a Korean thing. There is a cool restaurant at the bottom of this hill where you can get coffee before or beer after your long walk. There is spring water at the top so bring a bottle if you dont want to use the community cups.Must do if staying in or near the Dongducheon/Camp Casey area. A nice walk, very approachable for anyone even moderately physically fit. Getting there: I followed liljazz01's instructions to the letter and had no trouble finding the place. Seeing it: to be honest it was a bit further to the temple than I expected (2 miles? from the train station?) but about the time I was ready to give up on it, there it was. Level of difficulty: 2. There are stairs to climb, but they are sturdy and well-treaded and so not so treacherous, even in foul weather (it was 40F and raining when I went). Lots and lots and lots of grandmothers hike this trail. It's just a nice walk. For the dedicated hikers and more physically fit among us, there is a more challenging trail that goes up the mountain and for that the temple is just a startpoint. Why go: The temple itself is lovely but the real attraction is the scenery. The trail follows a winding streambed and when conditions are right there are waterfalls. Afterward, if you're hungry (and you will be), there are a number of restaurants at the foot of the trail. I can recommend the Soyasan, a fairly large restaurant serving hot pot-style meals, right near the intersection of the road that leads to the temple and the road that leads to the Freedom Protection Museum.If your stationed in Korea, have a day to kill and want to get a good leg workout i recommend this place. Lots of photo opportunities. Tips/Info:1. Cost 1000W to get in.2. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes. Hiking boots or combat boots recommended but not necessary. 3. Get there early if you want to do the longer trails.4. Not all trails have stairs, some have ropes to help you pull yourself up. 5. We caught the Taxi from the Casey Commissary and told him Soyosan Mountain. He took us there for 5200W. Took about 10Min tops.6. Bring water and snacks.Someone already mentioned how to get to Soyosan via vehicle, but it's just as easy to take the bus or train. The 39 bus will take you all the way there, or alternately, you can take Line 1 (dark blue line) to the last stop, which is Soyosan. Upon exiting the train station, go straight ahead to the main street, walk right to the first crosswalk and cross the street. You can start walking right and turn left down the first alley, go straight, then follow the street around. If you get lost, just follow the groups of people in hiking gear. If you forgot your hiking gear or want new stuff, there are shops on the way with super cheap stuff outside. I saw jackets for as little as 15,000 won and pants for 10,000. As others have mentioned, there are food stands and restaurants on the way as well, or you could pack your own food and bring some makgeolli (or buy some there) and picnic like the locals! Entry is a meager 1,000 won. Allow yourself 3-4 hours if you intend to climb all the way up and enjoy the surroundings. Make sure you are in ok shape before you go and bring water or buy some on the way because, although the mountain isn't huge, there are some fairly steep areas and you may need to take a break or two to catch your breath and hydrate. This is a wonderful experience and I especially highly recommend it to anyone in the area!

Name: 동광극장
Review: 11월31일 금요일에 연차를 내고 동광극장에 후드 14:00 영화를 보러 갔습니다.일단 들어가니 평일이라 그런지 사람이 한명도 없더군요심지어 사장님도 안보여서 10분정도 극장구경하면서 기다리니 사장님이 오시더군요영화비 결제후 시간되면 그냥 들어가면 된다고 하시더라구요영화시작 5분전에 들어갔는데 암흑 그자체 ㅋㅋㅋㅋ2시영화 보는 사람이 같이간 일행뿐이라서 쇼파에 앉아서 대기위치는 중간쯤이였는데 스크린이 커서 아이맥스로 보는줄알았어요 ㅋㅋ다만 너무 춥더라고요... 뒤쪽 좌석에 조그만 온풍기있는 자리가 있었는데쇼파에 누워 보고 싶었던지라..어쨌든 추운거 빼곤 너무 좋았네요.겨울철에 가시는분 꼭 담요 챙기시길응답하라1998에 나왔다고해서 찾아간 동광극장. 아직까지 이런 허름한 극장이 있다는게 놀라웠다. 상영관은 1개라서 교차상영하고 특이한게 지정좌석제가 아니라 선착순이라 빨리들어가는사람이 좋은자리에 앉을수있다. 옛날느낌 느껴보고 싶다면 한번쯤찾아가도 나쁘지 않음30대이상 정도의 성인들이 가면 빈티지한 매력을 느낄수 있다 모든게 20년도훨씬 더 되었기에 아련한 맛이 있다 영화보면서 싸온 간식을 눈치안보고 먹고 다리를 올리고도 보고 누워서도 보고 정말 부담없다타지에서 왔다면 가보세요 재밌어요

Name: 자유 수호 평화 박물관
Review: Haven't been here in about twenty years. It's now much improved. It sits at the base of Soyo mountain. If you come to Dongducheon from out of town, it's well worth yout while to spend the day here, with much to see and do. You can go up Soyo san, hike the trails, check out the MTB trail. Lots of nice little eateries and gift shops. It's especially beautiful in the Fall.The museum has artifacts and a lot of historical information about the war, great for history buffs.Definitely think the museum is worth seeing, but not sure it warrants a trip in and of itself. A good day, if you have the legs for it, is to make the hike to Jajaeam Temple in the morning, have lunch in town, and then see the museum in the afternoon. They're both right there together. You'll see the museum off to the right just as you head up the trail to the temple. If you just want to see the museum, then others have described how to get there. Allow 1 1/2 - 2 hours. If the weather's nice you might consider packing a picnic lunch and eating on the terrace just off the 4th floor, which allows for some nice views of the valley below.Was taking my wife to Soyosan and was curious about this area so we went into it. Taught us some interesting facts about Dongducheon and the Korean War. Also, they had an old US Army Warrant Officer Uniform in there so that was a plus.I have no additional information to add in that the recent reviews of others says any and everything I would say should you be interested in visiting this 'must visit' attraction. "Do Dream" in the "Land Of The Morning Calm" .....ThanksThe Freedom Protection Peace Museum is at the base of Soyosan, one of the most popular outdoor mountain hiking/general recreation...더 보기This museuum has 3 floors telling the story of the korean war, how it came to be, the sacrifices and...더 보기

Name: 부천중앙공원
Review: Особенно понравились маковые поляны,среди них качеля,рядом озеро,так здорово!Беговые,велосипедные дорожки!Красота!Просто в восторге от него, велосипедные дорожки, места для занятия спортом, тихие укромные места - все в нем есть. Чистый,...더 보기Большой парк в Пучхоне, красивый и ухоженный, как и все парки в Корее,  много людей гуляют, приятная атмосфера.

Name: CGV 부천
Location: 경기도 부천 원미구 중동 1164번지 현대백화점 중동점 U-PLEX 5층
Rank: 2위(13곳의 부천 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 부천역 쇼핑하기 가장 좋은 곳에 위치해있고 주변에 맛집, 놀 곳이 많아 데이트 약속 잡기도 너무 좋구요. cgv도 넓고 깨끗해서 이용에 매우 편리합니다. 규모도 크고 상영관도 많아서 매우 추천드립니다평일에 가면 사람도 많지 않아서 여유롭고 좋네요. 유플렉스 쇼핑도 하고 영화도 보고 맛난 것도 먹고. 한번에 해결할 수 있어서 좋습니다.넘환경이 좋와요.영화. 쇼핑. 맛나는 음식. 만남의 장소등멋진곳이기에 추천하고 꼭 찾아와서 아름답고 행복한 시간을 즐겨보시길 바랍니다.신혼집에서 가까워서 항상 영화보러 cgv부천으로 가요! 백화점 위에 있어서 밥도 먹고 카페도 갈 수 있어서 너무 좋아용~ 영화관 자체도 꽤 큰 규모예요!친구들 만나서 밥먹고 영화보고 커피한잔 마시고 헤어지기도 좋고 위치가 좋아서 자주 이용합니다평일 저녁에 갔었는데사람이 그리 많지 않아서 좋더라고요근처에 먹자골목도 있고 백화점도 바로 옆이라예매하고 기다리는 시간에 즐길거리도 많고 ㅎㅎ깔끔하고 친절하고 좋았어요 ^^애들과 영화 보러 자주 가곤한다. 집에서 가깝고 또 시설도 좋아서 자주 가는데보고싶은 영화가 나오면 바로 예약하고 가서 본다.영화관이 아담하고 예약하면 자리도 선택 할 수 있어서 좋았다.부천역에 위치해 있어서 이용하기 편해요영화관 주변에는 맛집도 많아서부천역 핫플이랍니다.심야영화를 보고 나와서 맛있는 음식도 먹을 수있는 위치에 있으니 데이트 할때 참 좋아요영화관이 쇼핑몰 안에 있어서 편하고 좋습니다.교통도 편하구요. 조조영화는 쇼핑몰 오픈전에 시작하기 때문에정문 옆 작은 문있는데 거기로 들어가야해서 좀 불편한건 사실입니다.그래도 교통이 편해서 자주 갑니다.백화점과 같이 있어서 쇼핑하면서 돌아다니기 좋아요 주말 같은 경우는 차가 많아서 주차가 힘들어요 그것 빼고는 극장도 넓은 편이고 식당도 많아요

Name: 웅진플레이도시
Rank: 1위(13곳의 부천 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 아이 얼굴보다 큰 공룡 뒷다리(사실은 칠면조) 고기는 여기에서 밖에 못본 것 같아...더 보기물 놀이기구가 많이 있어요 저희애들이 어려서 이용은 못 했지만 어린이용 물놀이터가...더 보기웅진 플레이도시는 락커 키에 비콘 신호장치를 넣어 일행찾기 서비스를 제공하고 있습...더 보기방학때 조카들 놀러오면 오후에 잠깐 데리고가서 놀기 좋은곳이에요. 부천주민이면 입...더 보기워터파크에서는 아이들과 놀고 뜨끈한 온천풀에서는 가족과 함께 시간 보내기 좋습니다...더 보기경기도 부천에 위치하고있어서 다녀오기 좋습니다. 사람은 좀 많은 편이나 야외와 실...더 보기집에서 멀지않은 곳에 이런 워터파크가 있어 아이들과 함께 가기 좋아요. 겨울엔 눈...더 보기교통편도 편리하고 각종 편의시설이 한 건물안에 있기 때문에 아이들과 함께 방문하기...더 보기여름에도 보드를 탈 수 있는곳, 비록 코스는 짧지만 보드에 대한 갈증을 해소 할 ...더 보기아이들과 함께 한 나절 즐겁게 보낼 수 있는 다양한 시설이 있어서 많이 찾게 됩니...더 보기

Name: 성남중앙공원
Review: In deze tijd van het jaar is een erg mooi park met mooie herfst kleuren, de plaatselijke bevolking wandelt er graag.

Name: 율동 공원
Review: The park is a nice quiet escape in central Seongnam. The circuit path around the small 'lake' make a great romantic stroll or running course (no bikes allowed), and it has a decent cafe on the far side. The bungee jump has been closed down, alas, but the traditional Hanok buildings and various art instillations help make it a good place to relax and take in some greenery and so on.A huge lake and fountain surrounded by greens. You can take a walk and have a cup of coffee. There are lots of good restaurants near by too. So it's worth to visit.It was especially beautiful when I visited in the Autumn.Colourful leaves and the pond and blue sky made a stunning view.This park will make you feel as if you are not in the city.Lake Fountain, Autumn trees, Ducks and Bungee jumping (wow)...it's all there..Take a walk with your friends or loved ones or play badminton if you wish and if you feel crazy...Bungee jump...How to go there?Take Bundang line subway to station Seohyeon ...take exit 2...you will reach the basement of AK plaza mall...Exit Gate 4 of the mall and you will see a bus stop Right in front of you...take Bus no.17 to Yuldong park...cross the road through an overbridge into the parking of the park...Cheers!The park is great, i Have nothing To say about it. But if you are going there To do bungee jumping then just look for another park. The reason is "the Guy working there" he is so rude To customers "maybe just To non koreans", so rude To the point of not letting me do the Bungee just because my poor friend couldn't muster the courage To do it before me. He is really rude and i had a bad Day because of him. Im sharing it so u dont experience what i had experienced.big park in bundangit have a bunji jumpwalking roadstarbucksbig water good for picnic with dosirakmany people in weekendsseongnam bundang have not good spot need more good food shop and more hot place ...A nice Park with lot of open place. Lot of locals comes for a day leisure. Got good Rose plantation and water area. Nice experience altogether.C1 ( 2017.04.07 ) There was bigger with reservoir than I think. Many local people walked and ran around reservoir, and the atmosphere was good. There had several facility including bungee jumping, trail and performance area, etc. There was very good place to enjoy rest with family. The parking area was big, and 2 hours free. Only one demerit was some private tomb was located inside. It was certain that there was good local park.We went on a Saturday afternoon in Winter on one of the days that the sun was out. The place was overcrowded yet no one bumped into us as we took a walk. I would not say that you should go out of your way to see it. I wouldn't dare do the bungee either as regulations in Korea wrt to these things are a bit lacking.A quiet park, good to chat and walk by a lake but I cant really say this is a great place to travel out of your way to visit. Just make sure you stop by if you are dining or staying near by.The only reason we went to the park was to try their 45-48 ft. Bungee Jump!!!!! We paid 25,000 won. It was such an amazing experience!!! Whilst swinging, I saw the beauty of the park. So I got two prizes for the price of one. Beauty and thrill. To get there. Go to Gangbyeon station and from there, go take the exit from a mall. Outside will be a bus stop and take Bus 17. Just tell the driver Yuldong park and he'll (or might) let you know that that is your stop :).

Name: 메가박스 분당
Location: 경기도 성남 분당구 서현동 262-2 씨너스 분당 4층
Rank: 2위(13곳의 성남 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 오래된 메가박스인데 리뉴얼해서 모던해졌다일층에 스낵바가 있다 그리고 일층에 뚜레쥬르 빵집도 생겨서 까페랑 같이 이용하기 편리하다주차는 지하에 주로 하고 일층에도 하면 된다. 사운드 광고를 영화시작전에 하는데 서현역에 cgv도 있지만 사운드랑 의자가 더 편해서 간다. 의자에 팔걸이는 올라가지 않는다. 영화관이 많지 않지만 작아도 좋은곳이라 생각한다. 무인시스템으로 바뀌었다 .아무리 핫한 영화라도 유명지역 메가박스만큼 북적거리지 않아 좋다. 규모가 작은 편이지만 상영관이 알차게 위치해서 다양한 영화를 상영하는 편이다. 지금껏 메가박스 분당 점에 가서 불편했던 적이 없어서 쭉 갈 것 같음.그리고 맨 앞줄 경우 다리? 발? 받침대가 있어서 핵 좋음 ㅇㅇ꽤나 되었지만 여튼 리모델링 한 뒤로 영화보기 완전 쾌적해짐 굿!앞줄과의 거리가 먼 것은 정말정말 너어어어무 좋다! (본인 키 175cm)위치가 좋아요. 씨지비는 역에서 걸어가기 은근히 귀찮은 거리에 있는데 여긴 바로 앞입니다. 저는 다양성 영화를 좋아해서 그런지 여기엔 잘 안 가게 되긴 하지만, 상업영화 볼 때 여러모로 할인혜택도 많아서 친구들과 만나서 보곤 해요.분당 서현역 메가박스 영화관이 온도조절이 잘 안되있어요 겨울인데 에어컨 틀어서 춥고 감기걸림영화 보는내내집중도 못하고 힘들었어요...메가박스 서현점은 위치도 서현역에 있어서 접근성이 좋으며 시설도 깨끗하고 좋더라구요. 위치가 좋아서 친구들과 자주가요.서현역 AK 바로옆에 붙어있어요. 엘리베이터 타고 올라가야 하는게 많이 불편해요. 끝나고는 거의 계단으로 와야한다고 보심되요. 상영관, 대기공간, 화장실 딱 크지도 작지도 않지만 위치가 좋고 시간이 잘 맞아서 자주 가요오랫동안 서현역에 대표적인 영화관으로 자리잡고 있다. 상영관들의 크기가 큰편은 아니다. 또한 imax 나 4dx도 없다. 하지만 위치가 좋고 콤보메뉴 등 팝콘과 음료가 싼편이다.여긴 유아동반 가족들을 위한 발코니 관이 있어요4명정도 볼수 있었던것 같아요사운드는 그렇게 좋지 않다고 하던데 저는 괜찮았어요서현역이랑 가까워서 이용했는데, 스크린도작고, 좌석도 그다지 편하지않았습니다.외환 크로스마일카드있으신분들은 팝콘,음료 무료로 받을수있으니 참고하세요

Name: 정자동카페골목
Review: Went and spot on my way to the capital, Great area to go, and plenty of places toy can choose, same for the pricesNot as popular as it once was and far too pricey. Baekhyeon-dong Cafe Street 10 mins away by car provides a better alternative and more atmosphere.Trendy cafe street looking like luxurious blvd. of Gangnam-gu.If money isn't your concern and you're staying nearby, good to spend time here.Many places to eat, shop and chat with friends and family. You can enjoy a number of different types of food from virtually all the world such as from India, Thai, Japan, China, Italy, Spain, and US.Maybe it used to be better, but these days it is just a short street with the odd cafe and western restaurant. We ended up eating in burger king and walked along the stream/river to Sunae station area to grab a coffee. Perhaps I was expecting too much or looking in the wrong place, but I much preferred Sunae for food and coffee options.4.5/5 would be the perfect rating. I gave it 5 because is beautiful should i say. Lot of coffee places and cozy restaurants. Some boutiques for shopping as well. Outside Seoul so there isn't much noise around. I saw this as a hidden gem to be honest. Would probably go back.Filled with many Japanese Izakaya restaurants and other expensive eateries. I would rather visit Jukjeon Cafe street. I would not recommend a visit to this street.This area is safe and has many cozy places to drink some coffee and teas. But the price is a little more expensive than other coffee shops. But it is worth to go to date with your bf or gf.아기자기하고 예쁜 카페, 음식점, 와인바가 있어서 좋아요. 조금 비싼 게 흠이지만 여친 혹은 남친이랑 데이트하기엔 강추인 곳입니다. 주차는 길가에 해야해서 주말엔 차 안가져가는게 좋은 것도 단점이에요 ㅠㅠThe title explains it all, since this is trip advisor i score it very low as there is literally nothing to do in this area for tourists, no local culture and horrible parking. Worst of all expensive for very average food or dining experience, if you are looking for an "experience" omit this attraction from your list.There are many mixed fusion style of restaueant and cafe. It fun to look around but they are quite pricy.

Name: 탄생츄어리스파 분당점
Review: Having been in Seoul for more than 6 months, I have tried to find a good Place for Massage. Some I would not class as a Massage, others even worse than that. The Prices for a Massage are unbelievably high yet the Service level is abysmally low this is my Own opinion based on experience throughout Seoul and surrounding areas.That was until yesterday when I had a 90 Minute Aroma Massage at Thann Sanctuary Spa the price is scary 200USD but I received a surprise discount 30% when I went to pay at the end of the Treatment not in advance like all the other places. (No thanks for the money don't care about the service attitude here) The Service is awesome, Perfect Tranquility, Calmness, clean, relaxing and a good decent Massage. As someone who Loves a Good Massage I highly recommend this as a Place to visit. The Staff at the store and the Spa located inside the Spa were excellent they truly enjoy their work. I will become a frequent visitor its worth it for a proper Massage

Name: 성남 아트센터
Review: ソウル市<U+5185>から行くと遠いイメ<U+30FC>ジですが、今回はブンダン<U+99C5>前に宿泊してミュ<U+30FC>ジカルを<U+89B3>てきました。ブンダン<U+99C5>には仁川<U+56FD>際空港から高速リムジン1本で行けて、ア<U+30FC>トセンタ<U+30FC>前までバス1本で行けます。ブンダン<U+99C5>付近は繁華街で深夜までやっている<U+98F2>食店街もあり、ミュ<U+30FC>ジカルが終わった後、江南に<U+623B>るよりも<U+697D>だと思いました。ミュ<U+30FC>ジカルを見に行きました。ソウルの中心部から最寄り<U+99C5>まで地下<U+9244>で1時間ほどかかります。皆さん書かれてますが、<U+99C5>を出ると結構<U+6B69>きます。坂もあり、階段もあり。足の弱い方はちょっとしんどいかもしれません。道中お店も少ないです。劇場は<U+5E83><U+3005>かつ見やすく、<U+89B3>劇自<U+4F53>は大<U+6E80>足でした。あえてこちらを、という感じではないかもしれませんが、チケットも比較的とりやすいですし、良い劇場だと思います。明洞や東大門などから向かうには非常に遠い施設です。バスでも電車でも行けますが降りてから坂を上らないといけないので時間の余裕が必要です。今回江南に宿泊しミュ<U+30FC>ジカルを見に行ってきました。建物は綺麗でどの席からも見やすいと思います。<U+99C5>から<U+6B69>く道はわかりやすいですが結構<U+6B69>きます。前回行った時に食事をするところがあまりなかったので地下<U+9244>に<U+4E57>る前にしっかり食べて行きました。ミュ<U+30FC>ジカルは長いから食べて行って正解でした。23時頃に公園が終わり、江南のホテルについたのがあと少しで翌日<U+30FB><U+30FB>。遠いのが難点かな<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>。明洞から向かいましたが、1時間以上はかかります。二梅<U+99C5>からは迷わず向かえると思います。劇場は舞台との距離が少しありますが、前の方でも見やすいです。19時からの公演であれば十分に明洞付近までは地下<U+9244>で<U+5E30>れると思います。きれいでとても見やすい劇場。<U+5E30>りの時間を考えると江南<U+99C5>界<U+9688>のホテルを<U+52E7>めます。<U+99C5>から１０分ぐらい<U+6B69>きますマチソワの間にカフェでワッフルなどを食べて時間をつぶしました。ガッツリごはんを食べるようなお店はあまり無いです。ミュ<U+30FC>ジカルを<U+89B3>に行きました。ソウル中心からだと１時間程度かかります。ニ梅<U+99C5>から大通りを<U+771F>っ直ぐ進めば右手にすぐ出てきます。ア<U+30FC>トセンタ<U+30FC>までは敷地<U+5185>を更にかなり<U+6B69>くので早めに行く事と、<U+9045>い時間の公演の場合は江南<U+99C5>近<U+8FBA>の宿泊をお<U+52E7>めします。カンナムから行きましたが、やはり<U+5E30>りは遠く感じます。とはいっても、分唐線、新分唐線、延長された９<U+53F7>線で、以前よりは便利になりました。タクシ<U+30FC>に自身のない方は、ホテルはアクセスのよい場所を選ばれるほうがよいと思います。なお、座席が二階の最前列でしたが、背もたれにもたれて座ると、てすりで舞台が見えにくい。しかし、<U+4F53>を席からはなすと、後ろの人から、見えないと言われます。ミュ<U+30FC>ジカルの<U+89B3>劇の<U+70BA>に城南ア<U+30FC>トセンタ<U+30FC>へ。<U+99C5>からは徒<U+6B69>10分ほどで、道も分かりやすい。ソウルの中心地からは少し離れており、夜の部の<U+89B3>劇をしたので終電を<U+6C17>にしなくてもいいように<U+4E57>換なしで行ける盆唐線沿いの江南エリアに<U+6EDE>在をした。ホ<U+30FC>ル自<U+4F53>はとても<U+5E83>く、カフェやレストランも<U+4F75>設されている。<U+65E7>正月の<U+89B3>劇であったが半分ほどカフェも開いていた。

Name: 황송공원
Review: C ( 19.09.05 ) I visited this park after lunch for walk. I went there by back gate, it was hard to walk because the road is inclined steeply. But there's atmosphere and air was very good. Around back gate, there was gate ball and badminton arena, and well-managed. There had good mood, but inclined steeply. So I recommend to go there by front gate.This is a great park for a nice stroll and view of Pangyo/Hwangsong city.  You can also see some Korean old culture and houses in the park.  I would say this is a hidden gem of the area.

Name: 화홍문
Review: 水原市<U+5185>を流れる水原川をまたいで建っている華城の城門ですが、ほとんどのガイドブックでも、この門の<U+5199><U+771F>が出ています。ガイドブックを見ていましたので、相<U+5F53>大きな門のイメ<U+30FC>ジを持っていましたが、<U+5B9F>際はこじんまりとしている印象でした。門の下を川が流れるデザインは、なかなかのもので一見の<U+4FA1>値はあります。水原華城の北に位置する門で、唯一の水門です。水原川が城<U+5185>へ流れ<U+8FBC>む入口で、水路の上には華麗な門が立っています（ちなみに南の流れ出る場所は水路だけで門はありません）。今は上流にダムがあるので水の流れはショボいですが、往時は水量も多く、もっと見事な眺めであったろうと思われます。水門とのことですが、水はほとんど流れていませんでした。途中で噴水が上がっていましたが、時間が決まったいるのでしょうか？門からの景色も、門に向かったの景色も良かったです。水原に行ったらここは絶<U+5BFE>に外せませんね。水原華城の建造物の中でもちょっと趣が異なっており、必ず訪れるべきポイントです。門と城壁の外側には池があり、街の憩いの場になっていました。今考えると<U+5F53>たり前のことですが、タクシ<U+30FC>の運<U+8EE2>手さんに「水原華城まで」と<U+4F1D>えても、どこの事だか理解してもらえませんでした。ガイドブックで<U+5199><U+771F>を見せて、ようやく降ろしてもらったのが華虹門。<U+6570>人の<U+89B3>光客が<U+5199><U+771F>撮影していて、私たちも<U+771F>似て<U+5199><U+771F>をパチリ。そこから八達門までおしゃべりしながらずっと<U+6B69>いていきます。途中の箇所箇所に城や見張り台などの<U+8AAC>明が書いてある看板があり、飽きずに<U+697D>しめました。八達門のあたりは野菜などを<U+58F2>っている市場で、見ていて<U+697D>しかったです。水原華城の中で一番美しい建物だと言われています。水原川の北にある水門なので、北水門と呼ばれているそうです。<U+7DD1>色を中心とした色合いが見事でした。１２月の寒い日だったので、水原川の水量も少なく、この華虹門の近くの川の表面は凍っていました。水門なので水量がもっと多ければ迫力が違ったのかもしれません。水原<U+99C5>のタクシ<U+30FC>運<U+8EE2>手に「ファホンムン」と言えばすぐ<U+4F1D>わりました。水門とのことですが、建物の下を水が通り<U+629C>けるというほかにはない<U+72EC>特な<U+69D8>式でとても<U+7D75>になってました。門の前に水原川がながれているので非常に綺麗でした。修復された後で少しきれいすぎて<U+6B8B>念でしたが良かったです。水原川の上に立つ門で、いい眺めです。近くには、自<U+8EE2>車タクシ<U+30FC>のような<U+4E57>り物とガイドらしき人がいました。チキン通りで食事をして、川岸に降りていく。川沿いには所<U+3005>運動器具が設置されているので、腹ごなしに使ってみて。使用方法は<U+7D75>が描いてあるのを見る。

Name: 수원 월드컵 경기장
Review: It is a pity as there was no game on due to the world cup but we walked round the stadium and you could see the pitch from outside. There are quite a few sculptures in the vicinity of the stadium that are interesting. Apparently there is a world cup museum but we did not have time to look for it.I am currently staying in Suwon, and I decided to catch a game tonight. Great venue. Friendly staff who spoke good English. Food and drink was adequate and good. Very convenient and easy to get to. Atmosphere and crowd wonderful. Tickets nicely priced. No complaints ! A very good night out !Caught a football match here recently. At the gate, the cheapest tickets were 14,000 KRW (approx. 14 USD), but since there were lots of empty seats, it was easy enough to manage an "upgrade" once inside. The Suwon Bluewings are an entertaining team to watch (they played well in the one game we saw anyway) and their hard-core supporters do not stop chanting and singing. One can only imagine the atmosphere they'd produce in a high-stakes game with a larger turnout.One of the 2002 World Cup venues, the Suwon stadium is well-maintained and has good snack options (the chimaek is tasty). Would have been five stars but for my experience with the ladies' room. While clean, none of the stalls I tried had any toilet paper left (if they had any to begin with). So grab some paper towels by the sink or bring your own tissues just in case!If you are coming here from Seoul, the most straightforward way is via taxi (ask a local to write down the destination and address in Korean for the driver). The ride took about an hour and cost between 40,000 and 50,000 KRW each way. Taking the 1 subway line all the way to Hwaseo or Suwon is a cheaper option, but note that from the train station you'll still need to catch a taxi or bus to reach the stadium.Saw a soccer game between the local suwon football team vs another in the same tier & the whole stadium was really well kept. Great accessibility, shops & large availability of food & drinks.Transport to the stadium with subway or bus from Seoul was also really easy so that made for a high mark aswell.I visited the Suwon World Cup Stadium sometime in Sep'17. I had a flight to catch in few hours and i decided to make the most of the available time in hand. I arrived at the stadium and found that it was closed!! I realized that there was no game on currently and so the stadium was closed. It was a bit of a disappointment (Hold on , there is a happy ending to this story :-))So, I spent the next 30 minutes walking around the stadium, taking pictures of the exterior and through whatever opening i could find of the pitch and the spectator's gallery. At the end of my walk, I came down and reached the museum at the stadium and found it was locked. There was a lady at the museum reception and i asked her if the museum was locked as well. She replied that the museum was closed for lunch and would open in an hour.I casually told her that I was from India and i had hoped to catch a glimpse of the stadium, but could not wait as i had to catch a flight in few hours. She thought for a moment and told me "Wait!" and spoke to someone in Korean and I guess explained my situation. Someone came over within minutes and she told me "I take you to stadium"!!I could not believe it! I had a personal tour of the stadium (Look at the pictures!!), I was able to walk along the sidelines and see the stadium, all on my own!! Of course the lady was watching me and instructed me not to step on the pitch :-)The stadium is well maintained. It is also the home ground of the Samsung Football team.I spent about 10 minutes inside and then she opened the museum for me. I took a quick look around, took a lot of pictures, and thanked her for the hospitality.Suwon is the city who has a Samsung football team. In this world cup stadium, you may have a world class facilities with fun. This wolrd cup stadium has several restaurants including golf practice range, swimming pool, health gym. within 30 min distance, you also can find out baseball stadium as well.Were here last week to watch World Cup U-20 match! It has good facilities, clean restroom, and even when you watch from the high-end seat the view is still amazing. The stadium also located in the center of Suwon with almost 24 hours transportation available. Outside the stadium, there is a track perfect for morning jogging.I first went to this stadium in 2002 for the World Cup, so everything was brand spanking new. Although subsequent visits were nearby, I did not go inside to see how it aged. Pristine clean, safe, and modern, it has all the things you would expect in a stadium of this category. For those of you who have never been to Korea, MasterCard and Visa (and Amex) are NOT the predominant credit cards used there. There are few places to get cash, and from what I remember there was only a couple installed at the stadium for these cards. Korea has their "own".Stadiums in South Korea are generally good. They have good facilities and well maintained. Very good place to hangout with friends.Here now its been 12 years this was a part of the world cup stadiums..its been looked sfter snd maintained very well.

Name: 장안문
Review:
Great to see as part of the walls walk. Start at the Palace and go counter clockwise. The round-trip us about 6km and takes 2-3 hours with stops.This is the northern and main gate to Hwaseong fortress. An impressive gate and associated pavilion and watch towers. Part of the 5km circuit of the fortress walls.The gate looks quite impressive from both the inside as the outside of the walls, although I have to say I liked the Paldalmun gate more.After passing this gate, you can get inside of Suwon Hwaseong Fortress and reach Hwaseong Hanggung Palace.
I guess this gate is bigger than any other gates in Seoul. It's good to visit and learn history & architecture.
- Connected to Hwahongmun(Buksumun) to the east....더 보기You can walk thru and around this impressive example of late 18th century fortifications. There are cannons, quarters, archery slots,...더 보기Janganmun Gate is part of the Suwon city wall that travelers could start here to walk around the wall to have a look of the city.We visited Janganmun Gate when walking around Suwon city wall. It's beautiful, and you can get great photos of it from a bit further back along the wall.Janganmun Gate is above the road that passes through the fortress so be careful if you decide to cross the road. It is the min gate to the old fortress and "jangan" actually means capital. It is considered the main gate as this is the...더 보기It was interesting on our hike along the 5.52 kms long fortress wall how the architecture of all the structures...더 보기The main gate of the Fortress.    Brightly colored painting. Walk up to get a good view out to the coty

Name: 화성행궁
