Like most museums in South Korea, it's very well laid out and welcoming. If anything, I was surprised at how few people were there. (It was a weekday.) It's obviously a lot smaller than the National Museum in Seoul, but there are plenty of interesting old things to see from clothing to jewelry to artwork. There are also a lot of nice souvenirs on sale in the gift shop. I'd plan on spending an hour to 90 minutes here.Free entry. All signage in Korean. Difficult to know where to go once inside but it's not long before you are politely ushered to the correct start point then it's a matter of just going to the next open door. Magnificent history to be read and artefacts to be seen. Not the easiest place to access via public transport, bus only, or you can cab it from Hwanggeum monorail station for a reasonable price. Good to visit on a rainy day.There is a good amount to see, some English translations, but a good depiction of the richness of the Korean history. I visited over the Chuseok holiday and it was packed with families. Chuseok is all about getting the family together and spending time enjoying traditional and cultural Korean things. So being at this museum was one of those chance opportunities to passively observe Korean culture. Pretty cool.If you have time, it's worth visiting. Only takes about an hour. There were hands on exhibits for children that had potential as well.I visited this national museum with one of my Korean colleague. There are lot of things to see but if you are foreigner then you cant understand meaning of anything. So better if you take guide or take some Korean with you. otherwise korea is very cultured & disciplinant country.This museum is great when there are exhibits and the park around it is gorgeous. Perhaps things have changed since I came here but a few more translations would have been helpful.A good museum but not like other museum at akl! Yet, I appreciate the parks outside and at tje back of the museum which has a small trailing stuff. It's good to visit in Chuseok cuz you'll enjoy the free games and free foods.

Name: 영남제일관
Review: This ancient door of the city has been rebuild in a close suburb on new foundations (close to the Inter Burgo Hotel, not where it is indicated on the T.Adv. map). It is a classical Korean architecture, quite spectacular, especially at night, but not exceptional. Worth a look if you pass by otherwise no need for a detour.We spent about 20 minutes here walking through the park which is tucked away in an industrial area surrounded by trees. The view of the temple at night was fantastic.

Name: 대구 약령시
Review: 韓<U+56FD>最大の韓方（漢方）<U+85AC>の店が集まる通り。地下<U+9244>半月堂<U+99C5>で降り、大城路（大邱一番の繁華街）の反<U+5BFE>側から始まる。最初はカフェや<U+98F2>食店が連なるが、しばらく進むと韓方を店頭に置く店が<U+5897>え始め、韓方の香りがぷ～んとしてくる。たまに松茸を販<U+58F2>している店もあるのだが、韓方の香りに<U+5727>倒！勿<U+4F53>ない…通りを先に進むと<U+85AC>令市場韓<U+533B><U+85AC>博物館があって、韓方の<U+6B74>史などを<U+5B66>べる。日本語、英語の<U+8AAC>明もある。地下<U+9244>セントラル<U+99C5>(中央<U+99C5>)から、徒<U+6B69>5分のところに、通り沿い<U+4E21>側にたくさんの韓方<U+85AC><U+5C02>門のお店が<U+4E26>んでいます。お店に入ると韓方<U+85AC><U+72EC>特の香りがあって、呼吸をするだけでも、<U+52B9>きそうな雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>を<U+91B8>し出しています。お店の方に、スマホの<U+7FFB><U+8A33>あぶりを使って<U+4F1A>話してみると、<U+8AAC>明をある程度理解できて、<U+4F1A>話が<U+5F3E>むと韓方<U+85AC>を煎じて、提供して頂きました。長い<U+6B74>史を<U+7D4C>て、先人の知<U+6075>が活きた韓方<U+85AC>は、<U+85AC>令市場韓方<U+85AC>博物館で、その<U+6B74>史と<U+52B9>能や、古人の知<U+6075>が病<U+6C17><U+30FB>疾病から人<U+3005>を治してきたことを垣間見る、良い機<U+4F1A>でした。時間に余裕があれば、散策するにはとてもおすすめの場所です。ここから、若者の街「東城路」も直ぐに行けます。韓方のお店が<U+4E26>んでいて、通りの<U+771F>ん中に大きな急須のモニュメントがあり「<U+85AC>」と書いてありました。韓方はよくわからないのですが、何を<U+58F2>っているのか店先を<U+8997>きながら散策しました。人通りが多く賑わっていました。１７世紀からの<U+6B74>史を誇る韓<U+56FD>の三大<U+85AC>令市場のひとつです。とても通りがきれいで、市場というよりは整然とした韓方ストリ<U+30FC>トという印象です。平日の１９時すぎに行ったので、ほとんどのお店が閉まっていました。それでも朝鮮人<U+53C2>の香りがぷ<U+30FC>んと漂っています。韓方足湯や韓方文化<U+4F53><U+9A13>も<U+697D>しめる<U+85AC>令市韓<U+533B><U+85AC>博物館（大邱市パンフレットより）とセットで次回は１日かけてゆっくり訪れたいです。繁華街の東城路や西門市場にも近くて足を運びやすい場所にあります。こちらは半月堂<U+99C5>より徒<U+6B69>5分くらいから漢方の通りが始まります。入り口に例の大きな門があると思いましたが半月堂方面からには無く、反<U+5BFE>側の入り口にあります。こちらの通りのほぼ中央に第一協<U+4F1A>と韓<U+533B><U+85AC>博物館ごあります。普通の通りですが<U+4E21>サイドに漢方<U+85AC>のお店が軒を連ねており、通りに入っただけで漢方<U+85AC>の<U+5302>いがします。また、漢方<U+85AC>の購入を考えている人は韓<U+533B><U+85AC>博物館で情報<U+53CE>集しから方がいいと思います。（私は韓<U+56FD>語がわからないので博物館で欲しい漢方<U+85AC>を<U+5199><U+771F>に撮りそれを見せて購入しました、50gで約200円でした）名前から市場みたいなのを想像したが、<U+5B9F>際はお店がずらっと<U+4E26>んでいました。これだけ一<U+7DD2>にあるのはすごいと感じたのと漢方の<U+5302>いが<U+72EC>特の雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>を出しています。土曜日から日曜日にかけて大邱に行きましたが空いていませんでした。ウィンドウショッピングの<U+69D8>な感じで<U+6B69>きました。鹿の角や漢方花や<U+5B9F>などがありあたりが漢方<U+85AC>の<U+5302>いがして雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>は<U+697D>しめました。韓方の本場、大邱を象<U+5FB4>するような<U+6E0B>いお店がずらりと軒を<U+4E26>べています。いきなり入るのは、ちょっとハ<U+30FC>ドルが高い<U+6C17>もしますが、<U+89B3>光案<U+5185>所や博物館もあるので<U+6C17><U+697D>に行っても大丈夫です。地下<U+9244>半月堂<U+99C5>から徒<U+6B69>で5分くらいです。この周<U+8FBA>には韓<U+56FD>以外の文化が入っており、この門からこの周<U+8FBA>の<U+89B3>光を始めても良いと思います。この門自<U+4F53>は立派な門ですが、すぐに見終わってしまうので、門をくぐったところにある<U+89B3>光案<U+5185>所を利用してみてはいかがでしょうか？こんなに漢方<U+85AC>局が<U+4E26>んでいる通りは初めてです。高麗人<U+53C2>、鹿角、<U+69D8><U+3005>な生<U+85AC>がズラリと<U+4E26>んでいます。とても綺麗な通りです。街の中に博物館もあります。近くには立派な<U+6559><U+4F1A>もいくつかあり、なかなか見<U+5FDC>えのある街です。お<U+6D12>落なカフェもチラホラ。

Name: 대구 약령시 한의약 박물관
Review: 足湯をしているとのことで行ってみましたが夕方だったため足湯は終わってしまっていました。いろいろな<U+85AC>になる植物や動物も展示してあります。自分の<U+4F53>質が分かるゲ<U+30FC>ムみたいな物があり、よい食べ物<U+60AA>い食べ物を<U+6559>えてくれるのはちょっと<U+697D>しかったです。最後に<U+58F2>店があり漢方の<U+98F2>み物が無料で<U+98F2>めます。ちょっと興味もあったし、無料にしては結構<U+697D>しむ事ができました。こちらは半月堂<U+99C5>より徒<U+6B69>5分くらいから漢方の通りに入りそこから3分くらいの所にある大邱の漢方の<U+6B74>史と漢方<U+85AC>について展示してある博物館です。入場は無料で順路は3階から2階へと見て行きます。展示の<U+8AAC>明は韓<U+56FD>語ですが、要所では日本語の<U+8AAC>明があるモニタ<U+30FC>が展示されておりとても分かりやすかったです。漢方<U+85AC>の<U+6B74>史から始まり、いろんな漢方<U+85AC>の展示、人間のタイプ別にいい漢方<U+85AC>などが展示されていました。また、日本との<U+6B74>史などもありました。最後は無理の漢方<U+85AC>のお茶、足湯とショップがありとても<U+697D>しめ、見<U+5B66>時間は1.5時間くらい必要でした。館<U+5185>は韓方<U+85AC>の詳しい<U+8AAC>明やル<U+30FC>ツ？などがあったので、勉<U+5F37>したい人や興味のある人には<U+697D>しい所でしょう。必要な項目を選<U+629E>すると自分の<U+4F53>質がわかるコンピュ<U+30FC>タが置いてありましたが、結果の種類が大<U+96D1>把でした。ちょっと感じを<U+63B4>む程度のものかもしれません。期待して行った足湯は干上がっていてやっておらず、<U+6B8B>念でした。漢方の<U+5302>いがあり、色<U+3005>な<U+8AAC>明がわかりやすく<U+8AAC>明されたりコンピュ<U+30FC>タでDVDの<U+69D8>な感じで<U+8AAC>明されて分かりやすかったです。漢方<U+85AC>のお茶も<U+98F2>めて無料で<U+697D>しめました。半月堂<U+99C5>から少し<U+6B69>いた所にありました。また行きたいと思います。11月最初の土曜日、ふらりと<U+6765>た初めての大邱。大邱<U+56FD>際空港で入手した日本語マップをみて中央路<U+99C5>から西門市場に向かう途中で立ち寄りましたが、意外にも<U+697D>しく長居しました。この日は外の足湯はお休みらしく、すぐに博物館の中へ。展示は韓<U+56FD>語ですが、あちこちにモニタ<U+30FC>があり日本語で<U+8AAC>明してくれます。四象<U+4F53>質診<U+65AD>では質問に答えると自分の<U+4F53>質がわかり有益な食べ物など<U+6559>えてくれます。展示の中には簡<U+5358>に着<U+8131>できる昔の衣<U+88C5>があり、自由に着ることができます。私は王妃<U+69D8>の衣<U+88C5>で<U+5199><U+771F>を撮りました。あとで行った<U+89B3>光スポットでは有料だったのでここで着ることが出<U+6765>てよかったです。韓方の<U+6E29>かいお茶が無料試<U+98F2>で置いてありますが<U+8AAC>明は韓<U+56FD>語だけで何のお茶かわからなかったです。韓方足湯<U+4F53><U+9A13>は20分5000ウォン。受付に行ったのが11:30過ぎてたので午前の受付終了で<U+6B8B>念ながら<U+4F53><U+9A13>できず。午後は14時からでした。<U+4F53><U+9A13>したいなら「大邱<U+85AC>令市韓<U+533B><U+85AC>博物館」のサイトで時間を調べてから行った方がいいです。サイト上で日本語表示を選<U+629E>できます。<U+85AC>令市の<U+771F>ん中にある、韓方の博物館。さまざまな展示が、各<U+56FD>語の<U+7FFB><U+8A33>付きで用意されています。あまり期待しないで行きましたが、思った以上に<U+697D>しめました。冬は足湯も<U+697D>しめるそうです。漢方<U+85AC>に興味のある私には、とても面白い博物館でした。無料とは、良心的です。<U+4F53><U+9A13>コ<U+30FC>ナ<U+30FC>もあり、時間があればリ<U+30FC>ズナブルな<U+53C2>加料で<U+697D>しめます。<U+58F2>店もあり、お値段もお手頃です。いろいろな展示があり、日本語での案<U+5185>もあります。韓方足湯がすごくよかったです。外には無料の足湯<U+4F53><U+9A13>ができるところもありました。かみさんが韓方に興味があるようなのでいってみました。入館料は無料で、大邱における韓方が展示してあります。映像もあり、日本語字幕もあります。有料<U+4F53><U+9A13>は、リップバ<U+30FC>ム、漢方石<U+9E78>、漢方ミスト、漢方足湯等があり、漢方ミスト<U+4F53><U+9A13>をしました。約５００円。韓<U+56FD>人と一<U+7DD2>だったけど、段取りがよく、予定の１５分以<U+5185>で無事終了。それなりに<U+697D>しめました。無料の漢方<U+98F2>料がおいしく、疲れが取れました。とりあえず、ただなので行ってみました。回りには漢方<U+85AC>屋さんがたくさんあり、まさに漢方<U+85AC>の街という感じです。平日の<U+663C>に行ったせいか、ガラガラでした。入場料が無料ですし、日本語のパンフレットも用意されているので、興味がある人にはよいのではないでしょうか。わたしは、同じく無料の桂山聖堂、テグ近代<U+6B74>史館、慶<U+5C1A>監<U+55B6>公園とセットで行きました。

Name: 천주교 계산 주교좌 성당
Review:
大邱のこの地域には、<U+6570>多く<U+6559><U+4F1A>が隣接していて、信者の方に迷惑にならぬように<U+6559><U+4F1A><U+5185>にも入って見<U+5B66>することが出<U+6765>ます。もちろん、<U+6559><U+4F1A><U+5185>部の撮影はダメですが、駐車場や西門市場方面へ下っていく坂道の途中から見える<U+6559><U+4F1A>は、<U+7D75>葉書になるような景色です。<U+7D75><U+753B>を描かれる方には、スケッチ場所としてはとても良いところでしょう。あたりを見回せば、他の<U+6559><U+4F1A>の塔がいろいろと見えて、なかなかインスタ映えする景色が<U+5E83>がります。散策にも最適です。でも、マナ<U+30FC>はきちんと守って見<U+5B66>すべきですね。ツア<U+30FC>で西門市場を散策後、大邱市<U+5185>をバスで移動する途中で車窓から外<U+89B3>を見ることができました。大邱市の中心部はビルが多いですが、聖堂の後ろに高いビルは見えず、聖堂の赤茶色、中央の丸いステンドグラスとそれを<U+631F>む２つの尖塔に目が釘付けになりました。こちらは<U+85AC>令市の立派な門から直ぐの所の<U+6559><U+4F1A>です。誰でも入れるようで、土曜日の11:00頃伺うと丁度、結構式が行われており、とても綺麗な建物でした。テグに行った際は必ず立ち寄ります。心が安らぐ建物でミサがない時も中に入ることができます。一度行ってみてください。夜に行ったらライトアップされていて綺麗でした。しかし、この日は車が多く、<U+5199><U+771F>に車が<U+5199>り<U+8FBC>んでしまうのは<U+6B8B>念。<U+85AC>令市の近くにあるので<U+4E21>方とも行けます。キレイな建物ではありますが特別見所があるかはよくわかりませんでした。大邱自慢の大聖堂は、<U+85AC>令市の近くにあります。もう一ヶ所、プロテスタント系の大聖堂の方が西門市場寄りに見えますので、間違えやすいかもしれません。テグの空港カウンタ<U+30FC>で「オススメの<U+89B3>光スポットはどこかありますか？」と聞いて<U+6559>えてもらった場所のひとつです。<U+663C>と夜とで雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が異なる、と聞いたので初日の夜に散<U+6B69>も兼ねて行ってみました！ライトアップされていて、とても綺麗でしたよ！！創建は1899年だが、火災により1902年に再建された。左右<U+5BFE><U+79F0>の八角の尖塔を持つゴシック<U+69D8>式の<U+6559><U+4F1A>。<U+5185>部のステンドグラスがとても面白く、聖人の<U+7D75>の他に韓服姿の司祭も描かれているのが特<U+5FB4>。明洞聖堂同<U+69D8>に、韓<U+56FD>を代表する聖堂。地元民にも愛される聖堂です。
決して大きくははありませんがライトアップが綺麗です。
夜の<U+89B3>光が、オススメです。

Name: 한국영상박물관
Review: 그냥 볼것도 없고 특색도 없던 박물관이에요.뭐 볼거 몇개 만들어놓고 박물관이라고 한게 너무 아쉬워요.지나가다 들리면 몰라도 시간내서 가기 아까워요개인이 영상에 관한 자료나 보기힘던 카메라나 촬영장비를 기타 하드웨어를 이렇게 까지 많이 그리고 귀한 장비들을 소장하고 이렇게 전시하고 있는곳이 한국에서 아마 세계에서도 드물지 않겠나 싶은곳입니다. 개인이 사재로 만든 곳이기에 조금 자고 시설도 낙후하지만 그 소장품과 전시물만은 과히 자이언트급입니다.영상학도라면 꼭 한번은 들려야 되는 곳같습니다.개인적으로 너무 놀랍고 괜찮은 곳이었습니다. 대구역 근방이라 찾아기도 편합니다.관장님이 개인적으로 모은 영상관련 물품들로 박물관을 개관하여 운영하고 있다. 인터넷과 디지털 기기들에 익숙한 현대인들에게 과거 아날로그 촬영과 관련된 영상물품, 음악과 관련된 기기들은 신선한 배움이 될 수 있다. 과거로의 시간여행을 하는 기분이라 방문을 추천한다.개인이 운영하는 박물관으로 알고 있음.디지털 시대에 보기 힘든 아날로그 영상 물품이 엄청 많은.사진, 음악을 좋아하는 사람들에게는 강력 추천!대구 화전동 대한극장 터에 지어진 박물관이다.1999년 개관했으며, 관장님이 지난 세월동안 모아놓은 영상 자료들을역사의 기록으로서 보존하고자 만든 곳이다.각종 촬영기기, 송출기기, 축전, 카메라 등을 볼 수 있고직접 설명까지 들을 수 있다.

Name: 서문 시장
Review: A huge open-air market which is colorful and heartwarming in offering a slice of Korean life at its best. Everything is sold here from clothing, household goods, plants to food of all varieties. Especially impressed by the stalls selling rice/porridge with intestines (a rarity in Singapore these days) oden and all types of street food. Stall-holders are hard-working and persuasive, calling out to us to buy fresh fish, mainly mackerel, but many varieties of dried goods as well from ginseng to dried shrimp.A wonderful Sunday morning's visit!This is an awesome market with a wide variety of foods and clothing, as well as other items. The street food is really awesome and very authentic. Definitely a must do while in Daegu.After the Kwangjang Market in Seoul, anything will feel smaller, with fewer choices and fewer people. But the Seomun Market is still a worthy destination to try lots of different dishes and you will never get food this close to the fire. Delicious scallops, BBQ Chicken, Mung Bean Pancakes all prepared and served in minutes. You walk, eat, walk, eat and yo can even duck into one of the stores along the way to pick up a cold beer.I visited there with my boyfriend.It’s easy to go there by subway. It’s a huge place, and they sell almost everything. I had tteokbokki with fried thin dumpling and kimbab. It was total 7,000won. The taste was okay. But I think it’s not original taste. I think they modfied the taste to forigners. I was abit a shamed of it. Anyway, eventhough the place was super crowded, I enjoyed there as much as I can. Oh, if I have change to visit there again, I would like to be there at night.I found this spot randomly while taking a walk to see the area of my hostel. Quite interesting place, lot of good looking food and kins people. Not so many sellers knew english but in the end it was not so big problem.Seomun Market is large and has many shops. Went on a Sunday and most shops were open. Street food and other goods available for sale.Though they have wholesale center here, the retail price of clothes are high and definitely not wholesale pricing. In fact the clothes are more expensive than those like Who.au, uniqlo or small boutiques in junggung ro. Daegu is known for napchang (flat fried dumpling wrap with japchae). Daegu offers more noodle than rice option. A lot of bakery and pharmacy here. The usual food fare like fried chicken , fried pancake in Seoul are not widespread here.There were a lot of people and stalls during the day. Many were closed for the lunar new year. At night there were a lot of food stalls that came out.Great food at the night market and very cheap! It's an easy subway trip in from anywhere in Daegu and worth visiting.Google indicated that the night market is opened everyday. The sign at the market stated so as well. But guess what, we went there at 7:30pm, and the whole market was closed! We were so disappointed.

Name: 대전도시철도
Review:
Again as in all South Koreon metros instructions are in English. If you struggle people always offer to helpWe used the Daejeon Metro a few times, it functions well but compared with other Korea cites it has only one line as opposed to many lines. Compared to towns getting large numbers of foreign visitors the metro signage in English did not seem to...더 보기Unfortunately, Daejeon has only one metro line, but this line connects Daejeon station and the Yuseong area.
Access is easy, and there are escalators and elevators at every station which makes it also easy when you travel with luggage.
Trains run every 10 minutes throughout...더 보기Fastest way to get around Daejeon, simple to navigate, clearly signed, destination announcements in English and always helpful staff on hand if you get a bit lost.Quite a simple metro system, but the plus side of this is that it is easy to navigate.
Either buy...더 보기system is limited in coverage, therefore cannot travel to a lot of places compared to other cities with subway systemDaejeon has the only one subway line yet. So clean but has long interval. If you miss one, should wait...더 보기It's a single line subway traveling almost every part in Daejeon. Ride on it and get off to your destination.As a foreigner living in Daejeon, it is oftentimes difficult to travel without carrying a stack of taxi-cards which tell the driver where you want to go in Korean language. Using the Metro is the answer. As long as you know where you want to...더 보기Daejeon metro is a single line rapid subway system with 22 stations along a 22.6 Km long track. It operates from 5:30 AM in the morning to the midnight. It starts from Panam in the north-western part of the city to Banseok in the eastern...더 보기

Name: Hanbat Arboretum
Review: It's not too easy to get to but if you like landscaped gardens it's worth the effort. It's an area of land by a river split down the middle with a roadway. One side of the road are large very attractive landscaped gardens, the other side forests of various types of trees. Along the road centre there are buildings used for exhibitions and plazas, when we were there speed skaters were practising. There is an attractive Expo bridge across the river and the rivers opposite bank features impressive buildings also created for 1993 World Expo.The park is very nice and a wide area. You don't have to pay anything, it's free. There are also some traditional Korean gazebo to relax. This place is also near Daejeon Expo Plaza with its fun fountain for kids to play around in summer.A very nice place, a lot of flowers, i visited at the Fall, so, the colour of the leaves are the best of my visit.I was staying here for a conference. And near Daejeon Conference Center you can find this lovely garden. It is free to visit and offers some great views over the gardens and Daejeon city. A visit is really recommended And it is free!This park is attractive and not too far away from a metro stop. It offers several trails and although it is small, you will end up spending a lot of time wandering around the various trails. There are several different areas of the park and it is great for beautiful pictures as well. It is free to visit.I was there on a June Saturday morning. Lovely and interesting vegetation of many types, very quiet, despite the hundreds of other people (and lots of kids) around. Would be even more beautiful in the spring, and maybe in the fallNot the best gardens I’ve ever been to, However nice peaceful and relaxing. Good place to bring your family, and have a nice picnicI like thus place because the location is close to the downtown (Dunsan area) and expo park. If your hobby is jogging, i believe you will like this placeI live in Daejeon over 20yrs. In my opinion, this is the best place to taking a walk with your families. Nice environment. You can park your car in front of the Nammun Park or art museum etc.There are a lot of Korean plants that are cultivated by gardeners. Perhaps you can take a rest from the city life. I sometimes go to the Hanbat Arboretum after work on Fridays. It has satisfying paths with various plants, so I rest or take a walk there. It has gorgeous views during each of Korea’s four distinct season.

Name: 계족산 황톳길
Review: Took 2 buses from the Yuseong area and then had to wait about 45 minutes at the bus stop for the 74 up the mountain. Had I known that, would have just taken a taxi (for less than 20k Won). Not sure if that is the actual scheduled time or if there wa sa hiccup and some 74s just didn't come... It took us about 2 hrs to get up, and I was already pretty over it. But I am glad we stuck with it - it was worth the difficult ride up. Siunce it was already 2pm when we got there, we just hiked up (with shoes) to the fortress, and came back down barefoot. It was a total of 7k and took almost 2.5 hours with a leisurely picnic at the top. This was the perfect length for us on this day. The fortress has amazing views of the mountain and river and city. I would definitely suggest walking with shoes in the beginning and barefoot on the way back. There are lots of bathrooms and drinking water faucets and spots to wash your feet and shoes. It's free, since a private investor pays for the upkeep. The hike was more strenuous than I expected, but mostly because of the many many steps up to the fortress. But do-able for all ages and levels of fitness.We caught two buses from Daejeon to get here, which was straightforward. The walk itself starts off with beautiful soft squishy mud and you could easily wear bare feet the whole way around, but we detoured up to the 7th Century fort that is in the middle of the loop, so put our shoes back on. With this detour and a generous stop for lunch (and to share food and sochu with locals on the top!) it was a 4-5 hour stroll. There's plentiful toilets and water, and a place to wash and dry your feet at the start/end. There's also food vendors for snacks.A group of 7 of us traveled at least an hour to climb half this mountain, during the fesitval. We went on the day that the marathon was not taking place, so it was not crowded. We were able to leisurely walk, take photos and enjoy the clay and its healing properties. The clay gets sprayed with water periodically to keep it moist and comfortable to walk on. We did not walk on the clay with shoes at all, so we brougt backpacks to hold our shoes, water and snacks. There are vendors selling beverages and snacks, there might have been one restaurant at the start of the clay path. There were a few areas for families: for children to play and do arts and crafts. There is a bathrooms, rinsing station and a few benches to sit and rest along the path. There is also an outdoor theatre where singers, dancers and musicians perform during the festival. There are places to clean your feet at the entrance and exit (same place) of the path. My only complaint is that was we all got lost and it ended up taking a lot longer to arrive. For the festival at least, I wish there was an easier way to get to the mountain. It was a great and rare experience.An enjoyable hike. The cooling sensation from the red mud and it's so therapeutic can go on forever. Worth a visit if you happen to be in Daejeon. Definitely one of my favourite place to visit in Daejeon and will definately come back for a hike.Go to this trail when it's warm so you can truly enjoy the red clay, if at least for a short jaunt. The trail was marked clearly and even the bus ride out was a lovely adventure, being hidden in a valley. Bring some cash to buy fruit from the vendors. Be prepared to get dirty. The entire trail holds lovely different surprises like a train playground for children, various washing stations, the usual outdoor workout equipment, benches, picnic areas, scenic viewing areas and so on. Pleasant and definitely worth the trip.

Name: 대청호자연생태관
Review: 대청호오백리길 4구간에 위치한 곳으로 대청호의 생태를 체험하고 휴식을 취할 수 있는 공간입니다. 야외는 미니동물원과 연못도 있고 자연생태관 내부는 생태표본식물, 화석광물, 곤충표본, 대청호에 서식하는 어류, 대청댐 개발에 따른 지역 수몰민들의 생활모습을 담은 향토관, 미래직업탐색센터 등으로 다양하게 구성되어 있습니다. 또한 3층 테라스에서는 대청호를 한 눈에 볼수 있는 발코니도 있어 휴식공간으로 손색이 없습니다.대전 대표 국화축제장소로 각광받고 있는 장소입니다.대청호오백리길과 함께 자연생태관광을 체험하고 싶으신 분들은 꼭 한번방문해 보시길 바랍니다.대전시티투어를 통해 방문했는데요 무더운 여름 더위를 피할 수 있었구요 ㅎ자연 생태계를 배울 수있는 장소에요곳곳에 사진찍을 수 있는 장소도 있어요제가 간날에는 유치원에서 소풍도 나왔더라구요 가볍게 방문하기 좋아요대전에 사시는 분들이라면 드라이브 코스로 대청호가 좋습니다.또한 자전거 라이딩이든 가족나들이 에 주차하시고 생태관 주변으로 걸으시면 봄이나 가을엔 조경이 잘되있어 쾌적한 나들이 코스로 추천드리고 싶네요시골길 따라 가면 나오는데 그리 볼꺼리는 많진 않음. 동구에서 운영하는 생태관인데 사람도 거의 없고 ;;; 그냥 대청호 가는 길에 들러 살짝 맛만 보고 오는 정도?차로 가는 것도 좋지만 대청호를 보면서 자전거로 간다면 금상첨화. 자연에 관심이 많은 자녀가 있다면 추천합니다.대전에서 바람쐬러 가기 좋은 곳입니다.차 안막힐 때는 시내에서 20분내외로 갈수있습니다.날씨가 좋을 때면 돗자리들고 많이들 나와서 즐기는 여유로운 모습을 볼 수 있습니다.책으로 읽었던 것들을 실제로 보면 더 좋을 거 같아찾아간 곳입니다.무료 개방 또한 너무 좋았어요~예전보다 더 많은 볼 거리가 생긴거 같고 깨끗하고 좋습니다.9살인데 그동안 책에서 보거라 직접 보면서 이야기 하니 좋아하더라구아직 이곳을 많이들 모르시는거 같은데 한번쯤 다녀오면 좋을거 같아요.아이가 흥미를 가질때 많은 것을 경험하고 직접 눈으로 보고 체험하고아이한테 소중한 추억이 될수 있을거 같습니다.어려운 내용 아니니 더 어린 아이들도 함께 다녀와도 좋을거 같네요예전에 한참 공사하더니 산책할수있는 코스를 만들어놔서 좋습니다. 다만 겨울에는 좀 추울것같으니 봄 가을을 추천합니다.대청호 드라이브 하다가 들른 대청호 자연생태관은 여름에는 시원한 실내에서 많지는 않지만 자연사 박물관처럼 꾸며져 있어 볼거리들이 있습니다.다만,,어른들과 초등학교 고학년쯤되면 심심해할수 있는 곳입니다.닭,토끼등 몇몇 동물들을 사육하고 있어서 어린 애들은 좋아합니다.

Name: 대전시립미술관
Review:
This museum takes about 2 hours to cover. It's very pleasant, and the exhibits are clearly organized. Beautiful modern art.Terrific little museum with a strong emphasis on the interface between Art and technology - as might be expected in a city like Daejeon!  Nice cafe too.The venue is great, seats a great for the price, we saw Carmen ballet and it was beautiful. Prepare to take bus/metro after the show gets done, taxis were scarce after the show.Worth the visit. The building itself is interesting. It is located in the Daejeon Exposition Park by the river. 
The subway stop is about a 20 minute walk. There are a few buses that stop closer.Currently the DMA has a fabulous exhibition with modern art from the Asian Pacific; here until October, if I'm correct....더 보기Around the Arboretum, the Arts Center as well. Exhibitions go the whole year. Would definitely go back.Some may find most accessible cultural experiences centered at Seoul.  But if you manage to open your view wider and...더 보기I enjoyed this art museum.  It had some interesting pieces, and it was also good to see there were lots of local school children there too!it is most hot place in the city. I can see some exihibition almost every day. also good to young couple to dateI thought for \10,000 the art museum would be larger, but there were only four rooms (unless I really missed...더 보기

Name: 장태산자연휴양림
Review:
Love the tall trees. We came early for autumn, but still beautiful.

The skytower is closed during our visit.There was a board walk up to the Sky Tower. Quite an easy stroll up and should be wheelchair friendly. 
Walked up the to the recreational sites and there were sequoia trees along the path. Very beautiful. Weather was just nice for the stroll.
There...더 보기This place has dawn redwood forest where you can put your tent and spend good time with family or friends...더 보기

Name: 반석역 카페거리
Review: 대전에선 찾기 힘든 고급스러운 거리입니다. 이곳엔 카페거리이긴 하지만 맛있는 음식점도 많고 분위기가 좋고 맛있는 커피집도 많습니다. 전 하나씩 다 들려봤는데 가게마다 특징도 있고 좋았습니다! 연인/가족 끼리 시간을 보내기엔 좋은 장소 입니다반석노은지족에 사는 분들은 오시기 좋은 곳입니다. 개인카페들과 맛집들이 즐비하고있습니다.하지만 협소한 주차공간이 아쉽습니다. 굳이 멀리서 찾아올 곳은 아닙니다.이른 오후에 점심을 먹고 산책하기 좋은 장소입니다. 점심 먹고 나른할 때 카페거리에서 아메리카노 한 잔을 테이크 아웃 하고 걷거나 아님 카페에서 여유롭게 수다를 떠는 것도 좋습니다.산책하기도좋고 이쁜가게들이 많이 있습니다초창기와 달리 문닫은 가게도많고요기대는 하지 마시고 ...여유로이 차한잔 하기 좋아요대전에 산책하기 좋을곳으로 반석역 대전1호선 이용해서 2,3번 출구로 나와 걸으면 카페 거리에 갈 수 있습니다. 카페들이 가로수길을 따라 즐비하게 줄지어 있어서 찾기 어렵지 않아요.. 외국에 가면 테라스 야외서 커피를 마시는 곳 있잖아요~대부분 카페가 야외 테라스 옥상을 개방하여 날씨가 좋은날에 커피마시기에 너무 좋은 곳이었습니다. 이쁜 거리라서 여성분들이 좋아할만한 곳입니다 .반석동 카페거리는 신도시 개발지에 들어선 이국적 카페촌입니다.젊은이들의 문화명소를 개발하는 차원에서 만들어져서 이국적인 풍경이 데이트장소로 괜찮습니다.예전만 해도 거리 개성있는 작은 소호 카페들이 들어서 있어서 카페거리라 불릴만 했지만 지금은 젠트리피케이션 때문에 다른 곳으로 이전하거나 페업한 카페들이 많고 옷가게들이나 음식점들이 늘어나 카페거리라는 명칭이 애매한 곳입니다. 프랜차이즈 카페와 몇몇 카페들이 명맥을 이으고 있습니다.

Name: 천주교대흥동성당
Review: 中央路<U+99C5>の近くにある<U+6559><U+4F1A>です。建物は特<U+5FB4>的でなかなか立派な作りでした。夕方に行きましたので、夕日に照らされて綺麗でした。

Name: 대흥동 문화예술의거리
Review: 대흥동은 근대건축물, 소극장, 카페, 갤러리, 화방이 많고 거리 곳곳에 발걸음을 멈추게 하는 다양한 예술작품과 조형물이 있습니다.여러 공연장도 많고, 애견거리도 있어서 구경하면서 산책하기 너무 좋습니다. 그리고 중앙로와도 연결되기 때문에 맛있는 것을 먹거나 대전역으로 이동하기에도 아주 좋아요그냥 상점들이 즐비한 곳입니다. 딱히 특색은 없는 곳입니다. 굳이 오실 필요없는 데 입니다. 대흥동은 좋은 곳이기는 하죠 하하구 상권이지만 최근 멋진 가게들이 많이 생긴다. 작은 갤러리도 많음. 다만 건물들이 낡은만큼 대부분 화장실이 더럽고 낡음대전에 볼거리 구경거리가 많은 곳이라서 구석구석 많이 돌아다녔습니다. 그중에 한곳이 문화예술의 거리~ 중앙시강에서 조금더 걸으면 옛중구청 자리에 새로 조성된 우리들 공원이 있습니다. 그 주변 골목길을 사이사이에 알록달록한 간판들과 벽화도 있고 도로바닥에도 그림들이 있고 소극장들이 있는 젊음의 거리임을 알 수 있었습니다.1970~80년대를 떠 올리게 하는 손 떄묻는 풍경과 새롭게 생긴 건물과 까페가 공존하는 이색적인 공간.

Name: 대전 오-월드
Review: We visited around afternoon till closing time 6pm. We only purchased the entrance ticket (without rides) and subsequently purchased a ride on the safari separately when we wanted to see the lions, elephant and zebras only in that session. But we didn’t find it worth but you get to see standing bears trying to wait for rewards from the bus (that drive inside). The ride in that safari bus is about 5-7mins. Too short for the amount we paid. Flowers sections according to the staff during November there’s nothing to see. We took bus there and bus back from hotel nearby bus stop. Not all area are up when we visited. Some area like seal session was closed but not mentioned in the map. There is no English map when we requested for one. Some Xmas decors are up while some Halloween still being taken up when we visited.I was a beautiful day, and the flowers were in bloom. A lot of people, but l was surprised at the number of animals there. We had lunch, which was nothing special, but not horrible either. A great place to take young children on a weekend.Good things first- it's nice for an afternoon with friends- the flower gardens are very pretty- the rides are funBad: and I'm not an expert but these were very obvious things- the Zoo and many animals were in poor condition- many cages were just overpopulated - severly- the monkeys on the picture were in a maybe 10 to 10 meter cage with no climbing possibilities and an obvious skin condition- there were more specially monkeys with skin conditions that didn't seem to be treated- there was a very little monkey baby in desperate need of attention all alone. At that age it should be with a careperson at all times.- many animals had no access to food or water- donkey hoofs were probably never in their life treated and must have pain walkingThis is the only zoo in Daejeon. Far away from heart of the city but frequent 301 bus brings you to there.Don't skip this delightful place if you have a day of beautiful weather and want to be outdoors! The two of us spent 4 hours (or more) exploring Zooland, Flower land, Bird land, the maze, plus two dance shows. We went the day before Chuseok (Thanksgiving); it was not too packed. The first thing we did was the safari, because we had to stand in line. Zooland was filled with so many animals I have never heard of, let alone seen even on Animal Planet. All of the signs were translated in English to read the names of the animals, but much of the animal information was written in Korean. Also, there are several vending machines to purchase food for the animals. Guests are encouraged to feed the camels, deer, bears, monkeys, etc. Very cool. Flower land was the best part to me; the displays and designs were colorful, creative and gorgeous. There are family restaurants there too, but we did not try any. The only thing I wished there was more of were maps translated in English and the payment details at the ticket counter. We didn't ride any rides; they seemed to be for children - but if I return I will ride the carousel. Definitely recommend arriving around 3pm to see the animals and flowers during the day, and see the sunset for the light displays and performances.When in Daejeon, it is NICE to visit O-World Park. This is a combination of botanical garden and Zoo! In addition, the park offers some rides and an entertainment area where free performances (dance and songs) are done! Every season offers a particular activities and sites to enjoyMy 5-year-old son, my closed Korean friend and I enjoyed visiting the zoo at Daejeon O-World. We saw various kinds of wild animals, especially those monkeys tigers and birds. The facilities and safety are good. My son really enjoyed watching these animals. This would be a perfect place for children to learn about wild animals. You wouldn't want to go to the natural history museum to see those stuffed wild animals no more.Don't look for western standard rides at this park, they're more in line with carnival style rides, but my son enjoyed himself all day here. We really liked the zoo portion of the park. They have put forth effort to make some decent enclosures for the larger animals and there is a drive thru safari where the animals have lots of freedom to roam. Large selection of species. New section set to open - Bird World that should be really nice. I didnt get to see the garden portion of the park since my son wasn't interested i n it so I can't comment on it, but the small entrance area i saw looked like they put an intense effort into creating unique topiary and flower designs.Be warned this park is filled with day care and pre-schoolers during the week. It seemed like millions when we were there. They leave as the afternoon goes on and the teenagers come in.One of my favorite places in Daejeon! Of course aside from the letter O, this theme park has a well organized gardens and a zoo on one side. In addition, there are song and dance performances by individuals and groups which are scheduled at a certain time of the day. I love this place!O World is Great!!!If you are in the area, just grab the kids and go. It is not very expensive compared to other amusement parks plus it has other activities for you and the kids that you need to be at the door upon opening.I certainly recommend a day out with the kids at O World.

Name: ㅅㅡㅋㅏㅇㅣㄹㅗㄷㅡ
Review: Shopping is amazing. Visited a pet store and almost brought two friends home. Food was amazing. Was in town to visit friends and to see the nightlife. This city did not disappoint. Went to a coffee shop, had a discussion over who is better: the Eagles or the Heroes. Korea takes its baseball VERY SERIOUSLY haha. I enjoyed my time here very much. Can't wait to do it again.Feels a bit dirty and smell of sewerage was everywhere. Shops around the area does make it interesting.Breathtaking in the night, when the huge display is turn on. Good for group pictures, marking events, surprises, marriage asking :))During daytime the beautiful ceiling of Skyroad is off, which is utterly disappointing. Hence, during the day it's just another a regular, loud, market street, with music blasting into the allies from the loudspeakers of all the shops. The main attraction -- the gorgeous ceiling -- is only visible in the evening.There is a light show in the weekend, and sometimes there is your face recorded and showed in the LED screen of Skyroad. You can find so many cosmetic stores, food stores, and others. The interesting places that I recommend are:- Sung Sim Dang (성심당) bakery (from 1956) that has authentic fried bread named Soboro (소보로) filled with red bean paste in yellow paper bag and with butter paste in purple paper bag,- Yoogane (유가네) a Korean food restaurant (semi fast food)- Farm's Chicken Buffet beside Yoogane in the 2nd floor, where you can eat fried chicken as many as you can, with 8 flavour (from the sweet to spicy), plus rice and soda for only KRW 7,400 (2019). You can replace soda with beer and add KRW 1,500 only. Cheap and delicious!- the Artbox with many cute things you can find.You can reach this place by getting off the train at Jun-gang-no station in Daejeon.It was a decent shopping area. In the daytime, however, they do not light the "Skyroad", the primary reason I decided to visit in the first place. The shopping is decent, though.This is really a shopping experience, peppered by eating opportunities. In fact, from the moment you arrive at Jungangno station on the Metro - leave from Exit 2 - you find yourself in an underground shopping mall, fanning out in three directions from a large seating area around a fountain. Mainly clothes and accessories but also a good clutch of the Korean cosmetic / beauty stores - Etude House, Tony Moly, Innisfree, Olive Young etc.Progressing up to street level and into the warren of streets that feed into the Sky Road you are beset by the sights and smells of fried chicken, street food and shops and restaurants vying for your attention.The previous couple of times we have been in Daejeon, it has been summer and so the streets have been lined with stalls but, in February, things are quieter, which also means that access is easier.The Sky Road itself is, in essence, the spine of the shopping centre with all the other streets branching off it (like ribs I suppose). The shops are pretty standard and there are all the usual cafe outlets. You will probably come across an Ajuma trying to hand you a leaflet or someone attempting to entice you into their shop.If you cross the Sky Road and keep heading towards the river, cross it via either the foot or road bridge, you will come to the market, a much more authentic experience.That said, if retail therapy with frequent refuelling stops is for you, you won’t be disappointed.Nothing spectacular except for the LED screen used as ceiling. Haven't seen anything like it, and having seen it once, wasnt enamored enough with it to do a special trip to visit again. But if you're in Daejeon, and haven't seen anything like it yet, drop by.Just to put things into perspective, Daejeon is not as bustling as Seoul. For those who are familiar with Australia, Daejeon is to Seoul what Canberra is to Sydney.It is a welcome break to see a modern city like Daejeon that has a delicate balance between the usual amenities as well as urban landscape in a modern city with rural pockets. Skyroad is an area to get your retail and food fix given the concentration of small shopfronts boasting a variety of F&B outlets, famous Korean cosmetic brands and other retail concepts. Ideal time to visit is at night where you get a chance to see the huge 200m ceiling TV screen. It has a young vibe and it’s quite obvious given the hoards of teenagers in school uniforms hanging out there after school. You will be able to cover the whole area, including exploring side streets etc in a leisurely 5-6 hoursI went there at noon time and spent 5 hours in that area. A lot of shops and the street is amazing. If you like simple nice places please visit it

Name: 광안대교
Review: We stayed in a hotel with a view of the bridge and we loved seeing it and enjoyed the light show too!The bridge looks great at night time, there are various look out points you can. Go to to get some great photosWas from Gwanggali Beach and opposite is the nice view of the bridge.It is better during sunset and when the lights are on. Simply beautiful. Enjoyed the night walk here.It’s a nice bit of architecture, and to be fair you can see it from almost anywhere in Busan. The Hop On/Off tour bus crosses it twice on its city route but ferry terminal observation deck has best unobstructed view for pics.It was very beautiful at night. It's quite difficult to find because I'm lost. There are many BBQ restaurants and they are good.Nice view from the port or tower, Gamcheon village. It is a real lamndmark of Busan. Nice view as well from the terrace of the Lotte mall in the sea port.If you're afraid of heights stay away but the views are fantastic. There is a toll charge but a few $. It's worth the view of the city.This double deck bridge can get busy at rush hour but it is very nice to visit over night time. Great piece of engineering.Didn’t anticipate the uniqueness this site offers. Went down to beach for dinner and a walk and was happily surprised by the light show on the bridge. A must-do. Don’t miss it.I have visited gwangandaegyo bridge in three ways: view of Gwangwalli beach, walked over the bridge during an event and from a ferry ride, and it has mesmerized me in all the ways. definitely must watch at night or a foggy morning. This is also the host of Busan Fire Festival which again makes it a must visit.

Name: 부산 지하철
Review: いつも混<U+96D1>していますが、バスと違って<U+89B3>光客にもわかりやすく利用しやすい。<U+99C5>名が<U+8AAD>めなくても、<U+99C5>の番<U+53F7>が車<U+5185>の電光表示、<U+99C5>名板、<U+99C5>の入口などに表示されており、番<U+53F7>だけでも大丈夫です。ただ、改札口が行先によって異なる<U+99C5>が多いので注意が必要です。また、ICカ<U+30FC>ドを利用すると割引があります。ICカ<U+30FC>ドは自動販<U+58F2>機でW2,000で購入し、改めてチャ<U+30FC>ジをして利用します。釜山の地下<U+9244>は、韓<U+56FD>の中でもとても親切だと思います何<U+53F7>線とかの、方向もアロ分けされて矢印で、分かりやすく又ハングル、漢字、英語が書かれています、番<U+53F7>で<U+99C5>が示され電車の中の<U+63B2>示板も、番<U+53F7>が示されています<U+4E57>り降りにとても助かります日本語のアナウンスも要所でありますし、<U+99C5>に番<U+53F7>が振られているので分かると思います。切符の販<U+58F2>機も日本語表示があるので親切です。釜山市<U+5185>のどこに行くにも地下<U+9244>は便利で早くて安いので、これを使わない手はありません。釜山<U+7DCF>合バスタ<U+30FC>ミナルのある地下<U+9244>1<U+53F7>線終点ノッポ（134）<U+99C5>も、2<U+53F7>線海雲台のヘウンデ（203）<U+99C5>も市<U+5185>中心部の西面（ソミョン<U+30FB>119）<U+99C5>から<U+4E57>り換えなしで行けます。交通カ<U+30FC>ドが有れば、釜山<U+5185>だと長時間<U+4E57>ってもおよそ150円位三日間の<U+6EDE>在中、本<U+5F53>に便利に活用出<U+6765>た全ての<U+99C5>が二重扉で安全性も良いし、<U+99C5>のトイレも問題なく<U+6E05>潔に使用できる各<U+99C5>に番<U+53F7>が付いていて路線が色分けされているのでわかり易いです。西面<U+99C5>は<U+4E57>換え<U+99C5>で地下が<U+5E83>く人も<U+6CA2>山行き交っていました。券<U+58F2>機は1000ウォン札のみ使用可との事だったので注意しました。釜山の地下<U+9244>もソウル同<U+69D8>日本語表記が可能。ただ電車の向かう方向で改札が分かれていたり、地下<U+9244><U+5185>も現在地が常に表示されていないとか、どちらのドアが開くなど情報がないとイマイチ。安いが、券<U+58F2>機は1000ウォン紙幣しか受け付けないなど多少めんどくさい。切符もソウルのSuica形式ではない日本の<U+9244>道と同じ形<U+72B6>でした。路線が色分けで表示されているので、わかりやすく主要な<U+99C5>は日本語アナウンスもあります。コンビニなどでカ<U+30FC>ドを購入してチャ<U+30FC>ジして利用すれば切符を購入する手間もはぶけ便利でした。料金も凄く安く色<U+3005>と移動するには活用できます。少<U+3005>椅子が固いですが<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>何度も釜山には行ってますが、地下<U+9244>の１日<U+4E57>車券を買うと安く<U+6E08>みます。割と<U+5E83>範<U+56F2>に展開しているので、基本は地下<U+9244>での移動でも大丈夫だと思います。車<U+5185>アナウンスが日本語でも放送されるので、下車する<U+99C5>を<U+4E57>り過ごす事も無いかと思う。番<U+53F7>も表記があるので、地下<U+9244>のりやすいです。パスモみたいな電子カ<U+30FC>ドがあればさらに便利。でもチャ<U+30FC>ジを<U+99C5>でしようとしたら1万Ｗいれて5000Ｗしたかったが、おつりがでなくて1万Ｗいれた。おつりがないこともあるので注意がいる。

Name: 장산
Review: We had a chance to go to Busan and Seoul, South Korea on 20th-27th April 2019. We decided to go to Busan for 3 days 2 night. We did a lot of outdoor recreation activities there e.g. cruising and hiking but the one of outdoor activities that we recommend you to do when you arrived at Busan is hiking. This activity is very popular for Korean people and foreigners because it was not too difficult to do and we didn’t have to prepare a lot of specific stuffs for hiking, we can wear only normal sneaker and proper attire for hiking. We did hiking at Jangsan Mountain where is the park surrounded by the forest, waterfall, and the natural scenic view. You can also see the Busan city view when you go almost to the top of the mountain. There is tourist information office, public map, insecticide spray service, sand dryer and public bathroom provided. During we walked to the top, we saw the caution of wildlife in the forest and you should not disturb them. You will get new Korean friends while you are hiking because Korean people are very kind and friendly. They will say hi to you all the way, they also look happy and enjoy with hiking. When you come back at the start point and feel so tired, there are a lot of local foods and drinks sell there and also have the area for take a rest. This activity is very recommended because it’s easy to go by public transportation and a lot of facilities provided. It’s not dangerous activity. The important thing is everyone should follow the rules and policy of the attraction respect of local people for making your activities goes well. We would like to recommend that the attraction should have the local guide who can speak English stand by there for facilitating foreigner tourists and should have a first aid service at the attraction if there is any accident.This is my first time to went to South Korea. I went to Busan and went to Jangsan mountain for hiking. It's like the most adventure activity that I had done. At first I took Metro to Jangsan station and walk to exit 10 then I walked from the station to the start point of the mountain but I didn't walk alone I came with my friends. For the start point It has the spray for every hikers to protect the insect then we chosen the way to hike they separate into 3 way by levels which are yellow line, blue line and green line at the first we decided to go to the easier than the least but when we hiked for a while we got lost along the way because the sign is the Korean language we don't understand. It's too difficult to find the right way but it has a few of English sign so we used the translation in the application to help and we asked for the Korean hikers to help us. They tried to communicate and help us as well as they can then they brought us to the top that is the helicopter park so along the way wasn't easy to hike but everyone try the best to go to the top. All of us already pushed our limits to this hike and we really appropriate to the kindness of the Korean hikers. It was fun and good experience for hiking this time. Next time I hope to be there and go to the top again absolutely I will bring my friends to hike together.We took the metro green line 2 from Seomyeon to Jangsan - 18 stops, about half hour ride, grab a seat soonest possible. Took Exit 10 and followed the main road (hint: head towards the mountain) to park entrance - about 15-20 min walk. A nice warmup to what's ahead, we walked up the road about another 20 mins to a large open area (hint: giant hula hoops). There are temples midway (hint: temple music & sounds). The waterfall was kinda non-existent - probably due to low rainfall. Go up the rocky steps (hint: hula hoops on your right, rocky steps on left). Else attempt the 45deg paved road - make sure you don't trip else it'd be a messy descent. There are milestones along the road for you to decide whether to go on the beginner/intermediate/advance trails. At one point, we came to barbed wire indicating land mines beyond the fence. We stayed on the right side. Funnily, as we passed one section, a booming voice came over the PA system - we reckon it was a reminder to stay on the path and not wander into the land mines. After a while seeing no one, we started to wonder whether we were on the right path. Fortunately a few locals, on their descent, told us to continue. We pushed on and finally reached the top. Fantastic view of Gwangandaeyo, Haeundae, Igidae. Couldn't see Oryukdo which was beyond a hill/island. Total time to & fro park entrance and mountain top was about 5 hours including meal & photo breaks. Great way to kick off our hiking vacation!Wear sturdy and comfortable hiking shoes with good grip a must.I went last weekend to the top of Jangsan Mountain. It was a really nice view above Busan but difficult to find right way because of no signs at the way. In advance I had look at the Internet to find a description for the way. (Take Subway to Jangsan station and go out at exit 10. Then always straight on until you reach the Daecheon Park and than follow the way "Peak"). Signs are very sporadic. So I had ask a married couple and they were so friendly that they allowed me to follow them :). I would recommend to climb to the top of mountain <U+263A> It was wonderfulThis is a really popular place with locals. The paths are pretty wide and easy to walk, but some places get pretty steep. They label the difficulty of paths pretty clearly and there're little benches along the paths.In mid-April this year, we climbed up this mountain. What a feat it was, for us novice climbers! We got lost along the way, but some basic Korean and friendly hikers made sure that we reached the peak, after 3 hours or so. Getting up was more challenging than it should have been because there were no signposts, and we often ran into dead corners/carparks. We also made a loop around north of the mountain instead of climbing directly up. Steep slopes and rocks made it rather tiring for us. We were glad to reach 200m within the peak, and we contemplated whether to go up or not. After persisting (in my opinion, the last 200m was the toughest part because of the rockiness), we were awarded with a beautiful view. We didn't stay long though, because we forgot to bring snacks and water up. Down we went by the proper route, crossing through closed eateries and encountering a wild dog along the way. In total, the hike was 6 hours for us.For future hikers: I would give directions, but we went by the longer route. The first part of the hike was fine, but it gets tougher nearer the peak. You MUST bring snacks up, because we ignored the advice from a blog, and couldn't really appreciate the peak properly due to our hunger. Good hiking shoes are highly recommended too. This is not an easy climb, but the satisfaction is worth it.A Nice trip. Nice nature and a incredible view of the city when you reach the top. Near Heaundae beach. In the spring you can see a lot of flowers. In the summer it could be to hot. Don't forget to bring water. I recommend the walk<U+263A><U+FE0F>I was pretty surprised when I noticed that this hike has not been added to TripAdvisor yet. This is one of my all time favorite places in Busan, mostly because it's so close to our front door. Jangsan or Jang Mountain is the large mountain that nestles Haeundae Beach. And believe it or not you can hike all the way to it's peak for an incredible view of the city and it's surroundings. This hike is super beautiful, although near the top it can be a little unsettling to see "Danger Land Mine" signs, but don't worry the area is barb wired off. For real though they weren't able to fully confirm complete removal of mines from the Korean War.There are a couple different routes to get to the top, the easiest to find is the riding the Subway to the Jangsan Station, leaving out of exit 12 and following the road until you get to the park. Once in the park just follow the signs for "Peak." It can be kind of confusing as sometimes the English on the signs goes away and you need to look for signs that say 장산 (Jangsan) or just ask a fellow hiker and they will point the way. The second way, and the better way in my opinion is taking the Subway to Dongbaek Station, and heading out of exit 4. Make a U-turn to the right out of the top of the stairs onto the sidewalk headed East. Walk about 100ft and you will see a small walkway tunnel on your left. Pass through it and take a right down a small gravel road to a small farming village surrounded by apartment buildings. Follow the gravel road till the end and turn left facing up the hill. You will see the start of a zigzag path that heads up the mountain. Take this path all the way to the peak, don't worry about the forks in the road, they all connect back together, but a good rule of thumb is always stay left. The hike itself can be challenging at times, and gets pretty steep in a lot of sections, round trip it's about 7-8miles so it's best if you set a whole afternoon aside to make it to the top. Also if you bring 1,000won there is a guy who always sells Popsicles at the top during the summer! It's a nice cooling reward for the effort! I would also make sure it's a clear day, the views are a lot better when there is blue sky. On a really, really clear day you can see Tsushima Island, Japan!

Name: 부산김해경전철
Review: なぜか釜山金海<U+56FD>際空港から釜山中心部までは地下<U+9244>が<U+7E4B>がっていません。そこでこの<U+8EFD>電<U+9244>と言われているこの<U+4E57>り物（モノレ<U+30FC>ルとどう違うかわかりませんが）を<U+4E57>ると、市<U+5185>中心部に<U+7E4B>がる地下<U+9244>沙上<U+99C5>までわずか３<U+99C5>、６分、1500ウォンで行けます。地下<U+9244>沙上<U+99C5>から市<U+5185>中心部の西面（ソミョン）<U+99C5>までは8<U+99C5>、15分程度で行けます。<U+4E57>り換えが若干面倒ですが、時間は<U+8AAD>めますのでお<U+52E7>めです。Ｔmoney（日本のsuicaみたいなもの）を持っていればさらに便利です。金海<U+8EFD>電<U+9244>と地下<U+9244>で、海雲台まで移動しました。金海<U+56FD>際空港の<U+6A2A>に、金海<U+56FD>際空港<U+99C5>があるので、沙上<U+99C5>まで金海<U+8EFD>電<U+9244>で移動しました。３<U+99C5>先なのでスグに到着です。切符は、コインのような物です。空港を出てから<U+6B69>いて3分程度で<U+99C5>につき、ほとんど待ち時間なく、ササンまでいけます。空港ビルから外にはでますが、屋根<U+4F1D>いに<U+99C5>まで行けるので雨でも大丈夫です。今、釜山金海<U+9244>道の出口付近は工事をしておりますが、2<U+53F7>線への接<U+7D9A>も問題なしです。リムジンバスで金海<U+56FD>際空港へ行きましたが、台風で欠航になり、仕方なく<U+8EFD><U+9244>を利用して元に<U+623B>りました。<U+8EFD><U+9244>は、英語<U+30FB>日本語表記が少なく、不便さを感じました。沙上まで1400ウォンでした。Tmoneyが使えると思ったら、ダメでしたもう少し改善があると良いかと思われます。空港からのアクセスで利用しました。地下<U+9244>というよりはゆりかもめのような新交通システムです。Ｔ－ｍｏｎｅｙも使えます。空港<U+99C5>から<U+4E57>車しましたが、編成は少なく席は全て埋まっていました。<U+4E57>客は韓<U+56FD>人が9割近く、<U+6B8B>りが外<U+56FD>人という感じ。誤って1度降りてしまいましたが、5分弱で次列車が<U+6765>たので<U+4E57>り<U+9045>れても特段問題はなさそうです。また、ソウル近<U+8FBA>で<U+767A>行できるT-moneyカ<U+30FC>ドが利用できるので、T-moneyカ<U+30FC>ドをお持ちの方はぜひ持<U+53C2>してください。空港から市<U+5185>への際に利用しました。ハングルはまったく<U+8AAD>めませんが、不自由なかったです。券<U+58F2>機も日本語を選ぶことができました。愛知<U+770C>でいえばリニモっぽい。釜山に旅行に行ったときは、金海空港から西面まで、いつも利用しています。交通カ<U+30FC>ド使えますが、<U+99C5>の<U+58F2>店では<U+58F2>っていませんので、あらかじめ自分の交通カ<U+30FC>ドを持っていかなくてはなりません。ササン<U+99C5>で地下<U+9244>MRTに<U+4E57>り換えて西面まで行く、この地下<U+9244>の混<U+96D1>ぶりに比べたら、<U+8EFD>電<U+9244>は２<U+4E21>編成といえども空いているほうだと思います。空港から西面までタクシ<U+30FC>だと２万ウォンくらいかかるので、電車なら２０００ウォンくらいでいけて安いうえ、<U+6E0B><U+6EDE>がないので時間がよめてラクです。荷物されなければ。。金海空港に到着したら3番ゲ<U+30FC>トを出て信<U+53F7>を渡り、右へ進んで行くと<U+99C5>があります。券<U+58F2>機は沙上<U+99C5>までしか買えませんので、そこから四面など先へ行く場合は地下<U+9244>2<U+53F7>線と連絡する沙上<U+99C5>で改めて切符を購入することになります。券<U+58F2>機は日本語を含めた多言<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>となっています。沙上には西部バスタ<U+30FC>ミナルがあり、バス旅する時はここから出<U+767A>すると良いです。金海空港に到着したら必ず利用します。地下<U+9244>2<U+53F7>線と連絡する沙上<U+99C5>までは3<U+99C5>。ちなみに沙上には西部バスタ<U+30FC>ミナルがあり、バス旅する時はここから出<U+767A>すると良いです。

Name: 상해거리
Review: テレビ番組で韓<U+56FD><U+5185>の餃子ベスト３に紹介されたお店「新<U+767A>園」を目的に行きました。地下<U+9244>を出てテキサスストリ<U+30FC>トが右側<U+30FB>左側が上海街になります。左側の３件目のお店で店外に人が<U+6CA2>山順番待ちをしているので直ぐ分かりました。店頭前に置いてあるボ<U+30FC>ドに名前と注文の品を記入し、順番を待ちます。中に案<U+5185>され「豚肉小籠包」８個6000ｗをいただきました。台<U+6E7E>の有名な小籠包に負けないぐらい美味しかったです。他に<U+713C>餃子が有名です。釜山<U+99C5>正面の「テキサス<U+30FB>ストリ<U+30FC>ト」のゲ<U+30FC>トをくぐるとスグ。中華料理店、ロシア料理店が軒を連ね、<U+4E21>替店や女性のいるＢＡＲなどで賑わう。夜はアヤシげな雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>だが、特に治安が<U+60AA>いわけではなく、ただの<U+98F2>み屋街。<U+4E21>替店もあり、便利。一本裏の通りには「ＴＯＰＭＡＲＴ」の大型店<U+8217>がある。「草梁市場」へも<U+6B69>いて行けるので、周<U+8FBA>をぐるりと回ってみるのも<U+697D>しい。界<U+9688>の雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>は何となく危<U+967A>な空<U+6C17>が流れていて、<U+663C>間でも一人で<U+6B69>くには警戒レベルを上げた方が良いと感じました。流域としては、<U+7E26>に2筋<U+6A2A>4筋ぐらいの通路。空港リムジンが通る大通りからすぐの場所にあります。たまたま<U+4E21>替所の近くにあって、夕方からは多くのお客さんで大<U+5909>賑わいます。中にはレストランから、漢方<U+85AC>、仕立て屋、喫茶、屋台的な店などが50件以上でしょうか、軒を連ねています。大通りからは中華街と書かれた通りや、Texas　street　もありました。少し物<U+9A12>な感じの店もありましたのでくれぐれも注意してください。立寄ったのが午前中だった所<U+70BA>もあってか、オ<U+30FC>プンしている店<U+8217>は少なく、閑散とした人通りでした。赤く塗られた店<U+8217>が多いのは中華街の特<U+5FB4>と云えそうでしたが、漢字と共に<U+4F75>記されたのは大半がロシア語となっておりロシア人<U+5BFE>象の中華街と云えそうでした。猶、中華街のア<U+30FC>チには "(上海街/Chinatown)" と記されており、中華と上海が同義語となっているようでした。釜山<U+99C5>下車すぐのところにあります。こじんまりとした感じで隣にあるテキサスストリ<U+30FC>トと言うロシア人が多いバ<U+30FC>があり、そのためかロシア語表記の店も多くみられます。ロシア人に話しかけるとウラジオストックからのロシア人が多いと言っていました。2018年9月に行きました。釜山のチャイナタウンは釜山<U+99C5>の近くにあります。中<U+56FD>らしい赤提<U+706F>が通りの<U+4E21>側に<U+4E26>んでいます。午前中に行ったためか、店がほとんど開いていなくて、人通りもなく閑散としていました。隣はロシア街です。30分20000ウォンの足裏マッサ<U+30FC>ジがあったり、<U+4E21>替所があったりと個人的に良かったです。良くも<U+60AA>くもロシアの雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が混じってるのも魅力的でした。チャイナタウンの隣にロシア人街もあります。<U+6B69>いていて<U+697D>しいエリアです。ガイドブックには、あまり近寄らない方が無難と書かれていますが、<U+663C>間は普通に<U+89B3>光客も多いです。夜は雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が<U+5909>わり、バ<U+30FC>などがオ<U+30FC>プンして、<U+89B3>光客も減りますが、警備スタッフも多く、普通に<U+6B69>けます。<U+4E21>替店も多く、レ<U+30FC>トも良いです。仁川と一<U+7DD2>で<U+89B3>光資源として再開<U+767A>された所だと思いますが今は中<U+56FD>人<U+89B3>光客が少ないのか少し元<U+6C17>が無い<U+69D8>に感じられました。

Name: 김해공항 국제선 터미널 관광안내소
Review: 中のCUは激混み。ダンキンド<U+30FC>ナツ、ソルビン、カフェ、小さいフ<U+30FC>ドコ<U+30FC>トがある。免<U+7A0E>品の引き取りは混んでいなくスム<U+30FC>ズ。9番搭<U+4E57>口の前のカフェでベ<U+30FC>グルサンドを購入。<U+6E29>めるか聞かれたので<U+65AD>ると「これは無<U+6761>件で<U+6E29>めるんです」と。でも中まで<U+6E29>まっていなかった…案<U+5185>係の女性が「どこかお探しですか？」と聞いてきてくださいます。<U+6559>えて欲しい場所を尋ねると、韓<U+56FD>語ですが、<U+6559>えてくれます。とても優しい案<U+5185>人です。日本各地から飛行機でプサンへ渡航する際、最初にたどり着くのがこの空港である。韓<U+56FD>で2番目に大きい<U+56FD>際空港であるが、<U+56FD><U+5185>線のほかは日本など北東アジア<U+30FB>東南アジア路線が<U+4E57>り入れているのみで、規模はそれほど大きくない。搭<U+4E57>時、および到着時は地上降機することが多く、そのため機<U+4F53>からタラップでいったん地上へ降りて<U+5C02>用のバスでタ<U+30FC>ミナルへ向かうことになるが、今回成田空港からの航空便はボ<U+30FC>ディングブリッジを利用することができた。入<U+56FD>審査はかなり簡素化され、機<U+5185>で渡される入<U+56FD>カ<U+30FC>ドに記入事項をあらかじめ入力しておき、カウンタ<U+30FC>では<U+4E21>手の指の指紋をセンサ<U+30FC>にかざし顔<U+5199><U+771F>を撮影するだけで、特に質問事項もなく審査は完了する。入<U+56FD>後はシャトルバス、タクシ<U+30FC>、モノレ<U+30FC>ルの<U+4E57>り場案<U+5185>がわかりやすく、日本語の案<U+5185>もある。また、<U+4E21>替所もあり日本円から直接<U+4E21>替できるほかに、クレジットカ<U+30FC>ドのキャッシング（50,000W<U+5358>位、手<U+6570>料6~9%）も利用でき日本語にも<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>したタッチパネルを搭載している。ただし空港<U+5185>のレ<U+30FC>トは高いので最小限にしておくこと。空港からプサン市<U+5185>各地へ地下<U+9244>で移動する場合、地下<U+9244>（メトロ）2<U+53F7>線の沙上（ササン）<U+99C5>までのモノレ<U+30FC>ルがあり、空港出口から<U+6A2A><U+65AD><U+6B69>道を渡りさらに5分ほど<U+6B69>くと空港<U+99C5>の入口にたどり着く（交通系ICカ<U+30FC>ドのT-Money利用<U+30FB>チャ<U+30FC>ジ可、<U+58F2>店では<U+58F2>り切れのことが多い）。地下<U+9244>（メトロ）2<U+53F7>線西面（ソミョン）<U+99C5>まで所要時間約30分、運賃は1,900W（現金）<U+30FB>1,800W（T-moneyカ<U+30FC>ド）、地下<U+9244>（メトロ）1<U+53F7>線およびKTXプサン<U+99C5>まで所要時間約45分、運賃は2,100W（現金）<U+30FB>2,000W（T-moneyカ<U+30FC>ド）である。荷物が少なかったので、南浦から地下<U+9244>で西面（そみょん）<U+99C5><U+4E57>り換え、沙上（ささん）<U+99C5>でさらに金海<U+8EFD><U+9244>道へと<U+4E57>り換えて移動しました。それにしても釜山の交通機<U+95A2>は安いなぁ。空港自<U+4F53>はごく普通です。手荷物<U+691C>査やイミグレは通過までに20分余りかかりましたが、イライラするほどではありませんでさした。仁川に比べたらかなりコンパクト、でも日本の地方空港よりは<U+5E83><U+3005>。月曜ということもあって空いて、綺麗で快適でした。出<U+767A>ロビ<U+30FC>にはあまり店<U+8217>がなく(朝鮮人<U+53C2>系のお土産、油揚げ？のお店、ド<U+30FC>ナッツ、くらいだったので、そうそうに中へ。韓<U+56FD>料理の食堂ぽいお店、カフェ2<U+301C>3店<U+8217>？、今回は、冷<U+9EBA>が食べたくて韓<U+56FD>料理フ<U+30FC>ドコ<U+30FC>ト利用。<U+9D8F>肉入りの冷<U+9EBA>1万ウォンと安くて美味しかったカフェAngel-in-is,一番端にあるお店、ホットコ<U+30FC>ヒ<U+30FC>6千ウォン<U+2615><U+FE0F>チョコチ<U+30FC>ズケ<U+30FC>キも濃ゆくてとても美味しかった（<U+89B3>光案<U+5185>所の口コミではないですが…）出<U+56FD>後に某パスを持ってKALラウンジに。通常は、そのパスがあればLCCでも使えるはず。しかし「ここは使えない。隣にLCCのラウンジがあるから、そちらへ行け」と<U+4E71>暴に言われました。その口調に、「もう絶<U+5BFE>にKALには<U+4E57>らない！」と決心。LCCのラウンジはカップラ<U+30FC>メンとドリンクしかありませんでした。<U+60AA>くはないですが、何のためのパスなのでしょうか…。以前、夕方出<U+767A>した時には<U+56FD>際線はゆったりした綺麗な空港という印象でしたが、東南アジアへのLCCが出る時刻は韓<U+56FD>で爆買いした人<U+3005>の列がさばけず、大<U+5909>な混<U+96D1>でした。レストラン利用を諦め、スカイハブラウンジへ入室。こちらもほぼ<U+6E80>席ですが、適度に循環。ブュッフェ台は他の空港に比べて少なめですが、<U+6E29>かい料理もあります。LCCの<U+9045>延で搭<U+4E57>口の前も空席がなかったので、ゆっくりさせて貰いました。空港全<U+4F53>は明るく<U+6E05>潔です。それだけでも<U+6C17>持ちの良い旅が出<U+6765>ます。<U+9045>延の情報が出<U+767A>案<U+5185>のボ<U+30FC>ドに反映されるまで、かなりの時間を要しました。この点が改善されることを望みます。買い物する場所は出<U+56FD>後の方がもちろん多いです。出<U+56FD>後フロアではブランドものやコスメがメイン。箱土産のお菓子や海苔、朝鮮人<U+53C2>ドリンクなどはありましたがマグネットみたいな個人向けの物は<U+58F2>ってませんでした。カフェは<U+6570>件ありましたがWifi提供しているところは混んでて入れなかったので、たくさん時間あるなら出<U+56FD>前エリアで過ごす方がお<U+52E7>めかも金海空港の到着ロビ<U+30FC>にあるので、すぐに見つけられると思います。英語、日本語、中<U+56FD>語などの言語に<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>しているようで、流暢な日本語を話すスタッフに西面の行き方を<U+6559>わりました。交通機<U+95A2>のパンフレットをもらいましたが、製本が適<U+5F53>で上下が逆になっているペ<U+30FC>ジがあり、ちょっと面白かったです。2018年9月に行きました。釜山の金海空港の到着ロビ<U+30FC>にある<U+89B3>光案<U+5185>所です。空港について地<U+56F3>とかもらうには便利です。今回は立ち寄らず前を通り過ぎただけですが、スタッフも常駐してます。何か用があれば立ち寄ってみる<U+4FA1>値はあるかと思います。

Name: 맥도생태공원
Review: 3/30～4/1の間<U+685C>祭りが行われていました。とてもきれいな道をずっと川沿いに<U+6B69>いていけるコ<U+30FC>スがあり、２人<U+4E57>り自<U+8EE2>車をレンタルして<U+4E57>っている方やベビ<U+30FC>カ<U+30FC>に赤ちゃんを<U+4E57>せて<U+6765>ている方もいらっしゃいました。3/31に行ったのですが<U+685C>がちょうど<U+6E80>開でまだ<U+685C>が散る少し前のようでした。家族連れ、カップル、海外からもたくさんの人が訪れていました。4/14～は菜の花祭りが始まるそうです。春に<U+6765>たらデジョ生態公園に<U+6765>ることをお<U+52E7>めします^^地下<U+9244><U+99C5>のすぐそばにあるので移動も便利です

Name: 금정 산성
Review: We decided to make healthy trekking and we did not know that there is also a fortress. The fortress itself was not impressing, but the long wall (kind of low Chinese great wall) was interesting to see! We run out of the water and there is no place to buy it - but local well helped us!Watch from a distance. Just a fortress remain and if you don't read about ti before visiting, it will be easily ignored.So, honestly, the Fortress is just a big 'ol wall with trees and weeds growing around it. It is not why you should go, but you should go. There is a cable car up if you need it, but I recommend hiking up. The hike is about an hour and it doesn't require a moderate level of fitness but the best views are from the hike, not the view at the top of the cable car. Also, from the Fortress you can continue a short hike to Seokbulsa temple. Follow the signs for Namman village, it is the only other road leading from the Fortress Gate opposite direction as the cable car. Go through the village and take the trail to the left heading up into the forest. It will take you to a long set of stairs heading down. The path will eventually come out at a road. Go right up hill along the road. Bit of a steep trek but at the top is Seokbulsa Temple and the beautiful stone carvings hidden behind the temple. You can either backtrack to the cable car or continue down the road and work your way to the metro (bit of a walk, Naver would be helpful here).We got the cable car, having walked from Oncheonjang station to the 'ropeway' station. The signs aren't great but we were using satnav so it was fine. The cablecar itself looks like it's from the 60s (in a good way- vintage rather than unsafe) with great views of the city as you go up. We were there on a Wednesday and it was pretty empty. Once at the top there were a number of walkers and we followed signs through the woodland to the south gate of the fortress. It was nice to see and lovely woods. If we'd had longer it would have been good to do a more challenging walk to one of the other gates or temples nearby.Took metro red line 1 to Beomeosa. At Exit 7 road level, immediately u-turn and take 1st right and walk up a small road to bus stop 90 (big letters which one can't miss) - it's the only bus which goes to Beomeosa Temple. Unfortunately I read some blogs which didn't mention this precious detail and cost us 45 mins of aimless wandering and sweating. After asking a few shops, we found this bus 90. Devil is in the details.The bus stopped at the temple entrance. We walked up the road and came to temple entrance. Continued to walk to back of temple (parking for temple stay) and started our hike to North Gate. The terrain was akin to a river of rocks, I kid you not. Fortunately we all had proper hiking shoes and most of us had hiking sticks. About 1.7km later, we reached North Gate - basically just an entrance with a wall running up and down. We had a choice to turn left and go towards East Gate and then to South Gate, else turn right for Godangbong Peak (1km). We all voted for the peak cos we wanted to have our picnic lunch at the peak. After more trudging up staircases and slopes for 30~40 mins, we hit the peak and were greeted by 3 cats - go figure. Scenery was a million bucks; egg and luncheon meat sandwiches with apples and pears tasted all the sweeter. After a photo session, we made our way back to North Gate and retraced our route to Beomeosa Temple. Bus 90 back to town - don't miss it cos the next one comes every 20ish minutes.I saw on the map that it was close to the Temple so though I would kill two birds with one stone. The trail up to the North gate from the temple is well marked and even has ropes to keep you on the track. BUT the track is steep, and in places very steep and you are stepping up rough stones that have been laid in a pathway, which is challenging for the legs. Took me just under the hour to get to the north gate and then another 30 minutes to make it to the peak of Mt Geumjeogsan for some big views, again well formed path with steps in the steep bits. By the time I had done this I was pooped, so headed back down the temple rather than heading out towards the other gates.Well , we have begin the fortress n'y the South Gare, with the ropeway which gives a nice view on the Busan Bay. I recommand if you want to go to the North gate 3 things : water, compass to follow the North and the Korean map ( the english Map is useless because the ways are in koreans). If you have this 3 things it is a very Nice travel not really difficult and you CAN sometimes walk on the remparts ( East Gate) and have really Nice view on the Town or the Mountains ( near the North Gate). Metro to metro it is a 12 kilometres walking .. about 4 - 5 Hours.Great fortress.West, East, South gate are easy to access.North gate is to approach from other gate or Bomosa.Anyway each gate is worth visiting.We travelled up the cable car, expecting to be at the top, but in fact there was a long walk from where the cable car stopped. It was light bushland with a reasonably good series of tracks and plenty of signage.An enjoyable outing with good exercise!We took the cable car and walked to South Gate. Then visited the 'Observatory' about the cable car station. Splendid old woods with reasonable trails having an almost 'Lord of the Rings' feel. Great views.Two ways in which the experience could be improved1) Better maps2) Cutting back the trees around the Observatory so one can fully see its splendid view.

Name: 회동수원지 둘레길
Review: 부산사람들도 잘 모르는 회동수원지. 근처에 많은 맛집들이 있어 식사하기 좋아요. 또 커피숍에서 커피와 함께 수원지를 바라보면 힐링이 되요. 오륜동쪽으로 올라가면 유명한 오리고기 맛집이 있어 오리고기를 먹은 후 둘레길을 따라 산책을 했네요.회동수원지 주변에 여러 식당이 있는데 오리고기를 먹은 후 소화도 시킬 겸 산책해 본 회동수원지 둘레길이네요. 도심에서 가까운 곳에 이런 아름다운 자연경관을 느낄 수 있어서 좋았습니다.수원지라서 맑은 물과 조용한 산책길이 같이 있어요.부산이라기엔 굉장히 외곽이라서 가끔씩만 방문을 하게 되지만 갈때마다 분위기가 좋아요. 산책로가 잘되어있고 최근엔 더 보수공사를 하여 깔끔해졌어요.바로앞 까페도 있어요.42번 회동동 종점에서 시작해 회동수원지를 따라 계속 가면 마을이 나오고, 이곳에서 식사 후, 마을버스 타고 나오거나 다시 걸어서 장전동 쪽으로 나올 수 있다. 큰 오르막 없이 평지길 위주라 편히 걸을 수 있다부산 중심에 위치한 회동수원지 주위를 트레킹 가능하도록 길이 형성 되어 있음상현마을 입구에 화장실 및 흙먼지 세척을 위한 에어건 완비 됨산책후 근처 식당에서 식사도 괜찮음

Name: 범어사 성보박물관
Review: 梵魚寺に行きましたら寺だけでなくて博物館も見たいですね！入場は、無料ですから<U+6C17><U+8EFD>に見<U+5B66>できます。（<U+5185>部は、撮影禁止です！）日本語のパンフレットもありますので安心です。梵魚寺の<U+6B74>史や文化も解ります。おすすめの博物館です。

Name: 부산대학교 대학로
Review: 平日の午前中に訪問<U+99C5>から大<U+5B66>までの道に色<U+3005>なお店がありますあまり早い時間だと回<U+8EE2>準備中の店が多く、<U+663C>からの方が賑やかかも、、大<U+5B66>正門<U+6A2A>に大きなマ<U+30FC>ケットがあり、そこ地下のス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>でバラマキ土産を購入しました大<U+5B66>に入る途中の<U+5B66>生用の文具店がとても大きく、可愛いキャラクタ<U+30FC>ものの文具などもあり見てて飽きなかった地下<U+9244>の釜山大<U+5B66>の周<U+8FBA>の通りです。ガイドブックにB級グルメが<U+697D>しめると書かれていたので<U+6765>ました。大<U+5B66>にも普通に入れました、隣にショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルもあります。通りは、屋台、ショップなど、若者も多く活<U+6C17>があります。ガイドブックを見てプサンデの<U+99C5>からこの界<U+9688>を<U+6B69>きました。なかなか<U+697D>しい街で、可愛いピアスやジャケットを買ったり、スタバで休んだり、<U+5B66>生街は面白かったです。<U+6B69>いているのは<U+89B3>光客ではなく、韓<U+56FD>の若者ばかり。大<U+5B66>生でに賑わう通りで、私が行ったのは土曜日だったため、閉まっているお店がいくつかありましたが、よっぽど釜山の他の繁華街より食べ物が安くて、利用<U+4FA1>値があると思いました。また、安い<U+9784>や靴、洋服屋もたくさんあったので、今度はもう少し時間をかけて回りたいと思いました。<U+5B66>生街街なだけあり、食事や衣類等が全<U+4F53>的に安いです。西面より若い子が多く感じました。ブランド品のアウトレットや安い衣類、<U+96D1>貨店が<U+4E26>びついついお金を使いすぎました。こちらで買い物すると安く<U+6E08>むので良いかなと。釜山大<U+5B66><U+99C5>から釜山大<U+5B66>までの通りは、若者、<U+5B66>生の街って感じの賑やかな通りです。ファッション店、ファストフ<U+30FC>ド店、カフェ、屋台、<U+6B69>いているだけで<U+697D>しそうなエリアです！屋台では安くてボリュ<U+30FC>ムのある屋台飯が食べられます。原宿みたいな街<U+4E26>みです。とても活<U+6C17>のある<U+697D>しい街です。日本食料理店もあり、きっと間違えているだろうと思いましたが、わりと日本食を忠<U+5B9F>に再現していました。釜山の<U+89B3>光エリアの中心から外れたので、すっきりとした雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が<U+6B69>いていて心地よいです。また<U+5B66>生街なので、<U+5B66>生がたくさん！エネルギ<U+30FC>を感じるまち<U+6B69>きができます。他の<U+5B66>生街同<U+69D8>、<U+98F2>食店や服屋さんがたくさん<U+4E26>んでいます。カフェも多いので、<U+6B69>き疲れたらカフェでコ<U+30FC>ヒ<U+30FC>とともにのんびり休憩できます。安いファッションのお店が多いので、お土産にも良いと思います。若い女性が好きそうな街です。<U+60AA>天候でしたが、割と賑わっていました。<U+7E26>ばかりではなく<U+6A2A>の道にもお店があるので、色<U+3005>見て回っているとどこに居るのか分かりにくくなりました。迷わない<U+70BA>に、曲がったコ<U+30FC>ナ<U+30FC>にあるお店を目印として<U+899A>えながら<U+6B69>くと良いと思います。韓<U+56FD>料理を食べる目的でしたが、パスタやピザ等のお店が多かったです。

Name: 범어사
Review:
Went end of October but trees are still mostly green. Interesting 600 year old fertile female Gingko trees with lots of Gingko fruits. Nice walk uphill.The temple is ok, like many other korean temples but it gets very crowded. The setting is beautiful and hiking to the diffent hermitages is even better than the temple itself in my opinionCaught metro then the 90 bus. we went on Sunday and lots of walkers. We planned on seeing temple and then walk up to north gate. The walk was strenuous but picturesque.When we reached gate we saw people on top of mountain and decided to walk part way and before we knew it we were nearly at top and then went all way. It was worth it has it has 360 degree views. Definitely recommend walk to top it took 4 hours there and back from temple.Beomeosa Temple is easily accessible by train to Beomeosa Station (Exit 5) on the orange line. Recommended to take a taxi from Beomesosa Station up to the temple to save your energy walking uphill, costing Krw 4500 or less. Unfortunately, it was raining when we arrive and we could only cover the temple ground missing the walking around the temple vicinity. What a waste!After a long drive a very good place to get out and walk around. Would liked to walk the trails but we did not have time.This is a nice hotel up in the hills. Its in the outskirts of Busan but very easy to find using Naver Maps. I recommend taking a taxi from the closest subway station. Its very cheap (KRW3500) and takes you all the way up to the temple unlike the bus.Got nice buildings and nice view. It also have a stream nearby.Beomeosa Temple is one of the important temples to visit in South Korea. You can reach the temple via hiking over the Geumjeongsan temple or reach Beomeosa subway station and then take a 15 min bus ride to the temple. I have tried them both but hiking gave me a wonderful experience. The trails are completely easy to follow up, plus the added beautiful scenery. One of the must-visit places in Busan3p* Beomosa Temple
Walk uphill, lots of steps, difficult, through three beautiful gates
Several prayer forums; need to take off shoes; no photos inside
Stone lantern
Stone pagodaVisited Beomeosa temple on a rainy day, the atmosphere was extraordinary! A peaceful place, the temple consists of numerous praying halls, each beautiful and unique. Highly recommended!This temple is a must visit when in Busan. The temple has quite a big car park, but you can also take the public transport to get there. The temple is beautiful in itself, but the surroundings make every visit unforgettable. We loved the impressive collection of buddha statues. You can experience the temple to the fullest during a temple stay, but even if you're just stopping by for a short visit, you'll love observing the bustling temple life. When we visited there were several ceremonies going on.

Name: <U+00A0>해동 용궁사

It is massive in size and spectacularly...더 보기Lots of tour groups spoil this magnificent place. Access is best done using the tourist bus loops. Get into the spiritual mood, see the inner workings of a great...더 보기Don’t come on a weekend it is soooo busy you can’t move, I cam there at 10am and was far...더 보기A walking distance to reach the entrance of the temple and you wont get hungry here as alot of dishes...더 보기This beautiful temple is perched on the hillside and offer a half a day worth of sightseeing. Name: 국립수산과학원
Review: I came across the museum by accident, but I thought it was laid out very well and had a lot of interesting exhibits. Aside from the main museum, there is a small aquarium, and an art gallery housed inside a replica boat. The downside, however, is that most of the displays in the museum do not have an English translation, removing the educational dimension of the museum. Still, it is worth walking through if you are already in the area.Free entry, located just next to a famous tourist spot, lots of things to see and to learn. For my 8 year old daughter one of her favorite places.

Name: 기장시장
Review: 蟹を食べるつもりは無かったのですが、「機張市場で蟹を食べる！」と、目玉にしているツア<U+30FC>を見かけ、どんなものかと<U+6C17>になったので、雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>を<U+697D>しむ目的で訪れました。釜山シティ<U+30FC>ツア<U+30FC>のバス（イエロ<U+30FC>ライン）が海東龍宮寺から出ていて、市場の入り口にバス停があるので簡<U+5358>に行けました。蟹や魚以外にも、野菜や果物、キムチや乾物、トッポキやおでん等、いろいろなものが<U+58F2>られていて、地元の方が購入していました。客と店主のやりとりが、韓<U+56FD>ならではといった感じで、とても面白かったです。蟹を見ているとお店の方に<U+58F0>を掛けられますが、「もう食べたから<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>」と言うと、それ以上は話しかけられませんでした。ズワイガニを食べてきました。生け<U+7C00>から取ったカニ1人一杯ずつで、2人で10万ウォンでした。値段交<U+6E09>は苦手なので、お店の人の言い値です。<U+53C2>考にしてください。電車の便が<U+60AA>いということでしたが、シティ<U+30FC>交通のような名前で（不正確ですみません）釜田<U+99C5>から2、30分に一本は出ています。<U+9752>いボディのスマ<U+30FC>トな車<U+4E21>で、シ<U+30FC>トは地下<U+9244>のようなタイプです。切符は<U+99C5>の窓口やそのすぐ隣の券<U+58F2>機で買うのではなく（それだと片道260ウォンのムグンファ<U+53F7>になり、2時間に一本になります）、電車のホ<U+30FC>ムに降りたところに設置されている改札機のすぐ脇の券<U+58F2>機で買います。片道140ウォン（2019年4月現在）、所要時間は約30分です。3年前の釜山旅行時に一度機張市場でタラバがにを食べてまあまあ良かったので、再びカニを食すために行きました。前回と同じお店がいいと結論に至り、タラバがにを所望したのですが、2月はタラバがあまりとれないし、美味しくないとのこと。ずわいがにを<U+52E7>められましたが、ずわいがには日本でも食べているのでタラバが食べたい<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>でもお店にはない模<U+69D8><U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>本<U+6765>さけるべき、姿<U+30FB>形が激似（甲羅の6個のとんがりがタラバ<U+30FB>4つのとんがりがあぶら）のあぶらがににしてみました。しかしこれが間違いでした。蒸しあがったかにはタラバとは違い（<U+5F53>たり前ですが）大味でくせのある味。誰ぞやのネット情報で、比べてもわからないとか、あぶらがにの方が好きな人がいるとかの書き<U+8FBC>みを見てしまっていたので判<U+65AD>を誤りました。これじゃお店の人もずわいがにを<U+52E7>めるはずだ～と思い知ったわけです。130000ウォンも出してまずいかにを食べた機張市場でした（<U+6D99>）目的は蟹です！蟹のお店に入る前に、市場をうろうろしました。アワビがひとかご￥1000ほど。買って<U+5E30>りたかった～！！新鮮な魚介がたくさん<U+58F2>っていて、活<U+6C17>のある市場でした。ずっと行ってみたくて、海雲台からタクシ<U+30FC>で向かいました。30～40分ぐらいだったと思います。タクシ<U+30FC>の運<U+8EE2>手さんオススメ？のへソンテゲというお店に入りました。釜山<U+89B3>光公社のHPにも<U+63B2>載されているお店です。<U+89B3>光客向けのセットメニュ<U+30FC>ではなく、水槽からカニを選びました。ズワイガニ2匹で170000W、その他一人4000Wずつ追加されました。ちょっと高いと思いましたが、おかずに刺身盛り合わせ、刺身サラダなど色<U+3005>付いてきて豪華。メインのカニはカニ刺しから始まり、カニのチ<U+30FC>ズ<U+713C>き、茹でたカニ、<U+3006>の<U+713C>き飯…どれも美味しかったです。カニはカットされた<U+72B6>態で出てくるので食べやすいですよ。ちなみに、<U+89B3>光客向けセットメニュ<U+30FC>は<U+4E26>が30000W、大盛が50000Wです。カニの大きさによって違うようです。どんな店<U+8217>でも、最低カニ１００杯は水槽にいるんじゃないでしょうか！計量時に値段が表記されるので分かり易いですが、そこから<U+5F53>然おまけしてもらってください。海雲台から古里原子力<U+767A>電所の方に行くのにバスで機張<U+99C5>前に着いて初めてランチを食べに寄りました。市場自<U+4F53>は小さな感じで名物の蟹が多かった<U+69D8>に思いました。何<U+6C17>に見付けた所で久し振りに食べ切れない家族定食？を７千ウォンで頂きました。釜山<U+99C5>からのシャトルバスを使って行きました。50000Wコ<U+30FC>スを頂きましたが、特に可もなく不可もありませんでした。カニ目的なら日本で十分だと思います。一度位なら行ってもいいかもしれませんが…。蟹は、値引きすると言って、最初は高い料金を吹っかけてきますので、<U+6570>店回って相場を確かめてから、値引き交<U+6E09>をして下さい。一匹で2000円以上<U+4FA1>格差が出ました。タラバカニを食べましたが、美味しかったです。味<U+564C>汁にもしてくれます。釜山<U+89B3>光でいくつか市場を回りましたが、最も市場らしい雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>がありました。ただ、鮮魚が中心のため<U+89B3>光客はなかなか買い物する事はないと思うので、雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>を味わう、また食事が主になるかと思います。私はス<U+30FC>ツケ<U+30FC>スがありましたが、ス<U+30FC>ツケ<U+30FC>ス等は絶<U+5BFE>に無い方が良いです。道も場所によっては<U+72ED>いため荷物は最小限がベタ<U+30FC>です。

Name: 부산항대교
Review: 釜山<U+99C5>の東<U+6A2A>インホテル前より、ナイトシティ<U+30FC>バスに１９時に<U+4E57>車。１１月からは冬時間となり１８時３０分<U+767A>になるようです。約２時間３０分コ<U+30FC>スで夜景の綺麗な場所を廻ってくれます。この橋は往復通過してくれます。２階の屋根無しバスで、スピ<U+30FC>ドを落とすことなく走りますのでカメラで<U+5199><U+771F>を撮っていられないくらい怖かったです。ジェットコ<U+30FC>スがお好きな方はお<U+5968>めです。ライトアップはとても綺麗でした。宿泊したホテルの客室正面に見て取れました。夜間はライトアップされており、橋の位置をはっきりと確認する事が出<U+6765>ました。<U+5B9F>際に車で渡ってみると街中近くの海上を<U+629C>けるダイナミックな雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>を味わう事が出<U+6765>ます。2018年9月に行きました。チャガルチ市場の裏側の海沿いから遠くに釜山港大橋が見えます。釜山港の入り口にかかる橋で遠くからでもその大きさがわかります。フェリ<U+30FC>で釜山港に入るときはこの橋の下を通ることになるようなので、その時はもっと間近にこの橋を見ることができると思います。遠くから眺めました。普通の橋ですが、周りのビル街の景色との融合でステキな景色になります。<U+663C>も良し、夜は夜景がさらに良し。釜山港大橋ですが、港の入り口にある大きな橋です。大型豪華客船もこちらの釜山大橋の下をくぐり港に入るのですね！そんなシ<U+30FC>ンを見たくなりますね！私は、釜山<U+99C5>の展望台と釜山タワ<U+30FC>展望台の2つから釜山大橋をみましたよ！とても大きく美しい橋ですね！夜はライトアップされているので、夜景がお<U+52E7>めです。近くで見るより、少し離れた場所から見た方が綺麗だと思います。七色に<U+5909>わります。ゴ<U+30FC>ルデンウィ<U+30FC>クの最中、<U+6A2A>浜港からのクル<U+30FC>ズで釜山港へ行きました。港に近づいた時に見えた釜山港大橋を見たとき、一瞬<U+6A2A>浜港に<U+623B>ってきたのかと思ったのは、吊り橋の形が「鶴見つばさ橋」に似ていたからだと思います。午後に<U+56FD>際旅客タ<U+30FC>ミナルに着岸し、22時に出港したので<U+663C>間の釜山港大橋と、ライトアップされた釜山港大橋大橋の<U+4E21>方を見ましたが、夜の景色の方が<U+697D>しめました。<U+6B8B>念だったのは、かなり撮影しましたが手持ちのコンパクトカメラではブレた<U+5199><U+771F>が大半でした。三脚を持って行くことをお<U+52E7>めします。港町だけあってゴチャゴチャしてますが、夜はライトアップされていて<U+5199><U+771F>を撮りたくなります。橋自<U+4F53>に行くより、遠くから撮影する方がいいと思います。オ<U+30FC>プントップバスでの夜景<U+89B3>光ツア<U+30FC>で通過するのがおすすめ<U+FF61>空中浮遊感があり快適。<U+663C>間は港が見渡せて爽快。バスはかなりのスピ<U+30FC>ドで飛ばすので<U+5199><U+771F>もとれないくらい。レインボ<U+30FC>ブリッジのごとく、夜は虹色にぴかぴかと光り、一大イルミネ<U+30FC>ションスポット的<U+697D>しみ方ができます。大きな建造物なので、釜山市街のちょっと高いところからだとだいたいどこからでも眺めを<U+697D>しむことができます。

Name: 부산 박물관
Review:
Lots of history from “prehistory” to the present day, signs in English too so easy to understand. Many interesting artefacts.we went there as it was a heavy storm day and was pleasantly surprised. Interesting display and overall well laid out. it is freeAfter visiting the UN Cemetery we headed here to learn about the history and culture of Busan from long ago to the present.  Admission is free and it is a rather large museum.  I found it interesting but as there are very few places to...더 보기The museum has nice grounds and exhibits with English explanations.  There is also a cultural experience room.  Tickets are free.We came here after visiting the UN cemetery as it’s just around the corner. We went to the cultural centre and were sad that the traditional tea making experience was fully booked for the day - certainly try to get on that as it looked...더 보기I loved my visit so much that I went twice. Excelelnt displays, clever animations and videos. I learnt a lot about Korea's turbuent history, I had a lesson in Korean tea ceremony and as i was rhe only person that afternoon, I had the full...더 보기The exhibits are interesting, but I was more impressed by the building itself and in particular by the lovely garden.We came here in Oct.2018 & we had extremely enjoyable experience of making tea. 
We also impressed by the teacher who guides us to make & enjoy Korean traditional tea.Very nicely laid out museum.  High quality of exhibits with a fair amount of English available.  Not everything had English language, but was still very good.  Larger than I expected and near the Busan Culture center and UN burial site.  The property had many trees...더 보기A really nice place. A historic place where anyone must see. It will help you to know more the origin and history of korea. Will advice or recommend to my friend to visit it if they will tour in korea. A very nice place to...더 보기

Very beautiful and classical

Highly recommendWas lucky to get tickets at last moment for a concert by the Busan Philharmonic Orchestra.  Was amazed at the...더 보기Absolutely fabulous performance. Visited as part of a cruise excursion. Definately recommend anyone to visit. THe level of performance was staggering and captivating.I came here last year when I took a cruise around Asia. We stopped at Busan for a day and...더 보기I went to take a look around the cultural center, the Venue big and spacious.
