Name: 국립일제강제동원역사관
Review: 昨年末になって韓<U+56FD>での<U+5FB4>用工裁判の結果から再訪しました。約３年ちょっと前に出<U+6765>た翌年には行っていましたが慰安婦<U+95A2>係の展示も分かりやすいです。その時も隣に有るＵＮの朝鮮<U+6226><U+4E89>の展示も<U+89B3>ましたが一方では正義の<U+6226><U+4E89>で<U+5BFE>抗したみたいなことが何か矛盾している<U+69D8>に感じました。UN墓地を見下ろす高台に所在しています。<U+6B69>くと少し大<U+5909>かも。タクシ<U+30FC>で行くのが無難ですが、散<U+6B69>がてら<U+6B69>いてもよいかもしれません。日本の植民地支配下で展開された「<U+5F37>制動員」に<U+95A2>する<U+69D8><U+3005>な展示物を見ることができます。募集<U+30FB>官斡旋<U+30FB><U+5FB4>用という「動員」の諸形態と、<U+52B4>務動員や軍事動員、「慰安婦」といった<U+5F93>事した業務<U+5185>容、そして動員された場所などによって、いくつかのセクションに分かれています。一人ひとり固有名を持った朝鮮の方<U+3005>が、日本の政策に<U+7FFB>弄され、人生を台無しにされたことが痛切に<U+4F1D>わってきました。遠い場所へ連れて行かれ、きつい業務に<U+5F93>事させられ、どうやって自分を納得させたのか。どうやって生きる希望を紡いだのか。一人ひとりの生活を破<U+58CA>したことの重さ。そんなことを考えました。

Name: 대연동 문화골목
Review: Located just inside of a few main streets, this Gem of a place will easily be missed if you don't know where it is. Came to know about this place from the Busan Metro Booklet highlighting about places of interest you can visit by taking the Busan Metro.Getting....take the Metro to Kyungsung University & Pukyong National University Station and look for EXIT 1. Walk down the street about 100meters and turn right. Walking Straight pass 2 side lanes, and turn right at the 3rd lane and walk about 30 meters and the entrance will be on the right.Inside this place, are a few bars, cafes, florist and restaurant. Great place to visit apart from the normal touristy places. You will find many sculptures and artist installations and makes of interesting photo opportunities.This location is also located about 30mins walk from Gwangalli Beach and we stopped by for a late afternoon tea at the DABAN cafe before heading to the beach in the evening to have dinner and watch the light show.I will also recommend that you download the NAVER Map App ( Korean Transport app with English) to navigate around as it will tell you the best options to consider either by train, bus, taxi or walking with estimated cost in Won and estimated time it will take. Very useful app to have when travelling in Korea.

Name: 부산역광장
Review: 釜山<U+99C5>前にある<U+5E83>場ですが特に特筆すべきものは見<U+5F53>たらず。土曜日には何かのデモ隊が集まってシュプレヒコ<U+30FC>ルをあげていました。釜山港に入<U+56FD>して、地下<U+9244>やバスrは使用せず、TAXIを利用して、<U+89B3>光したが、ブさん<U+99C5>は、若いころ、仕事で、利用しているので、少し散策しました。<U+5F53>時、戒<U+53B3>令下の釜山<U+99C5>とは比べようがないほど、<U+5F53>たり前だが、<U+5909>わっていたのが、感慨深かったです。ソウルをはじめ韓<U+56FD>各地から<U+4E57>り入れる高速列車KTXの終着<U+99C5>であり、ほかに特急ITXセマウル<U+53F7>や急行列車等も運行されている。地下<U+9244>（メトロ）1<U+53F7>線の<U+99C5>に直結しており、1階は主に<U+98F2>食店、2階に<U+58F2>店とチケット<U+58F2>り場がある。チケット<U+58F2>り場は自動販<U+58F2>機もあるがこちらは韓<U+56FD>で<U+767A>行されたクレジットカ<U+30FC>ド決<U+6E08>のみなので、予約がなければ有人のチケットカウンタ<U+30FC>にならぶことになる。チケット<U+58F2>り場は係員にもよるが日本語が通じ、そうでなくとも最低限英語は通じる（ソウル<U+99C5>も同じ）。日本の「みどりの窓口」と同<U+69D8>に<U+5F53>日から約1か月先までの列車の予約<U+30FB><U+767A>券ができ、現金のほか各種クレジットカ<U+30FC>ド決<U+6E08>もできる。<U+99C5>構<U+5185>にはコインロッカ<U+30FC>が多<U+6570>あるが利用客も多く使用中のものが多い。こういう場合は1階正面入口からすぐ右側に<U+9EC4>色い看板の有人荷物預かりカウンタ<U+30FC>があり、ス<U+30FC>ツケ<U+30FC>スであれば1日5,000Wで預かってくれる。スタッフは英語が通じ、クレジットカ<U+30FC>ド決<U+6E08>ができる。預け入れ時に氏名（ロ<U+30FC>マ字）と電話番<U+53F7>（日本での連絡先でOK）および引き取り時刻を申告する。ただ、預け入れ荷物がかなり多いこともあり引き取り時に預けていた荷物を探すのに時間がかかるようで、引き取りの際は申告時間より早めに<U+623B>るとよい。完全ではないが、改修工事はほぼ終了、キレイな外<U+89B3>が見られる。夜は特にム<U+30FC>ドがある。地下<U+9244><U+99C5>から地下通路でも向かうことが可能、また外に出ても遠くなく、フラットな路面なので、キャスタ<U+30FC>バッグなどを引きずってもそのままストレスなく進めます。メインゲ<U+30FC>トを出ると正面が市バス<U+4E57>り場。韓<U+56FD>は距離的に近く安く行けることもあって、思い立ったが吉日みたいに出かけたくなります。この<U+6570>年で見違えるようにいい感じなったのと、昭和の日本の名<U+6B8B>なのか、何となく恥ずかしいところが<U+6B8B>っている印象が<U+629C>けきれません。まあ、そういうところを<U+697D>しむために旅したい場所であらりますから、決してそれがどうこうではありません。釜山ステ<U+30FC>ションは、思っていた以上におおきくて新しかったが、<U+99C5>前<U+5E83>場は大工事中で全容つかめませんでした。2018年9月と2019年4月に行きました。いずれも工事中でした。工事がいつ完了するかはわかりませんでしたが、きれいに整備されると思います。工事中の今は、導線がさえぎられていて、少し遠回りを<U+5F37>いられます。きれいになったら行きたいと思います。かつてのプサン<U+99C5>前<U+5E83>場といえば、<U+5E83><U+3005>としたオ<U+30FC>プンスペ<U+30FC>スで、晴天時には休憩スポットとしても<U+6C17>持ちが良かったのですが、2019年3月に訪問してみてびっくり、何だか、立<U+4F53>駐車場みたいなのが建設中、という雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>で、<U+968F>分と<U+5909>わった印象を受けました。一等地なので仕方ないと思いますが、少し<U+6B8B>念なスポットになってしまった、というのが正直な感想です。最近は、釜山<U+99C5>の周<U+8FBA>にホテルをとる事が多く、釜山<U+99C5>の周<U+8FBA>はなにかと便利で、オススメです。スタ<U+30FC>バックス、マクドナルド、ロッテリアなど、ファストフ<U+30FC>ド店も多いです。チャイナタウンで<U+4E21>替もできて、レ<U+30FC>トも良いです。人の通りも多いですが、工事がなかなか終わりません。昨年の12月に訪問した時は、工事中で<U+5E83>場が工事で覆われていましたので、<U+5E83>場らしい<U+5E83>場はありませんでした。

Name: 부산역 관광안내센터
Review:
釜山<U+99C5>から甘川文化村までの最寄<U+99C5>土城<U+99C5>までの行き方を<U+6559>えてもらいました。地下<U+9244>の入り口が分からないとか釜山<U+99C5>自<U+4F53>もイマイ...더 보기釜山<U+99C5>の２階にあるインフォメ<U+30FC>ションです。
以前に大邱に行った際にも利用しましたが、日本語の話せるスタッフが良く居るので...더 보기<U+6570>年ぶりにやってきました。以前<U+6765>た時はまだあちこち工事中でしたが、すっかり整備されてオシャレでキレイな<U+99C5>になりましたね。...더 보기2018年9月に行きました。
釜山<U+99C5>はタ<U+30FC>ミナル<U+99C5>だけあって<U+5E83>い<U+99C5>です。案<U+5185>所も何か所かあって、この案<U+5185>所は2階の中央に...더 보기<U+89B3>光案<U+5185>所を探していました。中華街の案<U+5185>所が開いていなかったため、この釜山<U+99C5>（KIX）２階で探しました。位置がはっきりし...더 보기ＫＴＸで大邱に向かう際、チケットの買い方が解らず、ココで聞いてみました。日本語が話せるスタッフがいて助かり、親切に<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>し...더 보기釜山<U+99C5>の構<U+5185>にあります。
オンラインで予約したKTXのチケットの<U+767A>券方法を聞きましたが、それは<U+767A>券エリアで行うものだと言...더 보기<U+99C5>構<U+5185>に2つある案<U+5185>所の<U+5185>、<U+5C02>用ブ<U+30FC>スの方に立ち寄ってみました。<U+5185>部には案<U+5185>カウンタ<U+30FC>があり、その他一通りのパンフレット...더 보기釜山<U+99C5>2Fの吹き<U+629C>けコンコ<U+30FC>スにあります。パンフレットや地<U+56F3>などあります。ここを使うメインはKTXで到着する人でしょうか...더 보기切符<U+58F2>場近くに長い時間開いているカウンタ<U+30FC>があり、こちらは事<U+5B9F>上、<U+9244>道案<U+5185>が主要業務となっているようでした。<U+5B9F>は、ホ<U+30FC>ム...더 보기

Name: 금강 공원
Review:
The cable cars take you up to a picnic area and a bunch of hiking trails.The cars doesnt go at set times either and if you are unlucky you may find yourself waiting for a long time before the cars move.I had to wait 30 minutes before a couple of locals appeared and made the staff start the car. If they hadn't told the staff off we would've still be sitting in that car. The only people we encountered at the top were hikers. going to the south gate is basically going through small forest trails and is not suitable if you are wearing clothing for urban walking. I had sneakers, jeans and a t.shirt and regretted that walk. The south gate is not even close to the cable cars and its basically just a gate. so unless you want to go on a longer hike and wear clothing sutied for hiking then do not go here.Take the cable car from Geumgang Park for some breath taking views on Busan and its surroundings. The ride in itself is unforgettable, but when you reach the top it's only a short walk to the Geumjeongsanseong fortifications. The walk is nice and quite easy. Lovely!The ride offers spectacular views of Busan. Once at the top it's hiking time. You can go to Seokbulsa (unfortunately it was late and the air was bad) or to the mountain fortress, which is not very demanding. It closes at 6 so don't go too late in the afternoon. Park entrance is 10 min walk from Oncheonjang stationThe cable car ride offers a fantastic view of Busan and how the city is laid out.Signages at the top are not sufficient and can be confusing for an English speaker.The South Gate is nothing monumental but okay for a little stroll.Go for the view but definitely purchase round trip tickets for the cable car.On saying that I have come across many Korean hikers along the way so this might be good for those who are into trekking.Convenient to the Myeongyun metro station. Catch the cable car up to the top, then you have a variety of choices for beautiful walks including to the Seokbul-sa monastery with its beautiful cliff rock carvings. Park provides free insect repellent spray but we weren't bothered by any insects at all.Even though you are told otherwise the cable car is only accessible via two flights of stairs and a really steep hill from the car park

Do not attempt unless you can walkWe got promised amazing views but there weren't any! The so called "observatory" is a nice picknick area with tables etc. but it is within a clearing. So you haven't any views over Busan at all - just trees around you. If you love hiking this park is perfect for it but do not expect great views over the city - or only when using the cable car!Appears to be some great hikes around here. . but if you're a tourist and you go up a cable car you sort of expect great views back down . . not really the case here apart from of tiny bit of the city from the cable car. . . once you get up there its woods, muddy walks and the occasional brick gate . . also some screeching karaok-ing Koreans half way up which was beyond odd. . . . its a long way out of town for it to be a 'must do' for a weekend tourist.....This is a lovely park both winter and summer. If you are a hiker it's a good hike up to the fortress with walking trail around the fortress wall. Or you can take the cable car to the top and walk as far as you want. The cable car is 8,000kw return and provides a great view, on a clear day, of Gwangan Bridge. To get there take Metro Line 1 to Oncheonjang station. Take exit 1, turn left and then right at the next main intersection. Follow the brown signs to the park. You can see the cable car from the metro exit. Well worth a visit.Came here not for the park but to take the cable car to the top of Geumjeong Mountain where there's the "much-talked-about" Seokbulsa Temple with giant rock carvings of Buddha; as it turned out though, I actually came here for the great views of the pretty tall 20-to-40-storied buildings of the city which are "spread out all over the city" (not just concentrated in one area of the city as is the case in some big cities), and yes the big mountains beyond the city provide an excellent "nature backdrop" to make these aerial scenes from the cable car "absolutely memorable"! Being said that though, despite those great views from the cable car (as mentioned above), there's "nothing much" on top of the mountain itself, and I wasn't able to find the temple I came for; I'm sure I got "pretty close" to it (maybe just like 5 minutes from the temple) following the signs & asking people on the trails, going past the popular South Gate (about a 20-minute walk from the cable car station on the top) where I made like a U-turn and walked another 10 minutes to Nammun Village but gave up after another 5 minutes or so when getting to like two "pretty steep steps" leading downward since I wasn't sure I would be able to come back up those steps; also, I was "pressed for time" with the last cable car to go down the mountain leaving at 6 30 pm and it takes like 45 minutes to get back to the cable car station from that temple (Seokbulsa) with the rock carvings (yes "the 6 30 pm for the last cable car going down" is everyone coming up the mountain should keep in mind, whether you're going to Seokbulsa or not, since I'm sure it would take much much longer to go back down on foot compared to only like a little over 5 minutes with the cable car either uphill or downhill).If coming from Busan Station (after arriving by train), it's quite convenient to get here by taking the subway Line 1 from Busan Metro Station (right beside the train station) to Oncheonjang Station from which it's about a 20-minute walk: a left turn after getting out of the station from its front side & going on the overpass, then a right turn about 5 minutes later followed by a pretty much straight way (which becomes slightly uphill) for about 10 to 15 minutes, then a right turn again and you'll see the park on your left shortly after. About the park itself though, there's really nothing much to say except there are some nice flower beds right outside the entrance, and there's a playground or a mini-theme park with some rides (probably just for kids) inside not far from the cable car station.

Name: 타워갤러리
Review:
I really enjoyed this, very cheap to do, amazing gardens below. Hop in one of the two lifts and enjoy the lovely 360 degree view from the top. In the tower there is two levels, I suggest head to the lower level where the exit elevator is and there is usually no one there, and the windows are on a better angle for a better view. Really enjoyed this place and I rate it 5/5The tower is distinct in it's height and very visible. It offers a great view of the city and I recommend visiting it.Yongdusun Park is just within walking distance from Nampodong area. The name literally translate to Dragon Head's mountain. Since I'm a dragon, I guess this is my mountain. Yongdusun is also the home of the Busan Tower. It's closed the day I visited but visiting its base near sunset did offer some pretty amazing views. I could only imagine the amazing view that would have rewarded me from the top of the tower. But the view from the bottom isn't any less interesting. People are interesting. Makes them interesting to watch. Statue of General Yi Sun, a great naval commander during the 16the century. So they build a large statue of him to show how important he is. Apart from tower that dominates the park, there's also plenty of pavilion and smaller towers to act as great backdrops for instagram selfies. Make sure you budget ample time here to account for that.I took my family here way back many, many years ago. It was a great ride up. It was like going up more than 30 feet in a split of a second. The next thing we were on top. Great view from up there indeed.The tower affords panoramic views of the whole city area. At the bottom of the tower there are souvenir shops.  It would have been good for photographs to go there at night.Busan tower is position in Yongdusan Park. You can't miss it as it towers over the city.For a small entrance fee you can enter and go up to the viewing area of the tower gallery.From here you can see a 360 degree view all over the city. When we were there the view was very clear. You can see for miles. You can quite easily spend a good hour there. I guess the views at night would be spectacular and the sunsets really good.At the bottom of the tower you can place a lock of love on the railings. These are sold in the souvenir shop. I really wished I had bought several as I can't find these any where else in the world. Would I recommend visiting the tower - yes I would.This 118-metre-high tower is situated at Yongdusan Park, on top of Yongdusan Mountain (“Dragon’s Head” mountain). We followed the road sign (on top of the manhole covers) and climbed up the nice shaded steps to the Tower. I don’t remember how much we paid to go up observation deck, but the panoramic view of the city and harbour was worth the money. The base of the tower has a gallery and souvenir shops. We went in to take a look, I even bought 2 packs of magnets there.Happy Travelling!I'm a big fan of towers. I love seeing the entire city from above. Busan Tower did not disappoint. If you can, time it for evening as the lights are coming and the city seems to be coming alive. No matter the time of day you go, the views are well worth it!From the top of the Busan Tower you can enjoy the unique 360 degrees view of Busan town and also capture breathtaking pictures.

Enjoy your coffee at the Cafe located one floor behind the top one. Also there is a gallery with very nice exhibits.We did not find the escalator in the beginning and went up by walking uphill from other side where we found some arts shop. The scenery looked great. We also found love locks at the garden near the base of the tower. When going up (fee required), don't forget to take video on the display on top of your elevator. Spectacular views will be seen on a sunny day with 360 degree at the city. You can also find the distances n direction display towards your homeland. Souvenir can be bought in the small shop. A place worth to visit.

Name: 서면 먹자 골목
Review: 現地に住む友人に、こちらのデジクッパ通りに連れて行ってもらいました！ロ<U+30FC>カルな感じのストリ<U+30FC>トにデジクッパ<U+5C02>門店が立ち<U+4E26>んでいます。有名なデジクッパのお店に行きました。とても美味しかったです。ソミョン<U+99C5>から<U+6B69>いて<U+6570>分のところにありました。2018年9月に行きました。西面<U+99C5>を出ると<U+98F2>食店が建ち<U+4E26>ぶデジクッパブ(うまいもの)通りがあります。細い通りにデジクッパブ屋さんを中心にたくさんのお店があります。その中でも有名なソンジョンサムデクッパブ(松亭３代クッパ)に行きました。日本人もたくさん<U+6765>ていました。釜山最後の夜、ガイドが「ヤタイ行きましょう、イクラありますか」「5.6万ウォンくらいだよ」「カ<U+30FC>ドもつかえますよ」というので、ロッテの南側、一番西側の屋台へ、行きつけの屋台らしい、カップル1組、男同士が1組、意味ありげな女一人、その間に座る、ラ<U+30FC>メン以外では屋台はないなぁ、これも<U+7D4C><U+9A13>の1つか、と思いながら<U+98F2>む、サムギョッサル、うなぎというよりドジョウのような煮物、マッコリ1本と缶ウ<U+30FC>ロン2つ、チヂミも<U+983C>むが食べきれないので持ち<U+5E30>ることに、さて<U+4F1A>計...えぇ～～　10万ウォン　???　間違ってないか　?　「高くないョ、これふつうだョ」　高級レストランでもあるまいに、抗議するも、他の客もいることだし、みっともないこともできない、そういえばさっき、いもと<U+5185><U+7DD2>話をしていたのはこのことだな、ぐるで騙されてしまった、日韓政治<U+60AA>化もあるけど、民間ではボッタクリの被害のほうが<U+6C17>がかり、もっとも本人は正<U+5F53>な要求だと思ってるので始末に<U+60AA>い、<U+5E30>りホテルの前でガイドに言いました、"You are Fired !!"トランジットで時間があったので！屋台グルメ！チジミ、トッポッキ！立ちながら美味しくいただいた！出汁くれたロッテホテルの近くの通りです。カジノをプレイしていて、<U+6C17>ばなしに食事に行きました。カジノ<U+5185>でも食事ができますが、もちろん負けていたので、<U+6C17>分<U+8EE2>換に外に出ました。<U+98F2>食店がズラリと<U+4E26>び、ガイドブックにも紹介されているエリアですね。韓<U+56FD>には、良く<U+6765>ますが、いつもビビンバは頂きます。飯系なので、日本食にも近く胃に負<U+62C5>がかかりませんので好きです。ファストフ<U+30FC>ド、カフェも多く、若者が多いエリアですね。日本人も良く見かけます。西面<U+99C5>周<U+8FBA>は、大きな通りで交通量が多いところです。が、一<U+6B69>中に入ると、路地裏通りのように、小さめな店や屋台の店が<U+4E26>んでいます。ここは、ロッテホテルや百貨店の浦にある<U+6A2A>丁です。同じようなものが<U+58F2>られていて、違いはないように見えます。おでんやチヂミなど、韓<U+56FD>特有の味で仕上げられています。１本１本好みのものを選んで食べてみると、甘いようでも時間差でグッとくるものが多くあります。お<U+663C>でもお店はありますが、屋台街で夕方からがおすすめです。トッポギ、デジクッパ、サムギョプサル、キムパプ（海苔<U+5DFB>き）、韓<U+56FD>風おでんなど、お値段も明朗<U+4F1A>計でリ<U+30FC>ズナブルなので、屋台のはしごをしながら、いろいろなものを購入しましたが、どれもおいしかったです。おでんは、とてもあっさりしています。おでんのそばに、小さな紙コップが置いてあり、おでんの具が浸されているお汁を、そのコップに入れて無料でふるまわれていましたが、そのお出汁がとてもあっさりしていて、日本人の口にも合います。また、箸休めで　ホットックもいただきましたが、ソウルと違って、釜山のホットックは、ア<U+30FC>モンドやカボチャの種をまぶしたほんのりシナモンの香りのする絶品デザ<U+30FC>トです。安いので、お店を見つけるたびに買ってしまいます。おすすめです。21:30～いきました。行った場所が<U+60AA>かった？のか同じものばかりでした。トッポギのは、辛くないよ<U+30FC>。と言われましたが口に入れたときは甘いですが後から辛さがきます。餃子は中身は肉ではなく春雨チヂミはやっぱり美味しかったです。ブラブラしてると首だけ跳ねたフライドチキンが<U+58F2>られてました。ロッテホテル、デパ<U+30FC>トの東側と南側に屋台がずらりとあります。東側は夜と比べ5割程度のお店がお<U+663C>も<U+55B6>業していましたが夜の方が雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>あります。南側は海鮮の屋台が多かったように感じました。東側はおでんやチヂミやキンパなどのお店が多い<U+6C17>がします。おでんは一本70円ほどでした

Name: 부전시장
Review: まだ日も出ていない早朝。<U+5E30><U+56FD>日に散策。お目<U+5F53>てはウナキンパッ。<U+9EC4>色い看板の店　<U+65E2>におばちゃんが店頭にいました。種類はこの時は少なく、たくわんの細<U+5DFB>き4本1000ウォン　野菜の太<U+5DFB>きは1本1500ウォンのみ。あと通りすがりのパン商店で、大きなチョコマフィン2個入&コグマ(さつまいも)パイ2個入を購入。計2500ウォン思い付くままの散策は<U+697D>しいですが、くれぐれも迷わないようご注意を。大昔、多分、この市場は<U+6765>ていると思うが，魚類などは新鮮ですが、生では買えないので、酒のツマミと、<U+96D1>貨品を少し買いました。コンビニなどのツマミは、多分日本と<U+5909>わらぬ<U+4FA1>格ですが、ハングル文字で書かれた、つまみ、<U+96D1>貨品を土産に購入す。魚など生鮮が多かったので<U+89B3>光客的には買えるものはなかなかありません。ただこんなに<U+58F2>れるのかと思うほどに巨大な市場なので見て面白いと感じました。ミドリガメや蛙も多く<U+58F2>っていたのですが、あれも食用なのか謎です。庶民の市場という感じでチャガルチなどより<U+89B3>光客もいなくて地元の感じがわかります。魚や野菜、<U+96D1>貨などもあり垢擦りのグッズをたくさん買いました。入り口と出口がわからなくなるほどの<U+5E83>さですのでしっかり<U+6765>た道を<U+899A>えておく必要があります。釜田で初めてコムジャンオを食べました。ウナギとイカのような食感と聞いていたのですがまさにその通り！初<U+4F53><U+9A13>の食感でした！ビ<U+30FC>ルも合うし 締めの<U+713C>き飯も完璧！お店のおばちゃんも優しく 絶<U+5BFE>次も行きたいスポットです！肉や魚を中心にキムチも野菜も香辛料も電化製品も食器も<U+58F2>っていました。全部ア<U+30FC>ケ<U+30FC>ドがついているので雨の日でも見<U+5B66>は<U+697D>しめそうです。地下<U+9244>の釜田で降りると地上にあがって路を渡った所にあります。今回は西面から<U+6B69>きましたが、５分もかかりませんでした。ありとあらゆる地元の食品や食材が<U+63C3>います。韓<U+56FD>産の胡麻油を買う目的で行きました。韓<U+56FD>で<U+58F2>られている胡麻油は、日本で造られたものが多く、また多くが中<U+56FD>産の胡麻で造られています。韓<U+56FD>産の胡麻油を手に入れようとすると、高級食材を扱っているデパ<U+30FC>トか、このような市場になります。釜田市場には、胡麻を搾って油を<U+74F6>に入れて<U+58F2>っているお店が<U+6570>軒あります。搾りたての胡麻油もほとんどが中<U+56FD>産の胡麻で、韓<U+56FD>産の胡麻油をおいていない店もありましたので注意が必要です。ラベル（ハングル）を確認するかお店の人に聞いて購入してください。キムチは美味しいものが<U+6CA2>山ありますが、持ち<U+5E30>る時にはかなり<U+5302>いが漏れますので<U+899A>悟が必要です。2018年9月に行きました。釜山にはたくさんの市場がありますが、この市場が一番大きいです。おそらく1,000を超える個人商店がびっしりと<U+4E26>んでいて、どこを<U+6B69>いているかわからなくなります。買い物が好きな人や市場をのぞくのが好きな人にはたまらない場所だと思います。すごく<U+5E83>くて迷子になりそうでした。ほんとに何でも<U+58F2>っていました。今回は朝ごはんとキムチを買うのに行きました。お粥、キンパ、カルグクスどれも安くてすごく美味しいかったです。キムチはス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>の半額くらいでどのキムチも買えます。味見して、<U+6C17>に入った店で買えるのでいいです。釜田市場の階段を下ると、地下街(モ<U+30FC>ル)があります。衣料品、日用品の<U+5C02>門店が<U+4E26>んでいますが、とにかく長い長い。途中には噴水っぽいところもあり、そこにはご高<U+9F62>の地元の人たちが談笑されていました。何でもあるように思える<U+697D>しさがあります。

Name: 메가박스 서면
Rank: 28위(81곳의 부산 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)

Name: 서면 지하도상가
Review:
西面<U+99C5>近くの宿から繁華街に行く<U+70BA>に地下街を利用ズラ<U+30FC>っと左右にお店が<U+4E26>んでいます一店<U+8217>ずつの<U+5E83>さは大きくありませんが、<U+6CA2>山のお店がある<U+70BA>、１つづつ見ていると時間が足りません服と靴のお店が多いように感じました金額も安く、到着した日にこの地下街で買い物を<U+6E08>ませてしまいましたソミョン<U+99C5>の地下街です。食事に行く前にちら見しただけですが、安くて<U+697D>しそうなものが<U+58F2>っていました！！ショッピングエリアとして有名だそうです。
ご飯を食べに行く前に通りました。
安い服が多かったので次回ゆっくり見たいです。地下<U+9244>（メトロ）1<U+53F7>線と2<U+53F7>線の<U+4E57>換<U+99C5>で、プサン<U+99C5>からは1<U+53F7>線で約10分、プサン空港からのモノレ<U+30FC>ル終点である沙上（ササン）<U+99C5>からは2<U+53F7>線で約15分である。<U+99C5>周<U+8FBA>にはロッテデパ<U+30FC>ト<U+30FB>免<U+7A0E>店、ロッテホテルがあり、地上へ上がると市場と屋台があるが、地下<U+9244>の改札口に直結している地下街がとても<U+5E83>い。地下街の15番出口近くにKFC（ケンタッキ<U+30FC>フライドチキン）があり、英語<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>したタッチパネルで注文できクレジットカ<U+30FC>ド決<U+6E08>もできる（4ピ<U+30FC>ス10,000W＝約1,000円なので日本より少し安い）。南浦洞（ナンポドン）に比べておしゃれな店が多く若者向き、規模は大きくないがソウルの繁華街に雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が似ている。西面<U+99C5>の改札出口からそのまま地下街に。<U+771F>夏の暑い日、外を<U+6B69>くより良い。出口もたくさんあります。コスメやバック、靴など掘り出し物が色<U+3005>。大通りを<U+6A2A><U+65AD>するより、地下に<U+6F5C>って渡るほうが安全で確<U+5B9F>。お店もたくさんあるので、いろいろ眺めて<U+697D>しめる。衣類やアクセサリ<U+30FC>、化粧品、<U+8EFD>食などいろいろなお店が<U+4E26>んでいました。そして人が多かったです。地上は道路を<U+6A2A>切る<U+6A2A><U+65AD><U+6B69>道がほぼないので、自然と地下を利用することになりました。夏の暑さや陽射しをさけるのに地下<U+9244>と地下街を活用しました。地下街はたくさくの化粧品店や服などが<U+58F2>られています。以前より人が減っていた印象です。まるで、福岡天神地下街のように長く伸びています。ひょっとして店の<U+6570>は西面のほうが多いかもしれません。7月にシゴルパッサンに行くためだけに釜山から地下<U+9244>に<U+4E57>り役10分かけて到着。たぶん冬の寒い日にも地下街が稼<U+50CD>している<U+69D8>子がうかがえます。2018年9月に行きました。西面の東<U+6A2A>インに宿泊したので、<U+6EDE>在中<U+6BCE>日通りました。こちらの地下街は若者向けのお店が多く、<U+663C>も夜もたくさんの人で賑わっています。西面一<U+5E2F>が買い物や食事をするのに便利な場所で夜<U+9045>くまで<U+697D>しめます。

Name: 게임오브마인드 서면점
Rank: 6위(81곳의 부산 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: A place worth spending time with friends. The rooms are well planned and the staff were helpful. We had so much fun and would definitely visit again.Our group are a well travelled team of escape artists and we very fond of the Dark Magic room. Our escape experience was actually supposedto take place at a different escape company, however due to taxi difficulties we arrived late and they no longer held our reservation. We found that there are numerous other escape rooms within a 5-minute walk of their location. We were informed that Game of Minds had rooms in English so headed on over. The staff were friendly and helpful and luckily had a couple of rooms available for us to try.The Dark Magic room is of medium difficulty, but very well constructed with a lot of effort placed into making it seem like you are in Harry Potter's world. We were out in 30.03 (the fastest time of the month), and enjoyed the experience. Things inside the room were well translated into English.Would definately visit here again!My coworkers and I were looking or something fun to do and decided to do an escape room. We used their website to make a reservation and showed up a little before our session. The staff was friendly and the directions were in English, so with somebody help from the staff (CCTV cameras and English audio hints) we were able to complete the escape room.We had a really fun time here, we played the "Dark Magic" game, and we enjoyed it very much, there were some "elements" that made the experience even better. And after we finished they took a photo of us in some theme related costumes with our finish time and printed it without any extra charge.We are a couple of escape room enthusiasts who have done 40+ rooms in several countries. We did the Harry Potter themed room (four stars), the Davinci room (four stars), and the VR room (two stars). The VR was an interesting novelty, but we didn't especially enjoy it. Of the other two I think we liked Davinci more, though the Harry Potter one was fun as we are fans.

Name: 삼광사
Review: I didn't expect it to be so huge. Very well maintained, and very active, they had ceremonies in several halls at the same time. Great spot to do some hiking on the trails behind it. All in all, a very serene and beautiful place. Easy access too, bus 15 took us from Somyeon directly there.This temple complex is very large and during the week or 2 before Buddha's Birthday extensive lanterns are hung and placed and it is jaw dropping amazing to see. Photos can hardly do it justice, but you will have wonderful photos to share. Do not wait until the actual day of Buddha's birth because the crowds are also gigantic. Come before sunset and watch as the lanterns are lit.Wasn’t expecting much when we reached destination but was wowed by the spectacular scenery. Weather was cool, view awesome, best of all free. Took lots of pretty photos but unable to post due is size of photosI came by at night time and was surprised to find meditation taking placemany people were there singing and praying and it made me want to joinso I did, and they even have a spot for ppl who ant to lie down for a little sleep timethe temple is big and inviting, I had a very spiritual experience and I'm happy and lucky to have come there :]Incidentally ran into this place...not a regret to have some nice shots..close proximity to city...relaxingattended Lantern festival (29 Apr-22 May) in evening. I followed directions on the Visit Korea website, took Seomyeon Station then waited for bus 15 for 30 mins. tired of waiting, so left on an alternate bus and ended up walking for 30 mins. it was crowded but worth the visit. huge temple and park i believe (didnt explore far from temple since it was dark) beautiful lanterns overhead on stairs to the temple. also had lantern sculptures.I am not sure why this temple seems to be so underrated. It is much bigger and more elaborate than many of the other, more well know temples in the area. I love it here, one of my favourite spots in the city. The statues and carvings are amazing and there are some nice view both of the temple itself and looking back at the city. It is especially beautiful right now as it is coming up to the lantern festival and the entire temple complex is covered in lanterns. Absolutely stunning site to see. You can also hike maybe 30 mins to a smaller and more quaint temple- Seonamsa, from here. Also a nice place to visit, more relaxing and tranquil.We went there a week before Buddha's birthday so the area is well decorated and picture perfect. The area also has proper signages for the tourists.One of the best temples we have visited so far. We visited in the early morning and liked the serene atmosphere to offer our prayer. Located at the base of a small hill, it is not far from Busan City Center. The view of the city from the Temple is fantastic on a clear day. The landscape and flowers are heart catching. It is open 24 hours. There is a latern festival every year during the month of April which lasts for a month; it is the best time to visit. From Seomyeon Metro Station exit 13 and take Mini Bus 81 or 133 which drops you at the temple.. The bus stop is in front of Holly's Coffee. Recommended while in Busan.temple, busan, KoreaAfter trekking up the hill towards the start of the mountain and dark clouds over my head I headed straight up to the slope of a minders road to hill horizon. On that hill I found a monastery and heard on approach the chanting of a lone monk and the drum, banging at moments to awaken feelings of people inside, or that was the case. A beautiful collection of buildings matched in the colours of heavenly greens blues and the orcha colours of the earthy worlds governed by the laws of nature and time. In the distance and closer as I paced a pagoda with golden bells sounded off in the wind passing the sprit world and surrounded by folk figures I have only been able to view once I entered this land. On the wall had many reliefs of the gods and stories told by the faith of Buddhism and many more realistic impressions of flowers this land had come to known. The sun came out to greet me once I reached he main temple and as I went inside I saw people bowing their heads to the hard wooden floor, it thundered as movement went across it. Indeed it echoed in my mind and standing outside staring off the mountain into busan I felt the calm again, like a missing old friend I finally felt it again, I understood over the last few months I had been moving to fast and rapped up in my own pace that I rarely stopped to feel it again, but here it held me and let the clouds of my mind slip away.

Name: 석불사
Review: We arrived via subway (Oncheonjang Station) and up the cable car; we followed internet directions to reach the South gate, after that we got lost.The fact that it was raining on and off and the few signs didn’t help us. After a while we went through a little village (main dish they offered was duck bulgogi) and afterwards down (bridge/little river/rocks) and up (steep part). After hiking for 5+ hours through the mountain we finally reached Seokbulsa temple and it was worth it!It started raining again; there was only a couple walking around and soon we had the place all to ourselves. We have seen several temples, but got to admit the wall carvings are truly unique. We were thankful for 2 things: the drink vending machine a little before reaching the temple and for not slipping down the rocks along the way and being hurt.Arriving through the road (not the cable car) there are taxis that can save you around three fourths of the steep ascent, but missed one going the opposite way so had to walk down and had some food mid-way at a nice looking cafe.Once we reached the bottom since we arrived from a different place and there was no subway around we asked a guy waiting for the bus and told us to cross the street and take the bus; we did and arrived at Minam subway station to change to line 4.I enjoyed the hiking, but my teenage son hated it. My body hurt the next day, but I was still smiling.We left the Busan Tower area at 7:15 am and were back by 11 am - an easy half-day activity. Not sure why everyone says it‘s so hard to get to. We took subway line 1 to Dondae, then took bus 46. Just put Seokbulsa in Kakao Map, and this is the path it shows. The bus drops you off right at the 1.5 km path through woods and onto a sort of street to the temple. It took us 30 min. from there. The last 500m were the steepest. English and Korean signs all the way up. And it seems you could drive/get a taxi up if you really needed to. There were only 2 others there when we arrived. It was so peaceful and beautiful - the rock carvings, the views... a true highlight on our Busan trip. We were too early for the cable car on the way out. Thought we could take the cable car down, but the signage to find that path from the temple was questionable, so just took the same path back down. Would suggest going up with the cable car and back down toward Mandeok to the 46 bus. There are plenty of signs down.This temple was the highlight of our Busan visit. You can reach after taking the Geumgang Cable Car, but there is also a bus stop not to far away from the temple. We took the cable car and had a hard time finding the temple. We had to ask for directions, but luckily found a very friendly Korean gentleman who showed us the way. The walk to the temple was not easy, so you'll need to be in shape.But when you reach this temple everything is forgotten. The view on Busan is breath taking, but what makes this temple truly unforgettable are the magnificent rock carvings. What a tremendous feat!This temple is very hard to get to. We took the metro and then we hiked for a good 1h before we got there and the path is not an easy one. Since the temple is on top of a mountain, the hike is straight up. But honestly, once you get there, it is SOOOOOOO worth it. The views are breathtaking and the carvings on the stones are so beautiful. Once you get there, there is such a big sense of piece. I would really recommend it.Firstly, we came here by car and the journey up was quite something. Basically just keep going until you can’t go no further! It will mean going up some rather steep roads but there is a small car park at the top (just a level down from the actual temple - much better than parking early and climbing the steep slopes up). The stone carvings are like nothing I’ve ever seen. Really interesting and impressive. I also tried to find the room with loads of buddhas but was unable to? The air up there is very clean and fresh. Good views in places.Nice relaxing place for worship and scenery in Busan, Korea. Public bus transport at Won12,000 from outside Haeundae station to bus stop along main road from temple. Then a nice stroll to temple ground. Temple have simple route to main hall complex. Entrance is free and relaxing place to pray too. A spring head provides cool refreshing water to drink too. Avoid morning tourist timing and the crowd is manageable. Stroll around the temple complex and toss a coin from small bridge, visit the temple prayer hall and then walk to seaside area. Under ground room is cool and half a day is sufficient.My husband and I spent 6 long months working in South Korea. During our time off we often visit temples and this by far our favorite. It is a little difficult to locate, but not too bad considering we didn't know the language and were still able to find it. We drove most of the way up to it and parked along the road. We were not sure what the road would be like further up and had a large vehicle, so pulled over and parked where we could. This place is AMAZING. Large carvings in the cliff. A room with thousands of buddhas. Very, very quiet and peaceful. Not a lot of people. It felt like a real sanctuary on top of a busy city. Definitely recommend!Seokbulsa is small but different than other temples in Busan due to the huge stone carvings behind the temple. Certainly worth checking out. You can come most of the way by vehicle or you can hike from the Fortress if you want to combine the sites and get a little exercise.The most beautiful temple I've seen in Korea! Most authentic and impressive compared to all those "mambo jambo" touristic temples. Worth the visit in Busan!This place is seldom be mentioned in any guidebook in Asia. I just found this place accidentally through a news website. Before visiting this place, my husband n I found there r lots of routs to go to the temple on the internet. So we choose to take the subway to Mandeok Station( exit 2) first as our plan. Once u got out of the station, u'll see signs in English all the way which indicate the direction to Seokbulsa. So u don't have to worry about getting lost in the mountains. But I still recommend people who wanna go to Seokbulsa better learn how to read Seokbulsa in Korean. Cause there r signs indicate shortcuts in Korean on the way. Actually we should walk for at least 1.5 hr to get there, but we took the shortcuts n got there less than an hr. I don't know how to type "Seokbulsa" in Korean, but it's at the right n top of the 1st pic.The path is kind of hard for climbers especially the last 600 meters to the destination. U'd better not to take any little kids with you. The path is kind rough even for an adult.  The views on the way r really great. Once u got to the temple, u will feel it really worth it.

Name: 감천문화마을 하늘마루 전망대
Review: Toppunt van bezoek in Busan is deze dorp gelegen op de bergtop. Nostalgische huisjes en wandelen is hier zeer de moeite waard.

Name: 감천문화마을
Review: <U+05D8><U+05D5><U+05D1> <U+05D4><U+05E2><U+05DC><U+05D9><U+05D9><U+05D4> <U+05DC><U+05DB><U+05E4><U+05E8> <U+05E2><U+05E6><U+05DE><U+05D5> <U+05E7><U+05E9><U+05D4> <U+05DE><U+05D0><U+05D5><U+05D3> <U+05D0><U+05D1><U+05DC> <U+05DE><U+05E1><U+05EA><U+05D1><U+05E8> <U+05E9><U+05D9><U+05E9> <U+05D0><U+05D5><U+05D8><U+05D5><U+05D1><U+05D5><U+05E1> <U+05E9><U+05DC><U+05D5><U+05E7><U+05D7> <U+05DC><U+05DB><U+05E0><U+05D9><U+05E1><U+05D4> <U+05DC><U+05DB><U+05E4><U+05E8> <U+05D0><U+05D6> <U+05D0><U+05DD> <U+05DC><U+05D0> <U+05D1><U+05D0><U+05DC><U+05DB><U+05DD> <U+05DC><U+05D4><U+05EA><U+05D0><U+05DE><U+05E5> <U+05DE><U+05DE><U+05DC><U+05D9><U+05E6><U+05D4> , <U+05D4><U+05DB><U+05E4><U+05E8> <U+05E2><U+05E6><U+05DE><U+05D5> <U+05E7><U+05D8><U+05DF> <U+05D5><U+05D7><U+05DE><U+05D5><U+05D3> <U+05DE><U+05D5><U+05DE><U+05DC><U+05E5> <U+05DC><U+05D4><U+05D2><U+05D9><U+05E2> <U+05D1><U+05D9><U+05D5><U+05DD> <U+05E9><U+05D9><U+05DE><U+05E9><U+05D9> <U+05D1><U+05E9><U+05D1><U+05D9><U+05DC> <U+05DC><U+05E7><U+05D1><U+05DC> <U+05EA><U+05DE><U+05D5><U+05E0><U+05D5><U+05EA> <U+05D9><U+05E4><U+05D5><U+05EA> , <U+05D9><U+05E9> <U+05D4><U+05DE><U+05D5><U+05DF> <U+05D7><U+05E0><U+05D5><U+05D9><U+05D5><U+05EA> <U+05DE><U+05D6><U+05DB><U+05E8><U+05D5><U+05EA> <U+05D5><U+05D0><U+05D5><U+05DB><U+05DC> <U+05D0><U+05E0><U+05D7><U+05E0><U+05D5> <U+05D9><U+05E9><U+05D1><U+05E0><U+05D5> <U+05D1><U+05D2><U+05D2> <U+05E9><U+05DC> <U+05D0><U+05D9><U+05D6> <U+05DE><U+05E1><U+05E2><U+05D3><U+05D4> <U+05D5><U+05E0><U+05D4><U+05E0><U+05D5> <U+05DE><U+05D4><U+05E0><U+05D5><U+05E3> .<U+05E9><U+05D5><U+05D5><U+05D4> <U+05D0><U+05EA> <U+05D4><U+05D4><U+05D2><U+05E2><U+05D4> <U+05DC><U+05D8><U+05E2><U+05DE><U+05D9>도시의 미각이 살아있는 곳... 역시나 좋은 곳입니다. 달동네를 이렇게 예쁘게나 꾸며 놓다니... 사람 사는 정이 드는 곳이네요. 사는 분들은 힘들겠지만 구경하는 사람들은 좋습니다The village is amazing and you can take really great photos here. It's a must see if you're in Busan!Lots of colorful houses near the water provide the setting for a sweet vacation spot. Bring good shoes, as it is quite hilly here. Good place to find souvenirs. Most enjoyable walking around and finding the unexpected treasures.계단식으로 배열된 작은 주택들이 밀집되어 있는 곳. 주택 벽에는 파스텔 빛 페인트가 칠해져 있어 멀리서 보면 알록달록 이색적인 풍경을 볼 수 있다. 실제로 사람들이 거주하고 있는 공간이기 때문에 관광할 때는 관광질서를 지켜야 한다.A great place to wander round and see the old style houses and the little museums and when you need a coffee break you can find a place that looks out over the rest of the colourfully painted suburbInteresting place to go on your own by taxi. With 2 GFs, we had a good time with lots of pictures taken with the painted mural walls, a village of colorful houses. The main attraction was finding the statue of Little Prince perching on a platform, overlooking the colorful village of houses. Long queue to take photo with Little Prince. Lots of local souvenirs to hunt for.. we bought pretty hats to coordinate in our photo taking.Overall worthwhile to roam around with my 2 GFs.Thoroughly enjoyed walking through this historical area (for refugees of Korean War). Today, it offers fun photo opportunities, snacks and crafts.The best thing to do here is to get lost! We got our bearings over coffee in the Avant Garde Cafe at the top of the hill where the taxi rank and buses are, then set off. We managed to discover a temple, the House of Peace and the Steps to the Stars (luckily on the way down!) and several interesting murals and colourful statues of people and animals. There was a massive queue by the Little Prince and his fox so we didn’t hang around for a photo.Of all the places we visited in Seoul and Busan, htis cultural village tops our list!! It reminds me of the Rocinha favela that we visited in Rio de Janeiro many years ago. This village is so unique and full of character. Despite the narrow lanes that snake through the residents' houses, I don't feel claustrophobic or cramped like I did when I visited the Hanok Village in Seoul. There are also many quaint shops and tea houses here. Overall, it is a very classy place, and not too touristic or tacky. I love ths place! Highly recommended!!!

Name: 송도 스카이워크
Review: come here after visiting Gamcheon Village- take Bus 96 from near Jagalchi station. it was cloudy. its good for me the skywalk not too high. its not scarier like in Oryukdo which higher and windy.Came here after visiting Gamcheon village - Take Bus 7, 9, 26, 30, 71 or 96 from Chungmudong Gyocharo Board and get off at Songdo Beach Stop. Lovely walk along the bridge.It was good at cable car to see the view but not worth to go because far from other place. Not much interesting thing to see.We read 'SkyWalk' so we were expecting something a little higher! It is a walkway over the sea just a few metres above the the sea level. There is, in parts, the opportunity to look down through very scratched plexi glass to the sea below, which is also somewhat dark. Don't expect to see fish swimming around underneath the walkway, Busan is a very busy sea port and the sea reflects this. At one point you have to scramble over rocks to reach the viewing area at the end, this could be very difficult for less able folk or wheelchairs,Just like several others, Songdo skywalk is another sea view strolling location at Busan. It is near the Songdo beach. You can have a great view of the sea, shores, bridge and all around. Walking over the bridge and near the area is very comfortable. There is a cable car nearby to have a view of the whole area from top, but ground views from skywalk are just as fine as well. A good photo shoot location.This area is really pretty, especially during sunset. The skywalk takes you a little bit further out which gives you a very nice view of Songdo Beach. Just be aware of the seagulls as a lot of people are feeding them in the area.A nice little promenade out from the beach front, but really not much more than a pier! You do get a pretty good view of the big ships waiting to come in to port though. The beach itself is fairly average but it seems to be patrolled. If you’re from somewhere like Australia which has beautiful beaches, I wouldn’t go there on purpose.The sky walk and the cable car is located at the Songdo beach. It's near Gamcheon village. You can grab a taxi from the village. The skywalk is very long and cool.It’s a walkway over the water with scratched plexi glass in a few spots. The beach might be fun to hang out in fur a day, thoughThis is near Gamcheong cultural village. Good to drop by here to take some photos after visiting the village. The skywalk is not very long and you should be done with this place within 30 mins. Go this place only if it is on the way.

Name: 암남공원
Review:
松島の向かいにある公園です。松島から見る景色もいいですが、反<U+5BFE>側からだと釜山タワ<U+30FC>などが見えて綺麗です。アンナム公園で、以外と有名なのが貝<U+713C>きの屋台です。駐車場に小さな店が10件ぐらいあります。松島からロ<U+30FC>プウェイで行きますが、<U+99C5>から少し下ります。<U+5E30>りは、お店の方に<U+983C>んでタクシ<U+30FC>を呼んでもらいましょうチャガルチのホテルから南浦洞のバス停に行きそこからバスに<U+4E57>って岩南公園で下り　ケ<U+30FC>ブルカ<U+30FC>の<U+99C5>にアクセスしました。岩南公園はケ<U+30FC>ブルカ<U+30FC>に<U+4E57>り降りする人や地元の方　また釣り客がたくさんいました。噴水や運動器具　などがありました。坂が多くアップダウンあります。岩南公園駐車場のはしっこにあるテントで貝<U+713C>きを食べてきました。家族4人で６００００Wの中サイズを注文しました。ホタテ、とこぶし（アワビと言っていましたが）ム<U+30FC>ル貝（ス<U+30FC>プ）サンナクチ、チ<U+30FC>ズグラタン、最後に海鮮<U+713C>きめしをしてもらいました。結構な量なのでおなか一杯になります。タクシ<U+30FC>でチャガルチから６０００Wぐらいで行けます。タクシ<U+30FC>に<U+4E57>り、岩南公園の駐車場を言えば、連れて行ってもらえると思います。屋台が10軒ほど<U+4E26>んでいるので<U+6C17>に入られたところを選んではいるといいと思います。チャガルチのようにぼられることはないと思います。松島海水浴場を更に先に進むと、この公園に行きつきます。日本語版<U+89B3>光マップに岩南公園とあります。アンナムと<U+8AAD>むのですね。冬柏公園と同<U+69D8>に、岩場に沿って遊<U+6B69>道が設けられています。<U+4E80>島付近から遊<U+6B69>道が見れ、行ってみようかと好奇心に<U+99C6>られました。行って見てびっくり、こちらの方が際どさを感じました。途中でギブアップしました。昨年出<U+6765>たばかりです。
台北の猫空ロ<U+30FC>プウェイと同<U+69D8>なクリスタルゴンドラがありますが海上から<U+89B3>える景色は絶景！！ホテルのフロントで、新鮮なお刺身が安く食べれる場所を聞き。チャガルチ<U+30FB><U+5E83>安里<U+30FB>影島のチャガルマタンは行ったことが有るので、その他で穴場の刺身を食べれる場所を聞いたところ此方を<U+6559>えてもらい、タクシ<U+30FC>で行ってきました。松島海岸のロ<U+30FC>プウェイからの岩南公園からも行けるし、バスでも行けるみたいですが、今回は釜山での<U+6EDE>在時間が短かったのでタクシ<U+30FC>で行きました。岸壁は地元の方の釣り絶好のスポットみたいで、タクシ<U+30FC>の運<U+8EE2>手さんも釣りが好きで休みの日には<U+6765>ると言ってました。駐車場の脇には７～８件のお店があり、この時期は貝がお美味しいと<U+52E7>められ頂きました。松島海上ケ<U+30FC>ブルカ<U+30FC>に<U+4E57>って行きました。ケ<U+30FC>ブルカ<U+30FC>は日曜日だったこともあり、たくさんのお客さんが<U+4E26>んでいましたが、一つのゴンドラに8人くらい<U+4E57>れるので、サクサク列が進みました。ケ<U+30FC>ブルカ<U+30FC>が到着した公園には展望スポットや<U+58F2>店があり、訪れたお客さんは食べ物をつまみつつ記念<U+5199><U+771F>を撮っていました。韓<U+56FD>の方がほとんどでしたが、ちらほら日本からのツア<U+30FC>のお客さんもいらっしゃいました。８月２３日（水）に行きました。公園<U+5185>には<U+6B69>きやすいよう段を付けていたり、緩やかなスロ<U+30FC>プにしています。ただし南の方の岩場は、大きな岩が<U+8EE2>がっていて足もとが<U+60AA>いです。でも、岩が見事な地層をなしていて、驚きました。私は園<U+5185>を右回りに<U+6B69>いたので、前半は急な坂道、後半は緩やかな道でした。EDIYA　COFFEEから登ったところにケ<U+30FC>ブルカ<U+30FC>ができました。松島スカイウォ<U+30FC>ク周<U+8FBA>と<U+7E4B>がっています。往復と片道があるようで往復2000円くらい片道松島から海沿いに岩南公園行きの散策用の道が作られています。また、公園<U+5185>にはEDIYA　COFFEEがありなかなかオシャレです。公園自<U+4F53>は現在工事中で、これから何ができるかわかりませんが<U+697D>しみです。公園を大部分回るには3時間ほどかかるかと思います。

Name: 광안리 해수욕장
Review:
We stayed on a hotel overlooking the beach and we loved the beach itself and the whole area. Lots of restaurants and bars to choose from and a wonderful beach to stroll along- plus the convenience of the compressed air pumps to clean the sand off your shoes afterwards.We visited this beach early in October, and it was very lively and so full of lights. The view of he Diamond Bridge all lighted up was spectacular. There were also many concerts and live performances going on at the beach. We also saw fireworks - beautiful place to be at night. I doubt it will look so interesting and good during daytime. Plenty of restaurants and bars around for dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed our night visit here to the ebach. Highly recommended!!!This beach to great to come to, to stroll around and there are plently of restaurants to choose fromCame in the evening, Gwangandaegyo Bridge night view is beautiful. 

I suggest come before sunset and stay til early evening.Take Line 2 to Gwangan Station and walk from Exit 5.Turn right and walk for 5 minutes down 7 blocks to arrive at Gwangalli Beach.Perfect for a day out at the beachLovely fees and clean, nearby restaurant and coffee shop, with sea view. Would have like to spend more time hereThe sun sets perfectly well at Gwangalli Beach giving you a beautiful reason to end the day. The view from the beach is breathtaking. Too bad, South Korea seems to have a litter problem where there are literally litter at most popular tourists beaches. If not for the litter, it will be a great beach to visit.Best time to go is late afternoon/sunset and evening.There are a lot of shops, restaurants and nightclubs all around.Here you can often find shows in the street, like outdoor theater!Beautiful and young atmosphere!One of my favourite place in Busan.you can easily reach that beach by taxi. It is a free beach access with the chance to rent a sunbed and a parasole (10,000 each). Nice sandy beach and more quite that Haeundae beachIt was crazy crowded and water wasn’t clean. I didn’t get why it is one of the famous beaches. Whatever... I didn’t like swimming but there were so many sea shells. If you like collecting them, it is good place. Especially if you have children <U+200D>♀<U+FE0F> We liked being there night time. There were so many street musicians, gwangan bridge was very nice. There were so many restaurants, pubs. So you can enjoy your dinner by watching sea, bridge, people crossing by

Name: 태종대
Review: We took a bus from central Busan to the last stop at a place where we were approached by a man who asked us whether we wanted to take a boat trip around the park's coast. We agreed, and were driven to the port by a free-shuttle bus. From there, we took a boat ride around the southern tip of Busan. After the boat trip, we walked to the Park and explored it by foot and also took a train which runs around the park. Very interesting place to be, especially the views from the lighthouse.A lot of walking involved, so wear comfortable shoes!A nice park to spend a few hours in. Green forests, rocky beach, temples and monuments are only part of what this place has to offer.It was raining and the Danubi train doesn't operate even when it drizzles. Be prepared to climb 4.5km up to the top. It was an awesome slow walk up.Despite the endless steps, this place is stunningly beautiful.Great angle and position for photos. It was breathtaking. Though the time spent here was short, it was really worth it!Taking bus no 8 from Jagalchi to Taejongdae. The fare is about 1.2k. Then walking around 5 minutes to the entrance to catch a Danubi Train. (3k per ride ~ with 3 stop). The view is awesome. A lot of stairs but just chill and walk slowly so you can enjoy the view.Amazing view of the cliff, the lighthouse everything. You should come here early morning if you want to catch avoid the queue for the Danube train going up. But you can hike all the way up for around 30mins.The view is beautiful, lighthouse in the cliffside. But the you need to take stairs going down and up. A bit tiring for us, who are not so physically active.Beautifully sunny day day hot work but worth it. Lots of climbing steps to get there but all well organisedThe scenic view is stunning ! Try also the lighthouse. But you will need to be enduring, found downstairs and upstairs. Should be done during sunny days !Took a taxi from our hotel to here. Relatively easy walking in a loop which takes a couple of hours allowing for stops. Nice views; a few steps to the lighthouse. We went down to a pebble beach where the ferry trips go from and raw fish was being sold.

Name: 태종대유원지
Review: There are lots to see at Taejongdae Resort Park. Unfortunately I had little time, therefore I went straight to Yeongdo Lighthouse as that was the "must-see" attraction for me. You can choose to walk the entire park or take the Danubi Train, which I opted for due to time constraints.We turned up at the wrong time and the trackless Danubi Train service was not operating due to safety reasons as the roads were wet from the long drizzle. It was a large and expansive park so we decided save our walk and give the attractions a miss to visit another attraction nearby.You may chose to walk around this Park, or pay 3000W for the Danubi Train, which has 3 stops (namely Observation Deck, The Light House and The Temple). You may get in or off at any station. Personally first and second stops are recommended, but not really at the third stops. Prepare to walk and climb stairs especially to the Light House. Going up the spinning stair to the top of Light House, and you could enjoy panoramic view of the area, breath taking. If you have more time, walking down further and you could buy and enjoy some fresh oyster!If you plan to visit this Park, avoid weekends as waiting and taking the Danubi could be long with tourists and local crowds.You could also take a small ferry with a fees around the park, agents will approach you just before entrance to the Park.We went there as part of Busan city tour package and inside the park we took danubi train bus which takes you around inside the park. We stop by at one of the few look outs and enjoyed the view. If you have time, worthwhile to give a visit.alot of nice views and photo stopstake the train if u are lazy to walk do note the waiting time is around 30 mins.This is my second visit after more than 5 years and the place is as nice as I remembered it. Visited on a warm sunny day and the seaviews were spectacular. The divers/fishermen were out in full force selling their catch at the foot of the cliffs. I was impressed with how efficiently the tram car service was run and also how well maintained the toilets were.

Name: 영도대교
Review: <U+6BCE>日１４時に上がる、橋下から見ると<U+697D>しい夜は、橋の上から奇麗な夜景が、見えます。何度行っても<U+697D>しい南浦の<U+99C5>からも、チャガルチからも、行けます影島大橋には韓<U+56FD>の<U+56FD>旗がたくさんありました。チャガルチ市場などを海側からみることができますし、眺めは良いです。大橋の下では釣りをしている人もいました。跳ね橋なので時間には通行止めされ<U+89B3>光客でいっぱいになります。夜は他の橋がライトアップされている<U+5199><U+771F>が綺麗にとれます。ん～影島に、うに食べに行ったときにバスで通ったけど<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>なんてことのないただの橋でした<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>＾＾以上普通の<U+9244>橋です。<U+4E26>列して見える釜山大橋の方が海側、港<U+6E7E>に近く、高さもあるので、2つのうち一つを選ぶのであれば、釜山大橋の方が迫力があってよいと思います。影嶋大橋は普段は交通の要衝ですが、2時からの15分間は午後<U+89B3>光施設と成ります。橋の手前の<U+6B69>道には一寸寄り付き難い位の<U+89B3>客が詰め掛けます。しかし跳橋の少し前に車<U+4E21>が通行止めになり、車道が開放されるので、見<U+5B66>をするには<U+6B69>道で待つのが一番良いと思います。というわけで私は一番前の列で、橋が上がってくるのを見ました。カメラの放列は勿論ですが、橋が45度くらい上昇して。カモメの<U+7D75>柄が良く見えるようになると、殆どの人が橋に背を向けて自撮りを始めるのも、愉快な風景です。中には通行再開を待つ長い車列を背景に、車道に<U+5BDD><U+8EE2>んで<U+5199><U+771F>に納まる若者たちも居ました。跳橋を見るのも然ることながら、<U+89B3>客の同行を<U+89B3>察するのもまた見ものだと思います。この時間に南浦洞に居られたなら、ぜひ足を運んでください。ロッテモ<U+30FC>ル光複のすぐ近くです。2018年9月に行きました。釜山港に釜山大橋と<U+4E26>行にかかる橋です。釜山大橋は海面から高い位置にあるのに<U+5BFE>し、こちらの橋は海面に近い位置あって大きな船が通るときは橋が開きます。あいにく夜の時間だったので開くところは見れませんでした。１４時<U+301C>１４時１５分開きます。時間が合えば、ぜひ見てみてください。最大角度になると壁みたいです南浦洞<U+99C5>、バス停近くです。ロッテマ<U+30FC>ト、デパ<U+30FC>トにも寄れます。ホテルがすぐ近くだったので、ロッテマ<U+30FC>トに行く途中通りました。14時にはね橋が開くとのことでしたが、時間が合わないので見られませんでした。<U+56FD>際市場に行く前に１４時の開閉に合わせて初めて行きました。私を含めて<U+968F>分と<U+89B3>に<U+6765>る<U+89B3>光客？が多いなあと思いました。釜山のユ<U+30FC>ラシア大陸側と、大宗台公園のある影島にかかっている非常に立派な橋です。松島ヘスピアからの眺めは海と島がバックになるので、なかなか良い景<U+89B3>でした。きっと夜はライトが点<U+706F>すると思いますので、もっと魅力的な景<U+89B3>になると思います。

Name: 태종대온천
Review: 家族で<U+6E29>泉のみ利用しました。<U+5869>分が<U+5F37>く皮膚の弱い部分はヒリヒリするくらいでした。施設は古くて、潔癖な人は<U+6C17>になるかもしれません。釜山に行く時は、東菜や海雲台の<U+6E29>泉によく行っていましたが、今回は初めて太宗台<U+6E29>泉に行ってみる事にしました。釜山<U+99C5>、中央洞、南浦洞<U+8FBA>りのバス停から、影島大橋を渡る太宗台行きの66番や88番のバスに<U+4E57>ります。太宗台<U+6E29>泉は、太宗台終点と一つ手前のバス停（太宗台<U+6E29>泉）の丁度中間にありますので、どちらで降りても大丈夫です。目印は、バスが給油している大きなSKガススタンドがあります。そのガススタンドの<U+771F>ん中の道を入って行くと、太宗台<U+6E29>泉の大きな駐車場になっています。どちらのバス停からも<U+6B69>いて5分も掛かりません。入口を入ってすぐカウンタ<U+30FC>があり、ここで入泉料(w6000)を<U+6255>います。ロッカ<U+30FC>キ<U+30FC>を貰って、女湯は左、男湯は右の階段を上がっていくと、<U+8131>衣室になっています。靴のロッカ<U+30FC>がないので、履物は<U+8131>衣ロッカ<U+30FC>まで持っていきます。タオルは<U+8131>衣室にありますが、浴室<U+5185>には石<U+9E78>のみしか置いていません。シャンプ<U+30FC>等必要な方は、持<U+53C2>するか<U+8131>衣室の<U+58F2>店で購入も出<U+6765>ます。浴室<U+5185>には５つ程浴槽があり、１つは水風呂で、もう２つはかなり低<U+6E29>のお湯でした。<U+6B8B>り２つの浴槽はいい湯加減だったので、なんとか<U+6E29>泉に入った<U+6C17>分になれました。露天風呂もありますが、<U+6B8B>念ながらこちらもかなり低<U+6E29>のお湯だったので、少し物足りない<U+6C17>がしました。長時間浸かるのにはいいのかもしれませんが<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>。入浴後は２階のチムジルバンで休憩が出<U+6765>ます。小さな食堂もありますので、<U+8EFD>い食事も出<U+6765>ました。私は平日の<U+663C>間に行きましたので、お客さんの殆どが地元の方の<U+69D8>でした。太宗台からもすぐなので、休みの日は太宗台<U+89B3>光の後に<U+6765>る方も多いのではと思います。

Name: 국립해양박물관
Review:
not to be missed ! entrance is free, the displays are truly well organized and have to be seen, activities for kids as wellThe museum on the Youngdo island, you can ride the 66 bus from around the Nampo station to get there.  They got some knowledge about North Korea and how they be ineracting with the sea and all that.
 
Upstairs you can learn about the ships,...더 보기Zero entrance fee and the building architecture alone was awesome. 

There were a great variety of exhibits on Korean maritime experiences over many centuries.  An aquarium exhibit was inside too. 

There were very few foreigners who were aware of this attraction. 

Outside, a deep sea...더 보기Visited on a weekend, so it was naturally jam-packed.
However, the main exhibitions halls were not as crowded so we were able to enjoy the exhibits in peace.
The aquarium was entertaining.Visited this place mainly as it is a walking distance from the Hilton Busan hotel I was staying at. I must also admit to not having any particularly strong feelings towards fishing. I found the museum rather old fashioned and not engaging enough for today's...더 보기We enjoyed the Maritime Museum. There was a lot to see and a few things for young children like the library, aquarium, and Children’s Museum. The only thing we paid for was parking and lunch from the restaurant upstairs, which was really good.After reading a brochure of the Museum we visited the place. The building that house the Museum has an impressive architecture. There were three floors of exhibitions. A lot of thought has been put into this place as the building was divided into different areas...더 보기Contrary to the popular belief that the Europeans are the pioneers of maritime achievements, Asian nations, including Korea lay claim to some of the ingenious and heroic maritime accomplishments, whether ship design, navigation, naval warfare or even maritime trades.  A must visit place for anyone...더 보기I stopped at the maritime museum on the way back from Taejongdae and was glad I did - there was...더 보기Found this really interesting. Enjoyed the display and the history. They have great kid activities incorporated into the Museum as...더 보기

Name: 부산항
Review: インスタ映えします！のんびり過ごすなら最高な場所かと思います。ソウルよりも人も<U+7A4F>やかでごみごみしていないのでリラックス出<U+6765>るのが釜山の良いところ。釜山港付近はあまり<U+98F2>食店が少なかった<U+69D8>に感じます。<U+56FD>際フェリ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>ミナルは、釜山<U+99C5>の側であり、街の中心部にあって非常に便利です。釜山空港を利用するより、日本<U+767A>着の場所により利用<U+4FA1>値は高いです。フェリ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>ミナルは新しく<U+5E83><U+3005>していてきれいです。今回フェリ<U+30FC>で釜山港から入<U+56FD>し街の中心地近くにあるので飛行機で金海空港に到着するよりかなり便利でした。日本から韓<U+56FD>にフェリ<U+30FC>で入る際の窓口になります。結構しっかりとしたフェリ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>ミナルで出港時にはなかった手荷物<U+691C>査をしていましす。釜山<U+99C5>まで徒<U+6B69>で行けます。クル<U+30FC>ズ船で寄港しました。世界で9番目に物量の多い港だけあって、とてもきれいに整備されています。旅客タ<U+30FC>ミナルには免<U+7A0E>店も1つあります。イミグレ<U+30FC>ションの係官が、パスポ<U+30FC>トホルダ<U+30FC>を外して、返し忘れていたのには閉口しましたが<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>快適な<U+95A2>釜フェリ<U+30FC>、Air-craft以外では、初入<U+56FD>。朴正<U+7155>大統領の時代、釜山港で、墓石の原石の最終確認で、何度も<U+6765>ているが、コンテナ船が主流の現在、ガントリクレ<U+30FC>ンの多さに<U+5727>倒される。<U+6A2A>浜港より規模がデカい。港から<U+89B3>る風景も、貧しかった韓<U+56FD>の時代の風景とは、雲泥の差があります。韓<U+56FD>大統領、取り<U+5DFB>きの輩、もう<U+6C17>がくるっているしかない<U+767A>言等<U+3005>。我<U+3005>が、韓<U+56FD>で仕事していた時は、お互い信<U+983C>して仕事をやっていたなのに、最近の韓<U+56FD>はおかしい。。。。かつて日本で流行ってた歌を現地で聞くことはあまり<U+7D4C><U+9A13>できないものですが、釜山に<U+6765>ると結構あちらこちらで聞こえてきますね。釜山<U+99C5>からは徒<U+6B69>でも行ける距離です。チャガルチ市場近くには漁船港もあり、ここからの景色も良いと思います。2018年9月に行きました。港町釜山を象<U+5FB4>する場所です。<U+56FD>際港として有名な釜山だけあって、空港と<U+4E26>ぶ存在の玄<U+95A2>口です。日本からのフェリ<U+30FC>も到着します。夜に周<U+8FBA>を散策すると港町の雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>を味わえる場所です。釜山に<U+89B3>光に行くなら行くべき場所だと思います。釜山港に着くまでの間は、港の賑わいのあるコンテナが<U+4E26>ぶ<U+58EE><U+89B3>な眺めを見ることができます。左手には大きな橋、右手にコンテナを見ることができます！入港前の忙しいなかですが、是非ご<U+89A7>ください！

Name: 광복로 문화 패션 거리
Review:
いつ行っても<U+697D>しい<U+0001F3B6>街です

可愛いお店が、<U+6CA2>山有り
ショッピングや食事も<U+697D>しめます夕食を食べて、光復路を<U+6B69>いていると、釜山タワ<U+30FC>が見えました。
夜は、イルミネ<U+30FC>ションが本<U+5F53>にキレイです。ソウルタワ<U+30FC>程、...더 보기化粧品のお店やちょっとした<U+96D1>貨屋さんが多く、ちょこちょこ買い物をしたりカフェでゆっくりしているうちにあっという間に時間が...더 보기ショッピングで利用しました。
プチプライスなコスメ店がたくさんありますので、買い物にオススメです。ちょうどセ<U+30FC>ルをしてい...더 보기いろいろなお店がズラリと<U+4E26>んでいて、散<U+6B69>がてらぶらぶらと<U+6B69>いていると時間の<U+7D4C>つのも忘れてしまいます。ナンポ<U+99C5>からチャガルチ<U+99C5>にかけて、賑わったショッピング街です。有名なお店(高級店ではなく)、靴屋さんや、タピオカ屋さん、...더 보기スポ<U+30FC>ツブランドのショップや<U+98F2>食店が立ち<U+4E26>びぶらぶらと散<U+6B69>するにはいいと思います。時間つぶしにはもってこい。夕暮れ時は<U+6B69>行者<U+5C02>用となっていました。人の流れが<U+5897>えつつある時間<U+5E2F>で、外<U+56FD>人<U+89B3>光客も多く、所<U+3005>では日本語も聞こえました。...더 보기2018年9月に行きました。
道の<U+4E21>側にファ<U+30FC>ストフ<U+30FC>ド店やカフェ、洋服屋さんなどが<U+4E26>ぶ通りです。釜山<U+89B3>光でブラブラする...더 보기いろんな通りがあり、それぞれぎっしりお店がならび、買い物が<U+697D>しい所です。<U+6B27>米人もたくさん見かけました。食事にも便利な所で...더 보기

Name: 국제시장
Review:
７番出口を出て大通りを北上すると市場に着きます。途中「ダイソ－」に立ち寄りました。韓<U+56FD>のダイソ<U+30FC>は100円均一では無くお...더 보기チャガルチ市場と一<U+7DD2>に見たらいいと思います。いくつかの通りが連なっている、ざっとみました。人<U+6C17>の露店は、行列になっていま...더 보기台風で飛行機が欠航となり、ホテルで過ごすのはもったいなくて地下<U+9244>で出かけました。台風接近中で開いているお店もチラホラでし...더 보기大型客船で港について有料バスでチャガルチ周<U+8FBA>におろされるので、この周<U+8FBA>にはたくさんのクル<U+30FC>ズ<U+89B3>光客が訪れます。屋台みたい...더 보기南浦に食事に行った後に、周<U+8FBA>を散<U+6B69>しました。
<U+56FD>際市場は、チャガルチ<U+99C5>からの方が近いです。生活用品などが<U+58F2>られているお店...더 보기屋台、地べた食いの露店やら、中古古物？バッタモン、品質補償無しの非正規、<U+507D>物商品が多<U+6570>…買うか否かは個人の判<U+65AD>だが、これ...더 보기クル<U+30FC>ズ船で釜山訪れたときツア<U+30FC>で<U+56FD>際 市場に行きました。 この手の市場は<U+6226>後の闇市から<U+767A>生してできたそうです。 洋服 ...더 보기朝9時頃に行きましたが、たくさんのお店がオ<U+30FC>プンしていました。
韓<U+56FD>のお土産を買えるお店がたくさんあります。
韓流アイド...더 보기<U+96D1>多なところがとても釜山っぽいです、なんて言ったら地元の人に叱られるかな？日本人の感<U+899A>からすると、昭和と平成の入り混じっ...더 보기いろいろな商品が山のようにあふれています。通りをゆっくりと散<U+6B69>するだけで雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が味わえます。通りを入れば<U+98F2>食店もあり、街...더 보기

Name: 자갈치 시장
Review: An incredible place to wander around even if you don’t end up eating any of the unbeatable fresh raw fish on offer! Lots of photo opportunities of a huge selection of fish and seafood. Worth a visit! Lots of stalls around the market area too.I call it 大家煮 in Chinese for Jalgachi. We went there around 5:30 0m so the market was not busy. The market is huge with at least 50+ seafood vendors. It could be quite confusing which vendor to choose. There are signs in the market displaying the seafood market price on some items (You won’t find one vendor offers much cheaper price. I don’t know how they compete for customers then). You can choose any seafood and amount. Each vendor works with one of the many small restaurants on the second floor. After you purchase the seafood, the vendor will call the restaurant upstairs. A server will come and take you to their restaurant upstairs where they will prepare the seafood the way you want. In additional to the price you pay to the vendor for the seafood, the restaurant only charges $4 US ($4,000 Korean won) per person for using their service which include kimchi side dishes and food preparation. Therefore, expect to pay a bit more upfront for the seafood. We spent $240 US ($240,000 won) on the seafood for six of us and we were full. We had a yellow tail which was about $110. We had it for sashimi and was delicious. We also had abalones, conches, octopus, shrimps, eels, and scallops. It is better to have a small group of people to go so you can try variety of seafood. For those who don’t know how to select seafood from the vendor, you may go directly upstairs to any of the restaurant. They have a regular menu you can order from. The restaurant will get the seafood from their vendors and cook for you. They are just as fresh. By the time we finished around 7 pm, the place was packed with people. We noticed many were local people’s this is not just a hotspot for tourists. I would say this place is the place to go for seafood in Busan.Any food creatures you ever saw a nature documentary about can be found, bought and eaten around here.Wander around this amazing fish market and see a lot of interesting creatures from the sea. And don't forget to go out the back to where there's a walkway along the water and hopefully you'll get to see the seagulls playing in the sky.One of the reason we go to Busan is to have a taste of its street seafood and this is it. There is a central covered market and around it grows and grows of fishes, eels, shrimps, octopus, conches, oysters, giant crabs...most of them alive and swimming. The view and smells are overwhelming but you get for your money. We ordered seafood meals in the covered market and they are so delicious on the grill. You should try the abalones, the squids and the big prawns.Don't go to this place unless u want to be ripped dry. They overcharged us. We paid 44000 kwon just for bbq 3 types of seafood. The seafood is bought from the fish market on first floor n cost is separate. U have to pay for rice separately n they forced u to sit on floor even though we told them my hubby had problem bending knee to sit on floor. This place ought to be investigated by the korean tourist board. The cooking bill they gave wsd initially, 32,000 won when suddenly it become 44,000 won.I have never heard of this place before and my friends that I am travelling with, one of them recommended it so we decided to go and if you love seafood go here cause not only is it a seafood market, the animals are all fresh and alive. You look at what you like and buy but they don’t give you the seafood cause they put them in bags and tell you follow them. I was confused, I was wondering where we were going. We went upstairs and it’s all tables and chairs, you guessed it they cook your seafood and serve them to you. It is sooooooo good I didn’t want to leave. So recommend this place to all seafood lovers.Whilst living in Busan for 3+ years from 2011-2015 anytime friends or family from Canada came I would take them here. You can buy nearly any fish or crustacean imaginable. I’m a big Alaskan king crab guy more than some of the korean stuff like love octopus. I find the more korean prep of seafood is very basic, or not at all (completely live octopus). The crab is amazingly good though with some soy sauce and onion and garlic stuff, and *relatively* local catch. Recommend just for the sights.Stayed in Shin Shin Hotel for 5 nights. Comfortable room with tasty breakfast. Strategic location adjacent to metro transit and many places of interest. Busan has friendly people and clean environment. We enjoyed the street food. It's a pleasant holidays for us.If you have visited Japan's Tsujiki Fish Market, give Jalgachi a miss. Drop by only if you have never visited a fish market in your life AND you have lots of spare time in your itinerary. If you do visit, wear shorts or jeans and preferably boots. Jalgachi Market is busy and colorful but the floor is perpetually wet and slippery. The stallholders vie with one another to cajole visitors to view their fish and thrust their laminated menu cards in your face. The stallholders who are not touting for customers will invariably be doing some washing and think nothing of pouring pails or basins of fishy water in a random fashion so visitors should keep a lookout and duck quickly to avoid getting your footwear and trouser legs wet.Honestly, you can get good quality, fresh seafood at most places in Busan. Jalgachi is overrated and overpriced (see photo of menu); the cooking is rough and the cooked food is just slapped onto melamine plates and put on plastic table tops. Unless you are resident Korean, chances are you will be unwittingly ripped off. Even if you do understand and speak basic Korean, you will still be outwitted by the friendly but shrewd stallholders. Be prepared to spend at least KRW50,000 per pax for a simple meal, excluding beverages. For this price, one deserves (imho) to dine in a better (and drier) environment and served neatly plated food by trained waitstaff in uniform, especially in Busan where cost of living is lower than Seoul.

Name: BIFF 광장
Review: Maybe this place would be better after dark. I was expecting to see more related to the film festival, but instead it was mostly for shopping and eating.And stroll around in Busan central. You can find anything you e or need here. There are artists performing songs in the evening. This place has a very good vibe.Stroll and local street food. Went in the evening for dinner and enjoyed our night stroll. You can also see the celebrities hand-prints around the area.Came here for food! Nice place to hang out for shopping and food and an easy walk to Busan Tower (escalator that leads up to the park and tower)BIFF is very near to Jagalchi Market, less than 10 mins walk. If you want to shop local products, you should come here. From cosmetics to clothes to foodstuff. This place is not as nice as Myeongdong or Insadong in Seoul.The place can be crowded with all the cafes, boutique and restaurant surrounding BIFF. It’s fun place though like how you would probably enjoy myeongdong for shopping.What a wonderful venue! Its huge and very lively! Food, events, shops... Tonight they had a special performance followed by a film screening for differently abled people. This talks about how a city feels so caring and responsible towards her citizens. Bravo!!!This is the area we spent most of our time in Busan walking around, visit shops and small restaurants. The shops have good prices and are within close proximity.Each shop (even within the same chain / brand name) have different promotions, which we find unique and makes discount product digging much more interesting.The area usually starts late ~10-11am and cools down after 10pm. You can only find small food strollers after midnight.This road is located in the historic complex of Busan city. Here during the daytime saw crowded and bustling. The small central road has a car section so be careful when traveling.On the two sides of the road there are many fashion shops, coffee and food shops. The space here is very beautiful, bringing the appearance of the beach town because the sky is always blue.The majority of visitors in this square are young people. Occasionally meet some beggars. There are interesting crossroads with hand or foot marks. These marks are from famous or influential figures in Korea.Walking on the road is very safe, everyone is friendly. There are also specially designed break areas.My experience is to go to seafood market and square in 1 day because these 2 places are very close to each other.When I was here it was nothing more than an intersection filled with food stalls. I found one place with some had prints but mostly it was just food stalls all over the plaza. Only worth takign a picture when you walk pass it on your way to one of the markets.

Name: 부산 근대 역사관
Review:
夜は白い建物がライトアップされます。大<U+5E81>路から見ると、バックの<U+9D8F>頂山の釜山タワ<U+30FC>もライトアップされてきれいな夜景です。日本統治時代の「東洋拓殖株式<U+4F1A>社」の建物を利用した<U+6B74>史館。入館料は無料。日本がどのようにして、朝鮮半島の支配を<U+62E1>大して...더 보기釜山にある資料館等、立派な施設と<U+6570>多くの展示品を見ることができます。無料で入れる意<U+56F3>も抑えながら見<U+5B66>するとよいでしょう。...더 보기<U+65E7><U+56FD>策<U+4F1A>社の東洋拓殖株式會社の建物を利用した、政治的要素の濃い施設です。

同じイベントでも立場が違えば「日本語」の書き...더 보기バス停「<U+56FD>際市場」からすぐ近く。日本語のリ<U+30FC>フレットもあります。無料のロッカ<U+30FC>もあるので、大荷物の人は借りるといいと思い...더 보기地下<U+9244>１<U+53F7>線中央<U+99C5>５番出口から大<U+5E81>路を西に７～８分<U+6B69>くとクラシックな3階建ての建物が目に入ります。ここが釜山近代<U+6B74>史館で...더 보기この建物は日本の植民地時代に建てられた、
「東洋拓殖株式<U+4F1A>社」の釜山支店です。
周りの建物と比べても、
ひときわ重厚感が...더 보기過去の不幸の<U+6B74>史を幾度も<U+4E57>り越えて復興<U+30FB><U+767A>展した釜山市。ここの<U+6B74>史館では日本語による日本統治時代前後の<U+6B74>史を<U+5B66>ぶことがで...더 보기<U+4EEE>設板は日本語もあるので展示<U+5185>容がよく分かる。しかし、日帝の文字が目立ち、支配者であった日本に<U+5BFE>して<U+53B3>しい見方の解<U+8AAC>と言...더 보기朝鮮王朝末期から日本統治時代にかけての博物館です。
日本が金海地域を干拓して米を<U+5897>産したのも、<U+5B66>校を作って<U+6559>育したことも...더 보기

Name: 보수동 책방골목
Review: This alley is filled with books.... old books....The shops are literally filled with books...Fiction.. non-fiction.. children.. autobiographies.. and much more. I was lucky to have found two books.. The Little Prince and Aesop Fables that has both English and Korean in it.A few dramas also filmed some of their scenes here. Getting to the street is a bit complicated. You can choose to take the taxi. Else below was how i got to the place.Directions:.. Toseong Station.. Exit 1.. Walk straight.. Busan Bank will appear on your right at a junction. Turn right there... Walk past the bank and a church towards a traffic junction.. Cross the junction and turn right.. Walk straight till you see a traffic junction where pedestrians can also cross diagonally... Cross straight and go left.. Bosu Book Street is on the right on the immediate streetOk we were in the area and passed by. The alley is very small and it does smell of old books! There’s a good looking cafe near the end so maybe you can find a good read and settle down.It is a small alley so won’t take u very long to walk through if that’s all you’re doing. There’s a couple of statues and info at the ends saying why it’s famous.The alley smelt of old books. Even if you don't buy any books here, you can still enjoy the mood. In the middle of the alley, there is a book cafe named 우리글방(Uri-geulbang). It's a good place to take a rest. They sell small desserts, coffee, beverages, and also old books. And the shop is full of second-hand books, posters and LPs. Great atmosphere :-)For those who keen on books and reading it can be a place to stay for the whole day. There are lots of very cozy book shops with unique or just vintage books, like miss Oki's shop(on the picture)Very quaint. Took me about 20 minutes t slowly walk through leafing through the books - not always in English. Close to the marketI found this place online while I was planning for my trip. I was really happy to be here. Looking at people are still appreciating books. They are bookshops that do buying and selling. You name it, they (got to look around a few shops) probably have it! I also spotted mural painting and cute chairs around as well. There are also cafes around for rest too. If you love or appreciate reading through hard copy books, this is a nice place to just take a strollYou should definitely take a walk through this claustrophobic alley. There are books staked floor to ceiling, and it makes an excellent backdrop for selfies. They are almost all in Korean, but there are a few classic English novels hidden away. Just south of Book Street is a big market area.The street mainly sells second hand books, from textbooks to comics books and magazines. They are mostly in Korean but there are some English ones as well. It's more of an lane than anything and the books are neatly stacked up on top of each other like a wall. There is also a 7 storey Bookstreet cultural center, free of admission. The second and third floor are exhibitions and there is even a small cinema. Overall, a nice escape from the bustling shopping area nearby.Someone in Busan mentioned Bosu Book Street to us and we decided to have a look. It is close to other, bigger markets (Jagalchi fish market) and nice to stroll around for an hour or so. The shops in this alley are filled with mostly Korean and English books. I found it a cool, quirky place and it is interesting to see how locals try to find the book they are looking for in these gigantic piles of paper. See http://vorkintheroad.com/2014/05/16/busan-bosu-book-street/ for more photos and directions on how to get there by subway.

Name: 부평 시장
Review: 近くのレストランで夕食を食べた後に、探索してみました。0時前だったので、閉店準備をしているお店が多かったですが、<U+55B6>業中のお店もありました。日本語で話ができる人が多く、フレンドリ<U+30FC>な方が多かったです。BIFF<U+5E83>場より小規模ですが、ロ<U+30FC>カル感が<U+5F37>めな屋台でした。台<U+6E7E>の高雄や台北の夜市をイメ<U+30FC>ジしたら規模が小さくガッカリするかもしれません。どの店も<U+4FA1>格が2000~5000ウォンで結構します。三店回れば1000円になります。<U+663C>の方が庶民的かもコストパフォ<U+30FC>マンスから言えば、富平市場の夜市より屋台街の方がお得な<U+6C17>がしますが、何せ韓<U+56FD>はお一人<U+69D8>文化が育たない街。一人で行っても注文は2人分からと言われる店が多いので、その意味では夜市はお手<U+8EFD>かと夜市の露店で安心して食べられるのは韓<U+56FD>と台<U+6E7E>。賑やかな釜山、富平市場はウキウキ<U+6C17>分でお散<U+6B69>できます。美味しいものがいっぱいで困っちゃうくらい。2018年9月に行きました。<U+56FD>際市場と道を<U+631F>んだ向かい側にある大きな市場です。<U+56FD>際市場同<U+69D8>、小さな商店が集積した市場です。こちらの方が食品<U+95A2>係のお店が多く、屋台もたくさんあって食べ<U+6B69>きもできます。カントン市場とも呼ばれているそうです。昔ながらの食堂や食品を扱うお店が<U+4E26>んでいます。粉ものの食堂とタッカンジョン（<U+9D8F>肉の唐揚げを甘辛ダレであえたもの）のお店に行きました。粉ものの食堂は店<U+5185>はいっぱいで、通りに出ているテ<U+30FC>ブルや店頭のカウンタ<U+30FC>まで人があふれていました。ピンデトッ（<U+7DD1>豆の粉のチヂミ）を食べましたが、さくさくでおいしかったです。（ソウルより少し小さめ）タッカンジョンも２人でシェアするのにちょうどいいサイズが選べてよかったです。１月に友人と行きました。お正月の賑わいの中、若者、家族連れで賑わっていました。日本の豚足と違い、甘辛く、水あめも入っているのか女性や、子どもたちも食べやすいです。サイズも大、中、小とあり、人<U+6570>に合わせて注文ができます。チャガルチ市場だけでなく、是非足を延ばしてくださいね。生レバ<U+30FC>が食べれるレストランの近くだったので、ちょっと<U+8997>いてみました。夜は出店が出ていて<U+72ED>い路地に<U+6CA2>山の人がいて活<U+6C17>がありました。キンパの店が行列を作っていましたが、ホットクの屋台はありませんでしたので、biff<U+5E83>場に<U+5E30>りましたが、夜は活<U+6C17>があり<U+697D>しめると思います。台<U+6E7E>の夜市と比較してしまいどの屋台も混んでいましたが、我が家にはあまり惹かれるものがありませんでした。比較的値段も高く、ぶらぶらしただけで<U+5E30>りました。朝御飯は安くて、美味しい食堂があり良かったです。市場<U+5185>で男性用の下着購入しましたが後でロッテマ<U+30FC>トで４割位で<U+58F2>っていました。騙されたのかも知れません。地下<U+9244>「チャガルチ」の出口３or5　から外に出て大道りを北に向かって５分位<U+6B69>くとゲ<U+30FC>トが見えてきます。かなり<U+5E83>いです。月曜日１９時頃到着。夕食の時間<U+5E2F>なので混んでいました。食べ物屋<U+30FB>魚屋<U+30FB>香辛料屋<U+30FB>洋服屋<U+30FB>下着屋<U+30FB>玩具屋<U+30FB>台所用品屋<U+30FB><U+507D>ブランド店と何でも有り。１００店<U+8217>以上有るように思います。私はお土産用に小<U+92AD>入れセットと靴下を購入しました。小腹が空いたのでチジミを屋台でいただきました。言葉で困っていると必ず近くに日本語が出<U+6765>る方が助けてくれるので、一人でも充分<U+697D>しむことができました。<U+56FD>際市場の近くにあり ア<U+30FC>ケ<U+30FC>ド街になっています。天<U+6C17>も良く休日だったので混んでいました。お目<U+5F53>ては化粧品のサンプルを<U+58F2>っている店です。店の看板に番<U+53F7>が書いてあるので 探しやすいです。お店の方<U+3005>は簡<U+5358>な日本語は話されるので 買い物には困りません。今度は夜に行って夜市を<U+697D>しみたいです。

Name: 부산 민주공원
Review: There are loads of photos with details from the Korean War. You can climb the steps to the monument or you can get the little lift that goes up the side (really handy). The monument is impressive and large and reminded me of a spaceship looking from underneath upwards. Really a special monument. The views are also great from the top.Democracy park is located near the busy shopping district of Nampo in Busan. This makes it a good place to go to get away from the crowds if you need a break. If you want up there it is a bit tough, depending on your route it'll probably take about an hour. There are paved and staired trails from most directions up there, or there are buses from near Jungang station (186, 86) station area and from Nampo station area (186, 86, 190). Once you're up there you can get some nice views of the harbour and the city, you can see some old locals playing a kind of Korean style chess, or you just relax and stroll around the shaded hills. It's a nice place to spend an afternoon.Beautiful views of the city, and definitely a great park unto itself. Korea paves all of their parks with the jogging rubber-like pavement that makes walking everywhere easier on the legs and feet. Went on a foggy day after it rained but it only made the views more dramatic. I only had 5 hours in Busan and thus spot would be on the top of my to-do list (along with Jagalchi Market) if you're short on time!I had been here back in 1999 and wasn't impressed. I recently went back and liked it much better. Perhaps it's because this trip was on a weekday, so there weren't the crowds that were there the first time I went. They've renovated the area around the Choong-Hon ("Loyal Dead")Tower - it's beautiful in the fall and you get a great view of part of the city. We also went to Jungang ("Central") Park nearby. It's a recent addition to the area (five to eight years ago) and has monuments to those who sacrificed themselves in various democratic uprisings here since the establishment of the Republic in 1948. It's a poignant reminder of how far the country has come since the end of WWII and the Korean War. There was a small museum dedicated to the various movements. It costs only about 20 cents to enter and is well done for something its size. Most of the literature is in Korean, but there are visitor's pamphlets available in English, Japanese, and Chinese. On the top of the museum building is a great place to view the cityscape and the mountains behind it. Some parts of Jungang Park seem kind of run down, though, and it was a little depressing to look over the city of Busan and see all the brand new skyscrapers and other building projects going up while this memorial to freedom fighters is overrun with weeds and feral cats (one of which had drowned in one of the pools and was just floating around). Having said that, both parks (Democracy and Central) are free and are a great place to go to take in awesome views of the city and learn a little of Korea's amazing modern history.

Name: 부산타워
Review:
It has great views from the top but the windows are very dirty so basically you can’t take any photosWent up here during the night time and was overwhelmed by the view. You have the view of the harbour bridge which looks amazing at night and after your done with the view, you take the elevator to level 4 and you enter rooms that...더 보기Went here at night and glad we did. There was a lovely light show on the tower building which we...더 보기Great observation deck to observe the landscape below the deck. Observing is easily done from the deck.You get an entire view of Busan which is great but it's quite a small space and the gift shop takes up most of the area. There is only one elevator going up and one going down. There was a large school group which delayed...더 보기Having been to many towers around the world this one was fairly average. Nice views across Busan but nothing particularly memorable or special. Best part were the photo opportunities on the way out where you can sit on a sign of Busan, among sky scrapers...더 보기The Busan Tower offers a great view over the city, both to the sea and the mountains. There’s multiple ways...더 보기Busan tower is in a nice plaza at the top of some stairs.
Depending on your access point the stairway might be electric or not.
We arrived around sunset and were able to enjoy the video projection showed on the Busan Tower facade twice (same...더 보기Make your way from BIFF square heading towards Lotte Mall and you will come across escalators heading up to Yongdusan park where the tower is located. On our visit, there weren't too many people so it was straight up. There is the usual tourist trap...더 보기Touring of Busan Tower and surroundings are a must see if you are in the area. It’s worth the the challenge of the staircases (looks like stairway to heaven), but not to worry there are escalators as well. It was good that we have just...더 보기

Name: 용두산 공원
