Review: 釜山タワ<U+30FC>少し<U+6B69>くのが大<U+5909>ですがエスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>で公園<U+8FC4>登れます公園から<U+771F>っ直ぐ、タワ<U+30FC>に行けますタワ<U+30FC>のエレベ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>も素敵ですが、タワ<U+30FC>の中も素敵です光復路からエスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>があったので移動が<U+697D>だった。思ったよりもエスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>の入り口が目立たなくて探しそうになった。カフェやお土産物のお店もあったが行った時はそろそろ閉店の時間だった。<U+5E30>りは階段で長かった。食後に、少し街を散策して、エスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>で釜山タワ<U+30FC>に行って<U+6765>ました。光復路からアクセスできるので、移動が<U+697D>です。龍頭山公園は、夜<U+9045>くまで、<U+89B3>光客、地元のカップルなどで、人も<U+6CA2>山居ました。夜は２２時頃までオ<U+30FC>プンしています。夕方タクシ<U+30FC>で上まで行きました。インスタ狙いのコ<U+30FC>ナ<U+30FC>もあり、近くへ行くなら寄るべきだと思います。<U+56FD>際市場からはライトアップのタワ<U+30FC>が見えました。光復路から登りはエスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>がありますが、下りは階段。多少の展望はあるが、ロッテマ<U+30FC>ト屋上展望デッキ(無料)の360度パノラマと開放感には劣る。釜山港，早朝8時、上陸後、TAXIで、宿泊先のホテルの旅行<U+9784>を預け、３時ころまで、市<U+5185>の、<U+89B3>光地を順番に見<U+5B66>す。この公園は、初めてで、外人<U+89B3>光客と一<U+7DD2>に？、公園を散<U+6B69>する。釜山タワ<U+30FC>は、登れませんでした。。。地下<U+9244>（メトロ）1<U+53F7>線南浦（ナンポ）<U+99C5>5番出口からエスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>を上がると公園の入口にたどり着く。プサン港を見下ろす丘の上に公園があり、ふもとは繁華街の南浦洞（ナンポドン）をはじめチャガルチ市場、PIFF<U+5E83>場などがある。公園<U+5185>の階段を上がるとプサンタワ<U+30FC>があり、入場料は8,000W（日本語およびクレジットカ<U+30FC>ド可能）で、展望台へのエレベ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>は凝った演出があり一見の<U+4FA1>値があるといえる。展望台から夕日に沈むプサン港はまさに絶景であり、日<U+6CA1>の時間<U+5E2F>を選んで入場するのがおすすめ。また、プサンでも春になるとこの公園で<U+685C>まつりが開催される。チャガルチ市場やロッテモ<U+30FC>ルにも近い、釜山の中心部にある丘全<U+4F53>が公園になっています。丘の上の<U+5E83>場には１１８ｍの釜山タワ<U+30FC>と李舜臣（秀吉軍に勝利した<U+5C06>軍）の像が建っています。私訪れた時は<U+685C>や杏の花が<U+6E80>開で、とてもきれいでした。子連れなのでブラブラできて良さげかなと行きました。<U+5642>通りおじいちゃんの憩いの公園でした。タワ<U+30FC>前で3000ウォンで<U+5199><U+771F>すぐ出<U+6765>ると<U+58F0>をかけられました。安いし撮っても良かったかも？エスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>で登りますが<U+5E30>りは全て階段です。降りてすぐのゴンチャで冷たいフラッペを頂き、まったり<U+697D>しかったです。夏場は暑いので夜に行くのをおすすめします。夜はタワ<U+30FC>のカラ<U+30FC>が色<U+3005>と<U+5909>わります。カップルや<U+89B3>光客が多かったですが、<U+6570>人の<U+56E3><U+4F53>で<U+6765>ている人もいました。南浦からエスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>をつかってあがれるのが便利です。

Name: 남포 지하도상가
Review:
地下<U+9244>南浦洞<U+99C5>の地下街です。安いものがたくさんありそうでした。
ただ空<U+6C17>が<U+60AA>く、中<U+56FD>を思い出しました。地下<U+9244>南浦洞<U+99C5>の地下街です。
中<U+56FD>の地下街に雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が似ていました。
あまり良いものがなかった<U+6C17>がします。地下のショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルは主として衣類のお店が多い印象です。<U+6C17>候に左右されずにぶらぶらと散<U+6B69>しました。2018年9月に行きました。
地下<U+9244>の南浦<U+99C5>を出たところにある地下街です。どちらかと言うと地元の人向け、年<U+9F62>も高めの人向...더 보기地下<U+9244>を使うためだけでなく、目的地への行き<U+6765>にとても便利だし、いろいろなお店が奇麗に<U+4E26>んでいて、ゆっくり見たくなります。南浦<U+99C5>からBIFF<U+5E83>場方面につながる地下道。通路沿いにパラパラとお店がある感じで、西面の地下街を想像すると少し違います。...더 보기5000ウォンの靴や古着などが<U+58F2>ってあったりします。どちらかというと年配の人向けのお店が多いです。でも見て<U+697D>しめます。地下<U+9244>の<U+99C5>と直結で、地下<U+9244>の改札口のフロア<U+30FC>と同レベルなので、天候に左右されずアクセスできて買い物ができるのが便利だと思...더 보기ロッテにも行きやすく、とにかく長い地下道。寒いときにはやはり地下道が有難いです。通りにはいろいろなお店がありまた面白い。ロッテ百貨店光復店への行き<U+6765>に何度も利用しました。個人<U+55B6>業の店<U+8217>やコスメショップが多く、時間<U+5E2F>によっては賑わっていました...더 보기

Name: 부평깡통시장
Review:
There are so many things to eat at this market. I recommend Fish cake since Busan is known for it. It's perfect for a cold winter day, sipping warm soup and eating soft fluffy fish cake. There are also many restaurant around there area, if you want crave something they will have it.This was a faintly busy night market on a warm June evening. All the cooking that was going on all around us further added to the heat load. It was nice that the street was enclosed to protect the food stalls and vendors from the rain but I wonder if the enclosed roof keeps some of the heat inside. We tried a number of different items from various food stalls but the following stood out:A vegetarian noodle dish with a drizzle of some brown sauce came from a friendly Filipina whose noodle stand was right in the middle of the street. It was a little oily but flavorful. Fish cakes from Gamasot came as plain or four cheese filled ones on their own bamboo sticks. They were placed in a cup and a ladle full of broth (used to cook the fish cakes) was poured inside. The fish cakes were chewy but the broth was richer than we expected. A side of dukboki (made of rice) was slightly spicy and chewy. This seemed to be the only food stall with seats inside, a definite plus, to get out of the street and rest for a short while. We bussed our own trash after we finished eating.Overall a very good, but tight and hot night market.Very crowded in the evening and there are lots of foods stalls.
It's a good place to try various street foods.
But, they aren't affordable. Buying 2~3 kinds of street foods will be more expensive than eating at a restaurant.This is a better shopping place than any other markets that I have visited.Better shopping experience than Myeongdong or DongdaemunPlenty of street food available here!! There is a cheap cafe before you reach the entrance... their Americano is 800won only.It's awesome with street food lover. There are so many stalls where ou can find street food not only korean food but also of so many countries here such as vietnamese foods, turkey sandwiches, chinese foods or japanese foods. And out side of Bupyeong market, you will see so many restaurents and also many stalls that serve both soju and seafood in korean way. I just got lost here last weekend. It was so much fun with friends and I was so full LOL. Don't forget visit that night market. Oups! Bupyeong Kkangtong night market open at night till 24 o'clock.One more thing, Don't forget bring cash ;)Bupyeong Kkangtong have dry and wet market sections during daytime and transformed to food street and hoft. Its within walking distance to biff, gukje market and jagalchi station on Busan Metro line 1 is the nearest station.The food here is not that expensive as i saw the sliced pork belly for 3000krw for one portion and grilled eels for 9000 per portionThe market opens at 7:30pm till midnight. So for over 4 hours, the market is filled with people eating street foods from all over the world. So many choices, all delicious, from savory to sweet. During my trip to Busan, we tried at least 2 different snacks every night.Location: 48, Bupyeong 1-gil, Jung-gu, BusanAccessibility: You may take a taxi (the most convenient) or a local busBus No: 8, 11 , 96 , 103 , 113 , 126 Kkangtong Market is just a stone's throw away from Gukje Market.A visit to both Gukje market and Kkangtong Market is a good itinerary combo when in Busan. During the Korean War, imported goods (especially US canned goods) are supplied in the Kkangtong Market thus getting a funny name (tin can market). There are lots to see such as food, clothes, foreign products, accessories, fashion items, electronic goods, jackets, etc.!Your eyes and stomach will definitely thank you when you visit this market.This is like an extension of the gukje market across the road except that this has a roof covering making this place an all weather market. 

You can find food, clothes, souvenirs, etc here.

Name: 해운대
Review: I went there with hubby in May 2019. We tried to go as many locals (not too Tourist area) as possible, but this beach linked Tourist areas and some locals. Be prepared crowded areas. It was windy and My husband told me the water was cold (he went to do the testing) and it was good to be there. Locals were nice. Tourists were there and happy relaxing.Great beach for people watching and for taking scenic photos but not for bathing. Close to restaurants and easy access using metro or the tourist bus loops.Get down at Huaendae Station and walk about 500m and you will find this lovely white sandy beach. In the autumn it is cooling and perfect to go here. Good to relax and plenty of food to eat too. Many places of interest are nearby too: Dongbaek Island & Busan Aquarium ( walking distance ), Centum City ( by taxi / train) etc.A sandy beach, hreat for passing the afternoon with friends, family or solo. There are many restaurants on the promenade next to the beach and some green parks nearby as well.A beautiful beach and so clean ! We were here in November , I can only imagine what it's like in summer.Come here for sunset and people watch, I think that’s the best time to come and enjoy the beach especially in the colder monthsIn the summer it would be packed, but in early November it was perfect for walking along the beach path. Along the path there is a tourist info office, plenty of toilets, street food and the Aquarium. On the other side of the road there are restaurants, fast food outlets, cafes etc.Nice beach. It's about 40 minutes from Busan. From Haeundae Beach, can walk to The Westin Chosun hotel where you can get to APEC Nurimaru House.It is beautifully flanked on the north side by a cluster or modern looking metallic skyscrapers which also house fine dining restaurants. There are some small islands scattered in the far side ocean and some bizarre superman or spiderman statues not too far from the shore. A little bit wacky but ok.Went for a afternoon work. It's a nice place to just chill. Not overly crowded. Was close to my hotel.

Name: 부산 시립 미술관
Review:
No actual Korean art within. \5,000 and all I saw was a bunch of Finnish (think Ikea on steroids] stuff of which I saw a larger and nicer collection st the Manchester Museum of Art in England.I wish there would be more art pieces when compare to the space they have.
All of the staff are friendly and can speak English.Visited here on a Sunday afternoon. Very small crowd so it felt as though I had the place to myself. The outside of the building is rather plain, but the inside is quite beautiful. The exhibits were quite good, but very small for the space....더 보기We had heard about the reputation of the Busan Museum of Art, as being a terrific museum for Contemporary Art....더 보기Such a large building but so little to see.  The special exhibition was of little interest and no permanent exhibits.  English translation of Korean captions very poor.  Cafe was nice but that’s not what we went there for. Avoid.The current exhibit about the history of art in Busan is really interesting and informative. It covers Japanese occupation, art during the Korean War, contemporary art, etc. The recently acquired collection was good too. There’s English translation for most galleries. The museum is easy to...더 보기This is probably one of the better modern art museums in South Korea, and a perfect place to spent a lazy Saturday or Sunday afternoon. The attached restaurant id good but pricey so try the foodtrucks nearby in the sculpture park as a yummy, cheaper...더 보기Probably one of the better modern art museums in Korea. The exhibits were interesting and varied, mostly early 2000's works from Korean artists (unfortunately all of the piece descriptions were in Korean regardless of the artist). Not sure if there is seasonal renovations, as when...더 보기The main building has a few small exhibitions and is free, although several floors were closed, including the main sculpture garden.  However, the Lee Ufan annex is worth the visit if you like his work, with walk-through sculptures of starkly lit boulders, white gravel floors,...더 보기Two exhibits were advertised, but they filled maybe 10% of the museum, which was otherwise as empty as a new fridge.  So unless current exhibits sound compelling, it's not worth your time.

Name: 힐스파
Review: This is an excellent place to hang out and enjoy the hot water. It has a wide choice of pools and bathing areas including an outdoor area. The changing facilities and very clean and well organised and the bathing areas are generally well looked after although a little dates. It's slightly tricky to find but is behind a mall close to a subway station...about a 10-minute walk. A very Korean experience but definitely recommended. It's a big, busy place and foreigners are welcome.Our family's experience at the spa & the sauna went pretty bad from the start. At first, my sister and I couldn't help notice the tiny black substances that were floating in the cold water pool (other pools looked just fine) and so we didn't use that pool at all. The situation got even worse in the sauna. There were kids screaming & running around without any supervisions from their ill-mannered parents and the place was basically full of horny couples occupying any possible dark areas/corners to enjoy a whole lot of PDA. Lastly, the worst part of all (and the main reason that I'm writing this review) is that my allergies has gotten worse after my night at the spa yesterday. Now I feel like my time at the spa was a big waste of my money and I never want to go back there.Like many others have already stated, the location and the view from the spa are amazing. I also agree they have good amenities. However, this place needs some serious work on their sanitation and quality of service. What started as a casual weekend family night out to relax and to enjoy quality skin-care ritual really became a total nightmare. :(This place has been renovated, and changed its name to HILL SPA. I don't know how many 5 dots review pertaining to the new name jimjillbang, but according those ratings, I can confidently say, that the HILL SPA is heavily over rated, and there is much better spa in Busan close to Songdeo beach, with international crowd, and they speak English there.This is a 20 hrs spa, and 24 hrs jimjillbang that cost 1000 won/hour with a minimum payment of 12000 won, and 1000 won/ hour after that, no waiver!. So if you get to the reception at 10:05 you have to pay up till 11:00 .Keep this in mind! That is 24000 won/dayEverything is cozy all tubs and saunas having more than 6 people in them are overcrowded. The body rub fee is standard 20000 won (20 minutes) This place is frequented by Haeundae's yuppie crowd with lot of children running around virtually no visible foreigners present. So for save money on hotel to sleep there, you will find challenging to find quiet spot where no soap opera or news blasting off the TV screen, and nobody snores with implanted amplifier in their throats. This spa has nice view of the beach, and the bridge there ( not from the spa floors steamy windows), but their misleading website not listing the pricing properly on the English website.The Vesta Spa is now called The Hill Spa. Our taxi driver still knew how to get us there so the name change must not have been too long ago or taxi drivers are just used to the outdated name still being used. We took the metro to Haeundae station so we could eat dinner before heading to the Jjimjilbang for a soak and sleep. It costs 15,000\ on a weekday night, which was more than websites said when we were researching jjimjilbangs to stay. But it was still cheaper than a hostel or love motel. The place is run on a pretty specific schedule, 11pm they hand out blankets and pillows, 12midnight they turn off the lights, and 7am some of the lights come back on, but most people are already awake to watch the sunrise. The sleeping room overlooks the beach and it's amazing to wake up to that view! The soaking pools were decent, also overlooking that amazing view. We didn't use the saunas or massage services but they seemed standard. We were also expecting to have to carry money for snacks, as some websites said you had to, but everything is updated to the key/account/charge style. I think it was worth the 15,000\ for the view!The best spa by far in Busan.Super view over the bay from all floors.It was difficult for the taxi to find....but it is very close to the end of Haeundae beachThis is my favourite Jimjilbang depsite of it's old interior. You can have the best Busan night view on the top floor as well. Whenever I visit Busan this is one of the must-go place. The only word to describe it is "Cozy".Vesta was actually my first jimjilbang experience. It was a little tricky to find even tough I had google maps (there is an abandoned hotel closer to the water that looks sort of like this picture) and since the abandoned hotel is near the spa but the spa is higher up elevation wise, it sort of seems like google maps is pointing you to the abandoned place.It is worth the effort to find. It has views of the haeundae that are so stunning it is worth the admission price just to take in the view. They only sell beer here, which is $3 a can for Hite, slightly marked up than in town but not significantly so. I spent most of my time in the mens only area and don't consider myself much of a nude type of person. I am not in peak physical shape but felt very comfortable around the others. The reason I mention this is I read that white people tend to be looked at by Korean men out of curiosity since most white people in Korea are either there on business or there to teach english (neither category suites me) and I've read they look at your package and make people feel uncomfortable.Even though my body shape is quite different then most koreans, I did not feel anybody at any of the three jimjimbangs I visited spent even an additional second looking at me . Obviously I am out of place but aside from that it was common respect and politeness. Just don't expect much english or small talk.I ended up staying the night and sleeping in a 28c sauna. You might think, but that temps too low for a sauna, it was perfect for me.HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend a stop at Vesta. Also you can check out nearby Sharkys an awesome ex-pat bar run by some Californians. Theres a few sharkys in Busan but there is one near the Vesta Also this place has an outdoor tub, I'm not great with extreme heat be it via suana or hot tub, they ad an outdoor tub that was lukewarm in 13c weather, it was nice for a self described Canadian polar bear.Old interior but a nice set of public baths. Especially liked the jets of water which pounded against me in a nice massage. The public resting area is noisy with a lot of kids running around. The cleanliness of the water is debatable...Is a good experience as never been to a spa whereby we need to be "naked ". Kind of weird for me but good experience. Feel good when put on the clothing whereby u need to pay 10,000won. Just spa alone will be 6000 or 8000 won (can't rem ). But the food in the small cafe is nice. Thumbs up.Never been in public bath anywhere before but this first experience is something that very unique. Mens and women's separated into different level the natural hot tub is the best. After an hours or so in the hot and cold tubs, go for the Jimjilbang. Korean way to scrub the whole body. But keep in mind that you have to be totally naked to be in this facilities.

Name: 누리마루 APEC 하우스
Review: The nice thing about the place is how much history it holds while also having an amazing location overlooking natural greatness. The place is really grand and nice, and you can learn about the summit as you visit. It’s also in a location that allows you to visit many other spots while visiting it, which I found very convenient and nice~I really don't get the point of this APEC house. Why don't they do something nice with the building? It's a nice building, but they kept it exactly the same as at the time of the summit. Who cares what those leaders had for dinner back then, or who sat where during the meeting? Luckily it's free.The people of Busan are clearly proud of this venue but I found it hard to get excited over a building where the leaders of APEC's twenty one members signed the Busan Declaration way back in November 2005.The House was apparently built (at great expense !), specifically for the event. At the entrance is a panel of lacquer work, inlaid with mother of pearl and showing the 12 symbol of longevity !!Its on Camilla island as you walk around Heundae beach. Free to visit, you'll walk around the displays to understand its history.The building was at the top of a path that would have been too challenging for some but the Guide did not mention this. Attractively set overlooking the sea, the building was expensive to build so it is no surprise there was discontent with the original plan to take it down after the event.Worth a visit but it is a shame there was not more information provided on historical context.Out main goal was to walk around Dongbaek park, and we visited this site along the way. It's clear that the South Korean people are proud of the role they played on the national stage for this event.This is an elegant building with Korean touches round the supporting pillars. There is a beautiful picture at the entrance and the gardens surrounding it are lovely. The diamond bridge, the longest suspension bridge in Korea can be seen from here.If you enjoy the locations where global economics are discussed you will enjoy this visit. There is a Peace Garden, Conference room for events. The best part is the Photo Gallery and the meeting rooms as they were set up for the 2005 APEC summit. Admission is free and entrance is between 9:00 and 17:00.I came across this buy chance as I was walking from the beach. Built for the 2005 APEC conference the building gives an insight into the vast expense of hosting such an event. Inside you will get the opportunity to look at the meeting room where the leaders of APEC met and you also get to see memrobilia from the meeting. You will get some great views from the building across the bay and to the lighthouse. Certainly worth a quick visit and it is free.A nice place to see, walk and breath. This is the first time I come here but I like this green and this sea so much :)

Name: 신세계 갤러리
Location: 부산 해운대구 센텀남대로 35 신세계 백화점 센텀시티 6층 (우) 48058
Review: Случайно забрели сюда. Оказался вход свободным. Небольшая галерея, атмосферная. Все время меняются выставки.Сеть люксовых магазинов и  при них галерея, красивый интерьер в классическом стиле, хорошо проглятьсяНабрели на галерею случайно гуляя по магазинам. Помещение небольшое, хорошо освещенное. Вход бесплатный. Попали на выставку интересных ваз различных форм...더 보기

Name: 신세계 센텀시티 스파랜드
Review: When I go to Busan I usually go for the beaches and fresh food but this time I visited SPALAND and it's super worth it!! They have outdoor and indoor areas, hot springs, 13 (!!!) themed saunas, relaxing room, restaurant, etc. I could stay all day there <U+200D>♀<U+FE0F> My favorite part was the saunas, in the entrance of each one there are Information as temperature and effects in our body. I spent more time in "Body Sound Room", the nature theme and meditation song really made me relax I was not able to experience (extra $$$) but they also have professional therapists in SHIM SPA (herbs, oil and stones massages) and OXYSPA. <U+270C>> You pay W15,000 (weekdays), W18,000 (weekends) and can stay for 4 HOURS! If you pass it, W3,000 per hour. If you have time in your trip so Busan, it's worth to visit and relax after a tour day. I will definitely go again!!The most outstanding feature of Spaland would be the different rooms with varying degrees of hot and one ice room with cold to relax, meditate, receive mind and body/skin therapy. You can spend about 5 minutes in each of these to try their varying effects. The only complaint is inconsiderate users who chat loudly and discruot the peace and harmony but the administration conducts checks at stipulated times so they are aware of this.The onsen is good too except you must also shampoo your hair before going into their mainly sodium chloride heated pools so make sure it's your washing hair do before you go. Apart from this strictly enforced regulation, everything else is wonderful. The locker system(separate for shoes and clothes, bags) works efficiently and after your soak in the pools, you can use their body lotion and serums, drink warm/cold water and use the rest of the facilities, most free like the rooms (including relax room with TV) but chargeable for massage machines, snacks (the quintessential hardboiled eggs from Korean drama)!There are cafes and restaurants, separate spas of commercial brands, cosmetics and health are products in the entire building. You can spend your 4 hours happily here (early bird discounted rates for morning and late night sessions) ending probably with the outdoor footbaths where topcoats are thoughtfully provided for colder weather.The seafood soy soup is great. Variety of seafood, abalone, half crab, prawn, clams and mussel. Very reasonable considering it only cost 10000 won.Good place to experience Korean Spa. Its location is easily accessible by subway. But the staff at reception sucks with lousy atiitude.Really well done Jimjilbang (Korean Spa) experience. If you've never done one (like Wi Spa in LA) it really is worth it. Keep in mind you will need to be fully naked and showered to enter their excellent hot baths. But the best part is the area where you wear the pantaloons and shirt they provide and can enjoy the hot rooms that are peacefully coed. No nudity there.This spa was definitely the best Spa I have visited. It was extremely clean and many different options of different pools to try. The only thing that was not open when I visited was the outside baths, even more of s reason to return. Overall a fab place to relax and unwind, can highly recommend the scrub too!!It took about 20 minutes by taxi from busanjin market to here. There is direct train from here to seomyeon busan station when we finished shopping. So it is easy to get here by train too.We took taxi at busanjin cos we were not near any station and did not know how to get here from the market. So taxi was ok. The mall sells high end clothing, bags, etc. All international as well as local brands.The best park is the basement where it has many food stores. Just incredible. Most stores were korean, Japanese, Chinese, Western items. Unlike here we get really international food. We love the snacks like seoul roll, fish cakes, etc. You buy them then go into the marketplace (supermarket) to eat. There are some stores inside this marketplace selling korean delicacies.Then take one floor down you see a fashion street, mainly korean style.Then go yo 3rd floor to connect to centum city which is anotger smaller shopping mall. It has on ground floor selling discounted high end fashion like Kenzo, Burberry but still expensive after the discount like sin$800 and above.Undoubtedly the best place in the city to relax your mind. It is clean, well maintained. Best time to visit during winter. Quite expensive though but worth every pennyMy partner and I really enjoyed this spa in Busan. The location was centrally located, and the spa was very clean. Most of the staff could speak English and/or there were English signs explaining what to do if you've never been to a Korean spa before. We enjoyed the separate pools, and the areas open to both sexes, too. Plus, the smoothies in the cafe were delicious!I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Busan.This spa is super clean and super large !I came here on rainny day which was perfect spa day. I spent 4 hours that was given for maximum stay. I would come back again.

Name: 송정 해수욕장
Review: Randomly booked Hotel Laon and when I arrived and initially saw the view from my hotel room, a smile spread across my face. What a view of such a pretty beach. This is what you call a secluded beach especially visiting this beach during the off peak season. Every morning you would see a handful of surfers catching the waves. Waking up to see the sunrise was amazing. This beach is served by the over ground train and can be a trek to go to see some of the sights in busan but is nearby to via the overground and subway station to Haeundae beach which is the more popular beach. Ten minute walk to the closest train station. And a minute walk from Hotel Laon was this place that did fabulous french toast. All in all I was a happy bunny.We stayed at Hotel Carib, which gave us a perfect view of the many surfers who were out doing their thing every day....I loved it! True, it's maybe not the best place for really swimming, but for a great view and just dipping your toes in the sea, you really can't beat it!While Australian tourists might be underwhelmed by the wave sizes in Korea, Songjeong is a beautiful beach in its own right and the best for breaking waves on a windy day! Picturesque best describes the view on a blue sky day. Well worth a stop if you are heading north to Haedong Yonggung Temple.Song Jeong is an awesome spot, especially early in the morning. My favorite beach in Busan to visit especially when the sun is rising. It's quiet and the few surfers out there are having a great time. During the day, the traffic gets heavier so parking takes time, but there's food stalls, surf shops, coffee shops, seafood and the beach to make up for that inconvenience. Definitely recommended as a tour / hang out spot.Good hotels, good cafes at the beach and good and inexpensive restaurants in the neigbourhood. The beach is much less crowded than Heaundae and quite pleasant for sleeping or having fun with little kids.But the rule on guarded beaches in Busan is no swimming beyond buoys that are chest-deep during the high tide and below-the-waist deep during the low tide, so you basically cannot go more than ca 30 meters away from the shore. It's strongly enforced by many lifeguards, you hear their whistles almost permanently. After swimming there and back again and again along the buoys, constantly pestered by the lifeguards, because you're too near to them and kicking the sand in shallow water, you'll get annoyed soon.It is also prohibited to enter the water after 6 PM. Not to swim, they'll kick you out when you're walking knee-deep along the shore.And that surely weren't bad weather rules, those rules apply all the time.If you want to have fun in the sea, just don't go to Busan beaches. They won't let you have it.Here is a more quiet beach and beautiful as you expect it to be on a weekend getaway.Sunny day needed to see the beauty of the water and sand tho.I was there on a Sunday/Monday, and it was not crowded at all.its a surfer beach but dont expect waves, that's for beginners.Its still quiet at night, couples and family are coming Some good seafood restaurants, cheap and great hotel (I recommend Songjeong Marina Resort) nice view of the beach.The sunrise at the hotel was breathtaking.If you spend 2 nights there, I can assure you that you would feel disconnected.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for at least a night as it is far from everything else but its worth itI will come back for sure someday !I come from a country that has many vast natural beautiful beaches, so this looks small but well maintained with many facilities for the beach goer. Overall, there is nothing special about it.The beach is great for swimming during the summer months, and it is full of places to eat and dine and have coffee with friends all year around. It is very open sea beach, so you feel nature around, and surrounded by buildings where all sercvices are provided. So close to Busan and as good as the city.Nice quiet beach (off season) to enjoy the sea breeze and watch the surfers . Surfers are out there any time of the year and there are some small coffee shop to relax . Worth the visit as this is only a 10-15 mins drive from Haeundae beach . Highly recommended for people who like more natural surroundings .A beautiful place ruined by weekend beach goers leaving their rubbish. Lovely walks at the temple hill end. Lovely old ladies selling their home grown greens early in the morning in the street. Nice places to eat near the reserve road off the beach.

Name: APEC나루공원
Review: We went here on a shore excursion before traveling to the Buddhist Sea Temple. We couldn’t go in to the APEC House, but the walkway to the House and back is very scenic with lots of nice views. It is an easy walk.Nice walk where you could enjoy some sculptures. Not much to see. Could easily do this in 1hrs. But a nice free activity.Gardens and position on the coast make this a serene and beautiful place for time out from the city hustle and bustle. Very Pleasant Place.I had I great walk from Park Hyatt about 10 minutes.Nice place to see,a beautiful park around ,all the way to Haeundae Beach.This is a great place for a hike, walk or a place to take a photo.  The museum is a pretty cool attraction z to boot!!Visited here on a beautiful and warm fall weekday. The park is a beautiful place with wonderful views of the city skyline, the bridge, the beach, and the sea. Not many people here when I visited which gave it a calm feeling. I imagine it is quite busy on the weekend and in the high season. The APEC building is really cool too. Definitely a place to visit.Beautiful park by the beach. Need some stamina to walk up and around the park due to its lush ground . Place was clean and well kept. APEC house was historical. The lighthouse was great. Took many beautiful photos.Nice spot , nice surroundigs , with a historic background.Nice view but you miss nothing if you do not go to that placeThe park is really an attractive one, but not a great one. It is large and easy to walk (however, it can be too long for any in your group with mobility issues) in an hour or so. The key attraction is the APEC building--a well designed and interesting structure from the outside. The inside tour is OK, but not informative as one would like. It is a bit too "touristy" for us.The water and city views are beautiful. The architecture of the city is OUTSTANDING. It is hard to believe that they have as many great buildings as they have. The views form the park really show them off to grab your attention. There are lots of photo opportunities.To sum it up, we would not do this again, but it is a good trip to have a nice "walk in the park" along with some great views of the city--as well as the water. Once is enough!Building not of special interest unless you are history buff but nice walks around and views of beach. Not to go out of way for.

Name: 벡스코
Review: we easily seated and parked 3,000 people in one of its hallshuge with a decent sound systembit older and some of the halls made me think of a more communist-era large & empty structures, purpose-built to hold zillions of people rather than for comfortbuilding 1 is the original bexco, while building 2 is the newer oneremember, those are not interlinked and you need to know which one you are going to to tell your taxi driver!This is a great conference and exhibition complex. Everything works and it is very easy to get around. I spent five days here and appreciated the amenitiesAttended the AfDB Annual meetings. Great facilities as expected of an International Convention Centre.This is a large meeting area where conventions are held. Located with good access to the metro and public bus service.Attended a 3-day conference here. Easily accessible by various public transports, I tried both Metro & bus (can't remember which number but straight, single route from Huendae beach). Wifi's good. Huge conference hall.I would recommend Bexco only if you have seen everything else Busan has to offer. The site offers stunning views of the mountains/Visited KorMarine 2017 last October and appreciated the well-marked areas for visitors. Make sure to catch an amazing view of the mountains as the backdrop of the exhibition hall.exhibition centre with many booths to visit.fast bus shuttle service from the hotels.good coffee shops.close to lunch venues and cinemas.The event was over 2000 people and the organization was very good. The locals were very helpfull and the place clean.It is modern and has a nice architecture.Had the opportunity to visit BEXCO to attend Raillog 2017.It is a good place to attend exhibitions and conventions for professional in their relevant fields. Since 5-star hotels are walking distance from BEXCO therefore, one has access to a verity of excellent food.

Name: 신세계 백화점 센텀시티
Review: As the largest shopping mall in the world it's huge, sparkling clean and upmarket with designer outfits and accessories but moderate-priced in the restaurants on the 9th floor and the Food Hall in the basement.We had lunch at the traditional restaurant Gaejung, ordered the Jeonju style bibimbap and the seafood stew with soft tofu. Delicious, kind and warm service, value for money. There 's even a water dispenser near the lifts in this super-store.There' s a kind of Jurasic Park for children on the 9th floor before you come to the restaurants.Worth a few visits even if you're not a real shopper, you can get organic fruits and vegetables in the supermarket and try the lovely snack foods, skewers of meat, fishcakes, nut chips, buns and bakery goods which all look appetising and well-prepared. The cafes offer gourmet coffee and innovatjve dishes, Western as well as Korean.It was suggested by the hotel staff to go check out this gigantic department store. It's very well kept. The 9th floor park is a great place. The view is awesome. Unfortunately I couldn't find any halal products or food here.Super clean, modern and exclusive shops. everyone was so friendly and helpful. Plenty of parking easy to get access.Our tour guide took us to this Mall for lunch and then a walk through some of the the duty free shops. I’m almost sure we went up at least 5 sets of escalators and we could still see more ahead. Our lunch was at a buffet restaurant and the food did not disappoint. The few stores we visited were all priced like home. I liked the cleanliness and open atmosphere of the place, but merchandise wise, it is not worth struggling with extra luggage, when you can get the same items at home. Just checked off as having visited one of the largest shopping malls.Supposedly the World's Largest Department Store...well it is big and has a lot of stores, movie theater, ice skating rink, etc. Why would you come here? To see a big place with a lot of people. Again, a lot of people so only come here if you really need to go shopping. Otherwise, the best part is the food court in the basement with a ton of different cuisines and desserts.We grabbed a bite for lunch at the counter of a noodle spot and tried to copy the locals. Great experience and great lunch. Had a quick tour around the mall- saw the Guiness Book of World Records certificate, went on the escalators, got a Starbucks Busan mug and checked out the skating rink. Neat spot for a quick lunch and visit- I wouldn't spend too much time here as a tourist.So huge and nice with many choices to shop and even nice to walk around in there! Even has a nice vr experience that you should definitely try!~Huge Department Store, very easy to reach by underground train, staff friendly and helpful, but unless you are a Designer fan and prepared to pay the exorbant prices at one of the many Designer stores, you are out of luck. The selection of non-designer clothes, shoes, etc. are very uninspiring, floor upon floor of the exact same clothes, very boring and dissapointing. The Food Court is ok, the Ice Rink nice to see, the Cinema absolutely modern, these are the best things about the place. Not worth a second visit.This was a ridiculously large shopping mall. I know of no other mall that packs all the following into one building: a rooftop playground (known as Zooraji) filled with dinosaurs statues and playground structures, a golf driving range, an ice rink, a massive spa complex (Spaland) and tons of shopping.Besides the above, the downstairs basement floors contained the food market (consisting of another very large assortment of food and drinks) and a pharmacy.For all the people in the mall that day, the staff do a very good job maintaining the displays and the overall condition of the building. Prices in general were a bit on the pricey side so we just window shopped.The Guinness Book of World Records certificate was located next to the main information desk on the first floor.Overall a good place to keep anyone in the family occupied or entertained.This is review is specifically for the restaurant DimDimSum upstairs (not in the downstairs food court). There were a few restaurants upstairs (Korean, Chinese, Japanese and possibly Italian?) and it was much more relaxed and quiet up there than in the food court madhouse. We ordered dim sum with shrimp & scallop, shrimp, duck with choi sum and noodles, and stuffed eggplant. Everything was scrumptious and the staff were very kind and polite. Afterward we ventured downstairs and were ecstatic to find Kinotoya Cheese Tarts in the food court. They also had them in the Lotte Department Store in Myeongdong. Yay!

Name: 해운대 달맞이길
Review: Enjoyed the hike along the coastline with beautiful view of the ocean. The trail is fairly easy and has a few exit and rest area overlooking the ocean. Cherry blossoms can be seen all along the pathway at Dalmaji Hill when in season.If you’re visiting Busan, especially the Haeundae Beach area visiting Dalmaji is a welcome break. On the northern side of Haeundae Beach is a beautiful set of hiking trails, cafes, and restaurants. Hugging the rocky coastline you will find historic trees and sweeping views of...더 보기Great views of the ocean and surrounding area. Can be a peaceful walk as most people can't handle the hill so it won't be crowded until you get to the top.Going in between seasons without the blossoms was a mistake. The road was too long for me to squeeze into...더 보기A nice walk along Dalmaji Road and it leads to Haeundae Beach. The cherry blossom was very pretty at end...더 보기Pretty spot for pictures, but the best part to me was a short hike on the Moontanroad trail which makes...더 보기Seaside views and really pretty views. We passed by this on the BUTI bus and if time permits can spend...더 보기We drove by and stopped for pictures, there were cherry blossoms galore. If we had more time, it would have...더 보기Nice little spot in the city where the cherry blossoms bloom each year. There are some nice walking paths as...더 보기The coffee shops here can offer a fantastic view of the ocean, and for a steep price, get the cake,...더 보기

Name: 파라다이스 면세점
Review: 他の方も書かれていますが、現在は「新世界免<U+7A0E>店」になっています。立て替えたばかりなのか、中は非常に綺麗です。<U+58F2>り場面積は<U+5E83>く、ブランドから韓<U+56FD>土産まで一通り<U+63C3>っています。空路の他、福岡から船でも日本人が多く<U+6765>ることもあり、<U+58F2>り子さんはみなさん日本語が堪能です。ただ、お金の計算など、少<U+3005>トロい方が多いのとはっきり言ってお土産品は高いです。韓<U+56FD>の大<U+4F53>の免<U+7A0E>店では、購入時の割引とかスタ<U+30FC>バックスの利用券、特に<U+6765>店しただけでシ<U+30FC>トマスクやクリアファイルといったプレゼントが貰える大特典があります。免<U+7A0E>品も豊富ですが、特典だけでも貰えちゃって、お得なので是非いってみてください。<U+9045>くなりましたが、2017年8月にパラダイスホテルに泊まりました。向かって右側にあったパラダイス免<U+7A0E>店はなくなりました。現在は、パラダイスカジノになっています。新世界デパ<U+30FC>トに移動したようです。お店が無いので、星1つ<U+70BA>替も好くなく、セ<U+30FC>ル期間でもなく、人通りもまばらで購買意欲をそそられる要素が何もなく素通りしてきました。昨年よりの円安で日本人にとってお買い得感は薄れましたが良質な物が<U+4E26>んでいます。買い物客もあまり多くないのでゆったりと買い物を<U+697D>しめるのもいいですね。VIPカ<U+30FC>ドを作って割引とポイントをGET。地下<U+9244>よりも、釜山<U+99C5>方面と西面地<U+533A>方面をめぐる無料シャトルバスの利用が便利です。プサン市<U+5185>の<U+99C5>から無料シャトルバスが出ています。海雲台地<U+533A>から<U+6B69>いて回れます。免<U+7A0E>店では、ギフトがもらえ、シルバ<U+30FC><U+4F1A>員になれます。2015年 1月1日以降、海雲台行きのシャトルバスは<U+5EC3>止になっています。西面<U+30FB>中央洞間のみとなっていますので、ご注意ください。パラダイスホテルに宿泊しましたので、同じ敷地<U+5185>にあり、化粧品を買いに行くのに便利でした。地下１階はお土産品<U+30FB><U+96D1>貨、１階は海外ブランドがあります。ティファニ<U+30FC>は、釜山ではこちらの免<U+7A0E>店のみで販<U+58F2>されています。2階は化粧品<U+30FB>香水、3階はメンズです。全<U+4F53>的に空いていますので見やすいのですが、品<U+6570>が少ないのか、ロッテ免<U+7A0E>店にはあるのにこちらには無いという物もありました。<U+5E83><U+3005>と快適にお買い物ができる免<U+7A0E>店です。釜山市<U+5185>から無料のシャトルバスも出ていて、1時間ほどで海雲台まで<U+6765>ることができます。韓<U+56FD>のコスメ、チ<U+30FC>プコスメも充<U+5B9F>していて、セット割などもあって便利。<U+89B3>光客の減少のために、無料シャトルバスを今年から<U+5EC3>止したみたいです。<U+6765>るたびに感じるのが、購入意欲の現象です。品<U+63C3>えが<U+60AA>い感じがずっとしています。名前が<U+5909>わっています。無料シャトルバスが釜山<U+99C5>のいくつかのホテルから巡回しています。ブランド物が多く、タバコ酒などはあまりありません。

Name: SEA LIFE 부산 아쿠아리움
Review: Like all aquariums this had a wide range of sealife but it seemed more lively with children's show and feeding times etc. It is well laid out and a lot of funTo me this aquarium was quite disappointing. The interior is very cheesy. Almost everything is catered towards kids. Most tanks...더 보기Some of the exhibits are excellently put forward, but most are done for the young to like. Over 75% are...더 보기This is not the place to go to learn about the wonderful, fascinating, astounding life of sea creatures. This is a tacky theme park pandering to the most base instincts of people with an interest in only one kind of animal...themselves. The beautiful fish here...더 보기This aquarium is located right on the main beach and very easy to find it. A family place where you can entertain everyone.더 보기Quite a sad excuse for an aquarium. It has plenty of species, and some of the tanks are well put together, but the larger tanks are nowhere large enough for the sharks housed there. It’s also very overpriced. Very disappointing indeed더 보기The aquarium is quite big and houses a lot of different species, but if you've been to any of the European aquariums, e.g. the one in Barcelona, you won't be that impressed. The interactive features there are all in Korean but international children might be...더 보기One of the most impresssive Aquarium I have ever visited. It would be quite suitable with parents with kids or group of friends or couples. Many undersea unique species would make you feel joyful and amazing. I highly recommend to visit aroud 5.30 pm everyday...더 보기We went later in the day towards closing, so we missed all the shows/extra stuff to do. But walking the aquarium alone was great. Well set up and laid out. Went through 3 levels of nicely set up aquariums with various species with explanations. There...더 보기Not impressed at all..have been to many much nicer and bigger aquariums...what kind of aquarium has a fashion section? Really crowded and Koreans are just rude and run over your feet with strollers and consrantly run into you amd don't even acknowledge it더 보기

Name: 송악산
Review:
Visited on 17th October 2019.
If you going with friend it would be great.
A relax mini hiking walk along the breezy turquoise sea.
It's a must go. Nice place to take photo too.Mostly domestic tourists here. This hour-long hike offers both idyllic and dramatic views of the Songaksan volcanic craters and the open ocean. Walk on right till the end to make a complete loop journey, so that you won't miss the breathtaking, almost vertical volcanic crater...더 보기We hiked round the coastal route of the mountain in April and took an hour and a half to compete...더 보기One can go for a hike or just sit near the shore and enjoy the view. Along the coastline one...더 보기That means during a sunny day, you can see as far as the Halla mountain. And also the various geological formations around the sea. A nice hike which will take about 1.5 hours but you can just take a walk. By the way, the area...더 보기My husband and I are in our 60's and the hike was fairly easy.  The views were amazing.  You can...더 보기Songaksan was one of the places that had actually a very small crowd of tourists so it make the hike...더 보기Songaksan offers an easy 3km walk around it's perimeter, most of which is along its cliff (facing the waters). There...더 보기It is a place to visit if you visit Jeju Island. In particular, we recommend trekking around Songak Mountain. You...더 보기Nice hiking and walk for the great views. We managed to complete the hiking route round the mountain in about...더 보기

Name: 약천사
Review: It was not on our itinerary but our driver suggested to stop for a visit as we were passing by.It was a pleasant surprise since we had no expectations for this place. Beautiful temple with nice views of the sea. If we had time, we would attempt a hike from the temple as it is the beginning of an Olle trail.Yakcheonsa Temple is a famous Buddhist Templet located in Jeju island south of mainland Korea. The temple was built in 1981 by a Buddhist monk . It has three floors It has a large Buddhist prayer hall. It is also famous for housing, 80,000 Buddhas all located on the second floor encased in glass. It also has smaller statue of Buddha surrounded by lotus flowers under a pair of intricately carved, protective dragons. The view from the top floor is veryy beaytiful facing the seaOne of the checklist in Jeju, It is free and beautiful spot to take picture. You should definitely visitNice gardens, impressive location, however, normally a lot of people, busloads full. So it is preferable there early in the morning or late in the afternoon.A beautiful Temple which is in a serene location. With virtually any tourist to be seen, I could enjoy the calm and peace the place had to offer. The temple itself is a huge structure and very well maintained.While visiting a friend who works in Jeju, my family drove around to visit places casually with a flexible schedule. We planned to visit the temple for half an hour but stayed more than an hour. The name of the temple means medical spring and the flowing water from a 3-dragon-head fountain next to the temple store tasted good and sweet. Although the temple was built for only around 20 years, the buildings and layout followed the traditional design. The main building faces exact south that can view the sea. The bell tower is located in the east for sunrise and the drum tower is located in the west for sunset. The main building's first floor wooden windows are beautifully carved with inspiring stories covered by traditional white paper but not glass. There is a traditional Korean painting exhibition of Buddha of Compassion in the basement and it's gorgeous. The best part of our visit was that not many people around. We got the chance to enjoy the quietness and even used the mats inside the temple at the back of the first floor to meditate a short while. There are grapefruit trees in the yards along the way to bathroom.One of the larger temples we visited in Jeju. Beautiful well tended grounds and architecture. There is a bus stop right outside the temple which is handy!When we went, no tourists where there. It was a magical experience, I definitely recommend it. You should sit on the stairs, outside the temple, listen to the buddhist praying, and enjoy the moment.A beautiful architecture Buddhist Temple. Surrounded by tangerines trees. Come and see for yourself. =)Temple is nice design and along our walk, we found many tangerines tree which I believe during the spring season, the temple view will be good. Since It's FOC do drop by if you have time. It's along the way to Teddy Bear Museum and Cheonjeyon Fall, Yeomiji Botanical Garden

Name: 중문 색달 해변
Review: This beach is recommended by all as a "best beach on Jeju".I'm disagree, mostly absolutely.The Jungmun is perfect and ideal and best beach on Jeju for surfers only! And there are pretty overcrowded by them even in September. Waves are good there for beginners and middle surfers (at the moment I've been there).For swimming and relaxing is better to choose other beaches, for example Hyeopjae Beach and few other.Jeju has many beautiful beaches and Jungmun is definitely one of them! Great place to see huge waves and surfers in action. You can go up to the cliff top for that aerial view of the beach.We stayed at Benikea Jungmun Hotelon not very far walking distance from this beach. In the early morning or late afternoon are especially the best time to enjoy the beach, not very crowded during these times of the day. There's a special section for swimmers, however it's not too small. There is a changing a showering conveniently close, it is just beside the beach so that made it easy to prepare, and have a shower after the swim. An amazing beach!!We stayed in a resort on walking distance from this beach. Especially early in the morning the waves are good. Quite a bunch of surf school offer lessons and boards for hire. There's a special section for swimmers, however this is much too small.Everything ok here, except swimming is confined to a narrow area to the side, where are the swimmers are squeezed into a small area.Small, but great little beach. We didn't get much time here as we were on a tight schedule for our business trip, but we had enough time for a half hour swim. There were many surfers and the water was perfect. There were many people at the beach but it was not crowded. The beach slopes very gently into the ocean, so even 20, 30 feet out you're barely to your shoulders. Nice low waves, so a great place to just chill and have a leisurely swim. There was a changing/showering place conveniently just beside the beach so that made it easy to change and be ready to go again. Lovely little spot.My return to Jungmun, after almost seventeen years, revealed that not much had changed. This is not surprising, as the main draw of the place is its steep and jagged volcanic rock formations. The Hyatt Regency and other resort amenities were there in the 1980's, when we lived on Jeju. The concessions at beachside are still the charming "Mom and Pop" establishments, serving ice cream and Korean pastries, plus Yogurt beverages.Favourite surf spot in KoreaFriendly people and nice vibes on the beachBeautiful sunset and chill all day long, also the cliffs are fabulous SURFERS are great !I would not go out of my way to try to swim here. But it is pretty and interesting next to the cliff. Water, bathrooms, and other services not available when we were there but it was off season so maybe there's something there during the summer. The stairs up the cliff will kick your butt.Before flying to Jeju-do (island) many of my friends suggested me to do a one day jeju tour that completes the island in one day. But I'm the type of person to enjoy my vacation slowly. Although, the island is not that big, I wanted to enjoy every bit and detail of the island. I choose to focus on one area at a time. Three months before my trip I researched top 5 beaches in Jeju. After researching, I decided my hotel and location place where to spend my vacation. I choose Seogwipo, end of Jeju. The hotel I stayed in was Grand Mer Hotel. I stayed 3 nights there, it was a new hotel and the best part was it was across the ocean. You can wake up to the view of the Jungmun beach. Which was listed top beach in Jeju. It's a little far out so you'll need to rent a car. Shopping and museums and hiking was 10 mins drive away. But the view was spectacular and my morning walk was so refreshing. If your ever in Seogwipo you have to try Hawaiian Shrimp restaurant which was 15 mins away from my hotel

Name: 한라산 국립공원
Review: We went to Hallasan NP in early November by ourselves. It’s quite easy to take the bus to the park. Just make sure you know which stop to get off as there are several entrances. We decided to hike the shortest trail (1.3km). It begins at the Hallasan National Park Visitor Centre and finishes atop Eoseungtaeng Oreum, with sweeping views of the Jeju plains and the peak of Hallasan. The leaves are very beautiful along the trail. With our age, being seniors, and photo stops, it took us one hour to get up to the top. Definitely it worths the hike!Our visit was postponed for a day but it was worth the wait. There was a heavy snowstorm a couple of days prior and the roads to Hallasan National Park were closed. When access to the park was restored, a beautiful blanket of snow was awaiting.It was my first experience of snow and I loved it. I came from a tropical country (where the coldest temperature ever recorded was at 6 degrees Celsius) so experiencing snow is a surreal experience. Although we did not climb any trail to the summit, experiencing snow even just outside the Visitor Center was fun and pleasurable. The Jeju Snow Festival for 2018-2019 did not include the Visitor Center at Hallasan National Park, however, unlike the previous year so there were no attractions set up in the area.Because of this, I am going back to South Korea this coming December for another winter wonderland experience and to try out skiing.An UNESCO Biosphere Reserve and a World Heritage Site, the Hallasan National Park is loaded with walking trails and is home to South Korea’s highest mountain named the Shield Volcano Hallasan. You’ll find about 1800 different kinds of plants and a number of alpine animals along the way up. The park is a unique place for nature lovers. Settled right in the heart of Jeju island, this park with high density woods and blooming hillsides is concidered as a treat to be at. Transportation: start with chosing a right trail for you. There many different ways up to the mountain, but only one of them will bring you to the summit. To get to the entrance you’d probably need to take one of the public busses or rent a car. Both options are convenient. Equipment: You’d definitely need to be prepared for a long and tiring walk. All the trails are devided into segments, based on their difficulty. Some of the parts of the trail would be paved, some wouldn’t be equipped at all. You’d be grateful for those parts where you’d be able to walk and step on the wooden bridges and paths. But except those short and the easiest parts of the way, you’d need to climb on the steep and narrow rocks, hop along cobblestones and boulders. Timing: don’t rush, remember when you’re on the top, that was only a half of your journey. There is the same long way down the mountain when you’re on the summit. Tips: be prepared for considerable change of the temperature and other weather conditions. We started in a pleasant sunny day and finished when it was drizzling and the fog was literally embracing us. Add up some wind and decreased temperature and you’re almost in our shoes out there. You’d definetely need to wear tracking boots or something alike, protecting and supporting your feet well. Otherwise you risk hurting your ankles and knees. (as us, cause we were not prepared)You’d also want to change your clothes after 6-7 hours tracking up and down this mountain. Believe me you’ll be sweating af.If there is only one thing I can do during my travel in Jeju, it would be hiking at the Hallasan National Park. There were just 2 trails (Seongpanak & Gwaneumsa, where Seongpanak was easier) which can reach the top of the mountain, where you can see the Baengnokdam. You can even get a certificate (which costs only KRW1000) of climbing the Hallasan if you show the staff at the tourist centre your picture with Baengnokdam.A difficult one if you choose to do the longest one which takes 4.5 hrs up and 4 hrs down.We went up the Eorimok trail which took us 2 n half hours up..its not an easy trak with steps and rocky path but the track has been laid with a lot of effort.In autumn the trees start to turn their colours .We came down the yeongsil trail which took us one hour to come down with spectac views..its an easier way to climb down than to climb up the yongsil trail.Bus 240 goes and come back at both stops with the entrance name as the stop names.But while from Eiromok entrance it's just a 10 mins walk up to the start of the trail.....its 45 mins walk to walk to the yeongsil entrance bus stop to the start of the trail.There are no tkts entrance for the hikes,but if you have rented a car then there is a parking fees.Carry some food to eat and energy bars and water n juice.We took one walk here. Vertical rise of about 200m through nature. A couple of hours of hiking & stopping to view the plants & birds. Great view of the crater from the top. Worth the trek. Carry lots of water if it hot!There are several trials to explore and because of time limitation, have chosen the shortest one and the hike of 2.5 hours is rewarding. Air is fresh and can image the autumn maple leaves will be wonderful.I took the eorimok trail which took about 2.5 hours to get to the top with the rest rooms, the first part of the trek is hard work and quite strenuous. After reaching the top I took the yeongsil trail back down which had some of the most stunning views along the way. As I came by bus the walk down from the yeongsil trail to the yeongsil ticket office where the bus stop is located takes another 40minuts or so depending on the pace. I Would highly recommend visiting this area and trying the trails.Took the longest trail to Mount Hallasan peak (Seongpanak Trail) - 9.6 km - but started a bit late and did not make the cut-off time at the Jindalrae shelter (7km). However it was a great walk and I visited the Saraoream peak on a side tril on the way back. This was well worth it as there is great view and also a beautiful crater lake. It is key that you start early and take enough water with you. Also need good shoes. Although it was August - most of the trail is in the forest - so not so hot.choose to get up by soegpanak trail and down by another trail， Gwaneumsa, which much more harder and shorter. Manage to complete the hiking for 7 hours

Name: 성산 일출봉
Review: The short hike is easy with stairs. I went up for sun rise and sunset. The view is magnificent. There are convenience stores CU and GS25 nearby, but GS25 is further. The CU is not opened so early for sunrise hike and its staff is rather unfriendly though. Overall, I would hike again Seongsan ilchulbong if I visit Jeju again.<U+05DE><U+05E7><U+05D5><U+05DD> <U+05DE><U+05D4><U+05DE><U+05DE><U+05DD> <U+05D1><U+05D9><U+05D5><U+05E4><U+05D9><U+05D5> , <U+05DC><U+05D0> <U+05E2><U+05DC><U+05D9><U+05E0><U+05D5> <U+05E2><U+05D3> <U+05DC><U+05DE><U+05E2><U+05DC><U+05D4> <U+05DB><U+05D9> <U+05D4><U+05EA><U+05E2><U+05DE><U+05E7><U+05E0><U+05D5> <U+05D1><U+05D7><U+05D5><U+05E3> <U+05D4><U+05E9><U+05D7><U+05D5><U+05E8> , <U+05DC><U+05DE><U+05D9> <U+05E9><U+05DB><U+05DE><U+05D5><U+05E0><U+05D9> <U+05DC><U+05D0> <U+05E8><U+05D0><U+05D4> <U+05D1><U+05D7><U+05D9><U+05D9><U+05DD> <U+05D7><U+05D5><U+05E3> <U+05E9><U+05D7><U+05D5><U+05E8> <U+05D0><U+05D6> <U+05D6><U+05D4> <U+05DE><U+05D2><U+05E0><U+05D9><U+05D1> <U+05DE><U+05D0><U+05D5><U+05D3> <U+05DC><U+05D3><U+05E2><U+05EA><U+05D9> <U+05D5><U+05D0><U+05D7><U+05DC><U+05D4> <U+05DE><U+05E7><U+05D5><U+05DC> <U+05DC><U+05EA><U+05DE><U+05D5><U+05E0><U+05D5><U+05EA> <U+05E1><U+05D4><U+05DB> <U+05E9><U+05D5><U+05D5><U+05D4> <U+05DC><U+05D4><U+05D2><U+05D9><U+05E2> <U+05DC><U+05D4><U+05E1><U+05EA><U+05D5><U+05D1><U+05D1> <U+05D5><U+05DC><U+05D4><U+05E0><U+05D5><U+05EA> <U+05DE><U+05D4><U+05E0><U+05D5><U+05E3> .爬漢拿山難度有點高，決定退而其求次登上城山日出峰頂。付上5,000韓<U+571C>入票門票，花上約半小時，便抵達180米高的城山日出峰頂。往峰頂沿途雖然有點曲折，但大部<U+4EFD>是木樓梯和有平台拍照，難度不高。峰頂景色一望無際，山景、城景和海景盡入眼廉。下山是連綿不斷、較垂直的木樓梯，不用十分鐘便到達出口。This place is very popular in Jeju for climbing mountain and see natural beauty from the top. Highly recommended.Troch<U+0119> schodow do pokonania, pi<U+0119>kne widoki. Warto było si<U+0119> zm<U+0119>czy<U+0107>, wej<U+015B>cie na szczyt wulkanu bardzo wygodne, była ładna pogoda wi<U+0119>c było co podziwia<U+0107>My wife and I visited Ilchulbong at 5 pm, and unfortunately, couldn't catch the women divers in action. We made it to the top and it was quite a steep climb. We were completely winded by the time we reached the peak which has a beautiful viewing deck. The moon was up on one side while the sun was setting on the other side. It was our last day in Jeju and Korea and the beautiful sunset against the skyline of Jeju was the perfect ending we could have asked for.Beautiful sloppy landscape by seashore, wonderful crispy fresh air, women divers hub, worth to visit!Going out is fun, coming down is easy. My 5 yrs old enjoy so much. The view is impressive but the parking is limited그냥 그랬네요 생각보다 사람은 별로 없었는데 일출할때 가면 뭐가 좀 다르려나요?전 낮에 갔거든요 산책수준은 아니고 운동한다 치고 5천원내고 한바퀴는 돌만합니다.Несложный оборудованный подъем на невысокий вулканический конус будет полностью вознагражден очень красивыми видами, открывающимися постепенно в процессе подъема и при достижении вершины пика.

Name: 용머리 해안
Review: We had a wonderful time, enjoying the beautiful rock formations. Great place to take pretty photos. The climb down on the rocky rocks can be a challenge but the reward is well worth it. Some ahjumas are selling their catch of fresh seafood too. Place may be closed if it is high tide.If you are on the west end of the island you should definitely see this wonderful place. And, if you are lucky enough to see a few 'women divers' selling their fresh seafood (and you have a stomach for unusual and raw seafood) you should try this unusual treat. They will also sell you a shot of Suju if you need it!Visited on 19th October 2019.Check before departing because it's often close due to high tide.Unforgettable experience there with stunning spot to take photo.A must visit. Enjoy!!Pretty interesting coastal erosion processes and fantastic landforms. This is a relatively easy short walk along the coast. Be careful, however, if you're bringing kids or elderly person - the rock trail can get rather slippery and some parts will see you getting very close to the sea and waves.Great scenic spot with narrow shelf or rock at the base of cliffs which were part of an old volcano. We visited on a day of high wind and rough seas and the site was closed as the path was too dangerous. was able to visit the climate exhibition centre and see the model of the Dutch Ship De Sperwer wrecked hundreds of years ago. Also took the walk up the hill to the beacon tower.It's a beautiful place for you to admire the view and take IG photo. If you're good in photo shooting, you might be able to trick people that you're in Grand Canyon.Really enjoyed the walk around the coastal, all the rock formation is awesome. We walked around from the shipwreck and back again to the same spot. If you love nature, this place is a must.Just a dead volcano mount. Nothing special. Weather there i good for rest. Maybe good place to view sunriseOdd yet beautiful layers of rock formation. Frequent beating of waves and wind carve a character into the coast. Including the side profile of a crying man. Perhaps our fav spot throughout our stay.There was nothing much to see here and we got pretty bored almost as soon as we got there. Go elsewhere with more stuff to see/do when you're in Jeju.

Name: 신화테마파크
Review: Shinhwa Theme Park is unique in many ways. First, it tries to make its own characters seems as popular as Mickey Mouse and Spider Man - it doesn’t work but it’s great fun just trying to figure out who is who. Second, everything seems brand new - so it’s spotless and at the same standards as a Disneyland or Universal Studios. Third - the rides are small but oh so knock out fun. And there is rarely anyone there. I don’t know if they sell a fast pass but there is no need for one because i don’t ever imagine it getting that crowded. The food was quite delicious, too - great offerings at multiple locations. You can easily do this park in a half day and not feel like your exhausted or missing anything. Like everything in Jeju, I think they think they are expanding but who knows.. and as i remember, the entry price is super affordable. So, this is really a great time for anyone with kids or who enjoys theme parks. Don’t go in thinking it’s Disneyland, though, and get picky - just enjoy it for what it is...a bold effort to start something special and first class and doing very well right from the start. It was a great day for me and my daughter and her two cousins. Enjoy!Nice place for young kids is best. Not really good for adults but it was cute......will try water park next time.This is a hood visit in Jeju.Our family visit jeju in June 2019.We visit jeju city for three days , then go to Shinhwa world for another days.Hello, went there on a family trip with our small kids on children's day. Overall ok, not so crowed as expected, nice park and arrangement. However here some points which should be improved:1. Ticket price is 39.000 KRW for adult and 29.000 KRW, which is too high for what is offered (still construction ongoing). Price should be reduced during construction time to attract more tourist. There should be family tickets with reduced price. 2. Bump Tube Car in New Oscar World. Its not mentioned on the map/guide and even worst its not free! You have to pay extra 5.000 KRW for adult (any maybe even more for kids) but nobody explained to you, nothing was mentioned on a board. When you think you can take the tube car, the staff ask for your ticket. So you wait 15 min, then have to buy a ticket and line up again. Poor communication and every parents were very angry but had to pay because their child already lined up and wanted to take trip tube car. Very clever from the management. Why there is a need to pay for this attraction, it should be included in entrance fee as this is already very high. 3. Helium balloon price is 13.000 KRW, which is already 1/3 of entrance fee, which is too expensive for a simply balloon. Should be less than 9.000 KRW at least. 4. The worst, all the food where sold out in Food Court. Can happen, but all food? We asked to call the other cafeteria and ask what kind of food they still have. They still had one food where we had to run to get it. We also asked what will happen if there is no food, but the staff could not answer. Later we had to eat at the snack corner where as along cue and you had ti wait 20 min to get something. 5. Shuttle bus frequency to parking lot F shall be at least doubled, currently one but and you have to wait again in the cue for 15 min. 6. Before you decide to go there with your kids, you should check witch attractions your child can take. There are some restrictions on children's height (good due for safety reasons). Sorry, the park might be nice.I visited this place in January 2018. I traveled alone so I decided not to get into the theme park. I just take pictures in front of the entrance, but I feel that this theme park is very exciting. I'd love to play when I come again in the future. Access to this place is accessible by bus/taxi. This place is still not crowded by tourists, probably because this place has just opened and many tourists don't really know the whereabouts of this place.Our first time in Shinhwa World theme park visit in December 2017. One must come with the understanding that the theme park is not yet fully developed but it has some nice rides and you can spend a few hours there . My kids had a wonderful time . Since it is new , the park is not crowded. We had lunch at the food court and it was good Korean food . We were initially disappointed when the rides were suspended due to the snow. However the rides were resumed quickly after the snow stopped. We happened to have met the theme park Manager Mr Mason Kang when we ran into communication difficulty with one of the staff attending to the ride . He was very kind to explain to us that the rides would resume soon after they dry the area . His professionalism impressed us . Our theme park experience was a great one . My kids tried the ice skating ring within the theme park compound . Everything is new and clean . We will come again ! They are going to have a Water theme park probably year after .My 10 yo daughter and I came here on a Monday in December. There was hardly anyone in the park which meant no waits. Park is small but fun rides. We stayed about 3 hours did everything and some rides multiple times.Park is a little small but has some fun rides. Very clean and new. Great staff. Good food (except for pizza).I was lucky enough to be given the first hand visit to a mega tourist attraction project open progressively in September 2017. The Jeju Shinhwa World , is the first premium resort in Jeju Island. It's really a resort for everyone . With different choices of hotels catering for all ages. It's just so enticing that I hope I don't need to wait that long but ....everything here is done to perfection. There will be 7 theme parks(three of these theme with TUBAn),4 hotels , villas ,Asian Food street, YG Town all these within this 2.5 million square feet . It is really going to be so much fun staying here, the happening place. I only have time to snap photos on the theme park. Sooooooo excited to go back again to have fun in this Resort.

Name: 제주민속촌
Location: 서귀포 표선면 민속해안로 631-34 서귀포시 표선면 표선리 40-1 (우) 63629
Review:
it is unique ancient village, probably over 100 years old, pretty organized, quite.. something different!Ancient Village at Jeju where we can still look the village from the past , mixed with today technology.
The...더 보기We visited this place as we were told this folk village is a well maintained place compared to others. The...더 보기At least Pyeoson Folk Village had more flowers and more greenery and smaller than this one sk you don't have...더 보기The Jeju village is 5 minutes from Hyeopjae beach, with plenty of restaurants and cafe nearby. It's a perfect place to start off your day or end it. It's a beautiful good size historical park with plenty of things to learn, do and it's kids...더 보기I had the most amazing picture under the deciduous trees and surrounded by beautiful yellow canola flowers.People say if you want to know about the place, you must understand the culture. So this place are all about it. They show the history of their lives, the culture, the utilities, the household, etc. A large place to walk to reach at each...더 보기It’s very interesting place to visit, the Korean culture and history over there.
However, no any play or preform when we were visited ( it was a very cold )
But it’s still fun.
Worth to go as a tourist.All in a single location.
We could go back and learn of the past. There were even live animals in the pens e.g. black pigs, cows, etc.
The village was also the location of various Korean dramas.
Visitors could enter into the huts and experience...더 보기If you wish to understand Korean culture better, this is a must visit place as they have these display for better illustration for you understand. You can walk around the park nearby this Folk Village as we went there via Jeju City Tour Bus.

Name: 신촌
Review: 有名私大があることもあり、大<U+5B66>生の街という感じ。カフェや、お財布に優しい<U+98F2>食店も多く、活<U+6C17>があります。梨大<U+99C5>までも<U+6B69>ける距離です♪トランジットで一泊しました。地下<U+9244>の<U+99C5>を出るとコンテナ本屋を中心に物語り的な遊<U+6B69>道が<U+7D9A>き、近くには大<U+5B66>もあり、賑やかなパフォ<U+30FC>マンスが繰り<U+5E83>げられるストリ<U+30FC>トありと活<U+6C17>のある若者の街と言う感じでした。延世大<U+5B66>の新村、有名私立大<U+5B66>のキャンパスを中心に<U+767A>展した町です。安くてお得なお店や<U+98F2>食店が<U+63C3>っており、街の規模もそこそこ。<U+6C17>さくな雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が良いです。10月下旬に行きましたが、銀杏がとてもきれいでステキな街でした。お店もたくさんありました。梨花大<U+5B66>も近くロケ地？と思うほどキレイな場所でブラブラ<U+89B3>光するのにぴったりでした。初めての新村散策。クリスマスツリ<U+30FC>やイルミネ<U+30FC>ションの飾り付けがされ綺麗でした。平日の午後でしたが若者で賑わっていました。綺麗に整備された街の印象です。公園では、<U+9EC4>葉の美しい風景も見る事ができました。公園の<U+4E21>側にはお<U+6D12>落なカフェやレストランもあり、可愛いソフトクリ<U+30FC>ムのお店で休憩しました。<U+697D>しい散策になりランチも下調べなく入ったお店で大<U+6E80>足の春川家で美味しいダッカルビが食べられて大<U+6E80>足。新村といえば「ドラム缶<U+713C>き肉」が有名ですが　延世大<U+5B66>や隣の<U+99C5>(といっても徒<U+6B69><U+570F><U+5185>)には梨花大<U+5B66>があったりと、有名私立大<U+5B66>のキャンパスがあるので　<U+5B66>生向けの安くてお得なお店や<U+98F2>食店が<U+63C3>っている。裏通りの<U+8FBA>りは<U+98F2>食店のごちゃごちゃ感はあるが　表通りは<U+6B69>道がとても整地されている。規模もそこそこで<U+6B69>きやすいです。シンチョンもイデも韓<U+56FD>の名門大<U+5B66>の<U+5B66>生街で、必然的に若い方が多い。とくにイデは梨花女子大の近くで化粧品やアクセサリ<U+30FC>等が多く、シンチョン側はもう少しジャンルが<U+5E83>い。東大門やミョンドンより、<U+89B3>光客向けでなく、逆にロ<U+30FC>カルな感じで良い部分もあるように思う。昔ながらの古臭い感じの新村の雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が<U+968F>分と<U+5909>わった感じがしました。まあ何年というか１０年以上も特に寄り付かなかった私自身の問題かもしれませんが。百貨店の裏に行けばディ<U+30FC>プな感じの韓<U+56FD>のいわゆるザ食堂みたいなレストランがあったり、おしゃれなカフェがあったり新<U+65E7>交わった感じがあると思います。<U+96D1>多な感じを味わいたい方は一度行ってみて下さい。私はいつも夜に行くので若者の街、<U+5B66>生街、ショッピングタウンというイメ<U+30FC>ジを持っていません。サムギョプサルやホルモン<U+713C>きのお店が多い街だと思っています。八食サムギョプサルや新村ファンソコプチャンクイなどネットや<U+96D1>誌に載っている有名店から<U+6E0B>い地元のお店までたくさんあってどこに行こうか迷います。この間はホルモン<U+713C>きを食べてきました。そのうち雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が違うお<U+663C>に散策してみます。

Name: 한강 공원
Review: There are some walking distance (at least 10mins) to reach the park if you ride there by bus or metro. That is why some local cycling there to save time and evergy.There are food festival during weekend, however till month Oct only, maybe due to weather. During night time, there can be very cool because of strong wind. No worry about food if you going during weekend (please check it out the status first, night close due to changes of weather). Overall, is a great experiences.You can start anywhere along the Han river and cycle south all the way to Busan, almsot entirely on bike paths. There are concerts and other events on weekends at various places, like Banpo or Yeoido. Many people bring tents and order food at the park.I visited this park because I was missing a ´local´ experience. Though I love Seoul and especially all the historical sites, I wanted to see what locals do in this town. It was recommended by a business contact of mine when I asked him why there is almost no movement at all on the Han river and he explained to me that almost all transportation of goods happens over land so the river isn´t really used a lot. What people do, is visit and look at the river, enjoy it´s wide open space while it cuts through Seoul. The place to experience this is the Hangang park (metro Yeouinaru), where especially on friday afternoon thousands of Corean youth gather and have picnics, meet with friends or with a date and just sit and talk. The Hangang park is really wide and stretched along side the river bank, so you can stroll for hours, rent a bike, buy some food at the foodtrucks and watch people have a great time. I recommend you to buy food, some beers or sodas, a blanket and have a picnic before going on a stroll!As a bonus you will have an amazing background scenery of (one of the) Seoul skylines.Hangang Park has been a very popular shooting location for KDrama scenes. It feels good to be able to step on the ground where KStars also walked on hahaha :DThe Hangang-Park is a beautiful place to be. Where you can have a walk or jogging around or sit there for a beer and chicken, which you can order right to the spot you are sitting. It is awesome!Nice enough, and we rented bikes for a lovely afternoon. Services are limited, so pack food or go in the evening when the food trucks are open. Prepare for the crowds.Great place for a good time! So many activities you can do regardless of who you're travelling with. We visited several times during our stay, during which we tried one of the night time river cruises, had a picnic another day, and came for a night walk the last one (so many great food trucks here!). You can take the metro to Yeouido.Its summer time. Weather still nice in June. Not so hot. Not so cold. Just nice for picnic with family and couples. Lots of food truck to choice for food .Can rent a bike and ride along the river bank. Surely will come again for the sunset view.A Park where you can Relax and stay positive :) this is a great place to meditate and think about life. Experience picnic like a local here just bring your blanket and you are ready to go. And it is place for taking a picture :). and just be mesmerized at the view of Hangang river and Cruise. and in addition if you want to cruise there is a mini cruise at that park on Hangang River and experience the romantic view with your love one :)If you are in company eveb better: nice walk, nice cycling and on fridays and saturdays there are food trucks with music show, nice but don't expect too much

Name: 청계천
Review: 등불축제때 방문했는데 분위기도 너무 좋고 인상적이었습니다! 해마다 하는지는 모르겠지만 한다면 또 방문하고싶어요 ㅎㅎ일 하는 곳 근처라 매일 출퇴근 길 지나가고 가끔 산책도 합니다. 여름에는 벌레도 많아 잘 다니지 않았는데 요즘같은 가을 날씨에 걷기 참 좋아요.서울 도심을 흐르는 청계천이다. 가볍게 산책하기 좋은 곳이고 특히 야경도 멋진 곳이니 여행객들에게는 하루를 마무리하는 코스로도 추천한다.이렇게까지 깨끗한가 싶을 정도로 물고기들이 눈에 띄는 곳각종 행사가 청계천일대에서 자주 진행되기에 목적없이 방문했다가 깜짝선물 받는듯, 즐거움을 얻고 갈 수 있다점심시간엔 사람이 많아요, 슬쩍 피해가면 천천히 서울 한가운데서 여유 즐기기 적당한 곳이죠. 이벤트도 자주 열리니 재밌는 볼거리도 제법 있어요.잘관리되고 있어서 걷기 너무 좋았습니다. 서울속 데이트코스로 아주 좋은것 같아요. 매달 걷게됩니다. 외국인들에게 좋은 추천 코스입니다.청계천은 낮이든 밤이든 산책하기 아주 좋은 곳인 것 같아요. 특히 등축제를 할 때 오시면 정말 아름다운 광경을 보실 수 있습니다. 주변에 드르신다면 산책코스로 꼭 지나가시길여름에도 이곳을 지나면 선선한 기운을 느낄수있어요 ~ 그래도 땡볕있는 한낮보단 오후 늦게 방문하면 피서 가능! 야간에 조명도 잘해놨고 조경도 좋아서 광화문에서 동대문까지 쭉~ 거닐기 좋습니다! 광화문쪽은 맛집도 많구요. 대신 유모차 길은 없습니다 계단쪽 오르내릴때 힘들수있습니다.시간이 된다면 걸어서 이동할때 이곳이 서울이네~ 느끼게 하는 장소이다. 특이 저녁에 조명이 있고 삼삼오오 앉아서 맥주를 마시는 사람들도 있고 분위기 좋다.청계천의 야경이 멋있다고 해서 경복궁 관람이 끝나는 시간에 맞춰 방문하였다. 물도 정화되어 깨끗하고 곳곳에 작은 볼 거리도 있다.

Name: KTX
Review: Great counter staff who assisted me even when I asked them which public wifi spot I could tap on, and they got us the front facing seats we wanted. The ride was super comfortable and toilets are decently clean. Definitely will take it again as it is a more convenient alternative to taking airplanes within korea.Wow! Talk about efficient! We purchased tickets online to guarantee a seat and exchanged it at Seoul Station for printed tickets. Takes 2 hours to get to Gyeongju (seriously beautiful, btw) and the ride was smooth and comfortable.
