Name: 강남 지하상가
Review:
Good for shopping n price very reasonable. This is the 2nd time I went there, will visit again next timeNot much to distinguish the centre from a typical South Korean underground mall beyond the Gangnam signage.I had 1.5 hours to kill. I wove in/out of the stalls. but first, I remembered my exit
you ca eat, have coffee, browse and negotiate. make sure you ask if it's korean or Chinese made. they often have extra supply inside, so dont get...더 보기Lots of trendy clothes. lots of the shops sell similar items but price difference isn't that much. Prices are negotiable. They do inflate prices if you are a foreigner especially on items without price tag. Pretty big and there are small restaurants and stalls if...더 보기Lots of shops selling mostly ladies wears, accessories, shoes and beauty products. There are few phone shops as well as some selling phone accessories. Much like the express bus terminal shopping Centre that we went to. Prices are comparable.I find the choice of shops disappointing. Mostly girls clothes and make up. Also because it is very crowded and with low ceilings it is rather claustrophobic.Let me begin by stating this is not Gangnam Station Underground shopping. This underground shopping is known as the “express bus terminal” underground/GOTO Mall. For logistical purposes, it shares space with Shingase and the JW Marriott. I took a taxi to the express bus terminal...더 보기Long rows of shops between Express Bus Terminal Station and Banpo station. Most of the shops selling woman apparel and they are pretty similar. Handicraft shops and kitchen accessories, floral shops are located right at the end.Given we came to Seoul during winter, it was nice to be able to shop in relative comfort underground. You can still find lots of handphone accessories, clothing, food, shoes, etc.This is the place to go for affordable shopping in Gangnam, especially for women. Lots of women's clothes and skincare stores. There's even a Dunkin Donuts and Baskin Robbins. Only thing is, there is not too much variety in clothes and shoes. Lots of shops...더 보기

Name: 스파 1899 동인비 - 대치점
Location: 서울 강남구 영동대로 416 KT&G 타워 B2층 (우) 06176
Review: 正官庄好きなので前<U+3005>からスパにも行ってみたくようやく<U+5B9F>現。素敵な空間、スタッフさんは日本語話せて安心でしたし、フット&ボディ120分コ<U+30FC>スにし、飛行機疲れもあったのでジャグジ<U+30FC>を選<U+629E>し、エステティシャンのマッサ<U+30FC>ジは癒し系で良かったです。人<U+53C2>エキスを全て使って下さるので<U+4F53>も心もあったまりました。<U+5E30>りにはトンインビのファンデとリップバ<U+30FC>ムを購入しました。極<U+697D>な一時でした☆明洞店の予約が希望日にとれず、江南の方へ行きました！予約した時は値段が高いかな<U+30FC>と思ってましたが、何もかもが最高で<U+6E80>足です！お茶や出てきた干し<U+67FF>も美味しかったです。スッピンでホテルに<U+623B>りたかったのでタクシ<U+30FC>お願いしたら、電話かけてくれて、<U+4E57>り場まで<U+6B69>いてついてきてくれましたし、行き先まで<U+4F1D>えてくれました。また行きたいですスパGの頃、何度も明洞店を訪れています。一番初めに<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>してくれた方<U+3005>の施術が、それはそれは素晴らしいものでした。その後、何度か明洞店を訪れても、その方はおられず、正直、他の方はイマイチです。今回、江南店が良いとの口コミがあった<U+70BA>、初めて利用してみましたが、他の方の口コミにもあります<U+69D8>に、ダメでした。何がと言えば、施術の時間です。カウンセリング、トイレ、着替え、お茶<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>ここまではスパG同<U+69D8>ですが、何と、足湯に20分位浸かりました。いい加減、イライラしました。「大丈夫か？？」案の定、ハンドマッサ<U+30FC>ジの時間は10分位。これで121,000WN。施術後のアンケ<U+30FC>トには全部「とても良い」を付けてきたけど、全然良くなかった。お茶に添えてある杏、木の<U+5B9F>みたいなものは、以前と<U+5909>わっていない<U+69D8>ですが、<U+7D4C><U+55B6>者が<U+5909>わったから、質が下がったのですか。何にせよ、人には<U+52E7>められません。10回程のリピ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>ただ、名<U+79F0>が<U+5909>わったとたん(<U+7D4C><U+55B6>者が<U+5909>わった？)施術レベルが低下しています。日本語話せる方がいるのは嬉しいのですが、細かいニュアンスは<U+4F1D>わりません(リンパを流して欲しい箇所を日本語、英語で話しましたが<U+4F1D>わりません)いつもSlow-Aging C (顔+ボディ全身 150分 150Minutes225.000ウォン(ネット予約割引<U+4FA1>格)施術前に全身スパか足湯を選べますがいつも全身スパにしていますが…いつもより時間が短い施術は<U+96D1>で、150分前に終了していました以前はミニ冷<U+8535>庫にお茶と滋養ドリンクがありましたが無くなりました何度か<U+62C5><U+5F53>していた方がとても丁寧な施術で日本語も上手、こちらの要望もよく理解して下さっていつも指名予約していましたが退職されて<U+6B8B>念。。次回から明洞店に<U+5909>えようかとも考えていますポイントの件ですが、直接HP予約のみ付きます、お店<U+6BCE>のポイント付<U+4E0E>なのでご注意下さいね明洞店には3.4回伺ったことがありますが今回は明洞店がいっぱいで、でも伺いたくてこちらの店<U+8217>にお邪魔しました。苦情とかではありませんが…<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>は明洞店の方<U+3005>の方がはるかに良いです。こちらが<U+60AA>い<U+8A33>ではないんです。ただ笑顔がない、<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>に<U+6C17>持ちがこもってないかなぁ。明洞店ではいつも<U+6E29>かいおもてなしの<U+6C17>持ちが<U+4F1D>わって<U+6765>て施術とともに大<U+6E80>足な<U+6C17>持ちでお店を後にしますが、今回は<U+6B8B>念だったねと娘も同じことを思っていたようです。鐘路三街からわざわざ江南まで行ったのに<U+6B8B>念な<U+6C17>持ちでした。正官<U+8358>さんの化粧品donginbiのエステ。行きたい日程は明洞店は全て<U+6E80>席だったためこちらの本店の予約をいれました。<U+5F53>日、地下<U+9244>の<U+4E57>り換えなどに手間取り、予約時間を少し過ぎてしまったのですが、嫌な顔をしないで快く受付していただきました。ありがとうございました。コ<U+30FC>スはアンチエイジングの顔と上半身の2時間コ<U+30FC>ス。最初に水着に着替えてジャグジ<U+30FC>に入ります。漢方のお茶をいただきながらリラックスできます。その後、個室で施行が始まります。最初に首、から肩にかけてマッサ<U+30FC>ジしていただきました、が、その後すぐ眠りに落ちてその後の記憶が全くありません。勿<U+4F53>無いことをしました。一<U+7DD2>に受けた友人は非常に<U+6E80>足していました。最後にdonginbiの素敵なサンプルもいただきました。私としては最初のジャグジ<U+30FC>とかはいらないので、みっちり2時間マッサ<U+30FC>ジをやってほしかったな。と思いました。でも、お店の雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>や<U+5F93>業員さん達の立ち振る舞いはさすが正官<U+8358>！と思いました。次回はしっかり起きてマッサ<U+30FC>ジを充分<U+6E80>喫したいです。今回は友人二人と一<U+7DD2>に予約しました。人<U+6570>多いときは早めに予約するといいです。こちらのオイルは紅<U+53C2>のトンインビのオイルをふんだんに使ってくれるので終わった後、とてもお肌の調子が良いです。友人もとても<U+6E80>足でした。ポイントもつくようで、1000ポイントで2時間無料と<U+6559>えてもらったので、リピ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>の方にはお得だと思いますドンインビのスパ。お店はビルの地下2階にあります。ネット予約で10％オフで60分のフェイシャルが約1万円（今のレ<U+30FC>トで)マッサ<U+30FC>ジもあり、フットスパもありで大<U+6E80>足。お店の雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>もラグジュアリ<U+30FC>で大<U+6E80>足いつも宿泊するスカイパ<U+30FC>クセントラルホテルの地下にこのスパがあるので、そこで予約を取りたかったのですが、そこはいっぱいで予約がとれず、調べていたらこちらの店<U+8217>だったら予約できたので、伺いました。まず店<U+5185>にはいると、半端ないくらいの高級感か漂っています。さすが、『正官症』の直<U+55B6>店だけあります。全身スパ、ボディマッサ<U+30FC>ジ、頭皮スパを受けて￥17000くらいでしたが、施術、スタッフのもてなし、共に最高で、むしろ安いくらいだと感じました。最初にだされるお茶、全身スパの時に出されるお茶、そして最後に出されるお茶とドライフル<U+30FC>ツ、どれもとても美味しかったです。またぜひ伺いたいです。予約が取りづらいのが難点です。トンインビの化粧品は使ってるもののエステは初めての訪問口コミが良かったのでかなり期待していきました時間もなく、寒い時期だったのでフェイシャル60分コ<U+30FC>スをお願いしました口コミにもあるように土日の入り口はわかりにくかったです店<U+5185>は<U+5E83><U+3005>とした作りでモダン 高麗人<U+53C2>のあまい香りが心地いいですスタッフの方も日本語堪能ですフェイシャル60分なのに個室利用でシャワ<U+30FC>室完備なのも贅<U+6CA2>ですね施術は優しいタッチで癒されましたがデコルテ、頭のマッサ<U+30FC>ジの時の力加減が<U+5F37>めで絶妙 個人的にはこちらのタッチが好みでした次回はボディ<U+30FC>をお願いしようと思ってます

Name: 스타필드 코엑스몰
Review: Lots of shops, restaurants and art to see. Easy to get to from train and genuinely just a good time with friends and family.It is not just a Mall and a big shopping center with a huge food court but it also features an architecturally interesting library. With Free entrance, people could just walk in and read books which were just line up on the shelves. There were chairs and tables around the place. Many people were coming not to read books but to take photos of the place as it is very popular for tourists.This is a world class place with convention center, shops, aquarium, numerous restaurants and an airport check in for many airlines. You can spend hours here.if you are a kpop fans especially SM stan this place is a must list to visit because SM COEX ATRIUM will give u an experience to get close to your idol, inside SM there's museum, photobooth, merch shop, cafe or even auditorium. and Coex Mall is really nice to look around also the most iconic there's a library inside mall with amazing decoration and huge scale of bookshelf . U can also take a pic in here.The mall is great. Modern, lots of good shops and restaurants. Well connected to the metro and bus stop. The library in the center of the mall is a great place for pictures. There is an aquarium attraction which is great. It is also connected to the Hyudai Department Store, Intercontinental Hotel and SM Town Museum. As a family traveler, we appreciate the baby room which had all the facilities we needed. They had changing tables, resting area, nursing rooms, baby cots, and baby feeding area. Very thoughtful.Starfield Library is something very special! Thousand of volumes, magazines from all over the world, even magazines for interior designers, gardens, e.tc, from France and Italy, are all in the disposal of the citizens without any discriminations. It is worth it to pay a visit. You can buy or borrow (inside) the library, everything you might have in your mind. In general, the huge store Coex is available for your entertainment as for your shopping.Love this mall as it has nice shops with international and Korean brand. Very crowded on weekend and the beautiful library is also the main attraction. The Hyundai hall is a good place to start to hunt for food. You can easily spend your day here.The mall is very huge. The good thing is. I came when Korea Great Sale was happend. and i was really amazed by the giant library!!!!We stayed at the Intercontinental COEX which is connected to the COEX mall. Very convenient. The mall is huge and you can find all the usual shops such as H&M, Zara, Uniqlo,....lots of food choices as well. Great food hall where you can get great deals after 7 pm. Definitely a nice way to spend a few hours.This is more upmarket mall next to SM town and Starfield library. It has lots of different shops - great place to hide away from The summer heat.  It also has restaurants serving different food with a cinema

Name: SM타운 코엑스아티움
Review:
I am not familiar with K pop, but I enjoyed myself at SMTown seeing what the stars wore and their various performances. The cafe also sold yummy ice cream and their gift shop was very interesting and sold lots of cute stuff.A lot of fun, if you're into k-pop, especially the artist under SM entertainment. It give you a fun insight of their concepts and work !I couldn't forgot the time when I was there. My idol is Yunho so I could buy some products as well as took a lot of pictures in my idol's company. This is not memorable time in my trip. I will come back there again...더 보기Went to the SM Town Building, right by the Samseong (Samsung) station as an accompanying parent to my teen.
The lay-out is wonderful, and because we returned on the day of Typhoon Lingling, security has had the place secured, including double/triple knotting down the oversized...더 보기It is a free entry. The minute you enter you will listen to the nice lovely love song. Has many floors but do go to the highest to take photos with your favorite stars and do the handprints with them. There is a cafe and...더 보기A true paradise for K-pop fan from stickers, album, t-shirt, clothes,...
Highly recommend to come here to enjoy Korean culture!!!It was first time visit to K-pop stars mall.maybe I expect something special. But it is not like what I expected.
I have two girls, one of them 12, one of them 8. I thought 12 years old one like this place since she starts...더 보기Because some of my family members were SM fans, we had to go to this place. It had a very extensive collection of clothing used by their various artists. For non (crazy) fans like me, some of their displays provided a glimpse of the stuff...더 보기If you are a dedicated SM Artist Fan, this place would be heaven for you. You can even take selfies in the photo zone located on the fifth floor.If you are a fan of SM Entertainment, you must visit this place. I didn't have time to go inside and only visit the SM Store on the 2nd floor. They sold various souvenirs of SM artists so that it could be said this is...더 보기

Name: 별마당 도서관
Review: Admittedly, I got teary eyed when I saw all of those books with readers of all ages sitting everywhere. This public library reminded me that some parts of the world values reading BOOKS & MAGAZINES, not just texts or social media. Do visit if you're in the area & then head to the Lotte World Tower, 5th tallest building in the world.We were just be there to take photo as all the books are majority korean language.Opposite the mall is Beomosa, there is walking distance but nearby.It's too crowded with tourists who are just taking photos there. Pity those people who really needed a place to do their workI was expecting to be awe-struck But it was a "library"/ bookstore inside COEX mallStill, worth a pic for instagram . Beware: lots of other people there for the same reason.This was so not what I was expecting to find in the middle of a shopping mall - an enormous beautifully laid out library full of people of all ages browsing a reading rather than being on their phones. Amazing!It was too crowded with people taking pictures, and noisy. It's an open area library with cafes around. The ambience wasn't my cup of tea and I was only here to take pictures.I’m not sure this would be worth making a special trip to visit, but we were already in the area to visit Bonguensa temple (just over the road from the COEX Mall) so came in to see the library. It is wonderful - as book lovers it was a real jaw dropping sight! I can’t really imagine a UK shopping mall having a public library as a centrepiece...Wonderful resource in the middle of the mall. For non-Korean readers, the offerings are a bit limited as most of the books are in Korean. Nevertheless, there is a great selection of English magazines. Very enjoyable to sit, people watch and take photos (which is what most were doing). Having said all that, it is a great idea and other malls would do well to follow suit, even with a small/modest collection, if only to encourage people to read.So this was so neat to see, it's a beautfiul library, however, it's just too crowded with people grabbing the most insta-worthy picture. I felt a bit like Belle must have in Beauty and the Beast when she saw all those books in the massive library, but I was pretty sure I couldn't read any. We left after only 10 minutes here because it was just too crowded and noisy.I wouldn't quite call this a must-see attraction. As a library - it's pretty, but it's not particularly large. Also all the books are in Korean (no surprise).What makes it more appealing is how comfortable the surroundings are (you can grab a comfortable chair, and there's a good bakery on the second level for coffee and dessert) and just how entertaining it can be if you need a bit of a rest and want to do some people watching. Interesting to watch all the people go through taking photos, selfies, staging full on photo shoots fully dressed up and posing as they ride up and down the escalator.

Name: 청담동 패션 거리
Review: Unless you are looking to shop and have a LOT of money to burn on all the major vrand names, then there really isn't much to see here.Lot of art galleries, restaurants and trendy shopping around. Lots of tourists shop here as well. Good area

Name: 국기원
Review: I have visited 2 times in 3 years and had the good fortune to meet some of the great staff that represent TKD in Korea and in the development of the sport. I was presented with a visitor certificate on arrival and hosted through a short tour. The museum was very interesting and my host was able to translate some very interesting elements of the sports history for me. The area also hosts a number of TKD stores and you can pick up good quality gear and training accessories. If visiting, plan to attend on any day except Monday, 9which is the TKD demonstration teams day off).I heard that they were doing performances, but stopped after last year. Why aren't they doing demonstrations in 2019?After practicing tkd for 20 years myself it’s an absolute must. Ppl on the property are friendly and helpful. Entry is freeSeeing the team training is one of the most impressive things for every sportsman. Definitely recommendCome back Seoul every year.Wonderful stayWonderful placeKukkiwon are a mecca of taekwondo All practice Going in this site.Museum events.Go into this place!!!!!!One of the best Taekwondo demonstration I have seen, the plank breaking was really impressive. Show duration is about one hour and the performance hall is about 10 minutes walk from Gangnam station, exit 12.I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed Kukkiwon's Taekwando demonstration show. It told a story, and combined TKD moves into a narrative with a big screen in the background. I had expected to just see people do some routines. This was much more interesting. The artists did a great job too, with many difficult moves. I deducted a star because, as an english-only speaker, it was hard to get tickets. I had to contact AskAjumma to get tickets for me. And the time of the show was not advertised anywhere that I could find. But once I had the tickets, there was a nice gentlemen at the arena who helped us get seated. After the show they invited people who wanted to break a board to come onto the stage. The emcee spoke English and Korean so my kids were able to join in and broke their first board! Very cool.It is a great organization but for a tourist not much of a site to visit unless you go to their demo show "Great Tae Kwon Do". It combines legend, a ton of board breaking and action. It was a blast! At the end you can break a board with the cast. Their website sucks so get someone Korean speaking to figure out times.A wonderful institute established by Kukkiwon to promote globally the Korean tradition of Taekwando. They have a museum and cafetaria for visitors to explore. They also regularly organize international competition and demonstrations of Taekwando. It was an amazing experience participating in the September 2016 festival. I got to see the talented competitors of all age groups from different nations participating. Several nations also presented tradition dances and had their food stalls during this festival.

Name: 오휘스파 논현
Review: Seoul is famous for its beauty treatment and OHui Spa (or it had been renamed to Whoo Spa) is a hidden away gem that only locals (and many Korean Popstars) knows!! Whoo is a high end beauty brand that is suitable for mature skin and they have three product line that ranges from mid range price to high end.The treatment we selected is the special care package which includes a half body massage by hand, lower body massage by machine, and a facial (both with equipment and by hand). Every single component uses in the massage features their product and I can feel the difference to my skin after the treatment. Would highly recommend a visit to one of the top notch spa in Seoul!Pro Tip: purchasing product after your spa treatment offers a great discount!

Name: 김포공항 전망대
Review: ソウルの2大空港のひとつで、ソウル市街地からは仁川（インチョン）空港よりも手前に位置する。ソウル地下<U+9244>（メトロ）5<U+53F7>線<U+30FB>9<U+53F7>線のほかにインチョン空港へ向かう空港<U+9244>道も<U+4E57>り入れ、ソウル<U+99C5>からは各<U+99C5>停車で21分かかり、運賃は1,550W（現金）<U+30FB>1,450W（T-moneyカ<U+30FC>ド）である。インチョン空港開業後は<U+56FD><U+5185>線のみの空港だったが、近年は<U+56FD>際線も再開したものの就航先は日本の羽田空港のほか、中<U+56FD>の北京<U+30FB>上海など少ないので、<U+56FD>際線タ<U+30FC>ミナルはプサン空港よりも小さい。機<U+5185>預け入れ荷物がなければ自動チェックインのみで、セキュリティ<U+30FC>チェックも出<U+56FD>手<U+7D9A>きも非常にスム<U+30FC>ズだった。搭<U+4E57>ロビ<U+30FC><U+5185>には免<U+7A0E>店<U+30FB><U+98F2>食店がひと通りそろっており（もちろん日本語もクレジットカ<U+30FC>ドも<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>）、その中でもうどん店がおすすめである。金浦<U+56FD>際空港を利用し、時間があったので行きました。仁川空港より金浦空港の方が市<U+5185>から近いので便利です。JALの指定で大韓航空ラウンジへ、改<U+88C5>のおかげでエア<U+30FC>サイド側に移ったのはうれしいのですが…　一<U+6B69>　足を踏み入れて混<U+96D1>もしかり、ワンフロア<U+30FC>に仕切り無しの大部屋!　雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>も…　ね。<U+5373>　回れ右で　プライオリティパスて　スカイハブラウンジへ。混<U+96D1>無しに立派なホットミ<U+30FC>ル、サラダ…他　どうみてもこちらのほうが　航空<U+4F1A>社ラウンジでした。小さいのは特に問題は無いのですが、先進<U+56FD>とは思えず、他のアジアのエアポ<U+30FC>トと同<U+69D8>、入出<U+56FD>の手<U+7D9A>きや手荷物の取り出しは緩慢で手際が<U+60AA>いです。まと、エアポ<U+30FC>トレ<U+30FC>ルウェイにより、市<U+5185>へのアクセスは早く確<U+5B9F>にできます。しかし、ラウンジには驚き！ カップ<U+9EBA>が取り<U+63C3>えてられており、「VIP」の方<U+3005>がズルズル<U+9EBA>をすすり、とてもラウンジは臭いですし、うるさいです。カロスキルから30-40分でタクシ<U+30FC>で行ける、アクセスの良い空港です。25000w程度でいけます。空港<U+5185>は、コンパクトな免<U+7A0E>店やカフェがある程度なので待ち時間が暇かもしれません。中のカフェで<U+98F2>んだフレッシュジュ<U+30FC>スは7000wと高めですが美味しかったです。<U+56FD>際空港にしては、<U+72ED>いです。レストランもあまりありません。制限エリアに入るとほぼレストランはないので、保安<U+691C>査場に入るまでに食事とりましょう。トイレは綺麗です。金浦空港到着後、ソウル市<U+5185>まではタクシ<U+30FC>で30分程、タクシ<U+30FC>代も30000ウォンもかからないので、非常に便利です。バスを利用すれば8000ウォンくらいでソウル市<U+5185>のホテルまで行けます。空港は小さいですが、入<U+56FD>も出<U+56FD>もとてもスム<U+30FC>ズです。

Name: 롯데시네마 김포공항
Rank: 37위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 仁川空港にくらべてこじんまりしていますが、市<U+5185>に近いのでアクセスはとても良いです。これからは仁川より金浦空港を利用したいと思います。荷物を預けたらモニタ<U+30FC>で自分のス<U+30FC>ツケ<U+30FC>スを確認してから中に入るのでお<U+6C17>をつけ下さい。金浦空港のロッテホテルに泊まった時に行きました。ロッテモ<U+30FC>ル<U+5185>にあり、またロッテホテルや空港からも近いので利用するにはとても便利。スクリ<U+30FC>ンの<U+6570>も多く、大好きな韓流映<U+753B>をたっぷり<U+697D>しめました。空港直結のロッテモ<U+30FC>ル<U+5185>にある映<U+753B>館。チケットは機械での販<U+58F2>とカウンタ<U+30FC>がありました。<U+5F53>然ですが日本語版はありません

Name: 관악산
Review: my friend and I started climbing the mountain at about 3pm starting at sadang, and ended 7.15pm at gwachon city hall. we are both relatively fit (though I do badly going down rocks) but we found ourselves trying to beat the night! super awesome hike though. the trip up was relatively easy with loads of stairs, though note that the actual elevation would be more than 600m given that we would have to traverse a few small hills before getting to the peak from sadang. going down towards gwachon had less of such small hills, but the trails were not well marked and there were very few stairs, so do have your online maps with the trails ready (I used maps.me) in case you get off course (we did a few times). I would recommend bringing some light snacks and a hiking stick along -- they certainly helped me with keeping my balance scrambling down those rocks and gave me the much needed energy boost when my legs got wobbly.highly recommended hike, in all. the route is very scenic even though the peak itself is not very interesting. :pWe thoroughly enjoyed our hike at Gwanaksan. We parked at Seoul National University and had an easy walk to the trail entrance. We kept to the path along the stream and stopped a few times for a dip and to cool off. Beautiful location and so easy to drive and park here. Our only complaint was you had to make an online reservation for the ropes course and our phone doesn’t have Hangul which seemed to be the problem with getting a reservation. No matter course guides were there waiting for participants and the office had a few people with nothing to do but make reservations. Too bad the Internet was the only way - modern technology didn’t work in our favor to add the ropes course to top off an already fun day.We were lucky to climb the mountain on a perfect day. Started at 9 am. It was clear and 20 c. It is a steep climb though a temperate broadleaved forest. So you are out of the sun. But very steep, straight up the mountain with lots of boulders. Have good shoes, take your time and bring water. We took about 1,5 hours to reach top and hour down. By the it was about 25 c and convective clouds were forming. Going down can be hard on knees. Most locales my age had walking sticks. Really impressed with the amount of people in 50s and 60s doing the climb. It is a great opportunity to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Today our view was perfect. I recommend going in morning on mild days. On hot, humid summer day the hike could be quite strenuous.I and my friend went on hiking to Gwanaksan and it was the best thing I did in Seoul. It was very exhausting YES but it was so fun too. Sharing stories with fellow hikers on the way. It was a good exercise and so many older people go there on regular basis. I would too if I live there. Up there you can see a portion of the City, if not all. Very wonderful, cover-photoable shots in the top.This is a great alternative to Bukhansan, which although great, is a bit out of the way if you are in the center of Seoul and short on time. I recommend starting at Sadang because the views from that trail are spectacular.And not sure what to expect. The walk from the station to the entrance was tough enough. The seasoned old folks were warning us that it could be too difficult, looking at how inexperience we were. But we made it to the TOP! Not all easy and some slippery slope .... it all worth it. For the view and the sense of achievement!Mt. Gwanak, or Gwanaksan, is an excellent hiking option for anyone in Seoul who wants to get away, but not have to travel too far. Completely accessible by metro, this mountain is not the tallest, but it offers great views from the summit and has a temple that is dramatically set on the edge of a cliff - very picturesque! Like many hiking trails in Korea, there are a ton of stairs to climb, but there are also rocky parts that add some variety to the hike. I would say this is an intermediate hike. Not easy, but definitely not too hard technically. There are restrooms along the trail, but no toilet paper, so bring your own. Also bring plenty of water and a nice snack to enjoy.There are other trails that begin from different starting points. Here are detailed instructions on how to get to this particular trailhead that leads to the temple on the cliff. I found these directions online and followed them successfully on my solo hike, so the instructions are tried and true. Hope you find this helpful! Enjoy!-Take subway line #4 to Gwacheon Station.-At the station, head for Exit #2 and take escalator up.-At top of escalator, just walk straight out.-You’ll see the mountain above the trees across the street.-Continue on sidewalk until you see a sign that says Library Junction. Cross the street here.-After crossing the street, turn RIGHT and continue walking.-Soon, you will see a brown sign that points LEFT toward Gwanaksan which is 1km away (the sign also mentions other destinations).-Follow that road until you reach an intersection with a sign pointing RIGHT for Gwanaksan, cross the street and continue walking (there’s a convenience store on the corner).-Continue walking (passing a school on your right) until you reach a T-intersection with big mirrors for cars to see around the corner.-You’ll see another brown sign pointing LEFT for Gwanaksan.-Continue walking. You’ll pass a parking lot on your right but that trail is for a smaller summit.-Soon, you’ll see a small food stand and a bathroom on your right.-There’s a stream coming off the mountain with a bunch of tents on the left bank.-Cross the bridge and continue up the small road past the food vendors.-You should see the trailhead.I was staying at SNU faculty house and decided to walk a morning. I found the entrance to a trail at Nakseogaede Park and pleasantly discovered that it was part of an amazing trail ring of more than 150 km surrounding Greater Seoul. I, obviously, only followed a tiny portion of it, and didn't even make it to the top of the mountain. But it was a great experience. Sometimes a challenge, pleasant in general, you get great views of Seoul from many parts of it.beutiful mountain with various entertainment. if you don't want to go peak just want some fresh air from green, it has perfect side road full of flowers. if you are healthy enough to enjoy bit tough hiking you can see Yeonjuam, a Buddhist temple on cliff. you can enter the mountain through Seoul national university, the top ranked one in SK. it has soeuldae-ipgu nearby, you can get entertained with cheap gourmets and stuff.I went there as part of my exchange in Seoul National University. It has a great view and many many old Koreans climb it everyday. It is steep sometimes but my friends and I who are not great Hikers managed to do it quite easily!

Name: 서울대학교 미술관
Review: The museum had several parts closed down for renovation. I was led to believe they had some western art, which peaked my interest. I caught the last day of the Eternal Narcissist exhibit by Chun Kyung-ja, and was grateful for the exposure to someone I wasn't familiar with and to learn about her. Even though my expectations weren't met, I was not disappointed in the least. The grounds are lovely and the price was right!Amazing place to visit, very impressive. Great collection of arts and crafts which are laid down for us to admire. A must see!I wanted to check out a new place that I hadn't been to in Seoul. I found this place online and thought I would check it out. Positives: It's a short bus ride from Seoul National University Station and the admission is only W3,000. Also, the view from outside the museum was more interesting than what was inside it.Negatives: There was an exhibition of Kim Jong Yun art. There were some paintings, three-dimensional abstract rock sculptures, and regular sculptures of people. The only thing I liked were the sculptures of the people and I couldn't take pictures of them.It also took me a very short time to look through it. I was done in less than 30 minutes.

Name: 서울대학교 규장각
Location: 서울 관악구 신림동 관악로 599 103동 서울대학교 내에 위치 (우) 151-010
Review: Seoul national university is the best one in South Korea,I went to there on the Mid-Autumn day that is the most important holiday of Korean people.Many presents took their children to there,to make them up in studying.The university is big and a little far from downtown.You need to take a bus to there under subway.And I visited the College of Arts,because I am majoring in English Literature and Culture.But I think maybe students who like science would like there.Too much scientific surrounding to scientists.The library is big and excellent,you can study there with a quiet.Good luck to applicators.

Name: 서울 어린이 대공원
Review: The park is attractive to both adults and children in autumn (late Oct./ early Nov.). The autumn colours are fascinating but they vary from year to year depending on weather, etc. This year, the summer is long and dry but the ginkgo and maple trees still show off their beautiful autumn colours, although not as good as those of last year. The park has a good zoo, apart from an amusement park, etc. I like to go there (and to the Seoul Grand Park) when I visit Seoul, as both are great places for photography and leisure.My 17 month old daughter was so extremely excited to see all the animals and did not want to leave. Korea has so many family-friendly places and this is definitely one of them. I think I may have seen some strollers to rent on our way in, not entirely sure. Overall, this was a lovely experience for both of us and we look forward to going back with my husband.We went with our 20month old toddler and really enjoyed the whole day there. It's a huge park with outdoor and indoor playground. Probably because we went on a weekday, the whole park was very quiet. Entrance to the main park is free, but certain attractions charge a fee.Key highlights1) best thing about this place is the Seoul Children's Museum. There's an entrance fee but it's not expensive. They also allow u to exit and re-enter on the same day. There are 4 storeys catering to different children age groups and the set up on each floor is very impressive, especially the water play on level 3! I think it's fun for all kids from toddlers to teens.2) catch the animal show called Anistory featuring many types of animals including seals, birds, cats, monkey etc. Need to pay for entry though. It's quite entertaining. Even though we didn't understand the language, we still enjoyed it very much. 3) the park is massive, great if u like outdoor walks. There's a huge water fountain show near the Seoul Children's Museum that's quite impressive too. Overall a nice destination that offers both indoor and outdoor experiences. I didn't like the mini zoo though. Each enclosure was very small and the animals looked a bit depressed. I wouldn't recommend if your only objective is to visit the zoo.This place is a hidden gem and not many tourists visit this park. Very nice, clean and spacious park with lots to see like gardens, playground & mini-zoo. Kids would definitely love this place. The mini-zoo is a little sad as it's under-maintained and some animals look sad in their enclosures. Plus point: Nice, clean and spacious park. Free entry except for the amusement park section. Not crowded!Negative: Somewhat under-maintained. Has the potential to be much betterWe had a great time though it was so hot. You need to bring or buy lots of water. There are lots of places where you can find food/snack/ice water or other beverages. The kids loved the musical fountain, the water playground, the animals, the Anishow. We spent around 4 hours looking around and playing.Information found online about the Children’s Grand Park can sometimes be sketchy and inconsistent.I hope that the following will provide a better picture for those planning to visit the park. I have also attached a picture of the park map that I will refer to below.The park can be accessible by 2 subway stations.The main gate (#1 on map) is accessible easily by the Children's Grand Park Station on Line 7.There is a rear gate (#36 on map) that is accessible by the Achasan Station on Line 5.The park has no entrance fee, except for the amusement park section.My suggestion is that children below 14 yrs will appreciate the park.I brought a tween son, and 2 pre-school kids to the park.All three enjoyed the amusement park (#38 on map), which is closer to the rear gate. The amusement park had rides catering to pre-school kids to tweens. Do note there are some rides that have a 120cm height requirement. Rides such as the Viking, Dropzone and Roller coaster are generally adapted for tweens. For those a little younger, there are bumper cars and spinning saucers that are children friendly. However, this place would not be recommended for toddlers. A cafeteria is found within the amusement park serving traditional Korean foods and burgers. Nothing to shout about but it satisfies the tummy.Amusement park entrance fees depends on the type of ticket you purchase. Tickets are available in single ride, 5 rides, 10 rides and unlimited rides options.For the 5 ride option, kids paid 16,000 won. Adults paid 19,000 for the same ticket.Toddlers and pre-school kids should check out the playground (#12 on map) with wet play and dry obstacle options. Bring your toys for sand play if you wish.The other attraction we tried was the zoo <U+2013> a mini zoo at that. We saw an elephant, snakes, birds and baboons. A couple of macaws looked like they were suffering from a disease that caused balding on their body. The kids enjoyed the zoo but soon lost interest in it once they stepped out of the zoo.Next to the zoo is a pavilion which sells snacks (#34 on map) like ice-cream, corn dogs and cold drinks <U+2013> a great respite from the heat.2 attractions that we did not visit <U+2013> the children’s museum (#46 on map) and Kid’s Auto Park (#44 on map) would probably suit school going kids.Directions:For the museum, and auto park, use the main gate.For the amusement park, use the rear gate.The zoo is in the middle of the park and are equidistant from either gates.In summary, this park is accessible by 2 subway lines. It provides a place for kids to be themselves and preserves the sanity of parents who want kids to run wild and not bother them for too much over a couple of hours. School going children will probably benefit the most out of a half day excursion to this park.The park is quite far from where we stay at myeongdong and we paid 13,000KRW for the cab ride. The park is free and contains a zoo (where the animals look quite sad) and there is a little amusement park when you can pay for the rides. The main highlight for us is the Seoul Children's Museum located near the main entrance.Only covered a small part of it, as we were mostly busy with the museum, but what we saw was fun. A great big playground (with no shade though), big music fountain, a junk-made sculpture walk, a beautifully designed orangery... Lots to see!The park was pretty good, but even better was the FREE Zoo. Lots of animals to see, had some gardens to visit, and has a large children's museum to visit. There are also some walkways over ponds and sculptures to see as you walk around. There was also food stops encase you needed something in a rush but I saw many people bringing in lunches.Excellent place to bring your kids with the free zoo and exhibits.Do spare time for the children's museum as well, plenty of the little ones to explore inside.

Name: 롯데시네마 건대입구
Rank: 55위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: On Wednesdays and Sundays during the month of August, 2018, four selected Lotte Cinemas are screening the Royal Ballet's live performance of Manon filmed at the Royal Opera House, London, 07 March 2018. A friend and I had a wonderful experience when we attended one of these screenings on Korea's Liberation Day, 15 August. The film was shown in Lotte's Charlotte Premium Seating small theater located inside the Konkuk University Lotte Cinema complex. Prior to attending we had been feeling a little disgruntled over the 40,000W charge for the ticket - usually at other theaters special screenings of live opera or ballet cost 30,000W. Well, we were pleasantly surprised and quickly stopped quibbling about the cost. Charlotte premium seating has a special sliding door entrance to a comfortable air conditioned lounge with cinema staff in attendance to look after movie-goers. We presented our tickets and were asked to choose a complimentary drink and were also given complimentary vouchers for another film at a general Lotte Cinema. We entered the theater and found our great big armchair seats smelt of real leather. The little table on the arm of each seat had a complimentary bottle of chilled water and the theaterette was super airconditioned - thank goodness! Once we were comfortably seated staff brought our drinks plus a snack of a packet of biscuits. I have back problems so was delighted to find the luxury seat could be comfortably adjusted for my back and legs, it was very, very good. I found this was the most enjoyable way imaginable to watch a film - it couldn't have been better - I can't wait to go there again, it was absolutely worth the money we paid .... especially in contrast to my unpleasant experience at World Tower Lotte Cinema - Hall 16 when I attended another Royal Ballet screening last year for 30,000W in an unpleasant, strongly-musty-smelling small theater with no complimentary drinks or snacks - at the end of the film my nose had still not got used to the horrible dank smell!Thank you Lotte Cinema Konkuk University Entrance for the excellent facilities and service - a really super experience!!! For Arts-lovers ... I brought home a programme from Charlotte with information on future movie screenings in 2018 from the Royal Opera House, London; the Nutcracker Ballet will be screening in November, Liam Scarlett's new Swan Lake ballet in December, Bizet's opera Carmen in September and Verdi's(?I think) MacBeth in October.

Name: 고척스카이돔
Review: Very big. Very round. Very far away. Very crowded. Basically, a stadium. If wanting to see a sporting event be sure to try and get tickets in advance. However, with that said the websites for Korean sport teams are very protracted with a lack of English.Are the floor tickets there good? Is there enough space for people to stand and see the stage or is it cramped ? Am hoping to attend a Queen concert in 2020 and was wonderingDifferences between baseball games at Angel Stadium in Anaheim, CA vs here: Food is much cheaper, but there are no vendors selling at your seat. A box of about 25 meaty chicken nuggets was about $10 and fed 3 of us. Water bottles were only $1, beer only $3. Cheap seats were $13. Only 1 merchandise location outside the stadium so shop before or after the game. No 7th inning stretch or kiss cam, but they had cheerleaders and contests, and even an American player on the winning team. No rap music to suffer through, but fans know their chants and fully support their teams. there are restrictions as to the size of bag you can bring in and types of bottles, so check the website before you go. We entered with ticketless entry on our friend’s phone. Easy to get there by train and beautiful area.We went to see The Weeknd here. This stadium is huge and a great place to see a concert. However, coming from the western world, if you're not seeing a K-Pop act, the crowd will be fairly timid and relatively quiet.We went here for the korean music festival and had a very good experience. A lot of fun, and the area also had good temperatures (probably aircondition), which was perfect for us to escape the hot summer weather.The stadium is huge and surprisingly warm during winter. Commuting to the sky dome is easy. I had a great time watching Big Bang concert on 31st December 2017.It's a bit more sterile -- and of course cleaner--than Doosan Bear's Jamsil Stadium, but there is no better place to be when its 90 degrees outside and the fans are going wild, the entire 9 innings. For the best experience of watching Korean baseball sit in the sections in front of the ceerleading stands -- 104, 105, 202, 203 for home team Nexen Heroes and 110, 110, 208, 209 for visiting team. If for just watching baseball, anywhere is good. As prior reviewers noted, one of the major drawbacks is lack of few food choices and the menus are in Korean (no English help)I finally got to visit this stadium for the Hanwha Eagles vs Nexen Heroes, and the fans make the visit next level! The food stands are plentiful with so many options to choose from. Everything from pizza to sushi and beer. Thanks for having me!Went to my first every baseball game (Nexan Heroes VS Lotte Giant's) and even though it was a poor game there was a very good atmosphere, although I suspect it was mostly from the noisy Lotte Giant away fans. The stadium is a massive indoor arena and is nice and cool with the aircon on. Good food and plenty of variety within and outside the stadium and there is a quaint little fan shop where you can find all the essential merchandise and also very fancy jackets. I also enjoyed the product competitions during the breaks in play even though I don't understand Korean, I found it really entertaining. I am not a baseball fan but I might consider going to other matches in the future because of this match. Good location for the stadium near subway station and there is also some futsal football pitches next to the stadium of you fancy a kickabout before the game.Finally I got to go to the Skydome. Generally, great stadium. Well designed, looks great and holds the noise really well. A few little glitches though. There is not a lot of variety for food when attending a baseball game. There are just a few chicken shops and a small convenience store or two. Also, the service there could be a little better. I know tonight was busy and all, but the servers there could ask more questions about the ticket people want, and the tickets could be a little clearer telling people about seating etc. Generally though, the stadium is great and I am sure they will add more to it.

Name: CGV 구로
Rank: 64위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 상영관이 10개나 되어서, 상업 영화 뿐만 아니라 다양한 종류의 영화를 상영함. 인기있는 영화는 여러개의 상영관에서 상영하기 때문에 영화를 선택해서 보기도 수월함. 백화점내에 식당가와 서점등도 함께 있고, 게임 등을 즐길 공간도 함께 있어서, 영화와 함께 다양한 활동들을 할 수 있어 좋음. 규모에 비해서 주차장은 좀 협소한 듯. 주말에는 주차 때문에 종종 고생했음.시설이나 이것저것 조금 오래되긴 했지만 표 구하기도 쉽고 사람이 많지 않아서 자주 이용하는곳이에요...무엇보다 심야 시간에 조용히 영화 한편 보고 가면 힐링이 따로 없네요..주차장도 백화점 주차장을 이용해서 좋네요~구로역 바로 근처라 접근성 자체는 나쁘지 않지만 주변에 영화관 외에 즐길거리가 너무 부족합니다. ak백화점 내에 위치해 있긴하지만 백화점 문 닫고 난 후에는 아무것도 없어요. 다만 찾는 사람이 많이 없다보니 좋은 자리에서 조용히 영화를 즐기기에는 나쁘지 않습니다조금 오래되고인근 어트랙션이 적어서다소 표 구하기 쉬워서 이용합니다아무래도 신도림, 오목교, 영등포점에 우선순위를 두겠지만차선책으로 검색하셔도 좋을것 같습니다낡은 영화관이고 백화점과 이어져 있어 들어가기도 복잡합니다. 그만큼 인기가 없어 보고싶은 영화는 대부분 표를 구할 수 있어, 그냥 영화를 즐기러 가기에는 좋습니다. 그리고 보기 힘든 파파이스도 있어서 색다른 느낌입니다.ak백화점 내에 있고 구로구에서는 위치가 좋아서 사람들이 많이 찾는 곳입니다. 오래된 cgv인만큼 대대적인 리뉴얼이 필요한 것 같습니다. 최근 구로구에도 좋은 영화관이 많이 생겨 이 곳을 잘 찾지 않게 되네요.좀 오래된 영화관 입니다.내부가 전체적으로 약간 우주...이런 디자인로 꾸며져 있어서 좀 어둡습니다.개인적으로 신도림 CGV가 내부 인테리어가 훨씬 밝습니다.나름 인서울 cgv 이지만, 백화점 자체가 약간 프라자 느낌이라 그런지극장도 서울의 여타 시지브이보다 휭하고 시설도 썩 좋은편은 아닙니다.타상영관에서 별로 하지 않는 영화들은 해주는 경우가 있어 그점은 좋습니다구로역 AK백화점 5층에 있습니다. 평소에는 사람이 많은 편은 아니어서 여유있게 볼 수 있습니다.(가끔 BC카드 1+1이벤트같은 것 할 때는 사람이 무지 많음) 끝나고 백화점 쇼핑하거나 백화점 음식점에서 밥 먹기도 괜찮은 편입니다.CGV구로점은 시설이 약간 낡았지만 편안합니다.매니아영화의 상영도 종종있고, 구로AK위에 위치했기 때문에 식사와 음료를 즐길 곳과 영화시간을 기다리기에도 좋습니다.

Name: CGV 신도림
Rank: 145위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 너무 더럽고 시설도,직원 능숙도도, 스크린 상태도,좌석 상태도 개선해야할것들 투성이라고 생각했었는데,지금은 다른 곳으로 바뀜.신도림은 거의 새로 생긴 디큐브를 많이 가고 식사도 디큐브에서 하게 되는데 극장이 의외로 다른 건물인 테크노마트에 있어요. 왔다갔다하기 불편하고차 가져가면 차 주차했다 다시 빼고 번거롭네요..시설도 동네극장 인수한거 같아요요즘 CGV의 분위기와는 많이 달라서 당황스러웠습니다. 여러 극장체인으로 변경되다보니 예전 극장체인의 디자인과 올드함이 있었습니다. 위치도 신도림 메인스트리트나 디큐브시티와는 조금 걸어야해서 불편했고 특히 엘리베이터로 이동해야 하는 불편함은 엄청 힘들었습니다. 자주 오지않거나 오래 기다려야해서 인내심이 필요합니다. 그나마 사람들이 많이 붐비지않아 그 점은 좋습니다.

Name: 디큐브 시티
Review:
Connected to a busy subway. lots of eatery, a supermarket and fashion shops. There is a Art centre too.Very nicely situated shopping mall having Sheraton hotel. I stayed in the hotel for few days to spend family vacation. It has many choices of food and shopping. Just across the road, variety of Korean foods and drinks are available. Subway green-line is available just...더 보기A wonderful two hours with friends from Dublin on a wet autumn day. Our third visit, their first. A unique experience - quirky, interesting, fun. A must is a visit to the toilets. $12 entrance included wine tasting on the top floor with views over...더 보기Very modern and trendy with lots of shops and fantastic food court with live cooking. We chose the running sushi and it was great!I would say this place has the best shopping in Seoul. With HnM, Stradivarius, Zara and more. There's not too...더 보기Basically, all those retails/branded chainstores are in this place. Hyundai department store always have good promo on. Tax Refund service...더 보기Would I stay here again? YES.
-The rooms are large, clean and modern and the views are spectacular.
-There's the...더 보기hard to communicate in English, most of the staff only able to speak korea only. the closest shopping near to hotelInitially we came here to bring our 4years boy to visit pororo park. But its close now!!!
There's a hype...더 보기Great location , really good food court in mall attached to the hotel , cafes great gym on 28 the floor unbelievable view.
Really accessible to all services , very good little restaurants all around . It is a practical comfortable hotel , very nice...더 보기

Name: 롯데시네마 가산디지털
Rank: 58위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 영화관 자체가 조금 작긴 하지만 현대아울렛에서 편하게 쇼핑하고 남는시간에 영화 한 타임보기 좋아요 ㅎ1층에 캐리어보관하는 곳도 있구요.!현대아울렛 안에 있어서 좋고 오피스가에 있어서 가산동에 근무하는 경우라면 매월 마지막주 수요일에 저렴하게 영화를 보기 좋습니다. 이용객이 많은편이 아니라 복잡하지 않아요CGV보다 편해요아울렛도 있어서 영화보고 쇼핑하고 밥먹고최적화된 위치입니다.자리도 넓고 너무 복잡하지도 않고 주차하기도 편하네요다른 영화관에 비해 예약이 많지 않은편이라영화보기 좋아요 회사근처라 영화회식하기에도 편하고바로 식당가에 위치해서 관람전후에 식사하기도 편해요사람이 많이 없어 조용하게 영화보기 좋다주말 낮만 아니면 주차하기도 용이하다근처에서 쇼핑하고 영화보기 딱 좋은 장소가산 현대 아울렛 쇼핑몰안에 있어서 이용하기가 편리합니다. 이동도 편하고 주변에 즐길거리 볼거리도 많아서 영화를 보러가서 시간을 기다리기도 좋네요. 영화관도 깨끗하게 관리가 되고 사람들이 생각보다 많이 없어서 편하게 영화관람을 하고 옵니다.

Name: 마리오 아울렛
Review:
Easy to get here by Gasan Digital Complex station. A short walk of perhaps 5 mins.It's mostly the local korea brands in here without those international branded brands. Good to visit this place if you have time to spare and not a must. Can't really figure out how the pricing works here. Sometimes, there are additional discount off the tag on items we bought. Spent half a day here and we didn't buy much either.We got quite a good deal of 50% at the North Face over at the nearby Lotte outlet.There are few malls around that area and it is easily accessible by subway. The Lotte mall also nearby but a bit more expensive. Worth to drop by.It’s my first visit. But not many brand shops without few big brand. Price also was not outlet price.3 buildings for you to shop. Lotte factory outlet building is just next door. Don’t waste time there.Compared to the other places around, I find Mario to be the be the best in terms of coverage and price. It's a bit crowded but that's to be expected. There're a total of 3 buildings connected. The price is the same as the Lotte outlet next door, but Mario has more brand and choices.I recommend spending at least 3 hrs+ here to hunt for the best deal.I was disappointed because I thought I could find some western brands here such as Coach, Gucci, Prada among others but this outlet mall mostly has Korean Brands. The shoes options such as adidas and nike weren't also as extensive.travel very easy to go, more more shop and more hawkers area (product cheaper than Hong Kong, good quality)Brands are mid-range or parochial, prices are not impressive and it is comparable in both price and selection to the Hyundai department store across the street. Doesn't feel like a real value proposition- if you want cheap stick to underground malls/street markets. Neighbourhood is boring and out of the way to boot. Nah.Location is near if compared to outlets in paju. Price is little more expensive if compared than paju and the collection is not as large as ones in paju but price wise and time wise it is better to shop here.By the time we get there, we got free car parking. I think it is because some technical error of the operator. But still nice!Oh. And there is lotte outlet too nearby, right next to mario outlet.Tons to choose from a lot of great clothing decently priced not too much money and it's really conveniently close to the subway
 In addition there are good restaurants and there is the movie theaters.

Name: 서울약령시장
