Name: 세종대왕 기념관
Review:
free museum we surprisingly found as we were walking toward the palace down the middle where the fountain and outside statue is located. we went underground and entered for free. there you will find exhibits of korean artifacts. and there is an interactive area for kids and adults alike where you can make a key chain and other crafts for about 1000won. there is also a gift shop with drink refreshments and a restaurant. a good respite from the heat of summer. bathrooms are clean.This is actually a museum, whose entrance is a passageway behind the Statue of King Sejong the Great. The museum exhibits has English explanation, dedicating the life and achievements of King Sejong. There is a small movie room where you can watch a video as well. It also connects to another part of the museum dedicated to Admiral Yi Sun-Shin. He is famous for defeating the Japanese with the famed turtle ship that helped win the war. There is a replica of a turtle ship you can walk on. Being underground and free admission, it is a good way to take a break from the heat or rain, enjoy some air con and also use the toilet facilities.Briefly, we passed by the memorial hall of King Sejong. It was a nice area to check Korea's hangul (alphabet) history.Constructed in the memory Greatest king of Korea, King Sejong , this underground museum traces his life, achievement and contribution to the development of the nation.We passed by the underground museum when we were heading to the Palace from the Stream. The entrance way under the King’s statue, no admission fee. Good to have a quick visit if you don’t have much time. Not so crowded as other places in Seoul.This underground museum is a good place to visit if you're passing by Gwanghamun Square. It's a good way to escape the heat during a hot day, to warm yourself during winter and to pass time during a rainy day.You'll get to be inspired by the story of King Sejong as you walk thru the tunnel, read his achievements and see how his works have benefited the country.Connected with the king Sejong statue on the guanghuamun square and it's a free admission exhibition, which shows how the Hanja was created (by king Sejong) the evolution of Korea, next to it is the Yi sun sin exhibition, which shows a replica of the infamous turtle battleship. There are activities for kids also practising Hanja characters, rebuilding of the battle ship etc.Not being familiar with this aspect of Korean history, this was a nice introduction. The museum is open, modern, and well maintained. Offered several opportunities for children to interact using technology. This would be good for a rainy day as it is all indoors. It is located near the Palace, Ferry Memorial, and US embassy. There are several coffee shops within walking distance. To be honest, I didn't go too into depth at this museum, but it was nice to walk around and get the gist of it.Lot of Information is on display. Videos , Photos & Historic relics have been kept inside
Must visit for TouristsThis place has interactive displays and some very informative sections on two of Korea's greatest heroes. As a non-Korean speaker there was still enough information for me to get a great deal out of our visit. Not sure the 4D film added much, but it was free, and only lasted 9 minutes!

Name: 노량진 수산물 도매시장
Location: 서울 동작구 노들로 674 Metro #1 Noryangjin Station (우) 06900
Review:
The best place to get seafood in Seoul. The fish stall are linked to the restaurant, so Khuan need to select and they will cook for you. A bit pricey but the king crab is worth the price. A heartfelt meal for the whole family.The lady that sealling the fresh seafood was very friendly and give us advise on the seafood that we chose. And the price is reasonable too.
But be careful of the restaurant you going to choose.they will charge you the price very high..that what happend...더 보기Visited on a weekday morning and it's not crowded. Abundance of stalls selling live seafood. The lady selling us the seafood was extremely friendly but the guy was quite arrogant! She also brought us to a small restaurant on another floor to prepare the seafood...더 보기All fresh seafood are here . Not too expensive. And you can choose the restaurant for cooking upstairs . The price for cooking is also cheap . Very impressed . Some use English speaking, very easy to communicateWent to Noryangjin fish market with my wife to treat ourselves to king crab. Managed to get a good price for 2.8kg crab ($180Aud), however, we were stung by the restaurant preparing our crab. First there was the serving fee ( which almost doubled in...더 보기My friends mum said this place made new building.
So big..!!!  We choose sea foods then go up stairs one of restaurant we can eat these we choose sea foods. but quite expensive here ...
Sea foods cost + cooking cost +cover charge etc...
We...더 보기There were plenty of seafood, it was very interesting we went round and round the market. King Crabs are a common sight.. Fresh Fish if you want it sashimi style. We check the price, it was very costly. They have different layers of pricing like...더 보기My daughter and I visited this place because we wanted to get fresh seafood, and true enough this was the perfect place. There are fresh seafood vendors inside and outside and we opted to just eat fresh sushi but there are fresh seafood inside where...더 보기Heard from friend to give it a try. Ordered crab and 2 large prawns and cost 73000 won with cooking fee. Seafood tastes very fresh.We went there after all what we heard and read about that place! We really enjoyed the evening! The food is super fresh and tasty. Picking such fresh fish isn't something you can do in many places around the world! Yes, it was pricy and...더 보기

Name: 마포아트센터
Review: Ho avuto il piacere di esibirmi in concerto come fisarmonicista solista con orchestra d’archi e ho apprezzato moltissimo questo teatro. Molta professionalita cortesia e gentilezza. Spero di poterci suonare ancora! Grazie mille

Name: 클럽 보니따 서울
Location: 서울 마포구 동교로 191 디비엠빌딩 지하1층 B101호 (우) 03993
Review: An informal place where You can enjoy dancing even as a beginner !The atmosphere is really cool and relaxed! It s a real pleasure to see people always smiling around You just waiting for the next song!I ve to say that Miss Jessica together with all her staff are doing a great Job!Hope to come back soon.Congratulations !!

Name: 망원 한강공원
Review: This is one of Hangang Riverside Parks. The location is quite suburb and it's not that crowded normally. Once you are here, you can take a walk slowly or spend some time on lawns.There aren't many things to do. But, fishing decks are quite interesting to see. You can see people fishing there.Also, Seoul Battleship Park is locating within this park.We were staying at an Airbnb beside Mangwon Market and our host suggested that I walk to Hangang Park on the bank of the Han River, about a 10 minute walk. The walk turned out to be a little longer than that and I arrived at blue hour during some light rain.The park is pretty large and has climbing frames for kids and great views along the Han river and across the other side of buildings lit up in the night. There are also excellent views of the Seongsan Bridge which is also lit up.One of the most interesting parts of the park is the Seoul Battleship Park which is set within Mangwon Hangang Park. This park includes giant ships propellers and small navy boats both in the water and set up on stands in the park. The main building of the museum was still open but close to closing so for the cost of paying 3,000 Won to enter I gave it a miss.Overall, for bringing the kids in the daytime, for jogging and exercising or for strolling along the bank of the Han River, this is a pretty nice place to spend a little time.

Name: 홍대앞 거리
Review: This is an incredible area of Seoul worth checking out. If you are young and visiting Seoul for the first time, I would also suggest staying in the Hongdae area, it's really never a dull moment here even at night time. Amazing restaurants that are very affordable, cheap street food and of course arts as well. You can also check out the Hongdae Free Market on Saturdays.it was a ncie street, full of cute lil things. it is basically for teenagers especially for girls. They have many quaint lit shop that sell cosmetic, jewelleries, accessories and clothings too.For my opinion should go on the night. you can saw so mouch live music and dancer on the street it was enjoy.Also you can buy clothes in the streetIt is a good place to relieve stress not only by children but alsoadults at slime cafes. The inside of the cafe is clean and the staff is kind. The price is low, soyou can build memories with friends and get closer. As soon as you start to touch it with yourhands, you will feel better.This area has a California Berkeley University flare. Diverse eatery’s, beer, coffee houses, etc. The metro stop is in the middle. A great kick back place a cute walking area.Pretty cool. Lots of activity. Right behind and parallel to the street, in the evening, it is bustling. Lots of people, restaurants, and K-Pop bands showcasing their skills!Plenty of good people watching, shopping, and eating to do here. You can walk for a while and eat your way along. Fun way to spend a couple hours exploring some of the local area.Hongdae shopping street comes alive at night. Highly recommended to stay near the area if you enjoy street food with reasonably priced restaurants, fashionable streetwear, clubbing/bar hoping and noraebong (karaoke rooms). Everything night is a Friday night so a warning to those who don’t enjoy crowds and noise until the wee hours of the morning.Lots of food and bars, very reasonably priced, also good for shopping. Much busier then Ewha Women’s University. A must visit spot.There is food all over this area, From Korean BBQ, to Sushi, to Bibimbap, Coffee Shops you name it. My personal favorite is Bibiri for Affordable Delicious Bibimbap. It is in a basement and hard to find, but totally worth it.

Name: 서울 월드컵 경기장 (상암 월드컵 경기장)
Review:
It was a stadium as all the others but the people made the diffrent. Everyone was nice and friendly and took care of there dirt.Love coming here to watch Seoul FC play. It's super easy to get tickets - just come 30 mins before and get them from the ticket booth. Stadium is huge, with so many empty seats - not to worry! Seats aren't allocated, so you can...더 보기Just did the tour of the stadium
Which was pretty underwhelming. Didn’t even have player jerseys hung up in dressing room. Looked old and worn out insideWent to visit Faetansium where there's some facts and histories on football (and Korean football) but mainly in Korean. But...더 보기I have been here first time for Turkey vs China football match for World Cup 2002 in Republic of Korea. Turkey : 3 - China: 0 It is a great stadium, convenient transportation and easy watching stadium.Very interesting place to visit especially Faentasium has interesting stuff that if you're a fan of football you gonna enjoy...더 보기The massive majestic world cup stadium is impressive and fit for purpose for this day and age for major football...더 보기It's a nice stadium. With a massive super market underneath. Really good food centre big cheap meals with a massive...더 보기South Korea and Japan jointly held the FIFA World Cup football tournament in 2002.
The World Cup Stadium in Seoul...더 보기It was breath-taking when I finally saw this monument. It really stands out and so many activities going on at...더 보기

Name: 해피데이스파 홍대점
Review: Steam bath spa is a specialty in Korea and I really wanted to try. This spa is close to where my hotel is, so I decided to get it a try. Price wise, it is very reasonable but the facilities are very old and run down. The steam room is nothing spectacular. The resting room is dirty and there is this gentleman cleaning and stacking the mattress making a lot of noise without considering people are sleeping and resting. Unless there is no other choice, I will not recommend this place.This spa is easily accessible for those staying in Hongdae. The staff don't speak a lot of English but they are willing to help. There are lockers outside the spa <U+2013> ignore these as they aren't used. If you want a scrub, make sure you have KRW.20,000 cash,which you can give to the Ajimmas in the bathes who do the scrubbing. You'll.pay KRW.10,000 at the front desk to use the baths in addition to this. Your shoes go in a small locker with a key, then you'll also get a larger locker with an RFID lock for your clothes. I got this wrong the first time and put all my things in the one locker. I was eventually corrected by one of the staff. Learn from my errors and have a great time!This was my first time at a spa, it was near 2am and it was after a night of drinking at a baseball game.Paid 9000 won to use the sauna area.Guy inside guided me what to do with the lockers and sent me on my way. I thought it was pretty nice and refreshing. Sauna, bathe, shower was refreshing. Even brushed my teeth and what not.Contrary to some of the reviews read, I got quite a relative pleasant experience here. Counter service was good. There will be uncle inside the changing room who later guided me as this was my first time here. The only thing I hoped could improved would probably be including some of the English translation. FYI, I visited close to 12 midnight.I stayed happy day spa 2 times November 2017.I paid by credit card and I did not get receipt at 2nd time.When I came back to my country and check how much I paid,I paid double price which I paid at first time.So be careful.You should always ask to get receipt.If you are thinking about using this facility, i would like to tell you not to do. Staffs are very unkind(they are only kind for so-called 'health club(fitness club)' members. And electric key does not function properly. If u want feel BAD EXPERIENCE in Korean, then I do not care.Old and worn out. Basic facilities. Staff in jjimjilbang incredibly rude, shouting at you if you fall asleep. Will never return. Siloam is much nicer in my opinion.This is my 2nd Hanjeunmuk in this trip. I came in around 5pm. Not many people. The staff was ok with English and staff let me kow the $tix by pointing the pictures. I saw some wastern customers already in the spa. I didn't order any body srub as i just did it days ago. B1-spa and shower, B2 gym, resting area. B3- Hanjeunmuk, and huge rest area.( As i remember) good place to stay and sleep if your flight (arrives/leaves) in the middle of the night. Save $.If you have been to dragon Hill spa and feel that it is very packed. Then you can try this place. It have lesser crowd which is good if you want to have some rest. It is cheaper as well. And it is nearer to myeongdong. With lots of other activities may late at night in hongik.Huge jjimjabang without all the pretentiousness of the fancier ones in town. If you want to see what an authentic jjimjabang is like; soak in the pools here, dip into the frozen room, grab some delicious food and crash out for the night.

Name: 롯데시네마 홍대입구
Rank: 132위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 공항철도 홍대입구역에서 아주 가까운 위치에 있습니다. 상영관 아래의 층들이 쇼핑몰이나 음식점들로 채워져있어서 영화시간이 남거나 할때 시간을 보내기 좋습니다. 다만 상영관이 작은 관계로 스케일이 큰 영화를 보기엔 부족하다고 느껴집니다.

Name: 메세나폴리스몰
Review: 地下<U+9244>合井<U+99C5>直結のモ<U+30FC>ルで、小さい店構えですがエチュ<U+30FC>ドハウスで買い物しました。ス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>のホ<U+30FC>ムプラスを利用しました。平日の夕方に行きましたが、人も少なく買い物しやすかったです。フ<U+30FC>ドコ<U+30FC>トもあります。<U+99C5>前にある便利なショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルです。どちらかというと、<U+98F2>食店が充<U+5B9F>しているのが<U+5F37>みです。<U+69D8><U+3005>なタイプのお店があり、いい店が必ず見つかると思います。施設も新しく綺麗で、快適に過ごせる半地下ワ<U+30FC>ルドです。韓<U+56FD>、ソウルの地下<U+9244>2<U+53F7>線、6<U+53F7>線のハプチョン（合井）<U+99C5>に直結したショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルです。いろいろなショップ以外にレストラン街やカフェも充<U+5B9F>していて、ここで友人と待ち合わせて、ランチを<U+697D>しみました。弘大の一つ向こう合井(ハプチョン)に直結しているショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルです。ファッション、コスメショップ、大型ス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>、<U+98F2>食店とバランスよく入っていてとても便利です。めまいがするほどの人混みの弘大と比べたらはるかに人が多くないのがポイント高いです。コスメショップからス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>まであります。上がマンションになっているので、便利なお店が多いです。芸能人に遭遇する率も高いんだそうです。ちょうど雨の日に行ったこともあり合井<U+99C5>直結というのはありがたかったです。ショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルとしては大型ではありませんが、上の階は高級マンションになっており、入っている店<U+8217>はわりと庶民的なものが多くレストランも複<U+6570>入っています。日本で人<U+6C17>のファストファッション系は大<U+4F53>あったような<U+6C17>がしました。GAP無印ユニクロなど。ロ<U+30FC>ラアシュレイもありました。カフェもたくさん入っていて雨の日に濡れずにショッピングを<U+697D>しめる良いスポットだとは思いますが、韓<U+56FD>特有の。。。とかそう言うのでは無く、どこにでもあるショッピングモ<U+30FC>ル的な感じでした。上水<U+99C5>前近くの食堂でランチを食べたあと、お散<U+6B69>しながら隣の<U+99C5>のこちらのモ<U+30FC>ルへいきました。平日の日中だったこともあり、どこも空いていました。韓<U+56FD>版ユニクロ？のようなプチプラのお店あり（本家のユニクロもありました）、かわいい<U+96D1>貨店あり、もちろん<U+98F2>食店やカフェも充<U+5B9F>していました。地下<U+9244>２<U+53F7>線<U+30FB>６<U+53F7>線が通る合井<U+99C5>の10番出口に直結している、カラフルな傘がカワイイショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルです。ホ<U+30FC>ムプラスをはじめ、コスメショップやグルメ店、映<U+753B>館まであり雨の日の<U+89B3>光には特におすすめ。最近人<U+6C17>スポットの望遠洞にも近いので、足をのばしてみては。ほぼ<U+6BCE>回、おみやげを買うときはここにあるス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>（HomePlus）を利用します。品<U+63C3>えもいいし、安いです。キムチの量り<U+58F2>りがないのが<U+6B8B>念ですが、パウチタイプなら<U+58F2>ってます。ス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>のほかに食事のできるお店もいくつかあるし、化粧品のお店もあります。便利です:)

Name: 롯데시네마 합정
Rank: 131위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 메세나폴리스 안에 위치하고있어서 찾기 쉽습니다. 합정역과 가까워요. 지금 행사중인지 맥주 한잔을 약 천원에 판매되고 있더라구요. 부담없이 맥주를 즐길수 있어서 좋았습니다.합정이 가까워서 가끔 가요. 상영가능한 관이 몇개 없고 팝콘이 맛이 없어요 ㅠㅠ 그래서 가까운 롯데시네마 놔두고 홍대 cgv까지 가는 경우가 많아 안타까움.. 사람은 없어서 그점은 진짜 좋음.주말에 홍대에서 영화보기가 힘들 때 롯데시네마로 검색하면 자리가 그래도 많이 남아있는 편이라 애용영화관 자체는 좀 작아요 ㅠ 그래도 교통 편리하고 사람이 적은 편인거 같아요 은근 자주 갑니다합정이나 마포부근에 사신다면 좋지만 오래되지않은 극장치고 그렇게 시설이 좋거나 하지는 않아요~주말이라 그런지 주차장입구서만 이십분정도 서 있어야했던 극장이었네요. 늦을까봐 조마조마했는데 다행히 아슬아슬 도착했어요. 건물구조가 복잡하니 찾아가기도 힘들었고 극장도 좁아서 사람들이 북적여서 답답했습니다합정 메세나폴리스에 있지만 메세나폴리스 구조상 올라가는 길이 불편하고 복잡한데다, 상영관 구조도 영 엉망진창이다. 이래서 롯데시네마가 CGV에 못 비비는구나 싶음. 롯데시네마도 별론데 그중에서도 아주 최악인 수준.합정에 메세나 폴리스안에 있는 영화관입니다. 생각보다 규모가 작은거에 놀랐으며 입구를 찾기가 좀 힘들었습니다. 매표소와 상영관이 연결이 되어 있지않고 다른 곳에 위치해있어 이동하는 불편함도 있었습니다. 영화관이 들어갈 장소가 아닌 곳에 구겨 넣은 느낌이었습니다. 가까운 홍대쪽에 영화관을 이용하는 편이 나아보입니다.

Name: 서울 에스케이프 룸 홍대점
Rank: 8위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: The game starts when you have to find the place itself. It's not hidden but not so easy to find. The staff speaks English and they are very friendly. The challenge was about escaping from an elevator. Younger kid is 7 yo and enjoyed a lot.Don't be ashamed of using the hints otherwise you won't have enough time.Great timeWe took on the European Spy challenge. It was a lot of fun. 60 mins went by so fast! Well be better spies next time! Thanks for the great experience!Really cool experience, not too easy but definitely doable in time. Highly affordable, especially compared to the ones I know in Germany. Was fun!Very nice and pleasant staff, nice escape room , we enjoyed our time We played the european spy room and we finished it with 3:24 min remaining, and only 2 hintsMy friend and I went there to while away an hour, it was so much fun. The people working there was very friendly and helpful. We had a little problem with one of the boxes so they came and helped right away. Lots of fun. Want to go again.We had so fun in this room, and we are gonna try one more episode soon in this night time withmy eldest sonIt was honestly all just randomly placed. We had to search everywhere. I thought maybe it would be more brain-work like the escape rooms in norway where you have to do puzzles and stuff, but nope. We had to turn the place upside down and get hints when we got stuck. But all in all, it was ok.Played the Chairman’s office, and loved it! Thanks for the experience guys :) will come back if ever in the city and would definitely recommend to friends!It's really fun, and the fact that there is an option to do it in English means that you can actually enjoy the room. The staff there are really friendly, and the price is a decent too.I Love it! I've been 3 times now. Best escape room in Seoul!I will defintely go again! The Amazon room was terrific!

Name: 홍대앞 예술시장 프리마켓
Review:
It is a really small flea market selling crafts and other knick-knacks. Luckily, it is located in an area which is waaaaaay more interesting.I really do not have much to talk about this place really. I guess if you are within the vicinity, you can drop by for a quick visit.The market was smaller than we expected with only around 20 -25 stalls on the day we visited. It’s in a very lively area with lots of shops and drinking places. Probably not worth a special trip but if you’re in the area...First time here on a Chuseok holidays, I thought will be quiet but surprisingly NOT! The place is hip and happening with street performance about 5 different type to watch and support and you may tip them for some cash :) walk along the streets with so many ladies clothes, sports shops and also for guys. There's also street food as well. I am still feeling hungry, luckily there's a mall in Hongdae has Halal Guys for me to dine :PI came to the location after 1 PM that’s when the information said that it “opened” - but found ... a regular street of shops and stalls, and a few “buskers,” but certainly nothing that wasn’t open an hour before. I wandered pretty extensively, so I’m confident I was in the right place, but unimpressed for an “art market.” Fun to wander, but not as an art market.Lots of things happening here - plenty of atmosphere- buskers, great shops  food stalls and even nicer cafes (where you can actually sit!)
 Good prices here as it is in a university area and caters for kids with not a lot of money.Another gem provided by our driver. We met an artist who did wonderful oil paint reproductions of actual photographs for an very low cost. We visited the market in the afternoon and paintings of our three grandkids and two of my favorite airplanes were delivered to our hotel by seven in gathering evening. Lots of neat Korean art items.Every time we visit Seoul, we always schedule a weekend to go to Hongdae Art Free Market. It is an open area where artists get the chance to showcase their talents thru stuff like jewelries, potteries, leather goods, clothes, postcards, paintings, etc. All designs are handmade. You can even have your portraits made while waiting. My 2 girls and I enjoyed walking around and appreciating the talents of the artists who participated in the free market. We bought quite a handful of products and we loved them. Some stalls even accept credit cards. Try and visit this place when you are in Seoul.A place for youngsters and teens. Lots of apparel shops, cafes etc. There were teens performing K pop dance and songs. We went on a Monday so it was not really crowded. A must go place for the young and young at heart.Lots of food and apparels store. The place is livelier with the younger generations vibes. It is a must not miss place to go visit when in seoul.Is totally different with Myeong Dong walking street. Selling different range of stuff and food. Must pay a visit when in Seoul.

Name: 마포대교
Review: At first finding a safe way to get on the bridge seemed impossible but as always the lovely residents if Seoul aided us. The experience was awesome. We arrived onto the bridge shortly before sunset, the plan was to watch all the bridges light up. It didn't quite work out that way. Going back to the bridge. The views from here are stunning. It's crazy to think you have cars driving at full speed on one side then the stunning view of the Han river on the other. We walked across the entire bridge to yeouido hangang park. It was perfect timing because friday evening they have a night market that's open with amazing food options and lots of music festivals. Young talent appear and play near the riverside. It's just magical. The sign may have seen better days but the park speaks for itself.Been through this bridge several times. In the middle of Yongsan and Mapo districts, offer a nice view of Seoul

Name: 디지털파빌리온
Review: The variation in architecture alone is worth the visit. Lots of great sites. Make time. Open your eyes ... Korea does some things in a special way ...not so much to do for the adults, but the kids will have some fun there. its a small place, so it wouldnt take up much of your time.Decided to check this out as it had all this stuff written about it. Get a brochure and check if this is your thing before you go as it is quite a distance from Seoul. We made the trip on a weekday and there was...더 보기

Name: 망원시장
Review:
Interesting traditional Korean marketplace easily accessible by metro. This place has lots of delicious snacks and street food and you can see stalls selling hugh and tiny reddish, hugh cabbage and big red apples, etc. Worth a visitA traditional market near Mangwon Station. Good to visit.- Featured by media several times. This is popular even locating in a residential area.- This is quite away from other touristic areas. But, we saw some foreign tourists.- Very huge. The market continues even outside the arcade. Also, Mangwondong Worldcup Market is right across the road.- Various places to try street foods and they are affordable. If you don't know what to try, have some at crowded places.The market is a local community asset that the residents support in order to sustain it. 

It was good to visit such a market rather than only see a market aimed at tourists.Walk within 5-10 minutes from subway station to this market and it's easy to find using Naver maps. During walks, there are some shop sell fruits or local food and products. Inside the market, there are stall who sell raw meat, vegetables, banchan (korean side dish), local food snack shop, etc.. well, it's a traditional market and you can find anything. I bought strawberry for 3000 Won (big pack, 24 pcs). Strawberry is big and very sweet. I eat famous kalguksu (noodles with broth soup) which cost me 3500 Won with a very big portion. The restaurant is not too big that I have to queue for 5-8 minutes and 1 person 1 order. You can't share the meals even though it's very big for my size. I bought odeng (fish cake) for 2000 Won 3 pcs and it's delicious also thick (not like the one I eat in Hongdae). Very chewy. I also bought rice with red bean which is very good also. Oh my ... I do have a larger stomach so I can eat all of the food here ... hahahaha...Mangwon Market is a long sheltered street with shops at both sides selling all types of food. Unless you browsing at every stall and eating your way thru, one can cover the market in 1-2 hours. There are all types of food. There are cooked and raw food, meat, vegetables, seafood, fruits, marinated food.We had a pork and chicken culet near end of the market and the meat was great.We went here on Monday, 24 Dec 2018. It is difficult to find this market. We have to walk about 10min from mangwon station and there is no sign to this market from mangwon exit. We have to ask several person to find this market. Just a local traditional market with limited foods. 3 Odeng = 2000 won ( cheaper than odeng in myeongdong @ 2000 won )Although I love the Gwangjang Market, it is extremely busy and tourists tend to make walking through very difficult. This market has delicious food for much better prices. Short rib patties, mandu, famous fried chicken, croquettes, hotteok, fermented stingray, kalguksu and so much more ready-made food. There is even an Isaac's Toast without the busy line. He location is so good if you are near the world cup stadium or Hongdae area. Much better choice for those serious about the food scene!We were staying in an Airbnb just adjacent to the market so as I really enjoy traditional markets it was perfect to go explore this one. The market is very long and mostly covered with all kinds of interesting produce from fresh fruit and vegetables to meat, seafood and kimchi and dimsum and so much more. There were stores selling aquariums, shoes, hardware and there were mini supermarkets too.About halfway down there are public toilets as well as a park and some eat places. The places selling food can be found all around the market, but the best time to get really delicious street food at the market is at night time when the market really comes alive.This is a local market in a residential area, but a pretty huge market. If you are into traditional wet markets then this is a nice one.Stopped at Mangwon market on a bike tour. A very interesting insight into how local Korean people live. The food was delicious and their speciality is fried chicken although they do have stalls for all manner of different types of food. It’s relatively inexpensive but I would recommend trying the spicy chicken before you buy a box as it is HOT!!This market is far from city. However, it is a very local and authentic wet market. You can see the local shop and done here. If you want to understand local Seoul peoples living, this is a highly recommended place to go.

Name: 하늘공원
Review: I went to Haneul Park in Mid Nov and flowers have withered. All that were left are field of brown Lalang. Definitely, was hoping for more colours but can't be help that I went at the wrong timing. Personally felt that the park will be enchanted if we went at the right time with flowers blooming.You will be required to climb stairs up to the park. After the short climb, the gradient is gentle. It took us around 45 minutes to finish exploring the park, taking photographs. The park is a 10 minutes walk from world cup stadium, making it accessible by public transport.The weather was cooling then at around 10-14 degree Celsius making the walk enjoyable. It was a worth a trip there as you can visit Mapo-Gu or Hongdae easily after. It will be added bonus if you plan the trip well and see the seasonal flowers in timely manner.Overall, a beautiful place to go to if you have extra time to spare and is looking for a spot for instagram worthy pictures.I found this place from a few blogs that recommended scenic places to visit in South Korea. It is not hard to get here. Just needed to walk quite a distance from the train station. This visit to the park is very nice if you have one whole day to spare and relax walking around to just look at the scenery. There are other parks nearby but the area is very huge and you cannot visit them all in one day. Our feets are also hurting from the long walk. I visited during the end of Autumn, nearing winter. It was worth the trip here because it is really as beautiful as described in the blogs and when I was there, there wasn't a lot of people or tourists. Only the starting area has some crowd, but when you start to walk up and explore the tall plant areas, it is very peaceful and quiet. And you can take beautiful photo there. Just remember to bring a tripod if you have no one to help you take photo! I would suggest not to step into the plant area as it will kill the plants. There are already some area that people have cleared for you to step into so you can walk around and find those areas to take your photos instead. If you do not want to hike up, there is a place near the bottom of the park to purchase a ticket for the buggy car to bring you up, One way or round trip. The ride is very nice if you can sit at the back seats which was what we did.  If you are hungry, there is a little snack shop near the tall grass area, with many choices of food and beverages. There's also a few table and benches where you can rest and eat your snacks or instant noodles on. Just outside the train station, there are some shops selling clothes if you are not wearing enough.I come to Hanuel Park on autumn day. The weather is so cool and little hot at noon.The park is near by World Cup Stadium.It's so easy to go to there by subway.And you take electric car to the top or climb to there.You should go to pinky grass hill.It has fresh air and clear blue sky. I really enjoyed the moment there. You can go there by subway to World Cup Stadium Station and walk about 1 kilometres to Haneul Park. You can choose shuttle bus and pay about KRW 5,000 for round trip or just walk by the upstairs to the destination. It was good experience!!!Its my 2nd time here, went on summer 2018 and autumn 2019.You can see the park in many photos in social media. Its a nice backdrop for photos.Its crowded when we visited, long line for the golf-cart shuttle service.Visit this park for views of the river, city and football stadium. The area was a land fill turned into an attractively landscaped hill. It is a popular destination especially when its tall grasses seed and turn red. The hill top has a cafe and toilets. The staircase serving the hill features 291 steps, so bare that in mind when you start to climb it.Instagram brought us here! The park is huge, from the size of it, probably 90% is filled with silvergrass and the rest is pink muhly grass and kochia. We arrived early in the morning and had to walk around 20 minutes from World Cup station to reach the foot of the hill. There are 3 options to reach the top, by tram, stairs or hill climb. We opted for stairs and get down by hill. There was silvergrass festival during my trip but it wasnt fully bloom yet. Pink muhly grass on the other hand was blooming perfectly but the land plot for pink muhly is too small hence huge crowd. Overall experience, we had great time hereYou may call it hype, marketing, commercialized space... I call it, a patch of beautiful nature called PARKIf you have the time, GO Autumn is the best time to go when the grass turns pink and the leaves are yellow. The path is already an adventure with the different sounds that tingle your sensesThe signage around about wild creatures make you appreciate their respect for nature and the natural habitat of animalsSome say it is nice to go on foot instead of riding the buggy... I think paying 3,000 Won is better then perhaps fulfilling your step while at the top moving from one section to the other is much better.Make sure to take a drink with you because you will want to sit in one of the huts with a cold drink on hand (and maybe some snacks)-DONT FORGET THE SUNSCREEN!Interesting at the top with the grass land and good views of Seoul. Noticed long lines for the shuttle to the top. Not sure why so many waiting for shuttle. You could walk to top in less time than in line. And there is a gradual road to top if you want to avoid stairs.I visited here at the end of September this year and in October of last year. I went to see the pink Muhly grass and the silver grass. It was pretty but not as full at the end of September thus I recommend going in October as I went last year - the silver grass was blooming then at that time. Overall, nice views from up there. One time we hiked up, the other time we took the trolly ride. It costs 3,000 won one way. Avoid going on the weekend, if you can, as it is packed then. Weekdays are much better.

Name: 트릭아이뮤지엄 서울
Review:
Loved everything about The Trick eye museum i would highly recommend this to all my friends and family..love itThis museum was one of my most memorable place in Seoul. It was very interactive in that you can be...더 보기This place is so incredibly tacky that you can't help but to have a good time! It was well worth...더 보기First, this is not a museum in the conventional sense. It's a series of wall paintings and mirrors, and other...더 보기Considering this place is top rated amongst tourist. I feel that there needs to be some kind of guidance. There...더 보기Trickeye Museum??? Who knew!
This is an experience not to be missed if like us, you have no idea what...더 보기Had a lot of fun and took some crazy pics. There were indeed some eye bending displays that wow'd me....더 보기I had a fun time here, it is highly recommended to anyone visiting Seoul. Everyone would have a guarantee unique...더 보기I have truely enjoyed my visit here. The staffs were welcoming and atmosphere was fun. Next year's round 2. Thank...더 보기Such a fun experience, would 100% go again. Lots of good photo opportunities! Cheap for what you get, great fun....더 보기

Name: 아현동 웨딩드레스거리
Review: Поехали сюда что бы скоротать время до запланированного неподалеку мероприятия. Прошлись от станции Ahyeon до Ewha woman's university (обе на зеленой линии). В витринах выставлены свадебные платья, а так же вечерние и ханбоки. Свадебные платья, на мой взгляд, не актуальны для русских. Наши девочки такие одевали лет 10-20 назад, хотя все на любителя...

Name: 연세로
Review: Yonsei University is considered the one of the most prestigious South Korean university. Sinchon Campus where all K-Dramas are filmed is the main campus. Underwood Hall, is covered with vines/plants that turns reddish during autumn.Getting here:Sinchon Station [신촌역], Seoul Subway Line 2, Exit 218 mins walk to the 3 most popular Gothic-style buildings (side-by-side) in the university ground.It has one of the most beautiful campuses in Seoul.Right next to Sinchon towards North. Noce university, good location. Good for taking some pictures..This is a lively area with restaurants, shops and cafes. Live music performances can be seen on the weekends. Late night activities such as karaoke or norebang are plentiful. Word of caution: try not to stay beyond last subway train home. It can be difficult to flag down a taxi at 2 am in this area.It's a very modern university with a lot of buildings with different architecture. We had the opportunity to visit the new constructions that they were building at the time we were there.Had 2 student leaders or rep to take us around the school. They are very friendly. The university is very big. Some parts were under construction at the time of visit. Man, its so awesome to visit the whole place, there afew amazing buildings to see

Name: 연세대학교 박물관
Review: 韓<U+56FD>の慶應と言われる、エリ<U+30FC>ト私立大<U+5B66>の<U+6B74>史を<U+5B66>べます。<U+533B><U+5B66>部を含めた<U+6B74>史資産の多さを感じさせる潤<U+6CA2>な<U+5185>容でした。延世大<U+5B66>校の建物５２１の二階の一室が<U+6226>前に同<U+5B66>を卒業した夭折の詩人尹東柱の記念室となっています。建物の前の一<U+753B>には彼の詩...더 보기ソウルにある延世大<U+5B66>のキャンパス<U+5185>にある博物館です。延世大<U+5B66>は一般に開放してあるので誰でも入ることができます。植民地時代...더 보기

Name: 메가박스 신촌
Rank: 61위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 一度利用したらもらえたり、周<U+8FBA>の<U+98F2>食店に置いてあったり、お得なク<U+30FC>ポンをよく出しているのでこれを利用することを<U+5F37>くお<U+52E7>めします！カップルで、映<U+753B>鑑賞券２枚とポップコ<U+30FC>ンと<U+98F2>み物２つで２万ウォンと、他の映<U+753B>館よりお得な値段で見れますよ。建物の外見だったり、一階にある施設が全て閉店していたり、少しさびれた雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>がありますが、中に入ってみるとごく一般的な映<U+753B>館です。クリスマス、バレンタインなどのイベントだったり、<U+604B>活のイベントだったり色<U+3005>やってるみたいです！

Name: 연세대학교 신촌캠퍼스
Review:
If you are on a budget try campus tours.  This is definitely one of the campuses you shouldn't miss...close to Ewha University.
Nearest subway is Sinchon station.If you visit Ehwa Women's University, you should also come here. It has some attractive buildings and nice landscaping and it is one of the best universities in Korea.Came here for exchange a long time ago and the campus had undergone renovations. There may not be any main attraction here as compared to Ewha University but overall, the vibe is better. 

Not a must go place for tourist but for prospective students, this...더 보기I came here for a visit because one of my friends took a semester of school here. The campus was surrounded by trees which made it really pretty but otherwise it is not particularly special.

Name: 서대문 자연사 박물관
Review: While visiting Seoul, my son kept asking to see dinosaur bones so we decided to check out the Seodaemun Museum of Natural History. We arrived just after the museum opened at 9 and we were the only ones there. The entrance fee for adults is 6,000 won and it’s free for kids under 5. The museum was fairly standard for a natural history museum. There was a section on dinosaurs, beautiful rocks, cool insect displays, live fish and insects, some stuffed animals, evolution, fossils, etc. Overall, it’s a nice museum and good for a couple hour visit. There is a cool looking slide outside, but it was raining while we were there so we didn’t use it. While we were finishing up at the museum several school groups arrived. I recommend getting there early in order to avoid the school groups. There was a snack shop at the museum and also a small gift shop. We got off at the Gajwa metro station and took a taxi from there. It would be a bit of a ways to walk from the metro station plus there is a steep hill going up to the museum.We went all the family, my kids are 5, 12 and 15. They really enjoyed but the only problem that nearly everything is in Korean. But it was not the big problem, the like the Dinos and earth development I truly recommend to go, specially if you have childrensWe went yesterday with my 3 kids (5, 12 and 15). Was really fun but I don put 5 stars because nearly everything was in Korean. For the little one is no a problem because he enjoying mostly looking but the others are different. The app for the mobile so good for kids!If yours kids likes Dinos is super fun. Very interesting the earth environment. You can spend about 2 hours and it's a very good price.this museum is so good for adults, young and kids. its about dinosaurs and plants and how human beings lived before. must visit for nature loversIt was smaller than we thought it would be but it did not disappoint! We have a 2 and 3 year old and they liked it. Not an all day trip though. 3 hours max.I have seen many Natural History Museums and this is for sure not the largest but the rock and minerals collection displayed here is absolutely outstanding. Seoul has a lot to offer tourist, so depends on the time available to you and your interests; you may consider visiting Seodaemun Museum. There is no subway station near the museum and you will have to walk up/down hill for about 10 min to reach the Bus Stop. You can also take a taxi which is usually at a reasonable cost in Seoul.This structure and museum is like a step back in time for Korean heritage and culture. It is very beautiful here, especially around fall and/or spring. After a short trip to this museum, you can easily go around the corner and you will be in a very central location to shop, eat, etc.Although a relatively small museum (three floors) for natural history, the facility has a wealth of exhibits and visual fodder to keep young ones occupied. A lack of English description limits a full appreciation of the content, but a good and cheap ($3) way to spend a couple hours.This museum is tucked away and hidden from regular traffic, but don't expect that to mean it'll be empty. The adult fee is a reasonable 3,000 won. There are lockers on the main floor for you to store bags or coats. The museum is not large enough to get lost in, so you don't need to pick up the offered brochures unless you want a keepsake of your trip. All the displays are in Korean, so if you are a foreigner who doesn't speak the language, this is really just a look-through trip as opposed to anything educational. (I'm perfectly fine with those myself.) Worth the trip if you have a free day and no idea what to do.CYC(2013.2)There were three floors. The first was Human & Nature Hall and Central Hall, and the second was Life Evolution Hall, and the third was Earth Environment Hall. There were many animals, plants, and miniatures. But if you go there, you'll be not that easy to find there because it is in the middle of residential area. But if you go there, you'll be surprised. Because the miniatures are so full of life.

Name: 이화여자대학교
Review:
It has a beautiful campus and unusual architecture. This time I visited their museum near the entrance. Many tourists come here to take photos, mostly with the far end (hill-top) as background. It is also breath-taking going up to the far end and then look back towards the city.The young girl student here are freedonly wear their outfit to Uni. Around the Uni, there is alot cosmetic shop, cloth, cafe and etc
Be alert and bring enough cash and card as here is the cheapest shopping palace ever.Really great architecture. fell upon it by chance as we were walking through Seoul. The buildings and architectural layout were fascinating.Spectacular architecture and clean, also the surrounding area is great for shopping on a budget. We had some coffee and toffee grapes.This place is worth to visit. The campus is beautiful and the architecture design is special. Besides, there are many photo spots around here. After that, we went to shop at Ewha shopping street.this university is huge and breath taking...education all under one room, they even have a chapel, surrounding area is sereneWe went to the university expecting seeing a beautiful campus. We found it worth going. We visited the University Archives and learnt much about the history of the University and some prominent graduates, this made the visit much more meaningful.This place is so beautiful! The buildings reminded me of Hogwarts in Harry Potter. Instagram worthy!Stairs and more stairs every other part of this beautiful place. Very beautiful buildings and structures around. Cheap, hip and fashionable ladies clothing sold nearby. You will spend..spend..spend if you are not careful..Finally had a chance to check out Ewha Woman's University. Worth a visit! Beautiful architecture and yummy food too!

Name: 충정로 난타극장
Review: Its a very good show. Its very different from broad way shows of USA. Any tourist can understand it. Language is not a problem .Amazing performance by the artists.. The whole story is explained with orchestra by using kitchen utensils.The artists involve the audience also which makes it unique.You dont need to know korean to go there and the theatre is comfy and most the people that work there speak decent english to direct you.The highlight of my kids' holiday. They laughed from beginning till end. We appreciate the booster seats provided for kids. Row F where we sat was not elevated. The row behind onwards would be better.

Name: 서대문 형무소 역사관
Review:
Well thought out museum that gives an insight into Korea’s history and their relationship to Japan. As others have mentioned, if you are unfortunate enough to coincide your visit with a school tour then this really detracts from the experience. It is difficult to be...더 보기Very interesting history with a clear anti Japan sentiment coming across through the historical story being told.an easy subway stop
spent 2 hours (go later in the morning after the school kids take their tours)
download the app, wifi is free in the buildings
watch the touching videos of former prisoners. there's enough in English about the Japanese occupationIt's very easy to get there, by using the Orange subway line, hence I would absolutely recommend going. If gives you an amazing insight, of the status of Korea, during the Japanese occupation. Even if you're not to interested in history, it's worth to pay...더 보기Easy to get to this interesting museum from the City Tour Bus or subway - line 3 (Orange line) to Dongnimmun station, Exit 5 and a very short walk to the entrance. Open from 0930-1800 in the summer months and 0930-1700 in the winter Tuesday...더 보기This is formally used as a prison during Japanese Colonial Age. Now, it's a history museum for locals and foreign...더 보기there is so much to learn about what happened during the japanese occupation. this is a prison where koreans supporting...더 보기I was not expecting it to wow me but the setup was actually very good. It was not just empty...더 보기We were at Seodaemun Independence Park which leads to the Seodaemun Prison History Hall. We didn’t get to visit the...더 보기I would certainly come here if you are in Seoul. Set in a peaceful park it is hard to imagine...더 보기

Name: 독립문
Location: 서울 서대문구 현저동 941 Seodaemun Dongnip Park (우) 120-080
Review: 南大門や東大門、ましてやパリの凱旋門などと比べると、はるかに小さい門で、大きさ目<U+5F53>てに行くと失望します。<U+72EC>立を夢見た大韓帝<U+56FD>時代のものとして<U+6B74>史的<U+89B3>点で見ると、なかなか興味深いです。ちなみに<U+65E7>新村<U+99C5>には、オリジナルのロケ<U+30FC>ションの<U+5199><U+771F>が見られます。西大門刑務所跡地の公園<U+5185>に建つ<U+72EC>立門。朝鮮<U+72EC>立運動に<U+95A2>する知識を頭に入れてから見<U+5B66>した方が意味を理解できると思います。この門は<U+6E05><U+56FD>からの解放と<U+72EC>立を記念して1897年に建てられました。西大門刑務所を見<U+5B66>すると日本からの<U+72EC>立という意味合いも<U+5F37>く感じられますが、建てられた年代的で<U+6E05><U+56FD>からの<U+72EC>立記念を意味するものだと解<U+91C8>できました。以前は一般公開されていなかったそうです。近くまでランチに行ったので、ついでに立ち寄りました。小さな公園になっていて、のどかな雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>です。<U+5199><U+771F>を撮っている人は1組ほど。とても<U+9759>かでした。この史跡の意味をよく知らずに訪れましたが、あとで調べました。<U+6E05>からの<U+72EC>立という意味の<U+72EC>立門でしたが、日本も絡んでいて、色<U+3005>考えさせられました。中華思想から<U+72EC>立するという意味の門です。 甲申政<U+5909>後、日本に亡命した朴泳孝(パク<U+30FB>ヨンヒョ)が閔妃が日本人に殺害されたその後<U+5E30><U+56FD>して推進しました。 日本の意<U+56F3>で建築され、ロシアが1904年に日本に敗北した直後、日本が大韓の外交<U+6A29>を奪ったために'<U+72EC>立門'という名前が<U+8EFD>くなりました。 誰のための'<U+72EC>立'だろうか? 韓<U+56FD>人や日本人、中<U+56FD>人にも長けていない<U+6B74>史を抱いていますね(笑)韓<U+56FD>の方も勘違いしている方が多いと聞きましたが日本からの<U+72EC>立ではなく中<U+56FD>からの<U+72EC>立を記念して建てられたもののようです。形はパリの凱旋門に似せて作ったとのことですが、思ったよりも小さくてびっくりしました。公園の中にあるので<U+6B69>いて門をくぐることもできます。西大門刑務所の公園角に立っている石造りの門です。<U+6E05>との<U+6B74>史的<U+95A2>係に<U+95A2>連したものですが、こういった<U+72EC>立運動を<U+5F37>引に日帝に結びつけるのもどうかと思います。<U+5F53>時の運動家にも失<U+793C>なんじゃないでしょうか。暑い日だったからか、ペットボトルとアイスコ<U+30FC>ヒ<U+30FC>のカップが捨ててあって、<U+6C17>になりました。もっと<U+6B74>史に敬意を<U+6255>うべきなんじゃないでしょうか。<U+72EC>立門、地下<U+9244>の<U+99C5>からすぐの所にあるのでアクセスは、大<U+5909>便利です。公園<U+5185>にある<U+72EC>立門です。ソウルの凱旋門のような感じです。パリの凱旋門より小さいのですが石造りで立派な門です。日帝時代に<U+53CE>容所として使われていた刑務所<U+6B74>史館と同じ敷地にあるので日本の負の遺産に<U+95A2>連しているのかな？そんな思いもしました。門自<U+4F53>は想像よりこじんまりとしていました。<U+6E05>の支配からの<U+8131>却を記念して建てられたものですが、<U+8AAC>明のパネルには、<U+5358>に<U+72EC>立の決意を固めた記念、としか書かれてないので、日本からの<U+72EC>立と勘違いしている人も多いようです。（<U+5B9F>際には日韓<U+4F75>合前に建てられたものですが）近くの西大門刑務所<U+6B74>史館では日本統治時代の展示があるので、よけい混同しがちですね。周<U+56F2>は公園もあってすごく和やかな場所です。秋に行きましたが公園の紅葉がとてもきれいでした。市街地の北側の刑務所<U+6B74>史館に隣接する場所にあります。ソウルに<U+6765>る前に、この門の存在を知っていましたが、<U+72EC>立という名前で、勝手に日本から<U+72EC>立した際に、建てられたものだと誤解していました。<U+5B9F>際は、日<U+6E05><U+6226><U+4E89>によって<U+6E05>の冊封<U+4F53>制からの<U+72EC>立を記念して作られたものです。なので、明治時代にできた建築物です。門自<U+4F53>は、パリの凱旋門の小型版といった感じです。

Name: 양재동 화훼공판장
Review:
We went to this place hoping to buy air plants. Nope, Korea is not the place for this so it...더 보기We went there on a Monday morning and discovered the following :
1) Use Exit 4 of Yangjae Citizen's Forest Station of the Sin Bundang Line. Walked about 10mins. south east along the main road. The market centre is on the right. There is a...더 보기This is the most well-organised and clean flower market I have visited in my life. For a flowers lover, it is akin to stepping into the candy store. Even as a non-resident, I managed to get some cut-flowers & potted herbs to be used as...더 보기Loved the range of succulents available, big & small. It was hard to only come away with 7 small ones to bring home.
Wish this place also has a variety of pots & plant accessories.Googled for flower markets and found this one in Seocho. It's actually really near Gangnam and all but doesn't look like it. The surrounding neighbourhood is very quaint and quiet and perhaps cause it's near a mountain (not sure of the name) but the air...더 보기You can see all flower.
And, Yon can smell the scent of a flower if you go to there when Spring or Fall.
I recommend it if you love flower.
And, You can use subway "Sinbundang Line".Found this place while surfing the web looking for plant markets. Took the short drive out on Saturday and was not disappointed. Very easy access off IC 1 just 25 minutes or so south of Seoul. There is anything and everything plant or garden related...더 보기The Yangjae flower market is not only a good place to buy flowers and herbs, but also a nice escape from the hustle of the big city. Once inside, the first thing we notice is the silence.
The market is constituted from several connected halls,...더 보기I was curious to know how the wholesale flower market is like for the late winter and early spring time. So we took the train especially to go this market which is about an hour away from our hotel.
One thing for traveller to note....더 보기

Name: 양재 시민 공원
Review:
Really nice park in southern Gangnam-gu District. it's huge and the forest is amazing. But, tourists don't need to come here because this is quite away from most touristic sites.
- Many tall trees create shades and it's good to avoid heat in summer.
-...더 보기Yangjae Citizens’ Forest is a lush public park located in Yangjae-dong featuring over 70 different species of tree including zelkova, maple and pine trees. A popular picnic destination with Seoulites, it's also a peaceful and hidden gem to bask in Korea's stunning fall colours. The...더 보기

Name: 삼성 딜라이트
Location: 서울 서초구 서초대로74길 11 Connected to Line 2 Gangnam Station exit 8
Rank: 12위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: We heard about Samsung d'light from a family member. An easy place to find and get to. Just get out at Gangnam metro station and head towards exit 8. The retail-exposition type experience has a retail shop on the ground floor, an interactive experience on the first floor and a showcase of living technology on the 2nd floor. It's designed to give us a look at the near future at home, at school and in the workplace. Unfortunately, we arrived at the same time as about 2 dozen local schoolchildren who monopolised the VR headsets and other interactive displays. Staff members were not that helpful apart from the ladies who initially greeted us showing us how to access the interactive area. Other staff completely ignored us when we tried to access the VR gear. Perhaps it's simply luck of the draw.We really enjoyed our visit to this corporate enterprise and were able to spend a couple of hours enjoying the various attractions that were on offer. The fact that the place is free and gives one a glimpse of what Samsung think the future will look like was entertaining and interesting. Staff were on-hand to make sure you enjoyed the experience and a follow-up e-mail from Samsung with photos etc. was also a little unique. We visited at the end of a day's sight-seeing- it was great way to finish off what had been a very busy day.This type of store is the future of retail. So many experiential interactions and retail as well. Many floors of different things to see and experienceAmazing experience. And at NO charge! Brilliant VR and loads of interactive stations. Very clever. Massage chairs a highlight!!!This places is brilliant. You have your photo taken and it’s put on the wall, then you get given a wristband with your photo inside it.. you then move to different areas and scan your wristband to play that particular area, could be changing your picture, making a planet etc.... if your in the area go and try itIt was very easy to get to the building (2min from Gangnam station) and the exhibition is large covering three floors. On the first floor they have phones, laptops, and tablets you can play with. They also have a 4D VR experience which is amazing and a must. The rest is all kinds of electronics from fridges and vacuums to prototypes of massage chairs (yes, you can try them) and facial masks. On the second floor they have an interactive exhibit about emotions and machine learning - you can register a bracelet and go around the various stations receiving a report about your preferences and emotional state at the end. They have other VR stations here too. The third floor was the most interesting for me - it was the home of the future where Samsung showcases their vision of how machines will ease our lives and integrate with our homes. We spent about 1.5hrs there (40min just on the massage chairs). Definitely worth the trip.Amazing to see what is heading our way especially being ftom NZ.Everyone friendly so dont be shy to ask to try things. The VR jumping off a building was awesome. No entrance fee or fees to try things.Fridges, Washington machines and cooktops of the future are all here on display, together mith massive tvs, all showing what it will be like in the future. For me the massive washing machine, which does everything auto a tic, except putting the washing in.It.determines the fabric, the water temperature, the washing powder etc. and sms you when it is finishedCan easily spend a couple of hours by looking and getting a feel of all the experiences offered here. It presents a futuristic view of the World and all the potential technologies, digital and AI that Samsug is working upon and may well be a reality in the years to come. You can enter the the Samsung buliding with the exit pointed to Samsung Electronics from Gangnam station. From outside its just across Gangnam square.The experience section is on the upper level and the basement has the samsng shop where you can purchase products. Dont miss the VR experience, I had the roller coaster ride and it was adrenaline pumping.Don't bother visiting this place. There are far better things to do with your time in Seoul. The only mildly amusing part is the virtual reality experience at the end - and even that was just mediocre.

Name: 서울이스케이프룸 - 강남1호점
Location: 서울 서초구 서초대로77길 11 S호텔 빌딩 지하1층 (우) 06615
Rank: 2위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: Made an appointment in the morning and came in the afternoon. Was my first time so didn't know what to expect. Signed up for the Jazz Bar escape room and had a blast from beginning to end. Very well crafted and many unexpected turns. Professional and experienced staff made for a smooth first time experience and I would definitely recommend Seoul Escape room for couples and groups alike.It was great experience in seoul! :D and we finally made it !! Recommend to every people lets go 방탈출Visited Seoul escape room with my cousin. It was interesting experience in a very unique way..! Can’t say much details but it is definitely worth a try.I love escape rooms! It is so much fun. I almost completed season 1 and all of the episodes are amazing :)Had such a great experience with friends!! If you want to experience time travel u definitely should visit here :P I have played 2 themes so far and both were realllly satisfactory highly recommended~I only did one escape room (the one with the time traveling CIA), but it was absolutly amazing, would recomend.여기가 젤 쩔드라.형 인싸라서 진짜 웬만한곳 다 가봤는데여기가 막 어렵고 그렇진않고 논리적이라서 더 잼있다.hey guys this place is hot.i recommend here cuz english speaker also can playWe tried a hard and a insanity lvl room. After first day we had to go again next day because it was so nice! The rooms was well made, the english was very good and easy to understand. The staff was very friendly and im looking forward to visit again!한국에 놀러온 외국인 친구에게 방탈출 전파하기에 아주 딱인 테마같아요. 총 5명이서 했는데 3~5명 인원 추천합니다. This theme is perfect for spreading the room to foreign friends who have come to Korea. 5 people in total, 3 ~ 5 people recommended.퀄리티 엄청 높고 정말 재밌었습니다! 옷이 약간 더러워질 수 일으나 제가 했던 방탈출 중 가장 재밌었습니다! 시시하지 않고 퀄리티 높은거 원하시면 추천입니다! It was kind of fun cause of the weather but the quality was really nice and it was fun! I recommend you to come here if you guys want to experience this !

Name: 메가박스 강남
Rank: 27위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: Памятное место, обязательное для посещения в Южную Корею в первый раз. Нажмите на желтую руку в центре и заиграет музыка:)Этот место просто обязательно для посещения! Оно мега популярно среди молодежи и не только, очень позитивное место!

Name: 고속터미널상가
Review:
The area is mostly full of ladies stuffs and other home decorations, accessories etc..
I went during Autumn and the clothes are cheap. You can also find other things there and it was a good experience.Convenient and accessible. Located at Express Bus Terminal station, exit 8. Love this place, neverending shops. Bought a few stuff from there. Suitable for females only.There are many shops and mostly selling ladies clothes, shoes, accessories and beauty product. Prices are comparable if not cheaper then Myeondong though atmosphere is not comparable. There are also phone accessories shops as well as food outlets.I personally enjoyed shopping here more than the Hongdae shopping street (for women's clothing). There are two long rows of shops parallel to each other selling lots of affordable women's aparrel and jewellery. Not exactly premium top-class items, but decent quality for the prices. Did...더 보기Actually this is the second time in Seoul, but this time me go shopping in express bus terminal underground , really its good experience , good quality, cheap, we enjoyed so much there, everybody whom visit Seoul should go there.Endless rows of shopping for everyone including shoes, clothes, accessories, spectacles, household stuff, food, anything! I made the mistake of coming here on a Saturday and ended up having to jostle elbow to elbow with people with or without trolleys. Beware of wheels! This is...더 보기There are many many shops in this shopping area and most shops offer very reasonably priced female clothing. To me, it's the best place to shop for clothing & accessories compared to myeong dong, Ewha Womans University shopping, namdaemun market and dongdaemun shopping district! You...더 보기There's not an upscale retailer which is not represented, though one may have to wait in line to get into...더 보기This is a large underground shopping area with many shops selling clothes and accessories. We find that the shops sell similar things and the vendors are not friendly. Visit only if you have time.If the purpose of your trip is to shop clothes in Myeongdong, you should come here first.
The same item...더 보기

Name: 고투 몰
Review: 色<U+3005>なサイトで10時からお店が開店し始めるという情報を得たので10時過ぎに到着しましたが、開店している店がかなり少なく時間を持て余しました。お手頃で若い子向けの服が目<U+5F53>ての場合は11時以降に行くのがベストだと思います。一件ずつ全部見てたら周りきれない<U+5E83>さというか長さ。値段はほぼ<U+6A2A><U+4E26>びかな。今回ゲットしたブラウスは思ったよりお値段が高くて<U+5373>決はできなかったけど、同じ値段の商品を韓<U+56FD>人のお客に"午前中のお客<U+69D8>だから"という理由で10000ウォン値引きしてるのを聞き逃さなかった。おかげで私も同じ値引きしてもらいました！<U+663C>はモ<U+30FC>ルのサイドにある簡<U+5358>なフ<U+30FC>ドコ<U+30FC>トでいただくもよし。日本で人<U+6C17>のタピオカ店ゴンチャも普通に<U+4E26>ばずに<U+98F2>めます。今回はモ<U+30FC>ルをちょっと出たサンドゥレで韓定食いただきました。他を見てからここを見ると、最初からここで買えば良かったと後悔します。地下<U+9244>の出口を間違えると、なかなかたどり着きません。大きな表示もないです。韓<U+56FD>語ではあるのかな？安かろう<U+60AA>かろうもありますが、たまに掘り出し物も見つかるので、渡韓時には必ず詣でます。普段着や部屋着が安いので<U+6C17>に入ったものがあると何枚も色違いで買っています。前回も今回もそうでした。欲しいものが見つからない日もたまにあって、そういう時はつまらないです。 <U+4E21>手いっぱいになるまで買うのが<U+697D>しみです。とにかく<U+5E83>い。母と娘でひたすらさまよいましたが<U+697D>しかったです。大抵の洋服が10000wです。娘が大量に購入しました。よほど買い物好きでないと男性陣は辛いと思うので、女子だけで行って下さい。お店に寄ってタ<U+30FC>ゲット層がはっきりしているので、好みが合うお店でまとめ買いが良いかと思います。東大門なども見ましたがここが一番安い印象。明洞近くのホテルからバスで行きました。地下<U+9244>の<U+4E57>り換えが面倒だったので。新世界百貨店の前のバス停から行くことができます。Google Map で<U+691C>索すればバス番<U+53F7>もでます。天<U+6C17>も<U+6C17>にしなくてよくてフラットで<U+6B69>きやすいので、70代の母でも<U+697D>しめました。洋服やレ<U+30FC>ス小物、レ<U+30FC>スカ<U+30FC>テン、ハンディ扇風機、色<U+3005>な物を買えて大<U+6E80>足だったようです。<U+5642>に聞いていたやすい靴屋さんを探し求めたもの男性ものはほぼなくランチだけ撮って<U+5E30>ってきました。女性物のアパレルは目が眩むほどありますが、クオリティ<U+30FC>は…とりあえず靴下だけ買って<U+5E30>りました。ご飯は<U+60AA>くなかったです。午前中は、お客さんも少ないので見やすい。現金は必須。地下<U+9244>の出入り口そばのお店は少し<U+4FA1>格設定が高い感じがするが<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>。同じ店が<U+7D9A>くので、店の名前や番<U+53F7>を<U+899A>えておくのが良い。同じような店でも、店員の<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>が違うので、良い感じの店員さんがいるお店で買うと<U+6C17>分がよい。東大門でも似たようなものおいてますが、値段がよくわからないものもおおく、見てると<U+58F0>をかけられるし、怒鳴りつけてくるので苦手なのですが、こちらのGOTOMallは値段をかかげてる店が多いし店員さんも<U+6C17>さくな感じので見やすく思います！現金必須です！あと、時間に余裕を持ってこないと見きれないです（笑）<U+8EFD>食もあるので途中で休憩などもできますよ！ソウルに行ったらやっぱり行ってしまいます！今回も2時間弱くらいウロウロしました。おもに、洋服を買うつもりで散策開始！職場で着れそうなTシャツやするっと着れそうなワンピ<U+30FC>スなどを買いました。どれも一枚10000ウォン！<U+6C17>に入った物が見つかれば、安くてラッキ<U+30FC>です！

Name: 한전아트센터
Review: 꼭 아트센터안에 들어가지 않아도, 1층에서 식사한 후에 1,2층 전시장을 무료로 관람할 수 있고, 밖으나 나와 벤치에 잘 조성된 조경수와 함께 휴식을 취할 수 있어 좋다.한전아트센터 뒷켠의 담장은 게절별로 장미와 은행나무, 단풍나무의 정취를 즐길 수 있는 숨은 보석같은 곳이다.일단 지하에 식사할 수 잇는 식당이 있다. 아침엔 라면도 즐길수 있고, 점심엔 4500원. 착한 가격이다. 1,2층엔 각종 전시공간이 있어 무료 전시 관람도 할 수 있고, 공연장엔 각종 연극, 공연 등이 있다. 조경이 잘되 있어, 주변을 산책하기에도 최적의 코스이다.

Name: 서울숲
Review: Seoul Forest is easily accessible by subway. Change at Wangsimni to go to Seoul Forest Station (K211). After exiting the toll-gate, there is a lift at the end of the floor to take you to the street level. Turn left and then right to enter Under Stand Ave. There is a good eating shop on your left. Cross the road to enter Seoul Forest. Last year, the autumn colours were stunning but because of the long summer and dryness this year the ginkgo and maple trees were somewhat disappointing. It is still a good place to walk.Huge garden with performances on some days, without which, there isn't much to see. A lot of green and few flowers when we visited in early October. I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to visit this place. There are more scenic nature walks closer to the city.I went to Seoul forest to enjoy the weather with a friend. the place was really nice, we almost forgot that we were right in the center of Seoul. the weather was perfect and the leaves in the orange color of autumn were perfect. short a good time, I recommend this park.Wonderful place to spend a beautiful day. There are tons are walking paths and benches. The park is filled on the weekend. You can rent bikes and ride around the perimeter of the park. There is a lot of shade.I visited Seoul and really enjoyed the time with my friends. We stayed in the capital for 2 nights and explored some famous sites there: Gyeongbokgung Palace, Bukchon Hanok Old Village, Seoul Stadium... shopping at Myeongdong was a must and tasted street foods there which would give us happy time for the trip.A great place to walk around and enjoy some space from the hustle and bustle of Seoul. A very child friendly environment.It's an oasis in Seoul. Walking in this park/mini forest really makes you think you're out in the country side. It's very relaxing and enjoyable. Many attraction for kids as well. Great for outdoor activities.Came here for a walk with our toddler, and had lots of fun. A great big playground, a little corner with some water-themed equipment nearby. Deer feeding was prohibited, not sure if permanent or temporary... Large territory to explore with lots of pretty views and photo opportunities. Not sure it's a good option as a tourist destination, but if you want to spend some time with kids in a park and explore the territory, then it's the place to go.There are 2 subway stations nearby the park. one is green line and the other is yellow if i'm not mistaken. I think the yellow line is nearer than the green line. This park is not so crowded, we came around 6.30 pm and had a great time enjoying cherry blossom.We visited Seoul Forest early to feel the morning breeze since the temperature when we visited was still around 9deg. As the name implies, it is a big place. There are so many areas to visit but it takes a lot of walking to reach each part. And some directions won’t lead you to what is indicated. The only area we enjoyed most was the Tulip Garden where flowers are in bloom and in different happy colors. There are even cherry blossom trees in between. It felt refreshing and very calming. If you are a nature lover, you can try and visit Seoul Forest.

Name: 청계천 박물관
Review: Tells the story of the history of the Cheonggyecheon "stream" which is an iconic landmark in Seoul. With old maps and many old photos it traces its history from the 15th century to the present day. How it had been covered up and subsequently uncovered. Don't miss the portion of the original wooden stilt housing just across the road.Free to enter and easily reached by Metro and then a short walk.If you are interested in urban history or urban development, this museum is absolutely a great place to learn about how Cheonggyechong changed in the past decade. It includes the historical meaning of the river, as well as the social issues happened due to the economic boom after WWII and the detail of restoration of the river. Personally, I love this museum a lot as I can learn a lot about this amazing renewal project in Korea. Although Korean is still the main language in the museum, some important places would also have Japanese, English or Chinese explanation.This is totally off the beaten track but is a medium sized museum overseen by the Seoul History Museum but which focuses solely on the Cheonggyecheon River--its role in Seoul's history and the amazing story of its restoration to become the center piece of Seoul's "greening." The Museum is set up beautifully with you starting at the top of the Museum and working your way through history to the present at the bottom. That is suppose to represent the flow of the stream downhill. Great photos of Seoul in the past and all is in English for easy understanding. I visited the main Seoul History Museum also--and found this one to be much easier to understand and much more interesting. Few tourists make it here but was worth my time! Would recommend over the main History Museum. Its free too!The Cheongyecheon Museum is a wonderful look at the important role the Cheongyecheon area played in Seoul's development. It also offers insight into the political environment that influenced the redevelopment of Cheonggyecheon. The pictures from the 1880's were fantastic. All of the displays translated to English. Outside of the Museum is a mockup of a shanty town that is a great back drop for memorable pictures. The Museum is free and on a hot day is a nice cool excursion.The museum isn't near the "headwaters" of the stream where most people go, but it's worth visiting if you have time. Or sign up for the #2 option in the City of Seoul's free walking tours and visit then (that's what we did). There is also a replicated shanty town example at this site. The section of stream in this area is more rustic and also worth walking along for the different perspective it provides.There is the main building of the Cheonggyecheon Museum with a lot of display and educational videos shown and opposite of the museum are the old houses of Cheonggyecheon.Seems like no one knows about this place. My friend and I wandered around for approximately two hours and saw only one other person.This fantastic free museum is dedicated to the re establishment of the Cheonggyecheon Stream that runs east to west through the heart of Seoul. The stream had been covered/filled in during the late sixties and an elevated expressway put over it. More than the story of the stream, this museum tells the story of Seoul and how the stream and the people of this city, their fortunes and misfortunes are linked. It talked about life before and after Japanese colonialism. The hardship of WWII very brief elation following liberation then the terrible years of the Korean War. The resulting mass waves of refugees and crushing poverty that lead to shanty towns lining the Cheonggyecheon. The museum goes on to look at the dismantling of these settlements. The forced re homing of communities to "moon villages" on the out skirts of Seoul. Of riots and civil unrest.This museum is so much more than a mere look at a marvel of engineering... Which is what the resurrection of the stream is. It was the best insight into the recent history of Seoul and Korea that I've found here during my stay. A look at all this country has achieved in seventy very short years.It's a little out of the way (being at the non glittery end of the Cheonggyecheon). But so worth the effort of finding it.and a half

Name: CGV 왕십리
Rank: 19위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)

This is one of the best cinemas that I've gone to in years. The 4DX cinema was clean and spacious. It was easy to find and exit. Depending on how much I've eaten that day... 

I like a cozy theatre. This is...더 보기

Name: 성신볼링장
Rank: 147위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: 성신여대역 1번출구에서 직진하면, 오른편에 로데오거리(?)같은 번화가로 우회전하여 직진하여, 성신여대 정문쪽으로 좌회전 하면 왼편에 있습니다. 이 근방에 볼링장이 여기가 유일하여, 돈암동, 안암동 길음동 쪽의 사람들이 죄다 모여서 항상 자리가 없었습니다. 시설이 열악한 편이었으나, 최근 리노베이션을 마쳐서 시설 면에서 많이 좋아졌습니다. 저녁 9시쯤 까지는 항상 볼링 동호회들의 예약이 있으니, 저녁 늦게가면 좀 한적합니다.좁고 열악하고 불친절합니다. 이왕 가는거 가까운 계동으로 명동쪽으로 가세요..비추합니다..

Name: 북한산 국립공원
Review: Easy when it is at the beginning part of the mountain. However, it gets really steep and quite dangerous when reaching the summit of the mountain. Do get proper hiking equipment such as hiking shoe as sport shoe is too slippery. Spend 4 hours going up, and 4 hours down. Never climb down during the evening as it gets really dark and dangerous. Overall it was a great experience, would definitely want to go back again.Don't be fooled by the casual demeanour of the Korean hikers, and the neatness and cleanliness of their equipment. If you get up into the peaks of Bukhansan you may find yourself descending a cliff with only a steel cable or an iron bar to hold on to. Safety ropes are for sissies and westerners, apparently. But it is beautiful to be out among nature (but solitude is not guaranteed, you may find yourself in a throng of Korean hikers). I strongly recommend October to see the red maple leaves, so different than the North American maples. Some parts are accessible by subway (Dobongsan and Mangwolsa stations) and others by bus. Anything you need before (such as lunch or a forgotten item of clothing or equipment) or after the hike (such as food and beer) can be purchased between the subway stations and the mountain.Een van ‘s werelds populairste hiking trails is Bukhansan Mountain.Dit is een prachtig berglandschap, vlot te bereiken met het openbaar vervoer vanuit Seoul. Het meest uitgelezen tijdstip voor zijn beklimming is oktober tot november, vermits de herfstkleuren het landschap dan in een schilderachtig tafereel omtoveren.Er zijn meerdere trajecten mogelijk, doch de mooiste tocht is deze van Bukhansanseong Fortress tot aan Baegundae, de hoogste piek. Een pittige wandeling waarbij het laatste deel zelfs wat avontuurlijk is. Om de steile paden te beklimmen zijn de staalkabels die aan de rand van het pad gespannen zijn een welkome hulp. De fenomenale uitzichten van op de top maken de inspanning meer dan waard. Als het meezit met de smog krijg je een uitzicht over heel Seoul en omstreken. Wauw.Afdalen kan je langs de andere zijde van de berg, langs de oude stadsmuren. De tocht neemt zonder pauze zo’n 5uur in beslag.One of the world's most popular hiking trails is Bukhansan Mountain.This is a beautiful mountain landscape, easily accessible by public transport from Seoul. The most suitable time for his ascent is October to November, since the autumn colors transform the landscape into a picturesque scene.Multiple routes are possible, but the most beautiful trip is from Bukhansanseong Fortress to Baegundae, the highest peak. A tough walk where the last part is even more adventurous. To climb the steep paths, the steel cables that are tensioned at the edge of the path are a welcome help. The phenomenal views from the top make the effort absolutely worthwhile. If there is not too much smog you get a view of the entire Seoul area. Wow.You can descend on the other side of the mountain, along the old city walls. The trip takes about 5 hours without a break.Easy to get to the start of the hike via metro and bus (Gupabal station, line 3, exit 1 followed by 704 bus). I did the gorge path up which I understand to be slightly more difficult. Yes it was tough going, but so worth the experience at the top. I went at 8am on a Monday morning so there were very few other hikers. The most worthwhile day in Seoul!Let me get this straight, I'm not a climber and I haven't been to the gym in over 3 years. I have a decent staminia though. Not having a fear of heights was also helpful in my case.When visiting Seoul last summer, I decided to climb Baegundae peak because ... why not?I was wearing shorts, stockings and $5 primark shoes which were almost falling apart: perfect climbing gear, right? I was smart enough to pack 2L of water and lunch though. I went on a Monday I believe around 9:30 AM. The park ranger was super kind to me, but he made fun of my shoes lmao. He provided me with a map and drew a route for to climb. The first 1,5 hours up were AWFUL. I'm sure ANY other way up would have been better, but I spent the first 1,5 hours climbing uneven, very high stairs and it was almost bad enough for me to quit. During this period I only passed a couple of other people, which was really odd to me, since in other people's reviews I read that the hike is always busy.I started at the Jeongneun parking lot and made my way up to Youngchusa. This part is in the middle of the forrest and this is the part where I was just doing nothing but climbing stairs. I passed Daeseongmun and Bogungmun and this part was super nice, literally like taking a walk in the park. I decided to continue. The forrest ended and very suddenly I was confronted with how high up I was as I was on the edge of a cliff. It was very intimidating at first, but I soon got an adrenaline rush and was excited to make my way up. The next part I spent climbing on all fours over huge rocks and pulling myself up. I didn't find this hardly as draining as climbing the stairs though, and it was honestly very fun. The view from Baegundae peak is kinda unreal and it was really relaxing to sit down and eat my lunch. The locals were also super nice to me and pulled out their best english skills to have a conversation with me: why are you alone? Why are you wearing these shoes? The park ranger had told me to make my way back down to Ui-dong, which I think took me about 1,5 hours. The climb down was really nice and I came across a small shop, where I purchased some more water. There was also a traditional-style restroom which is not for the squeamish, but hey, I had to go after drinking all that water. After arriving in Ui-dong, my very sweaty self made her way back to the nearest subway station and went back to Hongdae.Over all, the walk was really nice after it was more than just climbing stairs. The view is beautiful and the adreneline rush is real. Not sure how difficult it is, since I haven't done a lot of hiking in my life, but for someone with average stamina it's deffos do-able.A would say you need to have decent decent footwear and I recommend padded/gripped gloves as well. In the later parts of the hike you have to climb over boulders and pull yourself up smooth rock whilst holding onto a wire rope. Gloves certainly made it easier. The views from the top are amazing, some of the best views of Seoul, and it really gives a scale of how big the city is. The down side though is getting there is a chore. The subway station that is closest is still bus ride away, and its a very popular route and you will be waiting a very long time to get on the bus. I decided to walk to the entrance to the park, which I would not recommend. Also there are multiple routes to the top, and I couldn't find any kind of visitor centre at the bottom to get a map.So when you start heading up there is no way of knowing if your are going up a harder route or an easy route. And in fact since the routes criss cross its very easy to go a much longer route. Also the ascent is mostly covered by forest so you really don't appreciate your altitude. The first time you come out of the forest you look out over a cliff and it really hits you hard. I'm not scared of heights but that sudden look over a cliff face still came as a shock. I would say its a reasonably tough climb as well. I wouldn't recommend trying to climb this unless you hike regularly.It was really gorgeous. I love walking around and drowning in the beauty of nature. Fresh air and nice weather thouIts amazing that older Koreans of 60+ age can climb the Bukhansan mountain with ease. The climb is quite steep and rocky. The trails are not always that clearly marked out. You definitely need good hiking shoes and walking sticks will also be a great help. Don't forget to bring food and water. You can fill your water in streams on some of the trails. Toilets are few, far and minimal. Its something different to do in Seoul if you are fit for the climb.If you like to hike, or simply take a long walk in nature while staying in Seoul, this could be the answer for you. Quite near the city . Nice views. You should bring along comfortable hiking shoes.Plan a half day; bring a snack/lunch.We are a family of four with two children (4,7). We started hiking up towards Baegundae Peak, however with the 2 kids we made it with in about 1.5k from the top. My 7 year old was fine, but my 4 year old had to be carried by daddy the further we went up. The hike was just lovely...wonderful smells, fantastic views, the nature was just gorgeous. We hiked about 4.5 hours with my kids. Stopped for lunch break (brought lunch) half way. Even if you don’t hike, I think the park is definitely something to visit to leave the hustle and bustle of the city.

Name: 고려대학교
서울 석촌동 고분군
