Name: 명동 서초 불한증막
Review:
受付の方をはじめ、スタッフの方皆さんとても丁寧な接客でした。アカスリもすごく丁寧でした。他のお店でありがちな『押しの<U+5F37>い...더 보기色<U+3005>行ってるけれど、、、まあまあ頑張ってくれてるのはわかるけれど
時間が明らかに短い！
90分と書いてあるのに60分で...더 보기明洞にあって、男性も利用可能だったので、家族旅行で行った際に利用しました。
料金は基本の汗蒸幕+アカスリのコ<U+30FC>スで7千円...더 보기韓<U+56FD>の旅行にて一度とはアカスリ<U+4F53><U+9A13>したいとこのお店を訪問。
色<U+3005>なサイトで口コミ見ましたが、結論は最<U+60AA>でした。
予約無...더 보기日曜日の朝10時頃、ホテルへ迎えに<U+6765>てもらいました。汗蒸幕は何回か利用していますが、ソウルへくるたびに違うところへ行って...더 보기マイナス12度と言う、日本の東京ではありえない寒さなので、明洞のど<U+771F>ん中にある汗蒸幕で韓<U+56FD><U+4F1D>統式サウナを<U+4F53><U+9A13>。たっぷりと...더 보기明洞で「火汗蒸幕と垢すり」を<U+4F53><U+9A13>してみよう、と、24Hオ<U+30FC>プンしているお店を探したところ、良さそうだったのがこちら。
...더 보기明洞の中心地にある汗蒸幕の店。受付スタッフが日本語ができるので安心なのと、夕飯前の中途半端な空き時間にも利用できるのが魅...더 보기汗蒸幕は女性<U+5C02>用の所が殆どなので、夫婦やカップルで利用したい場合には重<U+5B9D>すると思います。場所も明洞の中心部なので立地を考...더 보기初韓<U+56FD>で、アカスリを<U+4F53><U+9A13>したいと思い、明洞の中心にあるネットで評判の良いこの店に行きました。コネストのサイトでネットで予...더 보기

Name: 캣 카페 고양이 놀이터
Rank: 11위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: Came with my 10 y.o, the girl went outside to kinda greet us and told it's around 9$ for a child and 10 for adult. I was like, ok, but you give free drinks. But apparently you have to pay for them extra. Cats like to be fed by soft food 4-5$So for one he of petting cats I ve spent around 28$. Absolutely not worth it experience. Moreover there are better places with cheaper price. Looked like at least they brought drinks to Koreans, but not usWas there on August 8.2019 evening. Hope you guys will have different experienceCats are nice and lazy thoughI took my 9 year old son here one early evening in a Myeongdong and we had a blast. It only costs the price of a drink to enter, I think I paid around $20 for both of us but the drinks were very good. The cats are extremely spoiled, you can’t put them up but have to wait for them to either come to you or allow one of the staff to hand you one in a blanket. But it’s a fun experience and very sanitary. A cat lover’s can’t miss.This was our first visit to an animal cafe. We love cats. All of the cats were very mellow and sweet. I would definitely visit again.Wasn't expecting to have a cover chsrge but definitely a nice change of pace from the hustle and bustle of Seoul. Thirty cats interacting or sleeping contentedly. Very well cared for. Must hand ssnitize, remove footwear, put jackets/backpacks in plastic bag and not pick up a furry ( or not so furry in the case of the sphinx cat) feline. Enjoyed our refreshments while observing and petting cats!cats are amazing so chill out makeing you chill out great for old young couples and family would go againCats will be your companion while drinking a nice coffee or juice. Just be patient, they will somehow come to your place and play with you. It was nice to see that the cats are living in such good conditions and don't have to be on the streetsThe cafe is clean and not smelly, if you are afraid of cat, you can also come here because most of the cats are passive. they provide toys, and you can play with the cat and take a picture together.You have to be patient, but they are really friendly and like sleeping on you. Buying some treats make all the difference.Was waiting to check into our hotel and decided to pay this cat cafe a visit as my children love cats. We found the cat mascot and he led the way. Entrance fee was 10000won/adult, 8000won/child which includes a drink. The cat food costs 2000won per sachet. Oh boy, there were so so many cats and they were so chubby, fat and fluffy. They have signs to instruct guests not to feed cats with yellow collar as these cats were too obese or on special diet. The cats in blue collars were slightly unfriendly which you need to pay attention. Out of 3 to 4 staffs, only one was unfriendly, the rest were OK. They have cat toys for you to play with the cats too. You may stay as long as you wish in the cat cafe, there is no time limit. Overall the place is clean and pleasant as well.It was quite nice. The cats all seem happy there. They are fed and cared for and given lots of attention. They are not mistreated. They are house cats. Drinks were good, I didn’t have anything to eat but the drinks were like the standard Korean coffee shop fare.Would recommend.

Name: 스타일난다 핑크호텔
Review: This place if for those who love makeup and everything pink. It has 5 floors i think, the first one had tons of makeup, other floors had clothes, a laundry shop and a cafe. It was cute, but not a must visit.It is a rather famous flagship store in the middle of Myeongdong, where you are overwhelmed with pink, clothes and 3CE make up. I suggest going when it opens to avoid a very busy store and also take your time at the Instagram worthy spots.로시아 친구랑 핑크풀가페 추천했다같이 가고 사진 많이 찍었다 위치가 살짝 구석임. 디저트다 맛있고 잘생긴직원도 친절했다 추천~Cute spot. I recommend if you’re fan of pink color. Otherwise your eyes will be not so happy over there. My Russian friend took pictures every minute when she didn’t eat beautiful and delicious desserts. We also offered a tea and by the way spent a good time together. Really nice place but there was not too easy to find it :)minus: there were too many people. While we took pictures other people were waiting we finish eating and stop taking pictures :<I just visited Stylenanda over the weekend and had so much fun! What is this place? It’s a makeup and fashion 6 floor store with hotel themed concept. This pink facade is so much more! It’s always an adventure being here, and it’s always hard for me to resist leaving without getting something. I surrendered yet again and got a bag and a lipstick, but I wanted so much more. I truly enjoyed myself here - kind of felt like a little kid at a candy store. The pink pool cafe on the rooftop is probably the highlight for most people. Check this place out if you are into pink-lemonade-cottoncandy-makeuplove-fashionseeking or simply if you like quirky places with a touch of princessy-magical charm, or if you looking to catch a glimpse of good views in Myeongdong and surrounding areas ~ overall, this place is just fun, so regardless, you will leave with a smile.Shop is pretty , and sells all stylenada stuff. Nice place for photo spot. Alot nice corners... but items are expensive so didnt buy anything therewent straight up to the cafe where they serves fanciful drinks with candy floss! Great to have candy floss that wont melt during the winter. Great texture. Drinks was ok. Due to the snow the outdoor sitting area was closed. We had to stay indoor. However staff attitude needs to be improved!Went to the one in Myeongdong, it was super crowded on the ground floor, but it was actually quite empty on the other floors (which sells the same cosmetics). Top floor was the rooftop area, not exactly clean, the pink and white pillows were kinda turning grey and no one was taking care of the finished drinks from previous customers. Blue cream soda was good tho.I went to this cafe accidentally since I was looking for makeup stuffs on the lower floor. Didn’t expect to be so “hotel-look” and “fancy”, I totally feel satisfied with the photos and moment I got there. Come at summer will be a lot better! There is also pool inside that you can take a photo with!We are very looking forward to visiting their shop since we are a big fan from Thailand. The store is very cute, well decorated with vintage pink hotel atmosphere. Sadly we got a bad service from the staff both at Stylenanda fashion and 3ce counter. The 3ce cashier put all the cosmetic in the bag carelessly that she accidentally dropped the cheek power that we are going to buy, she looked at it suddenly she just put it back. I asked for a new one and the answer is “it isn’t broken” check it! No sorry nothing... Such a disappointment. They decorate their shop so lovely that they may forget that SERVICE is also important.Centrally located in Myeongdong, this building features the beauty make up brand 3CE, a cafe at the top floor and each level is fitted with a different style of interior design, but around the main theme of a Hotel. It is a very interesting interior space and is worth a visit!

Name: 명동 성당
Review: Nice place to visit. The interior is very impressive. Was a bit different to attend Mass in another language. Also a nice surprise to meet someone here who was also from my country.Nice and close to Myeong-dong.I'm elated that the Cathedral was full when the mass started. People cannot go in the church once the mass has started. There were mostly old people and their responses during the mass were simultaneous and synchronized. Though the mass was in Korean, my head felt lighter after the one hour solemn celebration.In terms of the Cathedral structure, one should see the gothic facade of the church if you're touring, shopping or trying street food around Myeongdong for the first time. It's located at the back end of the long street full of people from Myeongdong Station near the highway.Everytime I visit Seoul, I always dropby to say my prayers.Its a gothic cathedral near the Myeong-dong Street. Also its beautiful during autumn as the trees and plants changes their colors.While you visit this busy shopping area take a few minutes to check out this fine traditional church. Many Seoul churches inside are more like theatres but this is the real thing.The Cathedral sits on top of a Long flight of steps. Whenever i’m In Seoul i’ll Attend service there.Because the mayority of korean people deos the hinduisum of muslims and very But very little the catholic, near the su way sistemVery nice and quiet place in the center of Seoul. We discovered it during a Hop-On-Hopp-Off bus tour in the city - which we recommend very much - as you will see all major attractions during the tour.The cathedral is different to European ones but very nice!So nice to walk in on a Sunday evening.. An interesting and attractive building, over 100 years old, very close to the hubub of the street markets and shopping area. An oasis of tranquility that is well worth a visitlove this cathedral. the facade is lovely and is clean. One thing is not easy to find the cathedral...you have to go through a parking lot and through a mall, then take a lift up to the cathedral.it was an amazing old worship building. the other need church complex is very modern and well maintained. could get inside almost anytime. good place for taking picture for its european ambience. breathtaking places. likes to be there.and easy to find for its bell tower...

Name: 숭례문
Review: Just down the main strip from Gyeongbokgung Palace is a junction that spilts in several locations and in the middle of this junction is an ancient gate called "Sungnyemun Gate". It is part of the ancient city wall that surrounded the capital of Seoul in the Josean dynasty and is one of the oldest remaining features of the wall in Seoul today. It is a great place to visit on the way to Namdaemun Market and there are daily activities at the gate including Changing of the Guard ceremonies which occur daily every 2-3 times in the day. You can get some photos with the guards at the end of the ceremony which makes for some great holiday photos.Sungnyemum Gate, one of the four main gates in Seoul’s former fortress wall, dates back to 1398. But this South gate has been rebuilt many times with the latest completion occurring in 2013. I was exiting the Nandaemun Market at Gate 1 when I first saw the structure and wondered why it looked so new. Designated National Treasure No. 1, it stands across the street from the market on a big traffic island in a modern section of the city, known for its tall buildings. When I went to investigate, I was delighted to find free pamphlets in English that give the gate’s history from the Joseon Period until the present.The gate features a stonework base, a two-tiered pagoda-shaped tile roof and a large archway in the center. A few guards in colorful traditional garb stood nearby and I soon heard distant drumming that came closer. It signaled the impending arrival of many men dressed traditionally in colors ranging from royal blue to bright yellow, complete with big hats and boots and carrying large flags. I had arrived in time for the free changing-of-the-guard performance at 11:40 a.m. Only a few others joined me, which was a welcome change from the huge crowds I encountered at similar productions held at Seoul’s palaces. After the short, less-than-10-minutes show, visitors could pose with the men for photos.As a history buff, I really enjoyed my stop here and the lack of tourists. The gate stands between Seoul Station and Seoul Plaza. It can be accessed by Subway Line 1, Seoul Station, Exit 4 and Line 4, Hoehyeon Station, Exit 5. Closed on Mondays.The Sungnyemun Gate was built between 1396 and 1398 and was part of the old Seoul City wall.It has been modified over the years and in 2008 the upper structure was destroyed by fire, but now restored. It is an interesting structure in a city mostly glass an concrete.It's in the middle of a busy square full of cars. So it's good to see it when you are just passing by and catch a quick photo.Better known as Namdaemun Gate, is one of the symbol of Seoul: One of the 8 gates of the seoul's Fortress.It was built in 1398 during the Taejo Reign.You can walk throught it and take pictures.It's interesting see an historical place like this at the center of traffic jam!You can take a quick visit before entering the Namdaemun Market.This gate near Seoul Station is one of the last remaining gates in the walls of ancient Seoul. The gate is located on an island in main road. Best viewed from a distance.One of the 4 main gates in Seoul, reconstructed many times most recently in 2008, Sungnyemun Gate is impressive and great for some photos, but not really much to do there. There is a changing of the guard to add some colour (I missed it, but had previously seen the change at Deoksugung - its only a 10 min walk from Deoksugung to Sungnyemun). It's a good place to start a visit to the Namdeamun Market (there is an underpass from Sungnyemun gate to the top of the markets. Worth a quick stop and photo opportunity. More photogenic than Dongdaemun Gate and easier to get a good angle.This is a reconstructed version of one of the original Seoul gates and a lovely one, at that. Probably not worth a trip, but when in the area, worth passing by.Of the 8 gates in this once walled city, this one was the oldest wooden structure in Seoul until an arsonist climbed up and set a fire which destroyed the wooden pagoda on top of the gate in 2008. It took 5 years and several million dollars to restore this National historic treasure. The Namdaemun Market nearby is named for this South Gate.Right next to Namdaemun market. I love that it’s randomly in the middle of quite a busy intersection. Stands magnificently. We saw the changing of the guards. There are toilets near by.

Name: 롯데 면세점 본점
Review: 韓<U+56FD>コスメを探している方におすすめします。娘の見所は充<U+5B9F>したコスメコ<U+30FC>ナ<U+30FC>で、特に、韓<U+56FD>コスメは通常の店<U+8217><U+4FA1>格より安く購入できるので、お土産の大量購入なら、狙い目だとのことです。最初、娘がお<U+6C17>に入りの韓<U+56FD>コスメをいくつか購入しました。そのコストダウンやプレゼント攻勢を見ていた妻も負けずに、爆買いでした。私たち、家族は化粧品だけでしたが、非常に多くの中<U+56FD>人の方<U+3005>は海外有名ブランドを爆買いしていました。最近の中<U+56FD>の<U+7D4C><U+6E08>力のすごさを<U+5B9F>感しました。明洞にあるロッテ免<U+7A0E>店です。エレベ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>で12階までのぼるとお店がたくさんあります。化粧品からハイブランドのお店があり私が行った時は中<U+56FD>人がとても多かったです。特定の韓<U+56FD>コスメブランドを買いに行きました。品<U+63C3>えが豊富で、店員の方は日本がとても流暢で、とても親切に<U+5BFE><U+5FDC>してくださいました。サンプルを<U+6CA2>山つけてくださるので、助かります！ソウルで老<U+8217>的な免<U+7A0E>店です。日本ではお菓子のロッテで有名ですが、日本に<U+5E30>化した重光一族は、日本で成功した後、韓<U+56FD>でも各種事業を展開し、現在は有力な財閥の一つとなっています。とにかく巨大な免<U+7A0E>店、女性向けのコスメ用品は、メ<U+30FC>カ<U+30FC>も種類も豊富、ある程度買うものを決めていかないと、<U+6CA2>山買うはめになります。<U+89B3>光客向けのキャンペ<U+30FC>ンをやっていたからか、かなり混<U+96D1>していました。シャネルは<U+6BCE>度のことながら、<U+58F2>り切れが多いです。韓<U+56FD>コスメに<U+95A2>しては、大量買いしたい方はアリですが、少量で良ければ路面店で購入してタックスリファンドする方が安いと思います。また、<U+7E4B>がりにくいですが、オンライン免<U+7A0E>だとセ<U+30FC>ル<U+4FA1>格になっているうえ、空港受取も可能でお<U+52E7>めです♪韓<U+56FD>旅行のたびに特に家族が必ず利用します！やはりブランドも日本で買うより安いです！私は主にネットを利用していますが空港で受け取りなのとク<U+30FC>ポンなど利用もできるので時間がなくても事前ショッピングも出<U+6765>るのでとても便利です！高級ブランドの免<U+7A0E>店も入っていますが、韓<U+56FD>っぽい韓<U+56FD>コスメのお店も入っていて、取扱い商品は限られてはいますが、市街地で購入するよりも安く購入できるのでおすすめです。ただ、夜に訪れたので<U+65E2>に<U+58F2>切れになってしまっている韓<U+56FD>コスメ等もありました。9222外<U+56FD>人にとてもお得ロッテ免<U+7A0E>店 本店の口コミ保留中の口コミ外<U+56FD>人にお得なキャンペ<U+30FC>ンがよく開催されています。アイドルグッズやコ<U+30FC>ヒ<U+30FC>のチケットがもらえたりします。また<U+4F1A>員ランクがオンライン免<U+7A0E>店と連動しているのも韓<U+56FD>リピ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>からするとありがたい点ですエレベ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>で上がっていくにはギュウギュウに詰めて<U+4E57>る<U+70BA>、かなり苦手です。エスカレ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>で行く事もできるので、時間のある方はそちらをオススメします。ロッテ百貨店の2フロアが免<U+7A0E>店となっています。ツア<U+30FC>で訪問しました。ロッテ百貨店<U+5185>にあります。割引券をもらいましたが、ブランド物には興味がないし、お得感を感じなかったので、使いませんでした。

Name: 중부시장
Review: 干物や食品の買い物に、かなりお<U+52E7>めだと思います。今回は、じゃこ　するめ　海苔を買いました。じゃこは日本のじゃこと同じなのに、値段が破格です。少量の400グラムを買って割高でも、まけてもらって日本円で700円位。使っても使っても減りません。美味しいです。スルメは、するめ自然の甘味が<U+5F37>く、イカの姿を食べやすく編み<U+72B6>に切り目を入れてるやつで、明洞などで買うと１枚7千won位しますが、この市場は8枚位入って2万won。日本では考えられないくらい安くて、とっても美味しいです。海苔も美味しくてマ<U+30FC>トの半額位で買えます。その他<U+9905>なども安くて美味しいです。<U+5869>辛などの生物はまだ買ったことがないですが、破格で美味しそうです。ナッツとドライフル<U+30FC>ツを購入するために訪れました。市場の中ほどにあるお店のドライフル<U+30FC>ツがとても美味しい。ナッツも質のいいものであった。お値段もス<U+30FC>パ<U+30FC>で買うより<U+65AD>然安いんです。乾物中心の市場です。ナッツやドライフル<U+30FC>ツ、いか、海苔、いりこ、イシモチなどなどあらゆるたくさんの乾物が<U+58F2>っています。<U+6570>年前にメイン通りにア<U+30FC>ケ<U+30FC>ドができ雨でも安心です。ア<U+30FC>ケ<U+30FC>ドの中央通りにはオモニが手作りのキムチや明太子、チャンジャが<U+58F2>っています。なかには少し日本語ができるオモニもいてキムチを買ったあとは飛行機<U+5BFE>策（ニオイやタレの漏れ防止）にラップでグルグル<U+5DFB>きにしてくれます。韓<U+56FD>のりは南大門より安いのでいつもここで買っています。海苔や乾物が安いのでいつも利用いつも、日曜日はお休みの店が多いらしく今回は行きませんでした。日曜日に行かれる予定の方は<U+6C17>おつけてください。スルメやカワハギなどのお店がたくさんあります。カワハギは安くて美味しいです。お店の人も親切でした。食べ物のお店が少しだけあり、揚げド<U+30FC>ナツやキンパなどが美味しかったです。これほどまでに干物が一同に<U+4F1A>しているのを見たことはなかったので非常に新鮮でした。干物と行っても日本の朝市にあるようなものではないくて完全に乾燥したカラッカラ<U+72B6>態のもの。とくに干し魚は韓<U+56FD>の人にとっては欠かせないもののようで干しタラがたくさんありました。お土産に買っていっても良いのかもしれませんが調理方法が解らなかったのでやめておきました。店の人はあまり日本語は通じない感じでした。今までは<U+5E83><U+8535>市場で明太子やタコキムチなどを買っていましたが、こちらの方が安いようです。おでん、ホットクを食べ<U+6B69>き。<U+4F53>が<U+6E29>まりました。すいているので買い物しやすいです。東大門エリアに宿泊したら立ち寄る市場、冬の時期だったら最終日に明太子<U+30FB>たこキムチを買って<U+5E30>ります。朝食を入口にある<U+9ED2>米ホットクとおでんにしたりと、<U+99C5>に行く前に寄ったりもしてます。一年に<U+6570>回渡韓しています。今までは<U+5E83><U+8535>市場で買い物をしていましたが、ここ<U+6570>回中部市場に足を伸ばして行っています。物によっても違いますが、<U+5E83><U+8535>市場より1割ほど安いような感じです。乾物の種類も豊富で、買いすぎてしまうくらいです。明洞窟と東大門のほぼ中間、乙支路4街<U+99C5>のすぐ近くにある中部市場。干タラやシラスなどの乾物、本番韓<U+56FD>の明太子など、海産物を<U+58F2>る店なんと<U+6570>百軒が、明るい電<U+706F>の下で<U+4E21>側に軒を連ねている。「こんなに同じような店が集まって商<U+58F2>になるのだろうか？」と思うくらい。本<U+6C17>で買うのなら、色<U+3005>と試食もさせてくれるオモニ達。僕も明太子を少しだけ買いました。日本人はあまり見かけませんでしたが、美味しくて面白い市場です。30分ほどで<U+697D>しめますよ。

Name: 그레뱅뮤지엄
Location: 서울 중구 을지로 23 station la plus proche : Euljiro 1-ga (우) 04523
Review: I took one of the Osan AB, Chaplain's , her assistant and a friend to the museum. It was great. I am from New York so hearing the Godfather music and seeing Al Pacino, and Robert De Niro sitting down was a huge surprise and great experience. Also the room with the Presidents was priceless. There were even exhibits of Kings and the Pope. I especially enjoyed seeing Chinese National riding a Horse next to Napoleon. You can even ride a bicycle next to ET! I have not smiled and laughed as much in years.It was a warm day in Seoul on our day to visit the Palaces. We had a list of places to go to with our BTS edition of Discover Seoul Pass. This was one of the places to go to. It was cool and the place was full of figures of people we know, especially our Korean idols and famous leaders of the world.We took our time going from floor to floor and there were also other guests from our country, the Philippines. What was great about the place is that it was not just a museum of wax figures, they also had games and 3D figures you can have photo ops with. They also had a souvenir shop where we bought stuff of our idols ( G Dragon, LMH and KSH) It was a good afternoon for me and my son. We enjoyed it. We have been to a wax museum in HK but this was great because of our Kdrama and Kpop idols. Thanks Grevin Seoul, we had fun . Thanks too for sending souvenir photos through my email.Conveniently located near City Hall Subway station. It was easy to find. An opportunity to meet with many movie stars around the world.especially the Korean movie stars. An interesting wax museum...there were also digital games that you can play inside.I liked the Grevin museum, it was my first wax figures museum and I was really impressed with how real some of the statues looked. I had fun with Einstein and Steve Jobs at the pop quiz room and I enjoyed making photos with other celebrities like Al Pacino, Brad Pitt, Messi and the Queen. The museum has a section with only k-drama stars and k-pop artist and overall it was a fun day.If you have spare time, this is a good option. The place was pretty much empty when we were there & we received 20% discount with our MasterCard.Interesting museum to visit. However, the Asian stars doesn't look as realistic. We had fun playing with the interactive games though.Good place to spend an evening in Seoul. Some cool things to see and do here. Not a place to go multiple timesWe went there on Monday and I was surprised there was literally no other visitors but us. Around 4-5 people arrived later. Except taking photos you can also participate in some games at the museum which was kind of fun I think. They take your pics and send it to you via email later on. Also, the regular ticket price was 18kWon but you can get 10% discount if you pay with MasterCard.Worthwhile visit. You can go through the process of making your sculpture, makeup, costume and finally, taking picture.Like any wax museum, some figures look very realistic and some not. They also have some interactive activities for guests to participate so make sure you have more time to spend inside.

Name: 동대문 디자인 플라자
Review: This area is one of the best place to shop but this time, we went here to enjoy the cold weather and take lots of pictures here! Truly a wonderful place for photographyI stopped by at the DDP at nighttime with some friends and it was a great visit. The architectural design of the plaza itself is so unique and definitely worth some photos. I believe they tend to have some exhibits are art programs here sometimes but you'll have to check out their website. There is a History Museum that you can check out as well with free admission.This is a very beautiful building, spanning multiple blocks in Seoul. Its architecture is unique and outstanding from every perspective. There are pianos in various locations, free to play. Around the back there is an upscale street clothing market.The building is very attractive in design. There are spaces for exchibitions in the building. There are art shops and restaurants as wellWhat an amazing building!! The little shops in DDP were really interesting and worth exploring. Spend a lot of time in there. Glad that interior is not overly clutter but kept clean and minimalistic. The outside was full of activities so it was worth a trip both inside and out.Was looking forward to coming here but after marvelling at the structure and sculptures outside we were a bit bemused by the inside. We only managed to find a cafe and then a huge hall which was empty except for a couple of Mormon brothers having a rest. Not sure what the point of the place is.It is a wonderful place to visit. Great architecture and atmosphere. They have different exhibitions.This is a fascinating building which looks great from pretty much any angle. There didn’t seem to be an awful lot to do there - a small shopping arcade & a gallery for exhibitions plus some historic remains in the grounds with a small museum - but we spent an hour or so there, then went and ate in the arcades nearby then came back once it was dark when it looked even better. It reflects the light from surrounding buildings & looks quite otherworldly. Well worth a brief visit.As an architecture buff, I found this plaza in Seoul to feature one of the most innovative modern structures that I have seen. I first visited the 7-level (4 above ground and 3 below) building during the day and was so impressed that I returned to introduce the center to my husband that night. Designed by architect Zaha Hadid, the futuristic construction exhibits no straight lines or right angles. Instead, it presents elongated, curvy forms, built with concrete and cloaked in 45,000 aluminum panels.At night, the center’s lights seem to glow from within. At certain exterior vantage points, its shape and silvery hue give the impression of what I imagine a giant spaceship to look like. The park next to the building further enhances the look. It holds 25,550 LED roses, which light up 5 minutes after sunset and are absolutely stunning. It was a magical experience to stroll here in the dark. Inside, the curves continue in long corridors and connecting stairways (there are also standard elevators). The center serves as a fairly new venue for design in Seoul, featuring an art hall, meeting space, a museum, a design lab and a design market. I visited the huge lab, which displays a variety of well-crafted items for sale and gives visitors the opportunity to meet the designers. We enjoyed a light dinner in one of the many eateries in the market, which is connected to the nearby Dongdaemun shopping centers.DDP, located in Downtown Seoul, is easily reached by subway. Take Line 2, 4 or 5 to Dongdaemun History and Culture Park Station and leave through exits 1 or 10.We visited here as a nice walk in the evening. don't miss this work of art on the beautiful architecture. there are so many great things about this building. obviously curvy outside is amazing. The interior and exterior, both are inspiring.

Name: 방산 종합시장
Review:
There are lots of packing stuffs in this market.
Almost no place to eat unlike other typical traditional markets.
It's not a place for tourists. But, just visit and take a look if you are interested.Great place to find everything you need for baking. Cake Boxes, decorator tips pans and more. Take some time to really shop as prices vary and some shops only sell in quantities of 100 or more.Market was across the street from the Gwangjang market and so we venture there after having exploring the food market.
Bangsan market has got shops selling bakeware and packaging materials. I checked out a few bakeware shops and thought the prices were quite resonable Bought...더 보기More to baking packaging rather than baking ingredients.. there's many small shops hidden along the street.. ingredients not alot.. not too bad to take a stroll thereEasily reachable by walking along the Cheonggyecheon stream and across from Gwangjang Market, Bangsan is Seoul’s best market for baking...더 보기Korea seems to specialize in keeping like with like. Not for them the idea that shops selling paint should be...더 보기

Name: 실로암 불가마 사우나
Review: This jjimjilbang was awesome! After reading reviews about predatory pricing at other popular bathhouses we chose Siloam. Even our cab driver recommended Siloam as the better choice! The baths were relaxing, with the mugwort being my favorite, and the scrub was rejuvenating. My skin has never felt so silky and I regularly moisturize and exfoliate at home! After an hour in the baths, my boyfriend and I met up in the common areas to lounge on the mats before trying a 60-min massage. We definitely got our money and time’s worth! We wandered around and enjoyed snacks at the cafe before checking out the kilns. My boyfriend took a nap in the oxygen room while I rolled around in loess sauna. You could easily spend a whole night or half a day at this jjimjilbang (they even have a nap room). 10/10 would recommend and will return to next time we’re in Seoul!i got into incheon around 5:30 AM and couldn't check into my hotel in seoul until 3:00 PM. i knew i'd want a nap, so i googled spas and this one came up. i'm glad i came here because it was the perfect place to go post-14-hour flight.i came here from seoul station and walked over, they stored my luggage for me, i paid the fee (11,000 KRW...around $9 USD) and went up to the nap room for some peace and quiet. it was perfection. i got 2 hours of sleep without disturbance. i recommend using an extra blanket as a pillow, if you're like me and find the block pillows uncomfortable.after i slept, i went down to the baths, sauna, and pools. i got a full body scrub and oil massage for 35,000 KRW ($30 USD) and while i speak no korean, i was able to communicate effectively and did not feel awkward at all. as people mentioned, you're fully naked, so be prepared for that. the woman doing the scrub was friendly and efficient. i felt like a new woman after!after my scrub and spending some time in the baths, i rested my feet in a warm rock...thing? unsure what it was but 10/10 recommend lol. then i got food from the cafeteria area. i paid 10000 KRW for spicy pork and it was not only delicious, but came with generous portions for sides.all in all, it was an awesome experience! not particularly luxe, but definitely fantastic for the price.Nice traditional place, with lots of pleasant pools, a cascade and sauna with salt to scrub yourself. Also, the ladies who are massaging and scrubbing are amazing and it's not expensive. But the space itself is quite small and it's not easy to understand where things are. I think we missed some stuff because of lack of information.Average sauna in terms of its cleaniness. Pool was small. Have a number of different facilities which u cant find at the other sauna. The aunty selling food at level 4 was unfriendly when i ordered a binsu which tasted like ice-kachang. Overall average place.This is a very popular Korean spa(bath, thermal spa and more) for foreigners. Good to try if you visit Korea for the first time.- Putting luxurious spas aside, I think this is the best common Korean spa in Seoul.- 11,000 won was a very affordable price for the facility. It's even cheaper if you only take a bath.- Even though its reputation, it wasn't that crowded when I visited on Friday.- Don't forget to pick up a towel from B1F before you start enjoying yourself.- Some of chambers are too hot even for locals.- Most fun chambers are on the 4th floor and it's the most crowded floor.- Some locals visit here for a cheap overnight stay. Only for sleeping.- It's not necessary to get naked. Just skip bathing. No worries for foreigners.- Restaurant and snack bars looked pretty well-maintained.- Comic books are too outdated. I think they need to fetch recent ones more.When you searchs for spas in Seoul, the Dragon Spa was the most popular result and also guidebooks were singing praises of the Dragon Spa. However, the Dragon Spa attracted various reviews and I began to think it was a tourist attraction and over-priced.I initially approached concierge at my hotel to discuss the DRAGON spa but then one of the staff member at the concierge desk told me she had gone to Silloam which was more authentic and mostly locals went there.So on my last day I went to Silloam. They charge an entrance fee to use the baths approx 7,000 won or so but if you would like to use the additional rooms then its approx 11,000 won. On hindsight I should have just paid for the baths becuase they are separate for men and women. The other rooms are mixed.The baths are good with various baths st different temperatures. You will find in the baths a separate area where you will find women offering massages and body scrubs. I opted for a body scrub a massage with a face pack for 80,000 won which lasted for an hour. I loved my treatment and the woman administering my treatment was lovely and friendly. I left the spa feeling so relaxed and amazing. Later that day when I flew out back to London, I slept amazingly on the flight. I highly recommend this place and make sure you enjoy the baths first before opting for your treatmentCould spend hours in this place. They have everything you could need. Very relaxing. Please do research the customs before you go though so you know what to expect!I loved my experience at Siloam! My reccomendations are: read up ahead on jimjilbang etiqutte and process, and definitely ask the lady at the desk in the ladies' for a scrub + facial massage. Then go enjoy the different saunas before heading down to the baths. It's 60,000 wan very well spent.What a triumph. I’m not easily pleased when it comes to this sort of thing but truly brilliant.Don’t be a prude, the folk here are not there to look at you, just enjoy the liberty and let it all loose.Body scrub fantastic, massage even better and I’ve had massages all over the world, possibly the best I’ve had.Saunas, baths, etiquette, attitude all top drawer. Currently lying on a warmed floor in the jade room feeling very relaxed indeed.If you come here and don’t enjoy it, I’ll be amazed.My wife and I had a great time chilling out at Silloam Sauna. The place is very clean with multiple storeys of bath, saunas, massage and dining facilities. Their signature barley drink is a must try! If you’re looking for a nice place to spend a lazy afternoon, or just to experience the Korean jimjilbang, this place will not disappoint.

Name: 서울로7017
Location: 서울 중구 청파로 432 Near Seoul Station and Namdaemun Market (우) 04509
Review: A pleasant walk over the the hustle of the city. Markets are sometimes held as at the weekend. It has a nice view of Seoul station, especially if you want to watch the sunset over the city. Its also nicely lit after dark. Usually a few people walking about and taking photos, but never feels to busy.Like the New York Highline, this old roadway has been rebirthed as an above street garden walkway. As you proceed along, the vistas open out into a wide expansive view around Seoul station. If you’re lucky someone, maybe you, will be playing one of the several upright pianos stationed along the walkway. The gardens change as you walk through a range of plant species.It’s a bit like the NY Highline except more concrete. Nice way to get between areas of the city and avoid the traffic.A bit like the NY highline, this is an urban walkway created from a disused rail line that allows you to walk through the downtown area of Seoul unimpeded by traffic. What a simple but brilliant idea; I hope more cities copy it. There are pleasant features there (like a piano) to break the journey, it's a pleasant stroll you can pick up near Seoul station.Take the walk at night. The soft glow of the planters and occasional music along the way are good for the soul, an airborne oasis above the rush of cars and trains. During the days you may come across a player at one of the four or so pianos along the route. And the blooms are changing every week. Even umbrellas are provided for an oppressive summer sun. Thoughtful Korean designers at their best. Highly recommended.It's an urban garden that's above the roads. You get a good view of Seoul Station (both old and new). If you're trainspotter, you can look at trains coming in and out of Seoul StationThe walkway is not very long but nice, with interesting trees and many pianos, plus a few interesting views.A quirky elevated garden built on an overpass above the busy Seoul streets. They provide free umbrellas to borrow whilst enjoying the walk and protect yourself from the sun. There are plenty of different varieties of plants, a nice area where mist is sprayed to keep cool (plants and tourists alike) and was overall a nice place to visit without crowds to bother you.We were attracted by the lights at first, around midnight near our hotel in Seoul station. Taking those lighted stairs revealed at first a nice potted garden with each pot labeled with the latin botanical name for each plant. As we continued our walk, we found more than plants - it was a whimsical park, with working pianos, an embassy for an alien planet (where you can take official pictures behind the alien flag), trampolines, kids' drawing station, glass floors, and other rather amusing play areas - all free! Even late at night, the park felt safe - there are people walking through even after midnight. Also, the uniformed park keepers are still around late, with lighted red candlesticks in hand. This is an enjoyable place to walk, and it is most convenient when going from Seoul Station to Namdaemum or the Hoehyeon Station. Skip the traffic and take a walk in Seoullo - it will bring a smile to your heart!It is probably the most beautiful walk to take in the night. The old Seoul Railway station is in lit up and so is the new one, not to mention the sky walkway. It is such a wonderful place to wander. Simply go!

Name: 대한극장
Rank: 43위(285곳의 서울 소재 즐길 거리 / 게임 중)
Review: If you are feeling like a movie, this is a nice, clean multi-story movie theater in the midst of Seoul. Most movies are in English with subtitles so whether you are Korean or not you will enjoy the experience.Don't be intimidated by the process of buying tickets. I used an english website to check the timing of the...더 보기

Review:

Recommend to bring an umbrella when visiting as there is not much shelter.Very transit of people and motorvehculs, meny way to go best by subway, many atractions has fee, But not expensive, a must,The older and original City Hall was built during the Japanese Occupation in 1925 and served until liberation in 1945.The more modern building to one side was built in 2008. Both are interesting buildings in the heart of Seoul.This is a glass building behind the old city hall.
It looks expensive. But, I don't get much architectural beauty....더 보기Seoul City Hall is not an attraction in its own right, although the architecture is very interesting. It resembles a large glass tsunami. It makes an interesting side visit along with Seoul Plaza and Seoul Metropolitan Library (the old city Hall), whilst visiting the nearby...더 보기Apparently, there are 2 City halls, the new and old. The old city hall is now a Seoul Metropolitan Library while the new city hall, which is next to it, is a modern impressive architecture. They are located in front of the Seoul Plaza, a...더 보기The new Seoul City Hall is, indeed, an interesting architectural structure -- but if one's time is short when visiting Seoul, a visit inside is not required.We did not get a chance to go there for long but our hotel was right next to the City Hall square so we passed by quiet often. The buildings are impressive and we liked the vibe overall. Definitely worth a stop - esp when...더 보기We went here because it is very close with our hotel at myeongdong area. We went here after visit Deoksugung palace. Just for photostop.The original Seoul City hall became the Seoul Metropolitan Library and behind it stands the new city hall which is...더 보기

Name: 문화역서울 284
Review:
東京<U+99C5>に似て親近感わきましたね。
イベントも行われているようで、タイミングあえばそちらもチェックすると良いと思いますよ<U+30FC>ロッテマ<U+30FC>トのすぐ隣に ソウルの<U+65E7><U+99C5><U+820E>がありました。 日本統治時代に作られたということで東京に そっくりでした。前はよく...더 보기ソウルに行けば見ないことはない<U+65E7><U+99C5><U+820E>。

荷物が<U+5897>えても...더 보기レンガ造りで、レトロ感<U+6E80>載の建築物でした。ただ、暗い雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>なのは、植民地建築だからでしょうか。規模も東京<U+99C5>の丸の<U+5185><U+99C5><U+820E>と...더 보기東京<U+99C5>のような<U+99C5>ではなく、<U+53CC>子の<U+95A2>係にある<U+99C5>ですね。
隣に近代的な造りの建屋が<U+5897>築されているのは今の東京<U+99C5>と同じですが、...더 보기レトロな建物は、東京<U+99C5>を思い起こす雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>です。近代的なロッテマ<U+30FC>トやソウル<U+99C5>と<U+4E26>んでいて、不思議なコントラストです。ロッテマ<U+30FC>トのすぐ裏にあり、レトロでありつつシャレた雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が漂う建物。
昔のソウル<U+99C5>なので今は使われておらず形が<U+6B8B>されて...더 보기空港に向かう際に、ソウル<U+99C5>を利用しましたが、こちらは隣にあり、今は使われておりません。レトロな建物で、かわいらしいので、...더 보기

Name: 남산골 한옥 마을
Review:
My visit here occurred on my third time in Seoul and I did not regret missing it on my first two trips. Unlike other recreated villages I have gone to worldwide, this one offers only five traditional houses, which have been moved here. They provide a good cross-section of how Joseon Dynasty citizens lived, but none beckoned to linger; and no hands-on activities, such as wearing traditional garments, were available on an early weekday afternoon in November. Though there is no admission charge, the free access did not seem to stimulate interest, at least at this time of year. I saw only a handful of other visitors during my brief exploration. But this atmosphere proved to be a nice change from the crowds at popular tourist attractions, such as palaces. I enjoyed sitting by the pond here for a while and walking along one of the trails in the park at the rear of the complex.The village is near the Myeongdong area of Seoul. By subway, take Line 3 or 4, get off at Chungmuro Station and take Exit 3 or 4.This is a great place to spend the afternoon exploring and seeing the traditional style of living and shops. Really loved it here and It's free and easy to walk around.I loved this tour. The steep inclines and quaint houses and shops is reminiscent of our tour in Tuscany (on much smaller scale). So picturesque, I can understand the attraction for tourists. But I sympathize with the residents having to put up with us taking selfies in their doorways. We only stayed for about 30 minutes. It’s a real look into the history of South Korea.This Hanok village is easy to find and is walking distance from my hotel. The heritage houses are well maintained and is good to visit inspite of being free accessI didn't have high expectations as I went to Bukchon Hanok Village before; so reckon it'll be similar ie cafes housed in traditional houses etc. But at Namsangol Hanok Village (NHV) surprises me at every turn. First you can experience 1 hour sleeping time in the hanok (for a small fee). I thought that's a very refreshing experience in true sense of the word. Next you can rent traditional costume and take photos or pretend you're in a period drama and walk around the village. We also came across a gentleman who is a falconer and told us many information on this ancient heritage of korean falconry. The cafe nestled in the middle of the village is also very quaint and the souvenirs are worth looking at.We visited yesterday, 20/07/19, a family of 6 aged between 6 - 69. No entrance fee that we noticed. Information hut was on your immediate right after entry. Lovely clean toilets all the way round the area. This trip was throughly enjoyed by all. It was a nice steady walk around the village and gardens. Fun games for the children to take part in as you walk, including a stamp collecting map for the children to find stamps as they walk around. Lovely village and So clean and well taken care of. Some very large Koi fish in the lake which the children enjoyed watching. We could have hired traditional dress at the entrance but with the humid heat we would have struggled. I would happily go again for a lovely peaceful stroll.It’s very close to our hotel. Its a good place to visit, cultural heritage with traditional houses. Fresh atmosphere. 
It’s free access. Also its not so many people like other tourist attractions, so i like it.This place is a hidden jewel if you experience some of the traditional Korean culture. The park itself is peaceful and very walkable. One must try “Experience Korea” items at a nominal fee such as making bow and arrows, making crafts, making game pieces, rice cakes, etc. The instructors are people who are experts at these Korean traditions and passionate about sharing them.Just take a short walk from Chungmuro station and you will reach this village. Admission is free. We walked around the few traditional houses and the pond nearby. It is small but peaceful and not crowded. A great place for a stroll and photos.This is a good place if you want to know what Korean culture is like. They have a replica of a Korean village with the traditional furniture. There were demonstrations of Korean activities, ranging from Korean toys, make Korean rice dumplings and a Korean tightrope walker.

You can check the confirmation using their site; but is always as “checking” .... they dont even bother to inform you that is full.I had ZERO expectations for this as a cultural show isn’t usually up my alley but someone else on our trip booked this and it ended up being a highlight from our trip. The dinner is a multi-course affair and is based on royal meals...더 보기Every time I travel with my wife we always spend one night watching cultural shows that represent the culture of the country we are visiting. In Seoul I think Korea House is the place. They offer different ticket options, like show and dinner, and dinner...더 보기This is the second time I have eaten here. There were 21 of us and everyone felt it to have been very good. can't fault ti really. Traditional Korean food in an authentic setting. Beautifully presented and excellently served. thanks.I have seen thus show last month, and i think it is beautiful, elegant, highly professional , done in good taste. Go and enjoy!I went there with my group and we had dinner followed by the show. It was AWESOME! The food was fantastic and very refined and the show was a must-see. You don't have to understand Korean as there is a narration and the action in...더 보기We did not eat at Korea House. The performance was excellent. They engaged the audience and provided an interesting story.It was a fabulous experience. Our driver and guide, Paul, were very good. Paul was very knowledgeable about the city and very polite, funny, and caring. The dinner was great, and the show was fantastic, although the sound was loud. Overall the experience was very...더 보기

Name: 롯데아울렛 서울역점
Review: お土産を買うために寄りました首都の一番大きな<U+99C5>の近くにショッピングモ<U+30FC>ル的な施設があるのは日本では見ない光景だと思います。時間が無かったため一部しか見れませんでしたが<U+69D8><U+3005>な種類のインスタント<U+9EBA>やお茶の試食があって<U+697D>しめました。お<U+60E3>菜コ<U+30FC>ナ<U+30FC>では大きな箱に入ったフライドチキンなどが日本よりだいぶ安く<U+58F2>られていたので、試してみたかったです。あまり大きくはないので、雨の日の買い物に良いです。近くに大型マ<U+30FC>トもあるため、便利な立地です。一階にはザラもあり、日本で<U+58F2>られているものと少し違うようです。<U+99C5>から近くて便利ですが、ただのデパ<U+30FC>トっていう印象でした。品<U+63C3>えはよさそうで、いろんなものがあるので、時間がない時の買い物とかには良いと思いますが、買い物は明洞とかの方が<U+697D>しいと思います。反日運動とかはしてないので、行っても大丈夫です。特に他と比べて安いわけでもなく、中途半端な印象を受けました。ここを目的地として目掛けて行くことはないと思いますが、近く行かれた方は暇つぶしにふらっとよってもいいかなと思います。一階のシスレ<U+30FC>のカバンは買っても良いかなと思いました。ソウル<U+99C5>直結のショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルでブランドショップが<U+6CA2>山入っています。日本のアウトレットの感じではなくデパ<U+30FC>トのようなスタイルでした。わざわざ行くなら、日本のアウトレットモ<U+30FC>ルの方が良いと思います。ロッテマ<U+30FC>トに行ったあと、寄ってみました。普通のショッピングセンタ<U+30FC>と同じように見えました。マネキンが多い。ソウル<U+99C5>直結のショッピングモ<U+30FC>ルです。バ<U+30FC>ゲン品に人だかりができていました。いずこも同じ光景ですね。移動中の空港までの空き時間に立ち寄りましたがアウトレットというよりもデパ<U+30FC>トみたいな品<U+63C3>えでした！もっと普通のアウトレットだと<U+697D>しいかも！半額以下でセ<U+30FC>ルよりお得なものもあります。普通のアウトレットモ<U+30FC>ルとは違い、ロッテデパ<U+30FC>トのお店のアウトレットという雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>です。ソウル<U+99C5>の1番出口よりすぐです。お隣にはロッテマ<U+30FC>トがありました。アウトレットという名前に魅力を感じますが、ロッテマ<U+30FC>トの方が個人的には良かったです。

Name: 서울빛초롱축제
Review:

Should leave...더 보기The light displays were beautiful and is worth making a trip going to see them at least once if you are in Seoul during this time.It was such a nice time seeing all the beautiful lanterns, that are is very nice, and we had a great meal near by!It’s absolutely worth seeing! Just take a long walk near the stream in the evening. There are different scenes from eastern and western fairy tails and legends and some light projections on the walls. Looks really amazing and is not far from Myeongdong - in...더 보기Worth it. Nice time along the river. Great lanterns but Too much plastic.

We were blown away by the quaity of the...더 보기It's the exhibition of traditional lanterns(yeondeung) on Cheonggyecheon Stream.

There's no need to spend money. It's good to visit and join.It happens every November and is a wonderful attraction to stroll along the Cheonggyecheon stream. The artists let their imaginations soar and the lanterns can be fanciful or literal.I came here to watch the Seoul Lantern parade, and it was beautiful!! So many big and beautiful, and culture lanterns :).The parade was just perfect, everything was gorgeous. The people were dancing and celebrating everywhere, the feeling of festivity was incredible. Name: 충무로 애완동물 거리

You have about 8 shops of the cutest pups who are all so fragile and scared.. Every puppy I said hello too wanted to be saved- it really...더 보기Hi . I bought a puppy there 2 weeks ago . Just to see though, and weren’t planning...더 보기We went to chungmuro to buy a Pomeranian last month and not even 3 weeks later out of nowhere it started twitching and having seizures so we took it to the vet and they diagnosed it with distemper and it died a couple days later....더 보기

Name: 울산 대공원
Review: They have 3 walking course.. you can choose and also have bicycle for rent. Running Walking Picnic ...big Playground for kidsYou can spend a few hours here as it's big and open.It is dog friendly.On or off the lead.Free entry.There are two ponds.A carp and water lily.Both are devoid of fish and plants.There is a play area for kids.You can hire a bike for 3000 won for 1 hour.Squirrels are there if you are quiet and careful.I know I didn't get to see much of the park but what I did see was delightful. I can only imagine how stunning it would be during any other season. I particularly loved the accupressure foot walj.There are many park is Ulsan and all are very good, this one is no exception, it also host various different displays throughout the yearso beautiful during different festivals and the lake is so lovely for a walk alone or with friends. you can also rent bikes for one or two to ride within the park.It is located in the west of Ulsan and can be quite a ride to get there.A huge space offering garden layout with various plants for families with kids to spend the afternoon or evening.There are events like Tulip festival in April, Rose festival in May during which huge gathering of locals/expats visit.Visit rose festival at night for a light show as well.It is free of charge to enter. It also has refreshments/light snacks near the gate.Tip : Try to have a taxi booking app or bus schedules to avoid waiting for one to come around.Do you know? In korea have a bamboo forest. In the picture is a bamboo forest in the city of Ulsan. Taehwagang Grand Park (태화강대공원) Taehwagang Grand Park in ulsan city is beautiful. Park have a bicycle for rental free 1 hr. After 1 hr. price 500 won per 30 min.I stayed close to this park and was amazed at how big it is for a central city.I went early morning for a jog and was amazed by the amount of older people out walking at this timePlenty of quiet areas to stroll and sit, activity outdoor gym areas and a municipal swimming pool I think the area is 36sq km of space and I noticed a variety of pools, lakes and garden areas.Nice huge park with lots of activities and flower lightings at night. Lots of buses for transport. Well connectedIt's a really big park with lots of room for picnicking throughout the year. There are many events held here as well, from concerts to rose festivals.

Name: 울산 박물관
Review: I first came to Ulsan 22 years ago and since then every one or two years for buisness.My activity is petrochemicals, and I knew that Ulsan has also the biggest ship building yard in the world.But I ignored about the other activities in this town and how it started.PRO : the entrance is freeCON : More explanations in English would be welcomeJust come here on a rainy day and got really warm and thoughtful welcome from staff call Irene. She even help us call out for online taxi to Science Museum. Thanks a lot...!Not a very big museum, just the right size. Free entrance and great place to showcase korean culture and technological marvel of south korea.This museum has many pluses. It is free, it is small, so you won't get bored, and the restaurant HAS THE BEST buckwheat noodles in all of Korea, for only 4000 won (4USD)Relatively modern museum (opened 2011), located adjacent to Ulsan Grand Park and easily accessible from downtown Ulsan. The permanent exhibitions located on the 2nd Floor are divided into two main Galleries; the 'History Gallery' showing the history and culture of Ulsan from prehistoric times up until the establishment of the Ulsan Industrial Metropolis and the 'Industrial History Gallery' concentrating on the development of Ulsan as an industrial centre from the sixties/seventies up until the present day.I certainly was unaware of the amount of prehistoric sites in the Ulsan Metropolitan Area and this visit to the museum prompted me to subsequently visit such sites, e.g.: the petroglyph rock art in nearby Ulju, etc. As a "foreigner" working in Ulsan, the Industrial History was of particular interest to me and I was drawn to the exhibits concerning the automotive industry (Hyundai Motor Company) and the Shipbuilding/Offshore Construction (Hyundai Heavy Industries). Don't miss the Hyundai Pony - Korea's First Original Model from 1979 (remember when wing-mirrors were actually located on the front wings!).Entrance to the permanent exhibitions is free. When I visited there was an exhibition of 'Egyptian Treasures from the Brooklyn Museum' in one of the two Special Exhibition Galleries for which they charged a fee (discounted for Seniors like myself). This for me was 'icing on the cake' in a thoroughly enjoyable visit which included a pizza lunch in the attractive Bistro/Cafeteria on the 2nd Floor.At time for my visit, there was exhibition of religious treasures of Israel and the guide was so kind to explain us all details and spent with us about an hour and draw our attention to the historical point. The Ulsan museum is well-established and location is very convenient just next to Ulsan Grand park.The Ulsan Museum which is very easily accessible is located adjacent to the Ulsan Grand Park, Nam-gu (further up from Gonguptap Rotary). Entrance is free for the general exhibits. Some exhibition areas are subject to a fee. Tickets can be obtained on the ground floor. The only downside is that most exhibits are in Korean language with minimal English translation. Improvements to the translation would have been very helpful.The museum educates visitors on the Korean cultural heritage and its subsequent industrialisation prowess. A children's interactive area (in Korean) is also provided. All-in-all, it's worth the visit as it gives you a good look at the Korean way of life.Housing in a building of really interesting, modern architecture, it is divided in two parts (excluding the temporary exhibitions): History and Technology. So, it demonstrates the past and the present of Ulsan area. It is not a must-see spot, however, if you have more time after your visit in Ulsan Grand Park, a pass through the museum will get you deeper inside in the early and modern history of the area. The most of the information is written only in Korean, however the museum staff is eager to answer your questions and to give you more information about the exhibits.Hint: there is a quite cute coffee shop at the second floor of the museum.Not a bad museum. It's not extremely large, but moderate sized. Of course being in Korea; the exhibit's are dominantly in Korean. The exhibit that I saw did contain a decent amount of English and there were many interesting artifacts on display.It helps you understand so much of Korean culture. Their history and AMAZING comeback after the Korean War is fascinating.

Name: 대왕암 공원
Review: Excellent place for a walk by the sea on rocks and trails by pine trees. Lovely blue ocean and layers of rock formations by the waves.This is definitely one of the most beautiful nature attractions in South Korea. Walk along the enchanting forest path, passed by the lighthouse to the magnificent coastal wonder that has a beautiful legend. After the walk, why not treat yourself with some fresh sashimi caught by the Haenyeo of Ulsan!This was one of my favorite spots in Korea! The place was very pretty, not too crowded, the air was fresh and comforting. I enjoyed the trails and simply walking around, smelling the rich smell of nature and appreciating the very pretty natural views. Highly recommend!This is an iconic park of ulsan Is a very beautiful natural tourist attraction You can spend time to relax especially on vacation during summer.Had a chance to visit this amazing place and the views were so breath taking! Went in summer but the sea breeze was really cooling!! Great place for photos too!Watch the video on my Instagram @xuantraveloguehello,today ,sunday  .i am with my friends lunch in shalimar restaurant..very good service & best food,very testy..excellent food,,Beautiful sea side rock, small hiking, cafe and they even have outdoor fitness equipment. Morning or afternoon time will be perfect to visit this place.We passed by this area after our business tour for a short walk and sight seeing. I really recommend that you don't miss this park. From dragon statue playground to rocky cliff is about 10-15min walk. There are restaurants nearby. A breathtaking view on the cliff. Diving not allowed. We didn't see anyone swimming too. Rocky area.Such a beautiful area to walk about, it would take 3-4hours to walk around it all, little outcrops with bridges and walk ways absolutley stunning.take a bus no.104 is easiest because the bus stop at Daewangam entrance. Walk along the beach and take a photo with a nice view. You can try fresh seafood too

Name: 일산해수욕장
Review:
The beach is always busy July through August, the local council have sent a lot of money on the area and the surrounding areas. Well worth the visitYou can access this beach while walking around Daewangam Park.Just follow the cliff walk.The walk around the cliffs is worth the efgort.A very popular beach and the park next to the beach has had a lot of work done to it in past years, well worth a walk through this parkWe enjoyed this beach area in December, but the open sewer going into the ocean was quite aweful.  Wonder why...더 보기The beach normally opens from mid-July till late August. So, the best time for you to visit the place is summer. There are facilities for children so that many people come in family unit. Also, adults can enjoy various water sleighs such as banana boat....더 보기Ilsan beach is situated near the Daewangam park area. It has a lot of choices for korean food, fine dining...더 보기Much less crowded that Haendae in Busan. Many foreigners use this beach since the Hyundai Ship yard is nearby so...더 보기The Ilsan beach is located in a bay between Hyundai vessel shipyard and Hyundai Heavy Industry yard.
Clean water, plenty...더 보기Yes, we had the perfect day: Blue sky but the view was amazing and people there were nice. There is no subways so you have to take the bus and that can be a little weird. Watched Brazil soccer game in the bus because it...더 보기Definitely one of the most beautiful places in Ulsan district. Perferct jogging and walking pathways

Name: 간월재
Review: The name ‘Ganwolsan’ means a sacred mountain like ‘Sinbulsan.’ As high as 1,069 m, it has steep rocky cliffs on the east and highlands with gentle slopes on the west. In early August, the mountain lily blooms and creates a mystique view in harmony with the short silver grass around the peak.Ganwolsan is a favorite place for many hikers to watch the silver grass in autumn. The wide silver grass plains in the altitude of more than 1000m offer special points of interest, unlike other mountains.In the fall of the Yeongnam Alps, where the silver grass makes their appearance in the autumn, the Ulju Odyssey, the mountain concert, the mountain marathon, and the mountain climbing tournament are held every year.I would recommend to hike the Sinbul mountain and Ganwol Mountain from the Youngnam Alps Complex Center.You can also see beautiful eulalia yard.

Name: 국립 신불산폭포자연휴양림
Location: 울산 울주군 상북면 청수골길 175 Sangbuk-myeon, Ulju-gun (우) 44909
Review: Nice short walk from car park.Some extra walks available.Chipmonks around.Two levels of photo's of the falls.Get a badge from lady at the gate.This waterfall is located inside the forest, barely 30 mins from parking area. Great for long walks and family outings.Shinbulsan has great hiking trails with easy as well as more advanced options. There is plenty of natural scenery to be found at Sinbulsan. It's the perfect place to get out of the city for some fresh air.30 minute walking distance from the parking lot. Very nice and calm place. Surroundings are very beautiful. Enjoyed it. Good place for the people who love nature and hiking.An interesting complex. in the middle of nowhere (so to speak) a huge car park, a Korean theater and access to one of the beautiful areas to walk. Excellent parking and good walking, nice waterfall. gets a bit crowded on Sundays

Name: 태화강 십리대밭
Review: The easiest way to get to Taehwagang National Garden is by cab. The garden houses an incredibly vast garden. Bright yellow flowers were in full bloom during my visit. Silver grass reeds magnificently rose proudly in the afternoon sun. On the other side of the garden over the wooden bridge is the Bamboo Forest, which is definitely worth a visit. And a walk along the Taehwa River is highly recommended.While you walk in the bamboo grove, you would feel you are far away from a city. You would hear birds chirping, wind touching leaves and children laughing. This grove stretches over 4km along the riverside and there are a few other gardens you can visit as well.If you happen to be in Ulsan, this place is worth a visit.If you love to visit a non touristy and cool Bamboo Forest, this is definitely the one you're looking for! Take some time to indulge in nature!If you are in Ulsan and happen to have a few hours to spare, you could consider this.Quite cooling if you walk inside the grove.Getting here can be complicated though. This was my route:- Ulsan Express Bus Terminal- Cross the road and walk to bus stop on the left- Bus 407 to Taehwagang Observatory- Walk down a path at the petrol station to a white building and turn right at the end- You will reach the river. There is a small ticket booth. Get a ticket for the boat at 1000KRW. The boat is special. Pulled by hand on a suspended rope. Apparently it was the way in the old days.There is the National Garden across the bus stop earlier.not only bamboos worthes to be visited : very large park with nice various gardens a small marsh with white heronsThis is about a 5 block walk off the bus line on the main drag to the forest. There is a vistor center and fountain with a pond. The entrance to the forest is nearby and takes you on a 15-20 minute walk through the forest. There are online games/activities for kids, sections of the forest are illiuminated at night, and one activity where you squeeze between sections of bamboo. If you are walkers, you can exit the forest and cross the bridge on the river and walk to the foutain cave complex across the river. Transportation options from there are slim if you do no0t plan on walking back.Big Bamboo park. Bicycle for rent and a lot of space for picnic... you can spend your free time hereone of other good places in ulsan ,by river side. must try cycle ride .good place for evening walk with familyYou can visit this bamboo area as you are in the surrounding park.There is a short walk through the bamboo for a photo.Then you can explore the surrounding park area.It is not a must see place.Plenty of free car parking.I wasn't in this city travel plan, but I'm glad I went. especially the riverside walking track is very well arranged and intertwined with nature.I saw this in Japan similar to the bamboo forest, but this place is not bad either.

Name: 인천공항 환승 투어
Review: I booked this transit tour to GwangMyeoung cave in the morning. It's very easy to go to the transit tour counter on the arrival hall on terminal 2 then just showed my booking and my boarding of connecting flight then our group of 8 people with korean tourguide boarded bus to terminal 1 then going to this woderful cave with history of Japanese soldiers history when they invaded korean peninsula , now it transformed into entertaiment park, with aquarium, light and sound showcases in the cave, wine storage chamber and etc. It's courtesy for transit passengers from korean government tourim for organising this free tour.I had a 13 hour layover in Seoul and was interested in seeing the city a little. I did some checking with people who know Seoul and decided to try to visit one of the famous market areas. When I got to the airport I saw the Transit Tour booth and checked it out. It offered various tours to sites like the Castle in Seoul, some temples, and shopping tours ranging from 1 to 5 hours. They are free! All the time I was on the tour ( to the castle) I was expecting to have to pay some exhorbitant price to get my suitcase back from underneath the tour bus, but no there was no catch, it is FREE! While the schedule for the afternoon shopping tour did not fit my available time, I was able to take a 5 hour tour with about 25 other people on a tour bus with a tour guide who explained things while we were on the bus and kept track of us when we were off the bus.Could be better signposted in the arrivals hall, after you've cleared immigration - best to walk the length inside the arrivals hall, past all the doors, looking for the transit tour desk. Once booked and joined, very well organised. The young man we had as our guide was excellent. The caves were a revelation; beautifully lit.This airport is worth a stop just to see the airport it’s is very very clean newer architecture was over all super fantastic airport they do a great job with signs and English if you’re not from there.Once you exit out of arrival door, you can easily find the booth to book the tours. You can pick and most of them are free except one of them you have to prepay KRW. I would suggest you bring some cash so you can buy souvenirs while exploring Seoul. The bus is very efficient and on time getting back. The tour is very nice and tour guide had limited English but it was understandable. We came back from Thailand and didn’t have any warm jacket and it was in February in Korea. The tour had puffy winter jackets to borrow!Please check out the free transit tours laid on at Seoul Incheon airport.I visited the above temple in 2017, and their itinerary has changed since then. However, Seoul goes out of its way to sell South Korea to transit passengers in the hope they will become tourists, and it works.I have found Incheon airport (on my frequent visits) to be characterised by cleanliness, efficiency, and first class service to passengers. The transit tour I took was no different. They check your ticket to make sure you have sufficient time for your selected tour; it runs to time and is interesting; it was free of charge.This tour was the shortest one (all I had time for) and we had about 30mins at the temple to look around. That was enough to get a flavour of the culture and some great photos, I really enjoyed it.Pretty well run tour. The one we took had a charge of usd10 per person I think for food while the tour was free. It's not easy to locate the booth to sign up as it depends where your arrival gate is. So if you cant find it when you arrive dont worry. Clear immigration and walk out. The booth is in the middle of the outside area before you exit the airport. Just choose the tour that suits your time and away you go. There are various ones with different length of time. Tour guide also speaks English and it's pretty straight forward.Waiting outside the door of the Incheon airport with around 50 other people trying to get onto the buses is no thrill, and it takes around 40 minutes to an hour drive to get to Incheon!This was such a great tour. It was so worth it, lovely guide - English speaking, lovely scenario and beats the hours of waiting at the airport. The guide was also kind enough to inform us of the free showers and nap zones in transit lounge which made the transit experience even better. I did the Gyeongbokgung palace and Insadong lunch tour, the palace tour was beautiful and there was time to walk around the streets of Insadong after the lunch. Lunch wasn't fancy but it was good enough.I can't rave enough about this free tour! We went August 21st with our 4 children 13,11,11and 8 years old. I'm glad we reserved it online months in advance because they were booked solid. Theres limited seating. I do believe 2 people on standby did get on but if you have a big family you will not get on without reservations.Our tour guide was funny and informative! The drive over there went by fast because you get to see the scenery and she explains so much. We went through the palace quickly with her and no you don't want to be left behind because time is of the essence and they have it down to a science. But she leads you through it and explains every part of the palace. She'll even take your picture. The lunch was fine. I loved it but I love bi bim bap. It wasn't the best I've had but I loved the experience. My kids didn't eat any of it however and there were no other options. We paid by credit at the tour counter hoping my kids would eat something which was plain rice. Expensive rice I tell ya but I knew that. Afterwards we had very little time to shop about 30 minutes. It was a fast paced tour, go into it with that in mind. Also, I read many of the reviews on here so I knew that after I got off the plane I had to go to the transit tour desk first before going through customs. Then you have to go to the terminal transit desk again. It was all smooth. No problems. I highly recommend this tour. Check out the airport too if you have time. Most amazing airport besides Changi in Singapore!

Name: 신포시장
Review: 仁川空港でトランジットで6時間以上空いたので市場直結のバスに<U+4E57>って行ってみました。全くハングル文字が<U+8AAD>めないのでGPSだけが<U+983C>りです。東仁川<U+99C5>から徒<U+6B69>10分くらいのところなので結構遠く感じました(小さな子供連れだったせいもあり)市場はメインロ<U+30FC>ドが2本。入口付近でタッカンジョンの行列を作っているア<U+30FC>ケ<U+30FC>ドのほうが人が<U+6CA2>山いました。試してみたかったですが、量が多くて<U+65AD>念<U+FF65><U+FF65><U+FF65>そこ以外にも結構タッカンジョンの店はありました。行列タッカンジョンの近くにある食堂では店先でキンパやトッポギ、<U+60E3>菜などが<U+58F2>られていてそれを店<U+5185>で食べることも可能です。トッポギは日本で食べるよりも1本が太くて食べ<U+5FDC>えありすぎでした！その他、マカロンの店や何故かうんちをモチ<U+30FC>フにしたカステラ<U+713C>き、肉まん、韓<U+56FD>海苔等見て回るだけでも<U+697D>しかったです。本場のキムチやチャンジャなども易かったので買いたかった<U+FF65><U+FF65><U+FF65>！<U+6B69>くだけで<U+697D>しかったです。魚など生鮮食品を<U+58F2>る通りと日用品を<U+58F2>る通りで別れています。ただ個人的に惹きつけられるものはなかったです。この市場から東仁川<U+99C5>の間の地上部分はスポ<U+30FC>ツ用品が安い店が多く、そちらのほうが個人的にはオススメです。食料品メインの通りと普通のお店の通りが平行しています。タッカンジョンという甘辛唐揚げとマンドゥ（肉まん）が有名ということで、市場グルメが<U+697D>しめます。行列店がいくつもあるので、一通りみたり試食してから買うのがおススメです。通り<U+629C>けたら近代建築が<U+4E26>ぶエリアです。散策していたら地元感たっぷりの市場を<U+767A>見。市場の雰<U+56F2><U+6C17>が大好きなのでズラリと<U+4E26>ぶ肉、魚、野菜を眺めながら<U+6B69>きました。買って<U+5E30>ることはできなくても地元の風景が見られるのはワクワクします。ソウルの市場は色<U+3005>行きましたがこの地<U+533A>の市場はソウルとはまた違ったロ<U+30FC>カル性を感じます。人はあまり多くない感じで地元の人が殆どです。言葉はハングル語以外通じません、又<U+4E21>替の店も有りません。名物のタッカンジョンを食べましたけど結構ボリュ<U+30FC>ムです。仁川<U+99C5>からチャイナタウンと日本租界地を<U+7D4C>由して行きました。でも新浦市場という在<U+6765>市場で<U+56FD>際市場と言うのはどうかなあ？平日だからか分かりませんが少し寂しい感じがしました。まあ在<U+6765>市場で仁川自<U+4F53>の物<U+4FA1>が安いのか東仁川<U+99C5>前のレストランも安かったし。あまり日本人は仁川には<U+6765>ないと思うが中<U+56FD>人<U+56E3><U+4F53>が無くなって<U+53B3>しいのかも。仁川<U+99C5>の方から向かったのですが、場所が少しわかりにくく、現地の人に連れて行ってもらいました。屋根付きなので、雨の日でも大丈夫です。食べ物中心にたくさんお店が連なっていましたが、ソウルと比べたらこじんまりしていました。タッカンジョンの店がいくつかありましたが、人<U+6C17>店は商店街入り口付近のお店で、暑い中大行列でした。中にちょっとしたスペ<U+30FC>スがあり、そこに昔の衣服を身にまとった日本人と中<U+56FD>人と韓<U+56FD>人が交流（？）している像があったのが大<U+5909>印象的でした。自由公園から10分ほどの場所にある商店街です。地元の人が利用するようなお店が軒を連ねるア<U+30FC>ケ<U+30FC>ド街で、人はさほど多くはありませんでしたが、活<U+6C17>を感じて<U+697D>しかったです。英語がほとんど通じないエリアです。商店街のような通りが閉口して3本ほど<U+4E26>んでおり、全てシンポ<U+56FD>際市場でした。散<U+6B69>がてら<U+6765>たものの、タッカンジョンの量の多さに食べるのを諦めましたが、美味しそうでした。人<U+6C17>のお店は50人ほどの行列ができていました。

Name: 전등사
Location: 인천 강화군 길상면 전등사로 37-41 Ganghwado Island (우) 23050
Review: i highly recommend that this is a must do when in Songdo , the view from top of the lookout tower was breath taking as you watch down looking at the port and the city. you must do this.I joined temple stay program and stayed here two nights three days. If you want to stay away from busy city life, here would be a perfect place.I had sleep problem but surprisingly during my stay here I could have sound sleep. I don't know why.. I guess probably because of fresh air and healthy food. If you are interested in Korean style Buddism and want a peaceful time, I recommend you to visit here.What you can do-Comparing old and new types of Buddha statues-Having tea time with Buddhist monk-Joining morning or evening service-Walking around the walls (Interestingly this oldest temple in Korea is located inside walls that are know to be built by three sons of Dangun, legendary founding father of Gojoseon)-Enjoying beautiful trees and flowers (I saw many wild flowers I had seen in pictures)-Enjoying Korean traditional tea at the cafe Jukrimdawon.-Playing with catI visited Jeondeungsa Temple using the Free Korea Tour group the airport had provided. This one hour visit to the temple was fascinating. The colors, the architecture, the significance, all were very unique. Knowing its historical significance was interesting. The temple itself is located uphill. It's a very peaceful and quiet place. One can definitely do a lot of meditating here.Situated inside a small fort on a hill, the temple complex consists of a number of small halls in a serene wooded setting. There are some beautifully manicured trees around and I understand they also have accommodations for people wanting to stay for awhile. There is also a restaurant at the foot of the hill. Although not one of the more visited temples, it is pretty old and probably a better way to experience a serene Korean temple.The temple is uphill and quiet. If you are looking for a place to get away from noise and city headache then this place is highly recommended. I joined the temple stay program at Jeondeungsa temple which included 2 days and 1 night. It was an amazing experience and I will definitely go back againThis is a must place to visit if you have not been here before. Great Temple with a lot of beautiful buildings and sculptures.I went alone and I really enjoyed. This Buddhist temple is so beautiful and I just discovered u can stay there!Was visiting on our last trip to Korea, nice and quiet place, wasn't full of tourist. Nice walk through the park.I spent 3 nights at Jeondeungsa and was so sorry to leave. It was absolutely heaven for me and I highly recommend it. I did the free style Temple-stay and so I was up each morning at 4 for 4.30am prostrations (bowing ceremony) with the monks who were chanting. I loved every minute and found the chanting of the monks really touching, it was so beautiful. The monks didn't speak much English but there were guides and volunteers who did and who also translated when speaking with the monks - during some of the other ceremonies and when having tea with a monk.The peace and tranquility were simply wonderful and I highly recommend this place, it has had a profound impact on me.This temple is a wonder. You enter the real Korean spirit with typical buildings, well decorated in a sober but wonderful way.The entrance is free as almost everywhere in Korea!

Name: 옥토끼 우주센터
Review: Since we last visited and reviewed the space center, there is one clear upgrade. The dinosaurs have been renewed. Photos added in this review. Someone is clearly making some very good, moving, dinosaurs. Apart from the dinosaurs, the space exhibition is the extensive and interactive with various rides for youngsters. Outside there is a boating pool/ swimming pool in season, and an artificial surface sledge run A great day out for the familyGreat day out for children. Situated on the island of Kanghwado, about 1 and a half hours' drive from the capital Seoul. The center has an indoor area dedicated to.... Space and aviation. Terrific experience for children and adults alike as there are interactive experiences and exhibits galore. There is also a Dinosaur park outside, which hosts various large scale models, some of which move and make realistic sounds !There is also an artificial-surface sled run, particularly suitable for older children and teenagers. And finally there is an inflatable boat experience for all the family. Great day out, particularly during spring through autumn.

Name: 강화평화전망대
Review: 車で連れて行ってもらいました。駐車場から展望台のある建物までの坂道が結構キツイです。でも坂を上る途中で後ろを振り返ると海が見えて綺麗でした。展望台にはよく<U+89B3>光地にあるコイン式の<U+53CC>眼鏡があり、500ウォンでした。肉眼でも<U+5BFE>岸の北が良く見えるのですが、コイン式の<U+53CC>眼鏡を使うと、自<U+8EE2>車に<U+4E57>っ停る人もはっきり見えました。地下<U+9244>の<U+99C5>から少し離れた停留所から路線バスに<U+4E57>って1時間40分位でバスタ<U+30FC>ミナルに着きました。雨が降っていたので、<U+663C>食を食べてから目的地までタクシ<U+30FC>で行きました。（路線バスでも行けるようでしたが雨が降っていたので）運<U+8EE2>手さんは日本語を話せなかったので、私が拙い韓<U+56FD>語で行先などを話していたら運<U+8EE2>手さんは雨が降っているから北韓（北朝鮮）は見えないだろうけど行きますか？わざわざ<U+6765>たので見れなくても行って下さい。とお願いしてタクシ<U+30FC>に<U+4E57>り<U+8FBC>みました。走っているうちに　北韓の方に太陽の光が射してきてるとか話しながら到着した時は雨がやんでいました。駐車場から展望台までキツイ登坂を<U+6B69>いているうちに陽が射してきて展望台に上った頃には<U+5BFE>岸が良く見えました。望遠鏡を使って　私達夫婦と夫の友人の3人で替りばんこに見ました。<U+5BFE>岸に居る人達は　韓<U+56FD>への政治的理由で裕福そうな服<U+88C5>をしているが、運<U+8EE2>手さんが「見せかけ」だと言っていました。が、日本人の私達には　それすらも貧しそうな暮らしぶりに見えました。昔、江華島と北朝鮮を<U+7E4B>いでいた橋を爆破した時に　親兄弟が一瞬の間に引き裂かれたドラマを見ましたが　それを思い出し今も離れ離れになっている悲劇を　切に感じました。余談ですが、見終えた頃に雨が降り出しました。坂を下っている時に、登っていく人達とすれ違い、「私達は本<U+5F53>にラッキ<U+30FC>！」前回の江華島訪問では迷っているうちに、公共バスが爆走して通り過ぎてしまい、立ち寄れませんでした。「展望台」というだけあって、坂を登ります。平日朝一番に訪れると、訪問客はほとんどいませんでした。天<U+6C17>の良い日で、北朝鮮側がよく見えました。<U+5E30>りのバスは時刻表通りには<U+6765>ませんので、心の余裕が必要です。26番バスは11:10→05頃に通過し、2番バスは11:35→45頃到着でした。（26番バスに<U+4E57>るつもりで移動しましたが、坂を下りきる前に目の前を通過していきました）ガイドと車をチャ<U+30FC>タ<U+30FC>していってきました。途中、<U+691C>問とかあり普通でないところと思いました。<U+5BFE>岸の景色はあまり感動はありませんでしたが、ガイドさんの親類があっちにいると言い、<U+6D99>ぐんでいたのが印象的でした。江華平和展望台は、韓<U+56FD>北西部にある江華島の北側にあり、大韓民<U+56FD>から朝鮮民主主義人民共和<U+56FD>をみることができる場所です。館<U+5185>には、<U+4E21><U+56FD>の通貨や<U+6B74>史等の展示があり、また、VTRによる<U+8AAC>明を日本語でも聞くことができます。<U+89B3>光地に設置されている望遠鏡で<U+5BFE>岸をのぞくと、日常生活をしている人<U+3005>の<U+69D8>子を見ることもできますが、簡<U+5358>にその人たちと話ができないことを想像すると、こんなに近いのにとても遠い<U+30FB><U+30FB><U+30FB>ことを感じてしまいました。韓<U+56FD>の方と一<U+7DD2>でなければ行くことができない場所ですので、予め確認の上の訪問をおすすめします。江華平和展望台。「地球の、、」の最新版にも載ってません（＾＾）韓<U+56FD>には朝鮮民主主義人民共和<U+56FD>を間近に感じる展望台が各地にありますが、板門店をはじめとして、前もって予約をしておかなくてはならず、またツア<U+30FC>だけのところもありますが、ここは個人で行くしかない展望台。場所は江華島の北東部。バス路線がありまして、江華島の<U+89B3>光スポットで世界遺産の江華支石墓からも行くことができます。バスの本<U+6570>は少ないので、よく計<U+753B>をたてるのが無難です。<U+5E30>りのバスは２６番か２７番が江華バスタ<U+30FC>ミナル行き。さて、展望台へはバス停留所を降りたら、ひたすら上り坂。途中に入場料を<U+5FB4><U+53CE>するところがあります。あとは自由に<U+89B3>光することができます。本<U+5F53>に「北」が目の前に迫ります。<U+89B3>光客はそれほど多くなくゆっくりと<U+89B3>光できます。江華島<U+89B3>光の一つに加えてみてはいいかがでしょうか。お<U+52E7>めいたします。江華平和展望台江華島の北端にあります。ソウルから公共交通で行くには、新村から３０００番のバスで１時間４０分の道中で江華バスタ<U+30FC>ミナルへ移動。タ<U+30FC>ミナルから出ている１番か２６番のバスに<U+4E57>ります。２６番のほうが早く着きます。バス停は展望台の下で降りる人も少ないので注意。バス停を降りたら、坂を登っていくとチケット<U+58F2>り場があります。料金は２５００\。展望台からの<U+5199><U+771F>撮影は自由です。軍人さんも訪問されるので、その時は思考してくださいね。ここでは、北の宣<U+4F1D>放送のお供よく聞こえます。川を<U+631F>んで～２ｋｍの距離になるそうです。公共バスの便は多くないので、よく確かめて行動されてください。バスタ<U+30FC>ミナルから江華島<U+5185>バス1路で向かいました。途中コインドルあたりまでで他の<U+4E57>客はいなくなりました。北側の島外周の道路までくると、<U+5BFE>岸の北朝鮮が車窓から見えます。道路には<U+691C>問所もありました。展望台近くまで<U+6765>て「あの坂道を登るのか<U+30FB><U+30FB>」と考えてるうち、バスは停留所があっても減速することなく通過して行くため、降りる機<U+4F1A>を失ってしまいました。北朝鮮を車窓見<U+5B66>できたので良いか<U+30FB><U+30FB>と思い直し、外浦里に向かいました。江華島事件等、北朝鮮に限らず常に諸外<U+56FD>との最前線であった江華島の北のはずれにこちらの展望台があります。韓<U+56FD>の一般エリアとしては北朝鮮に一番近いとのことで、オドゥサン展望台より近く見えるうえ、「<U+865A>飾の無い」リアルな北朝鮮の村の姿を見<U+5B66>できます。民間人統制地域<U+5185>ですので市<U+5185>中心部より向かうと行き<U+5E30>りに機<U+95A2>銃を持った兵士がいるチェックポイントを通ります。7年前に訪れたときにはパスポ<U+30FC>ト持<U+53C2>を求められていましたが今回はそういうことはありませんでした。訪れた日はケソン工業<U+56E3>地から韓<U+56FD>側を締め出すという大ニュ<U+30FC>スが流れた日でしたが、展望できる北朝鮮側の景色は農村であるせいもあってのどかです。500ウォンで使える望遠鏡は大<U+5909>よく見え何回も追加してしまいました。海<U+5CE1>を見下ろせば韓<U+56FD>側の海岸線に切れ目なく<U+7D9A>く<U+53B3>重な<U+9244><U+6761>網があり、見た目とは違う緊張<U+72B6>態が<U+4F1D>わってきます。<U+7A4F>やかな風景とアンマッチな<U+9244><U+6761>網や兵士の姿はいやがうえにも平和の大切さを無言で訴えてきます。2階には展示スペ<U+30FC>スがあり<U+6226>いの<U+6B74>史や北朝鮮側の生活の紹介等がわかりやすく展示されています。韓<U+56FD>側から北朝鮮を遠望する展望台はいくつかありますが、こちらの展望台は最も近い展望台のようで天<U+6C17>のよい日は肉眼でも<U+69D8>子を見ることができます南北統一を願う祈願所や朝鮮半島の現代史について知ることができる展示室などもあります

Name: 계양산
Review: Was very excited at the opportunity to climb Gyeyangsan. Set out on a foggy Sunday afternoon with my 13 year old daughter. We both enjoyed the hike immensely. The views were spectacular...at one point were walked through mists that made it seem otherworldly. The people we met on the way were friendly and welcoming. Looking forward to other hikes in South Korea.Gyeyang Mountain is easy to find just walk up the hill from Gyesan Station (Incheon Line 1).
